There's quite a lot of work to do with this app. While it seems to functionally work well on a basic level, a lot of core features from the Wunderlist app have been removed, or awkwardly placed/restricted. New features of the app are incredibly limited and feel poorly executed. Unfortunately there is nothing in this app that says "I want this", when migrating from Wunderlist, and makes other apps look more appealing. I hope further updates from Microsoft can deliver on user feedback.

It is unfortunate that Microsoft decided to make this look like a Wunderlist copy. The old design simulated a lined notebook, and it was subtle, clean and minimalist. It looked like an extension of the physical world. This Wunderlist-inspired redesign is gaudy and artificial, introducing all sorts of unnecessary graphics and coloured lines. I never liked that Wunderlist made my tasks look like bricks, and I don't like this either.

Moved to Microsoft To Do from Wunderlist. After a month of trying to adjust, I can't. It's terrible and has extremely limited functionality. It's essentially an app which let's you make a list. Moving back to Wunderlist which Microsoft owns bizarrely, it's much smarter and easier and has a ton of more functionality and looks better.

At first I liked that I could choose to see or hide the done tasks and even the done tasks were on alphabetic order. I use this app also as a grocery list. So every time I want to add the done tasks I have to go throw everything. Why can't you have the done tasks in alphabetic order as well. Or that we could choose between this interface and the previous one ourselves. The way it is now (chaotic) it is very user unfriendly and time consuming.

This app is simply amazing as it comes from Microsoft and I'm quite a big fan of this app :) üòç All the features you wish for are all there in this app. But the major disappointment is that, the reminder feature doesn't seem to work. Okay okay. Recurring reminders do not work if previous reminder has not been ticked off as complete. For e.g., I have set up a reminder for every weekday. App has always worked sporadically, often set reminders don't activate. Needs a rethink. The access through the web is instant. The app (on Chrome OS) is still spinning it's login wheels. For quick access, I'd recommend access via the internet as its quicker and helps productivity.

I am quite disappointed that the sorting no longer applies to completed tasks. After years of missing this feature in Wunderlist, it was a very positive surprise seeing that it had been implemented in To-Do. Now it's gone again. If this change is not reverted, I will be dropping the app. It's a nice app but it doesn't serve me without that feature.

This app was perfect until they decided to do one single "you have things due today" notification instead of individual notifications. I was able to leave notifications until of had a chance to complete the task. Now, I'm forced to open the app (which makes the notification go away) or use the widget (which takes up a lot of screen space). I'm so disappointed by this update.

Microsoft bought the previous app I was using and the Microsoft experience has been ok. The biggest annoyance (and reason for the 2 star rating) is that the app keeps turning on the "Plan Your Day Reminders" notification regardless of how many times I turn it off. It's literally a useless notification that pops up saying "What will you do today?" and I don't want it to notify me.

Since adding multiple account support I have been forced to log in repeatedly each day and resync the account. This is quite frustrating as a good bit of my day is away from cell or wifi coverage, which means I'm unable to access the app or add new tasks. This is quite frustrating and eliminates most of the benefit of the app. -- The app needs to be able to function offline with constantly needing to sync.

Wish they kept the wunderlist app instead it was perfect üò≠!!! Some issues I had with this app compared to Wunderlist to fix: -have new items added to the top instead of adding to the bottom (or have option to change) -more quick choice options for the reminder times -quick add bar (to just type in a search bar box instead of clicking the + button) -have settings apply to all lists so don't have to individually change each list -option to add to list on main screen without clicking in list

Stay away. I loved Wunderlist. However, none of the changes the devs made moving from Wunderlist to ToDo enhanced the experience and they have broken countless other features. My most current gripe is that reminders don't consistently remind you on time. My recurring 9:00am alert finally kicked off at 3:59 today. My 7:00 nightly reminders only work about half the time. I'm defecting to something else as soon as i can find something suitable.

It does what it says, but not easily or well. Its frustratin . I downloaded because they bought Wunderlist, and this is the replacement. It does not offer the same experience and is NOT a good replacement. From sorting, to reordering lists, to automatically seeing up tasks for the day, it misses the boat. And using the"suggest a feature" button is a nightmare! You have to login for every new page, and the attitude is "here's our way of doing it" and no changes get made. I will be changing apps.

This is a step down from Wunderlist. Before deprecating Wunderlist in favor of this app, it should atleast have been brought to parity. Sharing is broken, and even when it works, I have to send a link to the other person. It was so much simpler with Wunderlist! In the sharing with SMS option, the link and the text together require 2 texts. Why?!. Unhappy.

dag, I JUST left a review expressing my love for the app less than 10 mins ago, only to have it start crashing on me moments later.. I thought it was a hiccup so to speak, but it crashed four more times, each time while trying to add a new task; I was editing the reminder date and time the last time but not sure about the first instances. I really liked the look/feel & ease of use but forced to give a poor rating because of it continuously failing during the usage of the most frequented portions

1) No way to share a list within the app: you have to do it via email every single time. 2) When you join a list, it happens multiple times "there's something wrong, please try again". For one list I tried five times before I got it to work. If you have many shared lists from Wunderlist, good luck resharing them. Hey dumb Microsoft team, if you are not ready, don't discontinue Wunderlist.

My wife and I used Wonderlist for years to share grocery lists, to-do's, packing lists, etc. The transition into Microsoft To Do could not have been more painful. Duplicate imports and no sharing between work/personal accounts made the move harder than it should be. But the most frustrating thing? I can no longer click and drag to order items in a list!! I be in the grocery store runnin around like a psycho cuz my list be all scrambled. And that's before I even look for toilet paper.

Actually wasn't a terrible replacement for Wunderlist until the last update. The one feature I used all the time was the ability to show completed items with un-completed and sort the whole list and then hide completed items again, leaving everything sorted. Now you can no longer merge the lists and sort. Why take something out that was actually useful? Now this app is virtually useless for me.

Why this constant pop up about Android settings? Once a day is much more than enough, don't you think? Why 100 times in a day? This popup treatment is bordering on adware. Wondering what your UX policies are. Another irritating feature. When i want to change reminder / due by date on a Sat, the only options are later today, Sunday. And the option for next week is present but disabled. So you want to decide by when a task should be done? It's not like you don't have space for option.

Still use the app and rely on it. But still can't stand the my day. Need to be able to get rid of it or shut it off. No need to have it when you have today, tomorrow separated. Also, still have tasks that are postponed show up on dates postponed from. Really annoying. But still potential for a great app. Update 1/23. Still similar issues. Bugs are back with alarms showing up when not even due. Infuriating. The solution shouldn't be i hands to start over.

This app is inferior to Wunderlist as of now. It needs to be an option to duplicate a list exactly and rename it. You should also be able to attach pictures and instructions to long lists that you've made. It's just not nearly as intuitive as Wunderlist. I have 50 locations that often need all the same services performed and it is a major waste of time to type can01 can02 can03 can04 etc every time i have a sweeping maintenance issue.

I give it an extra star for how it looks. For one time tasks it might be OK but for recurring, it just plain does not work. I set up two recurring daily tasks and I'd say it worked about 50% of the time. Luckily they were tasks that had some flexibility but after years of them NOT fixing this I give up. Simple Google Reminders just works. Doesn't have all the bells and whistles but it at least works. Sorry MS....you fail.

I do NOT recommend this app. Pro: it makes list & integrated into your Microsift account but it's an Inferior app. I like being first adopters of things. I regretted moving/exporting from wunderlist & started using to-do exclusively. After a few months, I've decided to move all items back. It was NOT an easy feat as I had to manually review everything; it was worth it. I will not going to download this app until I'm forced to move from wunderlist and have to find a better product (like Tick Tick or any.do).

Anyone have a better replacement for Wunderlist? I really am Just looking for list app and one where I can have shared lists. I don't need another half assed todo list. I have tried this in the past and it is not list app and it is not a functional task manage. I did go ahead a switch because the port was easy and I didn't want to loose my stuff, but I need a more functional replacement.

I just want an app that duplicates what I see on my desktop. I cannot use features like to whom the task is assigned, start date, end date, progress, Etc. I do not like to so-called smart lists. I want to see the entire list of my items, and not have them broken down automatically into tasks or anything else. At least give me a manual option. I like to look through my entire list and set priorities, without having to go through multiple lists. Outlook needs a task function on its app. Not this

Very disappointed I have been working with this app for about a week to see if it would work as a replacement for Wunderlist. There are some good things. But the biggest problem I have with To Do is that I schedule My Day the night before so I can hit the ground running the next day. This doesn't work. The app forces me to reset everything in the morning. The app is supposed to help me get my work done. Instead it wastes my time redoing what was already done - planning My Day.

I am a user of the previous Wunderlist but Microsoft acquired the app so here I am. There's some differences which is fine but this app has a tendency of being horribly unreliable. I was hoping by now this would be more reliable but it isn't. Repeating reminders seem to work for a couple days and then it stops pushing reminders to my phone. It's very disappointing. I use this for grocery and other lists. I wish I could use the reminders too.

I have used this app everyday for several months. It was working great, but a recent update (Dec '18?) removed the completion count, degraded the process of adding the previous day's items, and generally is no longer working as well. Now has more the feel of a student project than a professional tool.

Everything is three colors: black, white, and bg color. Nothing feels separate or distinct, meaning I find it hard to visually separate individual tasks. To do lists should help me break down tasks not make them feel like a uniform lump. The star shouldn't be the same color as the background if it's supposed to stand out. Please make the star stand out more with a banner like Wunderlist and with a different color.

It's pretty good at what it does but it's not perfect . My biggest issue is that It doesn't really have a backup feature You can export your data to be imported into Excel or Outlook tasks but you can't just hit one button and save the entire thing as an editable easy to read format So I basically need to select each individual thing one by one and save it through the printing option which is extremely frustrating and time-consuming

Why did you mess with the way the lists print? My grocery list now won't print on 1 page !!!! I'm frustrated & angry at your change. I've used this app since I got my 1st smart phone & loved it. Went to print my list for this week & now the box is on a line above the list item. Now it takes 2 pages - not something my husband can manage! It wouldn't even download to my.othet apps- I had to download to Keep & then from there download again to Google Docs in order to find a way to print it. HATE!!!

Too hard to group stuff to Today or Tomorrow. Annoying notifications stating why aren't you doing more? Accusing clients of laziness. There are better task organizers out there. There are more critical things in life to do than a random list of house chores. The app is totally rude! It lacks dark mode. It hurts the eyes. It doesn't wipe out completed tasks. It doesn't graph completion. It doesn't have a habit tracker or calendar view. It doesn't have notes for tasks or logging.

I like using this app to organize my to-do items for my company which subscribes to office 365. However, since the latest update my app constantly says "unable to sync" even though it appears to be working when I check in the browser on my desktop. Even uninstalling and reinstalling the app doesn't fix it. I can't trust the app with my vital work if I'm getting sync errors like this because I cannot lose anything. Please fix this and I will update to 4 or 5 stars.

Thee planting reminders aren't working for me for some reason. I have them set and on, but I don't get notifications. Also, my trees don't wither when I go into an app that's not on my whitelist. They have an advanced detection mode, but sorry, I don't want Forest to be able to collect data on what I'm typing (it includes everything but passwords, even credit card numbers)

I've set the app to not treat notifications as a disruption, and it still does. I respond to the warning that I need to "return to Forest as soon as possible or the tree will wither," it looks like it's going fine, and suddenly a minute later I have a withered tree. A bit of a slap in the face to be going along for 55 minutes and have something wither on me in the last 5 minutes of a decent run. Where are the instructions on how exactly the notification disruption setting works? What's there right now is vague, unhelpful, and flat out doesn't work. It's a waste of money and a giant irritation if they can't get this to ignore certain apps properly. I'm ignoring my notifications to let the app continue running, and then I'm being punished. Very frustrating.

No full-screen notifications.
Really disappointingly, the app slows my phone to the point where my phone is unusable. I actually really like the app but can't have it on my phone because of this
Modifies the system copy/paste menu

I don't know how this app has such a high rating. If we're speaking about services of MS more broadly, e.g. sync between the app and the desktop (DT) version of To-do, this is just a disaster. Tasks that I create on my mobile are not showing up in DT version, then when I click several times the 'Sync' button, it completely DELETES the task that I created on the mobile app instead of ADDING it to the DT version. The quality of MS products is falling down each year.

I don't know if anyone else is experiencing this, but the app glitches CONSTANTLY with Chrome OS. Whenever I flip to "My Day," the suggested tasks flicker on the screen and make using the app impossible. I used it on my Android phone and previously on my Macbook with no problem. I loved the "My Day" function and am loathe to switch to a different app, but I don't think I have a choice.

Just not far enough along to be really useful. It did pull tasks from different accounts (personal, work, school) but there is no way to come up with a consolidated list to work from for the day. Subtasks (steps) don't have the ability to show up separately on a day so you can't use it to plan out complicated tasks. Tasks don't have a due time assignable so useless as a homework tracker. No geo-fencing. Ever since they gutted Outlook I been relying more and more on paper day-timer.

It's confusing. to-do apps are supposed to make things easier but i find that this doesn't do that. it says it will remind but doesn't.. at least for me. it doesn't sync with cortana; she seems to have her own list. I think it syncs with Microsoft launcher? the ui/ux is confusing with the whole my day thing, and then there's planned, custom lists... there's no bi-weekly schedule. There should be ONE list tied to your account and all apps should sync with it.

Love the concept, enjoy To Do on PC, love that it syncs immediately. What I do NOT love is that scheduled tasks do not sync with my Outlook calendar. This is very inconvenient as I have to have two programs open and if I want to schedule anything, I have to check my to do list. Also, noticed today that I can no longer check off tasks as completed in the app. When I do the task disappears for a second then pops right back onto my list as incomplete. Is currently useless.

The new "auto-complete suggestions enabled" feature is loathsome. I have to turn off this nuisance in the list options for EACH list EVERY time I reopen the list. You should be able to turn it off in the app settings, and it should stay off when you turn it off. Worst, the list option to "turn off auto suggestions" is where a fat finger can do the most damage: right below "delete list"! I accidentally deleted a list with dozens of repeating items.

So I'll say this is a start. The pluses, the syncing between outlook tasks, todo web, and the UI is clean and generally nice to look at.  CONS:  Why is there no "Planned" list on the todo app. It's super annoying. There is no easy way to see my tasks for today and the upcoming week. "Planned" is implemented on web. The todo app really should have basic parity.  It's super painful in both the app and the web app to add dates. I add dates to every todo. It is very cumbersome compared to todoist.  I'm sure other people use it but I don't love the My Day feature. I don't like manually adding it. It should just show all the tasks due today. Maybe we could add that as a setting?  There is another bug. The date seems to be off. It works on mobile but it's off on the web app so it's not consistent. MS really needs to get their act together on this product.

Interface similar to Wunderlist, functionally not the same unfortunately. As an example, Wunderlist allows manual sorting after sorting by one of the sort options (alphabetical, etc), which can fine tune things beautifully. Microsoft To Do does not allow manual sorting unless you deactivate the selected sort (like deactivating alphabetical sort as an example). This then reverts everything back to the same unsorted mess prior to the selected sort option. Very frustrating.

I switched over to Microsoft to do after being notified that Wunderlist would not be available. With the most recent update to the app, the 'planned' list now only shows a filtered view. And I have to group it by date to even see it for each day. Previously I could see everything at once -by due date even overdue items. I can appreciate that everyone might not want to see everything. There should be an 'all' option if you are going to limit this. Looks like I get to find a new app.

[Updated Review] This app is very great and I love many things about it, but the unforgivable missing feature is some sort of "trash bin". It's unbelievable that if I delete a list by mistake, it's completely gone forever! This missing feature makes To Do very unreliable. Even a temporal trash bin that self-cleans in intervals would be very useful. I also have MANY UX feedbacks, and I'm very willing to share over a session (not possible to cover by text review) .

I loved Wunderlist. To Do not so much. I cannot get my phone app or web app to sync. Very frustrating when you are sharing a list and cannot see what other people have added or completed. They in turn cannot see anything you have added or completed. My husband send I have the same exact phone and he has no problems with his app. I don't get it.

I've used this app for quite some time with very few issues. When everything is working as it should be, it's a great app! However, since 02/06/2021 I've been unable to sync any of my shared lists. I cleared the app cache, signed out and back in again, and uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Despite these attempts to rectify the problem, I still cannot sync shared lists.

Bring back Wunderlist! This app has failed to link lists over and over. We find ourselves trying to relink lists, but it still doesn't work. Since this has changed from Wunderlist, it's a huge disappointment. Find a better app. Also, you can't silence it when someone is checking off a linked list (when it does work). Super annoying. I expected more from Microsoft.

A new "feature" of Microsoft To Do compared to Wunderlist is notifications being cleared at the start of every new day. This is incredibly annoying because if I don't have time to get to it, I want it to be a constant annoying reminder so I know to get around to it. I would rather continue to use Wunderlist, if the recurring tasks was implemented offline, instead of requiring the server to give you a recursive task.

This used to be a 5-star app. Loved it when it was "Wonderlist", and also when Microsoft first acquired it. This latest update has rendered it useless as a phone app, which is the whole point of using it... to keep lists and notes on the go. Now it only works on my laptop. On my phone, the cursor is all over the place, and the scroll bar moves up and down of its own volition.

Pros: Free to use with no premium tier. You can set tasks, set them to repeat and get reminders. You can check them off when done. Cons: 1. Tasks that repeat every week are going to be listed under "My Day" with no indication whatsoever of whether this is this week's or next week's task. 2. Sub-tasks aren't visible in the main view. 3. Other minor inconveniences. I hate Todoist's premium tier, but sadly it's the better app.

I have been using this app for a long time, even before Microsoft took over. One of the best to-do apps out there. It's great to be able to access the to-do list across multiple devices. Unfortunately since a recent update it is not possible anymore to edit more than one item on my tablet. After editing one item the app has to be restarted before another item can be edited, everytime. Re-installing the app doesn't solve the problem. I need the app to work across all my devices.

The app serves it's purpose but I came from wunderlist and I wish wunderlist would stay. Wunderlist is more aesthetically pleasing to the eye and makes it easier to remember to check. It's more satisfying to check it off your list and it feels less like actual work and more like play. Be more like wunderlist and you'll get more users

What a terrible replacement for Wunderlist! My husband and I have been using Wunderlist for years to coordinate all types of lists around the house. With To Do, we haven't been able to find a way to share lists directly between the app on our phone. You have to go through a browser to join a list - FAIL.

Seems like basic features are very buggy and poorly thought out. For example, skipping to current task on a weekly task can put the due date more than a week into the future, with the notification date on a seemingly random nearby date that might even be after the due date. Also, after daylight savings ended the notifications were an hour off.

For some reason this app changes your reminder date, after it has passed. So if you have a reminder set to April 1st, for something due May 1st, it'll sort that Task below other April tasks. The next time it's at the top of your list will be it's due date. This wouldn't be terrible if you could see all deadlines as a priority. But you can't, so it a badly done app.

Lots of features very large CPU usage.... Any interaction with the app seems to crash my phone. It seems like because it syncs with the other reminders app that I have on my phone that any interaction results in my phone crashing.... But has great features so if it works for you the options and functionality are top of the line.

App has always worked sporadically, often set reminders don't activate. Since last update will not work at all and am locked out of my task list with messages saying list no longer exists and owner has restricted access. I am the only owner/manager of task list & am signed in. I have paid microsoft subscription so very annoyed that paid for apps that have been set up to make sure critical things are done has failed like this, it is unrealistic to expect reentry/set up of all tasks/dates/reminder
I keep turning off auto-suggestions. The app keeps turning suggestions back on. I hate this. If I turn an option off, leave it off.

This is one of the most boring, average, to do lists in the world. From a company like Microsoft, it's frankly embarrassing. It has zero functionality and no selling points, though it does integrate with their products pretty well.

Works very poorly with mouse and keyboard input. When adding an item to a list, the suggestion strip only works well for touch input, but will work with mouse input IFF there are few enough suggestions that the horizontal scrollbar doesn't appear. Otherwise, the horizontal scrollbar hitbox is clearly overlapping the suggestions and has a higher z-order, making suggestions unclickable.

Okay okay. Recurring reminders do not work if previous reminder has not been ticked off as complete. For e.g., I have set up a reminder for every weekday. And now if I don't mark that task to be complete on Tuesday, reminder won't work for Wednesday and onwards unless I mark all pending reminders as complete.
Missing a lot of features the web version has such as categories, really lags behind other solutions

Was working fabulously on my Samsung A73 mobile until the last update a few weeks ago, half the time it is impossible to read the widget as it keeps saying "loading"! Just removed the widget hoping it'll rectify itself if add it to the home pages again.
Pop up to turn on Notifications every time I open the app is very irritating.
When it is skipped to the current tasks, it will skip to the next week, even though the due dates have been customised to days within the week that haven't arrived yet.
Awesome App, 1) if you could add undo feature : if we make any changes to the todo unexpectedly and press back then it saves it and we cannot find what was the original memo.

A fantastic and helpful app became useless with the last update. Grouping open and completed tasks may be helpful for some, but for some types of lists it would be really handy to have all tasks together. For example a picking list (or shopping list) with the items sorted in order of their position in the warehouse. You do not need everything every time, so you can just uncheck the items when needed during a round, possibly hiding the completed tasks to minimize screen cluttering. This was possible before, but with the recent update(s) all completed tasks have moved to a separate list. All custom sorting is lost. Dear Microsoft, please re enable these features. You could provide an option in settings to use one or the other. (Maybe even on a list level) 2 stars because it used to be a good app, otherwise I would have now given it only 1 star.

Totally agree with the below reviews. This was a perfectly serviceable Todo app, which I enjoyed that synced with Alexa, until it started giving me daily "Plan your day" notifications. There's a toggle for these in the settings, but it turns itself back on the next day! Rubbish, Microsoft! Needs to be fixed - but I'm going back to Todoist.

Notification improvements would make all the difference. This app is sleek & has a simple, would be helpful layout. Unfortunately, the notifiction function is useless. The notice disappears quickly (there should be an option for it to stay until ticked). So if you walk away from your phone you may miss an important reminder! I really wanted to like this app, not least b/c i syncs flagged emails in outlook but what good is a to do app which is outperformed by pen and paper?

When you create a task and then set a reminder, you have to go back to the text and press enter otherwise it doesn't save it, or even warn you if you navigate away. Caught me out a few times, seriously annoying so looking at other options. Other than that it's ok but nothing special and the views are a bit odd. All for example doesnt actually show all tasks!

Trialling this as they ditched the wonderful Wunderlist. Main problem so far is that there is no option to autoshift completed tasks to the bottom of the list. Hidden or taking up space at the top is not user friendly. Visually - no point in having a lovely background if the tasks block it with solid white. Wunderlist looked SO much better, friendlier and more appealing with translucent backgrounds to tasks. These are the kind of style and practical tweaks that should be obvious, right?

Could be great... But no. I really want to love it. It integrated with my other work apps and is (technically) cross platform. But it's extremely inconsistent. I can have tags in outlook and the browser, but not on mobile. You can't sort by tag in browser but you can on outlook. Subtasks do not exist in outlook, but task status ONLY exists in outlook. It's a complete mess and I need multiple apps open to get all the relevant information I need.

It's good that you can import from wunderlist, but the planner is missing some really basic features. For instance it's impossible to set a repeating reminder, which makes it pretty useless... And why 'My Day' doesn't automatically populate with the things you have set for the day is beyond me. Poorly thought out, as I am finding a lot of Microsoft products are these days. I'm looking for a better app.

Being able to slide tasks up and down on the fly is a critical feature which needs to be brought over from Wunderlist. I plan and order my work day tasks with it and need to be able to adjust the order quickly and frequently. My wife and I also were using Wunderlist as a grocery list sharing tool. Same complaint as we like to order the list to match our path through the grocery store. I see a few people miss this option in the reviews - Without it, the app doesn't work for me.

My to do list cannot be modified. This is a problem that I experience for months now. If I want to mark a task of my list as done, or make any change, I go from my reminders list. Last time I uninstalled the app and installed it again, set it up again and it worked for some days and then the same issue. I am thinking of uninstalling it again and use my reminders. In the past I would give 5 stars but now even 2 stars all too many.

Switching from Wunderlist. Can't even get started because I end up in an endless loop of "not a recognized Microsoft accout" so i click on create new account, use the same email and get "there is already a Microsoft account with this email." Just trying to not loose my lists when Wunderlist shuts down. Extremely frustrating.
"you can't get reminder if notification off" ... I know what I'm doing, it's extremely inconvenient to show a pop-up warning everytime the app is opened!
Recently, a lot of my appointments went missing. Or appointment only show up in laptop but not this app, despite the fact that both end are connected to the cloud and synchronized.

This used to be an awesome simple app, especially before Microsoft took it over. I'm using a Google Pixel 6 and the widget does not work in many of the sizes and even when you get it to work, the next day it may show nothing on your list. When it does this you can't even click on the widget to get in to the app. I have the latest firmware and software updates as of 03 /23/22

This does not work the same as wunderlist. When I sort, I cannot manually move items to in effect do a sort alphabetically within priority. Also when I prioritize items, they don't automatically move to the top of the list. With wunderlist going away, I am going to have to search for a new app. So disappointed.

Worked perfectly on my Pixel 4XL, when I upgraded to the Pixel 6 Pro, the widget often does not work. It's on the 2nd page of my phone, when I swipe there, I'll see my task list for a split second, then it goes to "My Day" list (empty), and I'm unable to access the drop down menu to select a different list. If I resize the widget it starts working again.

Super annoying that you can't find your expired, but incomplete tasks, or you have to dig through the screens to find them. Super annoying that the tasks are added in reverse order, i.e. the last two shows up first on the list and you have to constantly rearrange the list.

Good task app but buggy widget. App is good for scheduling tasks and reminders, but need more customization. Widget is buggy and sometimes just display black out with nothing on it, it happens a lot more often lately. It needs a phone restart to fix, and I'm not going to restart a few times a day just to"fix" this one buggy app.

Decreased rating to 2 stars because a recent change now causes an alphabetized list to become out of order when "Move starred tasks to top" is used. It used to be that when I starred an item then unstarred it, the item went back to its previous position in the list. Now it stays at the top of the list, and I have to manually move it back. My grocery list is now almost unusable. If this is not fixed soon, I will find another app that does what I want.

This app changed recently in an annoying way. Now, completed tasks are no longer sorted or even sort-able. We use this app for shopping lists and have previously appreciated the ability to sort a list we use repeatedly in alphabetical order. Now it's impossible to sort the completed taske for reuse. That's just lame.

The overall function is good. problems are, not all repeat options are compatible so therefore you can't use them. Also I was surprised there is not a way to search my tasks. also the widget doesn't color code anything so I have no idea what is before or after the due date I have set. I would expect better from Microsoft.

We started using this app when Wunderlist was no longer available. It worked well for so long. A couple of months ago it stopped syncing across the four androids in our household, which is terrible when you're grocery shopping and things are either not on the list or are still on the list from the last store visit. We all reinstalled the app, but that didn't help. We've now downloaded the Anylist app, but NONE of the apps are better than Wunderlist.

The my day widget does not update and after leaving the home screen stops showing to do lists. It has to be removed and re added which is a temporary and annoying fix to what's probably a simple problem in the code. This widget has NEVER worked right. Does Microsoft even fix bugs like this? At least once every 3 years or so (as long as this issue has been happening)?

I love the concept of this app, with sharing capability, but when I have to turn off auto-suggestion literally every time I open the app, I want to throw my phone across the room... Seriously how hard is it to respect my wishes with settings. Incredibly frustrating. Would be an easy 5-star otherwise.

I come from Wunderlist and I so miss the usability and simplicity of Wunderlist. This app somehow has very cluttered and hard too use UI. Disappointed that Microsoft cannibalised Wunderlist to push their so inferior product. The only reason stopping me from finding something else is the inability to migrate my task data out of this app to another todo list app.

Decent app, it was better as Wunderlist. Giving it 2 stars because the auto suggestion feature continues to turn itself back on every time you open the app. I don't want the feature and it should be a toggle in the settings app to turn off not on individual lists! Apps should defy users settings!

it is the very good app except it have only one level of sub-task, wish to have more. also, only one status (completed), missing other levels i.e started, in progress, delayed, completed with color code. Also, missing dashboard showing how many are of highest priority, started, in progress, delayed, completed etc. Sharing or colaboration is at task level only, sharing should also be at group level. Missing option to un-do the actions

Although I love it's simplicity and minimalistic look some tasks set at dates are not notified. Update: have tried this app again and it seems recurring reminders fail...checking the list there is no 'alarm' symbol next to task as previously. Due to this, recurring reminders are not activated hence this app is useless when it comes to future reminders

The widget is not syncing properly across devices. I have one device saying that an event due today is not due until tomorrow. Another device correctly says due today. Hitting the refresh icon does not clear the problem. Opening the actual app shows correct details. Widgets across the entire Outlook suite are unreliable.

I really like the app itself but ever since I got a new phone it prompts me to turn on notifications every time I open it. I don't want notifications. I turned them off for a reason. The prompt is annoying enough that I'm gonna find another to do list app.

I really enjoyed this app and used it daily. I would have given it a higher rating but it seems they removed the ability to add a home screen shortcut to individual lists. It has decreased its usefulness.

There is somekind of bug in the selection on subtask text making it glitchy. Normal double tap a word to select it. Please option to disable swipe to delete subtasks. Plse can there be an opt to have simp fast note edit. The new changes cursor position and line spacing from a reading mode to editing and one looses focus on where to edit.

When all one wants is a daily checklist, it's irritating to go into each task and skip to current task. If a task repeats why would I want it to stay forever under the completed. It becomes too much of a hassle to keep clearing the completed ones.

this app often missed to show notification. at first i thought probably android kill the app in background to save battery, so i often open the app many times within day. even then, still in many occasion the notification fails to show. please fix it.

I stopped using this because of the reminders to enable notifications every time I open the app. My motivation is comically fragile and that reminder is enough to keep me from looking at my to-do list

After the update, there is no sound on completion. I have tried restarting my phone, reinstalling the app, clearing app data, checking every setting and permissions very thoroughly, but to no avail. It's very annoying to constantly check the app to see when the tree is done growing or when my break is done as I do not get notified at all. Please fix!
Does not have the same functionality options as the outlook tasks. It is just an effort to repair something that is not broken rather than adding more functionality options to the tasks.

It's pretty good at what it does but it's not perfect . My biggest issue is that It doesn't really have a backup feature You can export your data to be imported into Excel or Outlook tasks but you can't just hit one button and save the entire thing as an editable easy to read format So I basically need to select each individual thing one by one and save it through the printing option which is extremely frustrating and time-consuming
Liked the app. The commercial that appeared evertime I closed any other app on my phone was annoying. Deleted your app and the commercials stopped.

Tasks that repeat more than once daily dont work, if you have something that is twice a day you have to have two separate tasks. If you leave a task pending until the following day and complete it, it will never work again.
To Do list apps, like this one, are not useful without the capability of using recurring tasks. Too bad because the interface is otherwise well done.

Had high hopes for this because it had everything I wanted but the completed tasks that I keep putting as completed come back the next day which is just irritating. Have tried all the settings to get of it but I can't and can't be bothered to persevere anymore
It was doing what it is supposed to do at first but after some time it's glitching and it is becoming worst. Reccuring tasks is unreliable.

Not able to install on more than two devices. I found this frustrating as I had one phone stolen and another broke. Now I can‚Äôt download on my new phone because it‚Äôs already on the other with my main email. Does not allow another email. Not too pleased about this.
Only subscription-based if you want to pay, doesn't allow lists at the top. There aren't options that I see from less expensive options.

app maybe okay, but its very confusing to understand. I have tried about 30 min to set a simple task for a particular date, but it doesnt show up anywhere. So, i will keep looking for a more simplyfied app. Sorry.

The 1st action the app wants is to name a list. What am I listing and why would I name it? What I'm looking for is a reminder with an alarm using the ringtones already on my phone to remind me of important events. This app doesnt seem to function that way. I dont know what I'd use this app for.

PLEASE make a home screen where it shows your active main tasks allowing you to just press and view them without having to click the top left button snd select. this would be VERY convenient. thank you.
It failed to notify me for the first time. I set up recurring monthly notifications for my bills and it was working perfectly. I'm two days late for a bill payment now.üò£

alarm that's supposed to go off at 11am,goes off 40 to 60 minutes later, for no discernable reasons. also, make picking time a 24 hours scheme. it seems to always assume i want to be reminded of something at 11 pm

YOUR CONDESCENDING ATTITUDE IS NOT HELPING YOR CASE. There is a sublist reorder but NOTHING for the MAIN LIST. THERE IS NO SORT OF ANY KIND says sort by DO DATE or lets you PICK WHAT TO SORT BY, A LOGIC CHOICE. Completed tasks NEED TO CHANGE IMIEDIATELY so you KNOW IT'S COMPLETED & next month IS SET. I DIDN'T SAY IT WASN'T SIMPLE. The INTERFACE is NOT VERY INTUITIVE. I DID LOOK AT HELP & THERE is LITTLE FOR THE MAIN LIST. YOU ARE very IRRITATING so I am going to try other choices.

Bad experience as the events created (Ex: Birthdays, Anniversaries, etc.) in Alarm mode is working only sometimes!! In such situations, the event is just turning "Red" (but Alarm is not ringing) as if i missed the event...!!
so far the app is great. would get 5 stars if it had a tabbing feature where you can side over to each task name instead of having to go to the menu button to switch.
Not competent at scheduling. Recurring tasks are automatically "completed" if not checked by the scheduled time. There is no way to know if you missed it. The interface is pleasant though.

Got everything set up with all permissions granted and unlike all my other similar apps, and after many tries, this app just doesn't work! I know how to set these apps up to work, at least I thought I did but... this app just will not work on my flagship Samsung phone. I'd give 5 stars for this to work!
Liked the prioritization by dragging and the highlighting, but there does not seem to be a way to create recurring tasks. That's a deal -breaker for me. I'm uninstalling

It was okay but when I tried to set a reminder for 15 minutes from now it said reminders set in the past will not show. That is extremely inconvenient and annoying . I tried setting it for 15 minutes from now but didn't work. Would have given five stars if it wasn't for this issue

I got a new phone and I backed up all my data from the application. When I came to restore the data it's says that only in premium version its possible. That wasn't mention when I did a backup file. So all important data is gone...

There is no way to create repeated scheduled tasks. I already have Google calendar for what this does. Its nicer looking but I don't need what I already have. EDIT. in response: no it's not easy. And honestly, the app has so many more issues. Deleting things is difficult, but making mistakes in organization is easy. Organization is not great on this app. I don't like your app guys. I dont know who it's good for, but its not me. But I appreciate the slight on my post.

It is a great tasks app I have ever seen but it was super duper expensive for me like I'm just a student. I just want to share my file to my mothers phone so that it can be secure even my phone will die. I hope you can do something about it.

Nice app with a lot of feature but I found a bug. If you use the repeat task, evertime the task repeat, the complete mark on sub-task suppose to be in not done yet state but the system doesn't do that. The tasks is repeated with completed state sub-task.
it was pretty good on my old phone. then when everything was ported to my new one, the app came, but not the lists I'd made. what's the point of that?! I've deleted it.
It would be great if it defaulted to a home screen with all the lists. I cannot find my other lists. Where the hell is what should be obvious, "your lists"
Confusing!!, i want to like this app, but as an aspie, im finding it confusing to navigate, considering deleting üò•
It's just okay, it's too easy to delete tasks on accident and it puts it in backwards

Thanks, but it now has gone wrong being unable to alert and no alarm at all. Please advise if this app is still ok to keep!!!?
Widget unresponsive. Boy, I am incredibly unlikely. I am the ONLY one to ever experience this! It must just be me.
Not very user friendly. So many steps to make a reminder that you will have forgotten what you wanted to remind yourself to do.
Not at all use ... Its not remainding with alarming then whats is the use of remainder app... Its only alarming while we open the app... Not usefull at all
I love nearly everything about this app, but it eats up the battery on my phone like crazy because it is always running in the background.
Thank u, but what I actually want to know is what settings I must use to let the app pop up on the screen even if the screen is locked. Thanks.
I really want to love this app but it won't even let me select PM so its constantly telling me its past the due date, which makes the app very useless to me.
Needs to be more user friendly , looked for a set reminder but could not find one , too many options for me .
can't back up and restore your lists unless you pay them so all my lists are gone. can't put a necessary feature like that behind a paywall.
Almost what I needed... no way that I could find to repeat tasks for future days without inputting them all individually for each day... thats a deal breaker

What an unprofessional reply. While swiping towards right the tasks are getting deleted. At least it should ask for confirmation whether the delete is happening accidentally or we really want to delete.
Terrible. I've missed so many reminders despite adding it to unmonitored apps and not being on power saver. I give up.
Paid for premium. Settings had reflected that I am using paid version up until the most recent update. Now it says "Upgrade to Premium". What is going on?
After setting the reminder and adding alarm sound in it I am only able to feel the vibration, sound is completely missing...
Almost what i need, except there's no option to set a start & end time with reminder for the start. So it's useless (for me).
It‚Äôs not that good as much as I thought before I downloaded it. It never sent me notifications or alarms. I missed my two events because of this. üò≠üò≠
Unhelpful cryptic instructions, Premium beta painfully slow. Can't waste time fathoming sublists and other features, though the app looks promising.
I'm using this app, but when I repeat the schedule weekly, it shows no repetition. So this means I need to make a schedule weekly? Ineffective. Please fix this. :(
The app no longer reminds me of tasks and keeps bringing up ones marked complete.

i hate how you cannot open the app and see all your lists there. you have to have one open at all times and it does not show a list of your list on the home screen. deleting this app for this reason. too bad... the rest is great. but they need a home screen. they don't have one.

I loved this app at first, but now when I change my task dates/times, it doesn't actually change them, and continues to alert me at the original time even though I've clearly changed it. It's very annoying.

Great app.. and as of now my main reminder app. But few areas for usability improvement. The most prominent. 1) Reminder calendar is fixed to start from Sunday as 1st day of week - very uncomfortable as Monday is our 1st day- system locale is right, other apps are fine! 2) more pronounced or large area to tap for reminder day/time - often I tap a bit above and this turns off the reminder function. 3) Very hard to apply swipe gesture to delete a task, I had to try dozen times until it reacts!

simple app, widget is bad (left side has a bar that ruins symmetry, also you cant remove the new task button), also, why can I change list color but cant change button color? would also be cool to preview what "compact/cozy" and whatnot settings do instead of having to select them one by one, leave settings, and go back in to change them again. all in all, its almost a 5 star app, but the nuissances ruin the experience a bit.

The backup feature does not work. I am stuck having to copy over 1000 items in my lists manually. I understand syncing is a premium feature, but the backup feature is not and I wish I hadn't bothered with this app in the first place. Edit: In response to your comment, my problem isn't the fact that I want premium features for free, it is the fact that I downloaded this app knowing that it had a free backup feature built-in, which is the main reason I chose this app. Your response shows a lack of professionalism, and frankly, maturity. The premium features do not include a back-up feature, but rather a syncing feature, which doesn't suit my needs. Your app is not the value of a free coffee. The premium features cost $20.99 for a subscription, not a one-time fee. The app accepts donations, but it's also for profit. The description of the app and it's features are misleading, and this is why I am giving you a negative review.

Looking as everyone else's very +ve reviews. I seem to be the odd one out but I didn't find it straightforward. It is too easy to delete a list (on my S9 at least) with even a slight bit of a swipe. Once deleted it is lost. Why not have a 'back' or 'undo' button? Personally I don't find the heading, group, list structure particularly straightforward although I've now got used to it.

Cute, so there's another star, But if it takes longer than pen, paper & Sellotape I'm not paying ¬£45 for a lifetime license. As every computerized to-do app, it's seriously more cumbersome than MS-Outlook ... and that's not a compliment by any stretch of the imagination. Setting up a morning routine takes all morning. My reminders (at various intervals) randomly stopped activating. For example, a daily reminder that last activated a week ago, or one for every 4 days that last showed itself 8 days ago. If this keeps happening I will need to look for a more reliable one. Too bad, this app was great on my old phone. Leaving for another app. Very good, bar repeated tasks resetting daily so if you complete 1 in advance of due date (as actioned early/next reminder not required), it'll still keep coming up every single day, showing as uncompleted. So if on holiday, work/usual home reminders would keep going off & showing in list (increasing stress as appearance of incorrectly long list).Raised with friendly support but not being adjusted.Filtering doesn't help as still completing task twice min. each time!

Looks nice. Has plenty of functionality. Can't actually use it because there is something wrong with reminders. Nothing wrong with device, reminders do show up. They show up at a wrong time. If I had not set reminder in a different app, I would have missed an appointment. Looks like a good app, and I understand the need to fund it with premium. I really don't appreciate the dishonest marketing of premium, however. You and everyone else all look at this and instantly see that some features and functions are free and others are paid. By itself that's fine. But do not say that all features are fully free and then also say that if you want to use these features you have to pay. If it doesn't matter that it's lying, maybe it matters that it's bad for business.

28 Oct 2018: same problem. Repeating tasks do not update and advance to next due date when completed. See how it goes. 27 Oct 2018: This app didn't work as well for me. It would regularly uncheck tasks I'd completed or check tasks I'd not completed. The repeating task function didn't work well either.

The star rating & my comment are only for the move capability. The order within the list can't be easily rearranged. Move to top and move to bottom is the only option. There's another move which tries to move the task to the same list if you have only one list. What is needed is a simple drag and drop of a task to a different order. The 2nd option is to have only 'Move' upon touch and hold, and then pop up a sub menu. This sub menu can have up / down arrow and other move choices.

It's excellent if you don't make the mistake of using the sub-tasks feature. Sub-tasks are broken. Well, they kind of work as long as you don't care whether the app correctly remembers which sub-tasks are complete and which ones are incomplete and don't mind if the app just randomly changes that for you behind your back.

Great app, but truly predatory subscription model that includes allowing you to back up your tasks, but not to restore them without premium. I reinstalled to try and fix a bug and lost my tasks Edit: look, as a developer I 100% understand what it takes to develop an application. But it's misleading to allow the back-ups for free and then require money yo restore. Having features locked behind a pay wall is one thing, doing so without warning people makes it feel like exploitative
