I have no experience, no level, no coins, NOTHING. I was having a really awful day and this was just icing on the cake. There was so much I put into this game. How can I remember all of the tasks I scheduled for myself? I am so so discouraged.

Never have I ever...written a review on an app. Such things are beneath me. Having said that, I was super annoyed that I'd have to reenter my to dos and dailys and basically my schedule of stuff to keep track of. Great idea for an app (especially for us gamers) but not so good on ze other stuff. Will not use. Delete. Game Over.

Ever get a phone call from a Salesman whom you don't remember giving your phone number out to? this is the app that does it. it reads your phone number and identity and uploads it to the cloud where it can later be sold to the highest bidder. this app makes sure that it gets your identity because you have to login before you can even use it. once you log in, the game is a huge disappointment. mypoli has everything over this.

Requires being online to use. Which is a shame because it looks like a fun way to get motivated. Would use if it didn't require constant network or wifi connection (I live and work in rural areas) . Had to uninstall due to inability to use throughout the day.

Broken app on Android. Tried to create a new account and objects were missing from the app. For instance, the initial tutorial only had pictures and no words. Also when making my avatar, there were no images or options that showed up. Worked fine on my wife's iPhone but not my note 9.

Class system is broke. Tried to select a mage when I hit level 10, but it kept getting an error. Somehow ended up as a rogue and now it wants a purchase to change class. Also has an issue with scheduling monthly tasks to occur on the same day of the same week (i.e. The third week of each month on Sunday)

I kept getting empty screens when opening the app, so I pressed skip. Filled out the registry info and was taken to character creation where I couldn't see my character or the build options. I could select things like body or hair, but nothing appeared relating to that.

Can't log in with google, can't register. Apparently I have an email associated but can't retrieve the password. I've lost any interest I had in using the app. It's not worth the effort. Devs, please don't ask me to email support. It's not worth the time tome, just fix your app.

Need to be online to use this app. In case you make changes in offline mode. It doesn't sync automatically when online. You need to again make those changes. Enable offline feature and offline data should be synced when ever we are online. Once this is done, you got my 5 star.

I love this app. It has truly helped me stay organized in a more efficient way. The biggest help with this is the guilds. The guilds have been uplifting and have given challenges that help me even more, even helped my mental state. The guilds are also how many people find party members. I give a one star rating because Habitica is getting rid of guilds and the tavern. Without them, there will be no community, no helpful challenges for specific needs, and no way to find party members in the app.

Recent update has so many bugs. Tasks and habits will be gone upon first opening the app. I have to restart the app every time I want to do something. Save and delete buttons are the same color as the banner or gone entirely. I love this game but I'm about to be done after this update. üôÅ

This was a great app & the best bit for me was the guilds which allowed me to get a bit of external motivation & help with my disabilities which can impact my ability to be consistent enough to be on a team with others (which is limited in number anyway). I paid for an annual subscription to help support these features so hearing that the guild function is being closed means I will no longer be paying. I may as well just use a paper list or another app without guilds. 1* due to removing guilds.
Notifications don't work.

So... I downloaded the app, I made my account, and I created my first daily task. Exciting right? Next thing you know, the app crashes and it NEVER opens again. Just keeps crashing each time I open it. I really hope this issue in resolved fast since this is a fantastic idea of an app, but until then, 1 star is the best I can give.
No offline support? Seriously? It's 2024 people! Besides, I would love to see time tracking integrated into the app.

Just completed a huge and enormously stressful to-do, which I had logged in-game. When I ticked it off my list I lost a level and got a patronizing message. I get the impression this is designed solely for a neurotypical experience because instead of getting rewarded for doing something that had my anxiety going crazy, I got punished. Uninstalled.

Very limited character creator. There is not even an option for long hair. I get locking customization options behind a pay wall, but not offering the most basic options is unacceptable. UI is cluttered and frustrating to use. Tutorial and examples do a very poor job of explaining what each section is. I had to rely on 3rd parties and half the people I spoke to were also confused and gave up using it as intended. Rather than help with productivity, this app ended up reducing my productivity

Same issue as Don Smith who wrote a review on 10/10/19. Will consider this app but the lack of slide visuals and character visuals makes the app in-op. Current phone is the Google pixel 4xl......perhaps I misspoke in regards to the reply. My issue is not with the visuals but the lack of visuals. Everything is blank for me so literally can not see half of the content.

Downloaded this app hoping for a fun way to form new habits, but when I get to the register screen the first two tutorial panels are blank and then the third one lets you link social media accounts. Then I can't save the username and display name I create, and the avatar generator screen doesn't load any options. Opened the app the next day to find nothing I could edit had been saved. Uninstalled and tried registering again with a different account and got the same results. Pretty disappointed

Very depressing. I put in the effort for quests. I got excited about my pending damage for nothing. Quest ends just before my cron and all my pending is lost. I haven't been able to use my pending anything for days. That's not motivation. It's devastation. It never matters if i task or don't if my whole turn is skipped because of timing. Working hard for just collecting stuff and never getting to actually quest. My pending should keep rolling over until I get a turn. I should get a turn.

As soon as I downloaded the app and made a new account, I couldn't create a new character because under the body, skin, and other options to make your character was blank. When I changed my display name, I got a weird message for 'profile.name' required. The randomize button didn't even work for me either. I left originally because there were many bugs with to-do's and other things and I'm not confident it's functional past the character creator, so I don't see a point to continue. On the S10E

I purchased a one-year subscription and canceled the automatic renewal. They cancled the gems that I should be getting every 3 months and said "Since you cancelled the auto-renew, that subscription is still active, and that is what has pushed your next hourglass for the month-to-month subscription to February 2024. This is expected, correct behavior. We understand this may not be to your preference, but we have clarified the situation as much as we can".

The app is broken right now. Downloaded today to try it out and the first two slides were blank. Character creation is all blank. Unfortunately deleted but was looking forward to trying. This has been catalogued by others. When its fixed I'll try again but so far it seems that this app is only really properly supported for iPhone users. (I have a Samsung S9)

I signed up for account, it wouldnt log me in on the app but sent me an email and i was able to get in that way. Made a couple tasks, wouldnt let me go further. Then app finally let me create tasks, but every time i tried to "do" a task it said i was out of sync. Logged out of online and app. Tried to relog into app. It does the little spinny thing like its going to start then doesnt leave log in screen.

Server issues ended up draining about 125% of my battery today, 45% of the day's phone useage with an activity of "less than 1m," presumably due to the home screen widget. Between that and the strange choices of the staff lately (removing all the community features that made this app stand out), I'll be moving to Offline Notepad. As someone who's used Habitica since 2014, let me suggest you find something less fiddly; stability has been an issue with Habit RPG/now Habitica since the beginning.

First thing I did when I installed the app was disable notifications and yet I still get constantly spammed with notifications all day long. That aside, the app is poorly made. UI is very buggy. Chat functions are glitchy and don't update mezsages correctly. Sometimes the main ui responds to nothing. You can switch tabs and nothing changes till you close and open the app again. Almost all fun and worth while content is locked behind a paywall or subscription.

Used to be one of the best task managing apps out there, even without the gamified features. The biggest selling point was its online community as you could connect with people and hold each other accountable. Unfortunately, due to a falling out with their volunteer mod team a few months back, they've now removed almost all social features. I can no longer recommend habitica.

I really really dispise apps that require you to be connected in order to use them. There's no reason for it. I'm a professional pilot which means if I can't check off habits while I'm at work, and I cross into midnight in whatever time zone, I lose points making the whole game pretty lame. There is no need to have to be connected in order to check off habits.

2021 update: the app continues to lose data and just be janky in general. My streaks are constantly being lost even though the streak is a weekly thing and I've done this habit 6 days in a row? Sometimes the app opens and just displays no data, no habits, no dailies, and has to be force closed and reopened. It's all really discouraging, I'd hoped the problems had been worked out since I stopped using it last but they haven't.

DL'd to try this app out, but could not get past the initial setup. Buttons missing labels or information, lethargic loading issues, and the graphics are really sub par for what other games host currently. Even the initial avatar appearance has most things locked behind a pay wall, and keeps putting me in a wheelchair! The idea behind the app has a lot of potential, and would be a joy to see if they can make it better and working properly. Will have to wait and see. As is? Not functional.

Paid features are just cosmetics. There's no "game." There's just a jingle when you do a task & earn meaningless "gold" & "experience" in order to "level up." You can spend gold on pointless tools & armor that do nothing. The"Quests" feature is strongly intended for multiplayer. You earn pets, experience, gold & armor from quests, which do not do anything except look cool or pretty. Nothing meaningful has been released, & they removed a graph habit tracker in the past. There's no adventure.

I used to use this app often & got a subscription to it. Then I needed to financially cut back on stuff, and this app was one that got cut. I never deleted it, but I canceled the subscription& stopped using it. Then, after about a year, I started getting charged again out of nowhere! I know for certain I got a new card since then, so I literally have no idea how they got my new info, but I'm really uncomfortable with the idea that an app started charging me again after a year with *NO* warning.

This app is completely unusable on my Note10+ The account creation is riddled with errors and when I finally get into the app, I can't click on any items or add a new item without the app instantly crashing. I was excited by the premise and motivated to start using it, but the experience was downright embarrassing. I'd love for a developer response here to acknowledge these problems and maybe offer some solutions.

This seems like a fun idea, and was recommended to me as especially helpful for people with ADHD, so I was intrigued. Unfortunately, I have encountered a bug where when I get to the screen where I choose my screen name and username, I cannot press the next button after filling out the name and username. Then, when I exit the app and go back to it, it's the default character and I cannot customise it/my account.

I really want to use this app, but on my Galaxy S10, the first 2 of the 3 slides in the introduction before logging in, are blank. The character visuals on the character customization are invisible, and on the settings menu, I scroll down and the options start to overlap each other (hard to describe). I will consider reinstalling after the graphical issues are fixed because it seems like a great app, but currently it's unusable for me.

While the web version of Habitica has been working fine, the mobile app has been unusable for days. "Server connection lost." For days. I can understand needing to connect to servers to receive gold/xp/damage from checking off habits/dailies/to-dos, but the fact that you can't check off tasks without a connection is a major flaw. Currently looking to switch to a new app where all the productivity features can be done completely on the client side.

This app has some major problems. It seemed to work fine for the first day of running. After the first day no reminders were executed. Any game armor or weapons could never be equipped. it appeared you could equip them but once you left the screen they become unequipped and they never showed up on the avatar. I mainly got this app for productivity and since the reminders do not work I'm not certain I'm going to continue using it unless these problems are fixed.
I paid for the gems, it took my money but did NOT give me any gems that I paid for. Garbage scamming app.

Unfortunately, the notifications pop at totally random times on random days, which are few and far between. They're the whole reason I downloaded the app, so I can't recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable accountability system.

Both the app and the site are super buggy, the app won't refresh the daily tasks everyday and sometimes when you erase tasks they stay there bugged, you can't get rid of them or check them or anything. The app also constantly gives me the error "lost connection" although I have quite good signal and connection and no other app has struggles with data or WiFi... It is a good idea the app but a poor execution.
It's been 4 years and there's still no custom sounds on Android. Seriously?

I was very excited to try this but the app is a joke. There's no proper user flow or error handling- after registering I got no confirmation, I had to quit and open the app again so it would let me login. I added goals but they were in no way saved after reinstalling for troubleshooting. I can't check them as completed. No tutorial, no character loads like in the screenshots. It's not a network problem either, it's just a broken app
Does not send noticeable push notifications to keep you engaged. Rubbish
Offline restrictions suckcs as someone who spends most of his work day without any network, app is in big part unusable and big offline baner is annoying.

Asked me to rate it before I've had a chance to see a single feature. Disgusting. Definite cash grab vibes. Don't waste your time. If you're asking for a 5-star review before I even get to see the app, you're not trustworthy.

Are you kidding? All the cool character customization items (which are very limited in the first place) cost real money. I thought the purpose of the app was to help people by motivating them with rewards, but there's absolutely nothing interesting you can buy for your character with the regular currency. What is the point then? Ridicilous. Put ads in it if anything, but not lock the very few items you have available behind a currency that costs real money.

The server connection error is well known and there is no known fix. I find that it makes the app nearly unusable. Since the error wastes my time (you gotta close and relaunch the app to fix it), Habitica often prevents me from handling my real life, rather than helping me with it. Edit: dropping one star cause the issue persists. This company is sinking fast. Edit 2: connection errors everywhere... another star is gone. Moved elsewhere. Such a pity though, I met good friends there.

Busted from the start. On the first open of the app I got a 3 pane swipe intro and the first 2 were blank purple screens. Then, on the Avatar creation screen the Avatar wasn't visible. When finally getting in to the app the "help text" bubble didn't point at anything, just the bottom of the screen for the whole dialogue. This app sounded interesting but it seems there's a complete lack of interest in quality.

Functionally very very limited. Try setting up a habit for every x days, weeks, x times per week. No rescheduling, no reminder settings (remind x minutes before, remind on time) No sound /notification settings, you can choose a sound theme, tho no idea what it is or if I'd like it. On s plus side the rewards are nice and creative and you can pay to get more of them.

Removal of guilds really wrecked Habitica. I had a subscription that I let lapse and will not renew. I was part of a couple of challenges that greatly enhanced my life, and a big part of the experience were the guilds attached to those challenges. Checking in on other's progress was a big part of them. I've collected all the pets, mounts, and gear I wanted (used it about a year), so I've learned how to make dynamic habit trackers in Google Sheets and am transitioning off Habitica. Such a waste.

Frequent Connectivity Issues!! I have used Habitica on and off for the last 4 years. Recently I re-joined, wanting to take control of my good habits and trying to eliminate the bad ones, I decided to support the platform by paying a year's subscription. Big mistake. Most of my time on the app is spent refreshing and refreshing over and over, waiting for it to be usable again. The performance is truly terrible and it takes away from the good that this app can do! Truly a shame.

EDIT: developer response does not help with the fact that I am stuck on the "refill your health and try again" screen. I literally cannot use the app because it won't let me. That's 90% of the reason I gave it a one star, because I cannot use it anymore. That's what I meant when I said it "practically forced me to uninstall," it just froze completely. Uninstalling and re-installing did not fix the problem. I guess you just didn't read the end of my review.
this used to be a good app but then they removed all social aspects with no valid explanation. it's no longer good or useful without those.
I havent tried the app yet so I can't give more than 1 star, no point prompting review on initial app start. I just made the account too.

A very badly built application, it constantly lost connection to the servers and would crash, or not update. The UI would freeze, many UI elements are non-responsive when clicked. I got to level 10, and even though I was doing my tasks, I still lost all my energy and died, and fell back to lvl4. It quickly moves you to microtransactions to buy diamonds to stay alive and away from habit forming behaviours. On the whole it's a good idea, but this missed the mark by a long way.
you have to be online and you can't change the colors of the tasks(they go red when they aren't going bad it's just a long to do)
very unforgiving. it's supposed to garner and encourage good habits but I lost all my accumulated gold and skills as soon as I died. uninstalling!
At first, it sounded like a fun way to track my To Do lists. But... No task sorting No Today view No Calendar No Categories Useless.

Servers are still garbage. I wrote an entire 20 item to-do list and shock and behold; "sErVeR eRRoR" pops up again and deletes the entire thing. Probably shouldn't have fired their volunteer mods and coders.
The notifications do not work, which kind of defeats the whole point of using this app. It's an incredibly cool looking app, with a fatal flaw.

Was great, but now is super slow. Even after clicking start my day it doesn't understand that it's a different day so it's keeping all my tasks that a finished from a previous day. Very annoying, uninstalling.

The habitica used to be a big part of my life and was even a free contributor, but seeing all this makes me want to leave and never return.

Seemed like a great idea until I found out the weekly streaks will only reset on Mondays - despite an option in the app to set week start to any day. In my view, you can make it or break it when you take care of your paying customer or ignore him. It seems like they dont see it that way. Perhaps now they will pay attention.

The ads that started after a week of a nice ad-free experience were the most awful malware like things forcing downloads of apps without my permission, popping up at random with sound even when the app wasn't open and more. This is an unacceptable way to treat your free users. I'd much rather have been given a 7 day free trial and be forced to pay to use it after that than what this is.

I initially found this app very useful, so I upgraded to the premium version for the automatic backup feature. When I got a new phone and transferred all of my data to the new device, I discovered none of my backups had actually occurred and over two years of habit tracking data had been lost.

Not a fan of how this directly links to your calendar. I wanted a separate app to track two different sets of calendars. If I wanted to see the calendars shared with me on Google, I would just use Google calendar. When you turn off the view of one calendar in this app, it also turns it off in your Google calendar. I like the concept of the tabs at the bottom but unless I can un-sync this from Google, it is useless for me.

Sync doesn't work properly with Microsoft calendar anymore, it was once great but this makes it useless for me. Sometimes I see new appointments I added to my Outlook calendar, sometimes it doesn't show up. The reminders mostly don't show up and I have duplicated entries sometimes.

Full screen ads ruin it all I've been using this since it was just "business calendar". It was still $7 back then so I wouldn't buy it but would click the ads every now and then. Now with the full screen ads it's practically unusable. Also, before the dev comes in with the stock "the free version has ads" response: no duh it has ads. We didn't pay for the app because its upfront cost is too high so we liked the corner ads. Now you force them to take over our screens. Uninstalled and 1-Star.

Ok app. It's better than the default app that came with my phone. However it has a lot of issues. You can't organize tasks or events, it automatically alphabetizes everything. I tell it I don't want notifications. I change it in settings & it adds a random notification. If you set something to be a recurring monthly task, once you click it after it's done, it moves it to a different day the next month. It's not reliable. I switched to a paper calender, which is easier to view & organize.

Update: My events prior to 2021 are all gone! Do you delete events after a certain time??? I'm having trouble with duplicate events popping up on my calendar and nobody is responding to my emails. Also, the custom color settings should transfer over when you get a new phone. I always have to start from scratch choosing my colors again when I switch phones. Why can't the color choices move with us?

I've had this app for years, even upgraded it to the premium version. Loved it.. then as the developers started updating, I started having many issues. Each time i used the app it would show in the premium or free version; it was inconsistent. I wrote the customer service for assistance and I didn't get any help. So i lived with it. Most recently, I started receiving ads after every entry; Not okay!! I sent another email 2 wks ago which they have not responded to; which is why I'm here. Help!

I am going to drop this app after years of use because of recent full page video ads which are out of control. Edited to add: of course the free version has ads. Always has, and I don't mind, because *something* has to pay for app development. But these new full page, video that can't be shut down, in your face for many seconds ads are new and intolerable. That was a bad business mistake you can correct. I hope you correct it soon. I'll be checking back to see.

I used to like, even love this app. It was great. Now though, every time I add an event on my calendar an ad comes up and stays there until it is finished. It's awful! So far the ads have not been inappropriate, just annoying. I don't think that going to the pro version would fix this. I don't even know how to find the pro version to purchase as it doesn't show up in the play store. Super frustrating. I don't want to find another app. I just want this one to work without the silly ads.

Used this calendar for years without any issue. Now ads will take over the entire screen after entering an appointment in the calendar and there is a delay before you can cancel them out. Terrible and disappointing choice on the part of the developers. They've lost me as a user as I refuse to pay for a pro version for a simple calendar app. Do yourself a favor and stay away. The ads suck and are annoying.

Its a great app I used for years. I was ok with ads, but the full screen can't be immediately banished ads make it unusable. When I need Calendar info, I need it RIGHT NOW. I'll give it a couple of weeks but if it doesn't go back to discrete corner ads I'm out. Edit post response: I'd have paid a couple of bucks for ad free version, because it is better than stock Calendar. But its not 7 bucks better. So if you're not going to remove full screen ads, after years of using, gotta say buh bye...

Now there are ads. I have used this app for years and there were no annoying ads. Now i randomly get a full screen ad with no way to dismiss, after saving a new calendar entry. Bad move. A small ad at the bottom of the screen would be ok, but a full screen ad that has to play all the way through? No thanks. Will find a new app. Very disappointed.

Resonse (2/13/20): I know that the free version is not ad-free.  The issue that what you have done recently is to force people to watch ads instead of just clicking them away. And this happens while I'm trying to add or edit something on the calendar. Had to change from 5 to 1 star because of these pop up ads. Will be looking for a new app soon.

App is total garbage on my Samsung classic watch 4. Have it for years on my phone, but installed on my watch today. Crashes immediately when trying to add an event. Reinstalled and tried to add event, and also immediately crashes, no prompting for which keyboard this time. Guess I'll stick with samsung calendar.

This freezes and requires reboot constantly. I have a oneplus 7T on Android 10 and this is the ONLY app that doesn't work right. Love this calendar up until a few days ago. The ads used to be fairly non-intrusive, which I get and could totally live with. So, 2 (almost 3) years ago I purchased the pro version of this app. At the time, that unlocked access to all present and future "pro" aspects. Ads that completely take over your phone & have a forced timer so you can't exit out of them. - EDIT - It's untrue what the developer says regarding ads appearing once every 18 hours, it is more frequent. The "skip" the developer is referring to is NOT instantly available, you must wait a timer out. - It wouldn't be a problem if the ads weren't so disruptive, they literally take over your screen. I'm so disappointed. I've used this app for years as it was one of the best calendar apps, but now the obtrusive video ads that hold you hostage have completely changed the experience. I finally had to uninstall it because it's to the point where it's just too much. I'm understanding about banner ads if you don't want to buy the Pro version, but this is unacceptable.

I've used this app for years and have loved it up until now. Now I get full page ads that sit there for 5 seconds and disrupt what I'm doing. I don't mind a full page ad that I can back out of or scrolling ads at the bottom, but to force me to watch a 5 second ad is not reasonable. Seems like they're forcing you to pay up or move on to another app. If this continues I'll find another app.

About a year ago I left a review about sync errors. I have given this app full permission in android settings. It still does not update changes to my work calendar. I'm deleting this app as it is no longer useful. Update May 8: I did those suggestions, and thank you for the help. But it is still now showing updates.

I do understand "free" means accepting advertising, but your recent ads are horrible, cannot be shorten, and sometimes embarrassing. I uninstall now. Left you two stars for old times sake. *Added after Dev response. It wasn't the frequency. It was the advert that was served. Putting dark mode behind a paywall is straight up torture/ableism, my dudes üôÉ Edit: I'd be completely fine with the paid themes if a basic light and dark theme was available for free. I (and other people with sensory issues) can't use an app without dark mode at all. It's not a cool design feature, it's an accessibility issue. Free versions are there so people can try the app out before they pay, if you make that inaccessible, disabled people aren't even allowed to make that decision.

Installed this app with intention of possibly purchasing the premium version. Then I found out that it's an app that requires a subscription. I am so sick and tired of apps that require subscriptions.

TO THE DEVELOPER: There's GOOGLE Exchange and it DOESN'T let me use a Microsoft account as it fails to add it every single time I put in my credentials. I'm sick of repeating myself. BC2 doesn't properly support Microsoft accounts as it relies on Google's poor sync implementations. That's fine. It might work as an app for other people. It doesn't to me. If/Once you add an alternative solution, I'll revisit my review. Until then, I'll use something else.

Ads that cover the whole screen [Later update] Since you bothered to respond to my review I will elaborate: 1. Any app that displays weird looking adds (ads for games?!) that cover the whole screen are suspicious apps: spyware, etc. You should count yourself lucky that I did not report your app to Google. The only reason for not doing that is that I've been using your app for some time, before the new ad behavior, and it was fine. 2. Let's ignore my previous point for a minute and consider this: a "Business Calendar" app that sends me adds about online games that I can "skip" by stopping the app and then re-opening... Really, if I'm a business person what would I want with an online game for children? 3. You mentioned the apps has to be deployed daily. Tough luck! I did not make your release schedule, you did. Furthermore I would be perfectly fine using an older version of the app, with no ads, or far fewer adds. I really don't care about the latest releases, and most business people don't either. We want stable things that we don't need to upgrade every week or so. 4. Since the ads covering the whole screen started being pushed I realized that your app has little added value over the calendar apps that came preinstalled on my mobile devices... And they don't have any adds.

Great, except... it has a serious (and unpredictable) problem displaying events from both Google/Outlook calendars. Compared to version 1 - poor. Allows for editing one entry of (for example) a weekly appointment, but rather than edit the one instance (as you think you are doing) it creates a new one, so you have a double entry, the original which you can't delete, even after synching. If you've set weekly appointments and one is cancelled, you should be able to edit that one instance without creating a duplicate. I've had this installed for some time now, thinking that the developers would resolve these problems, but although the app has regular 'updates', nothing has changed. Drag and drop defaults to copy, imo should be 'move' by default. If you change an appointment it changes, not duplicates. Also the interface and look (big text and colours) looks like a children's calender, while the original version actually looked quite professional.

Very nice app with a bad drawback: today's repetition for a recurring task will not appear unless I mark yesterday's task as done! Here's how this is very bad for me:  - I have many recurring daily tasks, and it's a very tedious job to mark all my recurring tasks as done, even those that were NOT done! It gets much worse if I don't use the app for a few days! Then I have to mark all recurring tasks as done for every and each previous day!!!!  - The app forces me to record false information! A task that was not done on a specific day, should stay there as NOT done, and the recurring task should be generated for the following day.  - You have only 3 options for a recurring task: 1) to mark it as done in order for it to appear on the following day. 2) not to mark it as done, and it will never "recur"! 3) to delete, and it disappears, and naturally, it will never "recur"!  A recurring task should recur, regardless of marking or not marking the previous repetition as done!

Tasks are no longer syncing with Google Calendar. Therefore they do not sync between devices. Lowered rating from 5 to 2 stars. I'm trying to respond to the Developer. Their comment doesn't show up in the edit pop up so I'm not sure where it will be when I submit this. I have been using Business Calendar since I got my original Droid about a decade ago. Once I decided that I liked the way that it worked, I paid for the pro upgrade. When Business Calendar 2 came out I installed it along side Business Calendar Pro to keep the pro features without an additional payment. I also installed both programs on an Android Tablet. Everything synced with Google Calendar and tasks showed up on both devices. The only issue was that if you entered a repeating task on one device and marked it complete on the other the repetitive task was not created. I realise that this is a Google problem, but you could probably pass this information in the description field if you wanted an enhancement. I recently got a new phone. That is when the tasks quit syncing. I think that a newer version of the apps were installed on the phone than I had been using. I also upgraded the apps on the tablet to see if that would fix the problem. I have just uninstalled the apps from both devices, deleted the tasks from Google Calendar in a web browser, and reinstalled the apps on both devices. I recreated several repeating tasks on the phone. They did not sync to Google Calendar.

The biggest bug being adding in birthdays or anything that has a date, as instead of putting the date I requested it will put it a day behind or a day beforehand.

Checked out this app in my quest to find a good solution for combining calendar events and tasks into a single, scrollable homescreen widget. --- Unfortunately, although the app has the option to repeat a task "from the completion date," the functionality is broken.  For example, I scheduled my test task on a Tuesday and set it to repeat every week from the completion date. The app forced there to be a day of the week listed in the repeat schedule, so that it would say something like "repeat weekly on Thursday on completion date." --- Now, having a day of the week and also "from completion date" makes no sense, so I was curious what the app would do. I set my Tuesday task to repeat every Thursday from completion date and checked it off on a Sunday. The app should have rescheduled the task for the following Sunday, but it didn't. It scheduled it for the following Tuesday and completely ignored the "Thursday" and the "from completion date." --- Sorry, Business Calendar 2, but that's just not going to work.

It had bugs and limitations that hindered what I was attempting to accomplish. Problems such as: inaccurate characteristics, no quick access from rewards to inventory, non removable default achievements, inaccurate values on skills after undoing a task and hidden xp multiplier from skills to characteristics.

The app is great, I love it. However, I'm giving it one star because there is a bug that is breaking my workflow! After the last update, Everytime that I go to the task list section in order to search for a specific task, and click the magnifying glass button, the application closes automatically. I cannot search for a task after this :(

Crippled version without even a way to purchase outright. EDIT: I'll be clearer. Many apps features are disabled. But there is no way to just buy the app. The only option is some ongoing payment subscription which makes no sense as this app does not provide any ongoing or backend service, it's just an app! and a simple one at that. It's like going to buy a water bottle and going to check out they take your credit card info and charge you the same price every year that you use the bottle. Bottom line, it's just a scummy business practice.

The constant "turn on notifications" popup made me uninstall this immediately after testing it out. It seems fine if you want notifications on, but there is no way to turn it off without it making the app frustrating to use. Ive found with these types of apps the notifications come at the worst times and are distracting, so i do not want them on at all. Seems counterintuitive when the app is meant to help accomplish tasks, to force a distraction during them.

Enough with the pop-up ads! I don't mind if an app has ads, but if I'm going to be interrupted by a 15 second video every 5 seconds while I'm checking off my list I'm deleting your app. And no, I'm not going to subscribe just because you keep popping up the subscription page. If I have to pay to make the app decently usable, you may as well require I pay for it to begin with.

I love this app! So much that I opted to pay for the permanent subscription. There's just one thing that I don't find great. No Google calendar integration, and no dedicated calendar widget. I could survive of either of these two features existed, but not having either makes it a pain to use. When I schedule tasks, I now have to duplicate them in my Google calendar. What a hassle! I emailed the developer, and got no response whatsoever, so I'm hoping they at least read the reviews!

Could be good if basic features like icons weren't locked behind a paid subscription. Update: your calling THEMES an advanced feature because you want to not because it is one.... Sorry but changing the background color to black, which it should be in the first place isn't an advanced feature, it's about one line of code. I'm a software engineer myself and know the difference between the two. Same goes for icons which are essentially to app functionality. Check out Notion for a great example.

Way overcomplicated for a simple To Do List app. You need to create a task, search through the extremely limited icons, set the XP and coins you get from it, set the XP and coins you lose if you miss it, set all the skills you improve, set the percentages of how much for all of the above, set the reoccurance (which is about 3 steps in and of itself), turn on notifications, tell it WHEN to notify, and finally, save it. For every single task. That's not even getting into the premium features yet.

I can't add any new task for the next days. Every time I select "daily", it resets it to "today only". That task only shows up today. What's the use of being so custom if I can't add my own tasks for the day? Unless I add the "routine" thing, it doesn't work. I should be able to have any "resolutions" for the following day, not just the preset ones, right? It's like nothing I do is even saved. Not to mention the disaster your translation site is.
Makes me sign in but then doesn't carry over information across devices. There is far too much overcomplication to have to set up twice

It's trash. Was forced to switch from Wunderlist only to have this app repeatedly fail as it reported there was a problem with my Microsoft account. I had a nicely working solution that I didn't have to think about. Now that's now gone thanks to this company's need to get it's branding on my phone. At this point I'm going to cut my losses and find some non-proprietary way of keeping/sharing to-do data. No more startups that get bought up and disappear.

Had to uninstall because I kept getting annoying reminders each day that it's time to plan my day. I turned these off in notification settings, only for it to turn itself back on EVERY DAY. Tried turning it off multiple days, but it keeps turning itself back on. Get lost with this and fix your bugs, or just get lost if this is intentional to increase app usage üëéüèªüëéüèªüëéüèª

As an experienced Office 365 subscriber, Android has enough standalone To Do/List apps. What it lacks is a cohesive all-in-one Personal Information Manager. For Windows, that has, for years been Microsoft Outlook. Instead of developing a standalone To Do app, Microsoft development time would be better served adding Tasks and Contacts to it's Outlook app. Extending functionality to the Microsoft Outlook Android app to mirror Microsoft Outlook for Windows would make so much more sense.

I've tried using the app with a shared list for grocery shopping with my partner. When one of us adds a new item to the list, it rarely populates on the other person's list. We've had this issue both using Apple devices and Android devices. We have restarted devices, uninstalled and reinstalled the app, and checked to make sure our devices are updated, but nothing seems to make a difference.

This app WAS AMAZING & it once replaced all others that I used for productivity until the "notes" section began a horrible glitch. While typing, it scrolls so you cannot effectively continue to to read, or edit anything that is written. As an event planner, I literally use digital notes to keep track of EVERYTHING. This is extremely disappointing, but looks like I was correct in considering transferring all of my data to another app over the past few months!

This app is CONSTANTLY dropping added data. I use it to remember all of my 'to-dos' and it drops 1/2 of them. Stuff I have deleted reappears. The app is NEVER in synch with the co-user of my lists. Terrible. I miss Wunderlist. I am in the process of finding a different app to manually transfer all of my data to. That process will be much less frustrating than trying to use this one.

This was my favorite app for many months, center of my home screen, used it every single day multiple times a day. Loved it. Put so many tasks, reminders, notes, subtasks, etc. in it. And then, a few days ago, I opened it up and everything was gone. Everything. Thought, OK maybe it will get restored in a couple days, but nope. Thinking about starting to enter things again, but the prospect of finding it all deleted again someday has taken the fun right out of that. Sooooo disappointed.

I want to like this app, but I regularly run into a problem where it does not notify me of a task even when I set a specific date/time for it to provide a reminder. This happens at random and for no apparent reason. A task app that cannot reliably remind you of the tasks is pretty much useless. Microsoft needs to fix this. Update 2/10/21: Still not giving reminders at random. Unbelievable.
Feel like can add calender
It's just okay, it's too easy to delete tasks on accident and it puts it in backwards

The star rating & my comment are only for the move capability. The order within the list can't be easily rearranged. Move to top and move to bottom is the only option. There's another move which tries to move the task to the same list if you have only one list. What is needed is a simple drag and drop of a task to a different order. The 2nd option is to have only 'Move' upon touch and hold, and then pop up a sub menu. This sub menu can have up / down arrow and other move choices.
I like the Apple task app way better.

Good idea for an app, but I uninstalled due to overcomplicated interface. For example, there are 2 "+" symbols, neither of which are self-explanatory (is it for a sub list of main list or another sub list category. I'd prefer there to be words there to explain what they mean and, additionally, a description of what list you're working under after you enter a list. I need an app that's unobtrusive but yet daily I can easily view my to do lists and subgoals.
Go

The logic sucks. Unintuitive, can get complex with more added stuff. It becomes a mess when you miss tasks that were part of scheduled routine. I spend more time getting around this app instead of having a clear head on what to add and do on my list. This app truly sucks. Everything Microsoft has gone downhill. Keep hiring the indians... typical microsoft product false reviews. 4.7 is way overrated and misleading. microsoft pays 3rd world country users to leave a good review.

Caution anroid users! TO DO app will cause your phone to crash, freeze, etc. Have been using the app for a long time with no issue. Since a few months ago I have switched phones 4 times and with others experiencing the same issues of freezing, it's confirmed. As soon as I uninstall the app phone performs as usual. Don't waste your time with the app, it is not worth anything at the moment. Stay away from TO DO!

There's no recent edits or undo functionality to the tasks. There's also no save button. So you can lose all your changes if you made a change elsewhere, and somehow it didn't get updated to their servers, then view the task on another computer, and nothing has changed. Worse, your new changes on the first computer never went anywhere and you're stuck remembering what you had typed or missed.

I've been using Wunderlist, finally downloaded this to switch. I went to use my info from there, it says it's linked to a Microsoft account, so I go to sign in using that. I sign in just fine but it takes me to my Microsoft account page, no way to actually use the app. Closing it just means I have to sign in again, and back to the account page. I absolutely can't find a way to get to the app/it's features from this page. Beyond frustrating.

A Horrible upgrade! Its predecessor, Wunderlist, was a very useful tool. I could easily add new tasks and speak them by pressing one button. Now you have to go through a variety of clicks to do the same. Wunderlist easily and seamlessly integrated into my different operating platforms. Unfortunately, to do list requires that you use Windows 10 which I do not have and refuse to upgrade from Windows 8.1 Pro. There are other lists out there that you may want to consider.

Edit: originally 3/5 because it is a nice app with one major flaw. Microsoft commented on my original review saying to contact customer service via email I did and they told me to look at one setting but my phone doesn't have that setting. They responded back basically "o well. That's all we got" and said it's my phone's fault. Like really? Piss poor support. Especially considering the app works fine for an extended period but then will stop. Can't be the setting they recommended.

Terrible. When you sign in using the app on a laptop it resets all other apps...like your user info on office 365, which screws up every thing you do outside of the app. I don't want it all connected to one email. I like my apps separate. There is also no week view, and so far I've gotten no reminders despite them being set. Very disappointed that wonderful Wunderlist is being replaced by this unuseable nightmare of an app. I'm not going to be using this.

OMG!! They BROKE what was a very good app! Completed "tasks" can no longer be sorted which makes this app USELESS. We mostly use this app for shopping lists with hundreds of items on the list, mostly in the completed section. When we again need the item, we just uncheck it. When these items were listed alphabetically they were easy to find. Now they are in random order and impossible to find. WOW

Someone thought it was a good idea to add a "feature" that asks me "what i plan to do today?" EVERY. DAY. You can turn it off if you can find the option buried somewhere. I dont need a reminder app to suddenly start reminding me to set up reminders. Seriously who though this was a good idea to add? UPDATE: You can turn off the daily reminder BUT IT WILL TURN ITSELF BACK ON. Also, WHY do I need a Microsoft account? What if I dont want to sync reminders to anything outside my phone? So bad!

I used to love this app, but for the past month or two, the "Add Note" feature has an annoying glitch, which makes it impossible to use. There is some type of automatic carriage return going on that just keeps scrolling down, no matter what you do. If you finger swipe to go to the top, you can barely click the screen where you want to edit before it glitches down to wherever the cursor has progressed. I've uninstalled, restarted, logged back in with the same result. I'm using notepad now, sadly.

I've loved using Wunderlist. Now I'm being forced to use a different app that takes longer to load my lists, it takes an extra click to move an item from one list to another, and you can't change the look of it like we could in Wunderlist. It's little things, but the speed and simplicity are what make a to-do list app useful in the first place. I might have used this app if it could load my tasks as quick as Wunderlist already does.

If you share a list with someone, it hardly ever syncs between users. My wife and I tried to use this for a grocery list after Microsoft killed Wunderlist. The horrible syncing means if someone adds an item to the list, the other person won't see it when they are at the store. Also, Wunderlist was so easy to add a person and share a list. It's a total PITA to share a list now. You basically have to send an invite through text or emai, then you need to log in using a Microsoft account.

Why did you have to ruin a good thing Microsoft. Wunderlist was perfect until you came along. The primary reason why I enjoyed Wunderlist was for it's flawless widget. When you checked off a task from the widget it would simply disappear. But you guys can't seem to do the same thing. Worse part is that your widget glitches out after completing a task (it's more like a 'twitch') like it's trying to get rid of it but can't. Didn't you guys buy the program? Why did you have to change it?

Sbasically does what you want it to. However you will get notifications everyday. Even after you go into settings and turn them off. the next day you still get notifications and you see in the settings that the notification setting that you turned off is turned back on. Have been doing this every day and nothing changes. so you will be stuck getting notifications you don't want everyday. They are hell-bent on making sure this app gives you notifications no matter what your choice. That is wrong.

I like what its trying to do and want to use it, but it's missing a few things. To-Do doesn't support formatting AT ALL (mobile or PC), and any formatting you do in Outlook is erased and spacing is messed up. To-Do has the ability to create subtasks but doesn't translate over to Outlook. The To-Do app on PC doesn't allow you to enlarge the task/note window so your forced to type in this little box on the side of the window. PLEASE FIX THESE!!

Not user friendly... Wunderlist was much better. I have several different lists and liked the "All" view from Wunderlist where I could see all the different tasks from all of my lists on one screen and I could easily move tasks between different lists. Now there is no "All" view and I have to open each individual list separately and go back and forth to see everything... I also can't move a task to another list. I'd have to open one list and copy the text then open the other list and paste...

The app is allowing flagged spam & junk mail into the app. There is no option to turn off unless you don't use this feature all together. I like to flag email option so this so is useless to me. I've tried to look for help regarding the issue but nobody seems to care. Should be a simple option to add. Just allow flagged email from my folders only and not my junk folder??

DANGEROUS - DON'T USE FOR THINGS YOU VALUE. I have seen items and entire lists disappear. Quick search online shows I'm not the only one. A task management app should be Auto saving after every character you type into a draft task. Working on your to-do list while disconnected from the internet should not cause problems. Until Microsoft can commit to the correct priorities I think I'm going to have to find an alternative.

Migrated from Wunderlist, used this app for a few months with no issue, then it deleted all of my sub-lists and their content. The grocery list sucked, since I was at the store when I found they were deleted, but I can recreate those. However, I had movie and TV show recommendations from friends, family, and strangers going back almost ten years that I was slowly working through. They seem to be gone forever. Completely unacceptable. I will find an alternative and recommend everyone do the same.

I've updated this review a half dozen times with various bugs; here we go again. Reported to customer support that when using the "skip to current task" feature on daily tasks, reminders don't get updated correctly sometimes, and will get set for some day in the future or past, sometimes MONTHS in the past. Received a useless condescending reply explaining that I have to complete daily tasks for the new instance of the task to appear. Engineers can't fix a bug they don't know about.

I will update my review when the basic features are fixed. I am extremely disappointed.I ran my warehouse floor with Wunderlist. I added tasks that needed to be done. They would automatically sink to the screens all around the warehouse and supervisors phones and everyone got an immediate notification. I switched everything and everyone over to this and I'll be lucky if one out of 15 screens syncs. Balls get dropped everyday over the last 3 weeks because notifications and syncing problems.

They Ruined Wunderlist The day I got the email saying that Microsoft bought Wunderlist, I cried. That's 'cuz after 20 years of being an IT Manager, I know that everything MS touches turns to sewage. I got an email telling me I had to get my stuff out of Wunderlist by May 6. So I went to download it to my 2 Macs and it won't do it because I don't have the latest OS on my Macs. Correct. It has bugs Apple can't fix. I'll look for another to-do app and hope they don't acquire it 'cuz MS bites.

I had Wunderlist, but it changed to Microsoft To Do. To Do is more clunky than Wunderlist. It does not currently group starred items by category. It does not have a variety of theme back grounds, and the sharing of lists with others had to be done list-by-list and was unnecessaryily time consuming. I am hoping to see significant improvements in thia app.

Bad transfer from Wunderlist. Resharing lists is time consuming. Order of items on lists is not preserved. Looks like it at first until you add something to a list and then it appears at the end/bottom of the list not at the top. Must then sort by order of creation date which throws everything out of wack if you had items ordered by importance or any other custom order.

The app is absolutely great but with one very very painful flaw that makes it just unusable for me!! For the love of God, why does such an awesome Todo app doesn't have an option for recurring reminders ? When I can set recurring due dates for a task, why not recurring reminders? I haven't seen single other good Todo app, either free or paid that doesn't offer this feature. I cannot use this app anymore even though I really love it. An issue from years now, hope they fix it soon.

I moved my data from wunderlist before the deadline. I used a Microsoft 365 account to set up my new to do account using a browser. It worked fine and I was able to access my lists. A week later to access Microsoft To Do but when I log in it says I can't access To Do because I don't have an exchange license. I have tried to log in both in my browser and the apps I downloaded with no luck. I can't access my data which is no longer in wunderlist, apparently no customer support for To Do.

I have to give it a low rating because location based reminders have been "on the list" for two years and counting. This wouldn't be so bad except if you use Cortana, it uses this app for reminders, so you lose location based ability. Add location based reminders and this is a five star app.

Was forced to migrate from Wunderlist. My husband and I both used Wunderlist extensively - sharing and updating lists. When we were force to migrate over, it migrated everything except the lists were not shared anymore. So when I updated my list, it does not update his list. I reshaped that list and it created a duplicate list for him. This is extremely annoying because we have to reshare EVERYTHING.

Why don't daily tasks just work? It can't be that hard. It will push some daily tasks properly and one or two just will not show up. I'll confirm they're set for daily repeat but they'll show as due the day before... Despite being a daily task that's also due today? Super glitchy. Once fixed though, it's an otherwise great app. Daily tasks need to be fixed.

Wunderlist was so good, but this app doesn't sync shared lists. When hubby and I used Wunderlist, he would add something to the shopping list and I would see it immediately. Shared list functionality seems like a one-off on this poor excuse for an app. You share it once, and any changes you make don't update the other person's list. I soooo badly miss my Wunderlist. Oh why did you desert us, Wunderlist? I would have gladly paid for a quality list app.

The update to the app on about April 6th made the app much less useful since it took away the ability to alphabetically sort completed items. When you use the app for grocery items, the completed items no longer sort alphabetically thus adding frustration when sifting through hundreds of items to find the one you are looking for.

Worst implemented app I have ever used. On first use it displayed every piece of SPAM that i have received over the past couple of years. I delete that stuff as soon as it arrives but I guess MS thinks that it's necessary to hold on to that stuff and put it into the Task app. You cannot bulk delete items, either. You have to go to each task item, select it, click the delete icon, then confirm deletion. THATS 3 STEPS for each and every item. This app is the biggest pain in the arse

Ever since the January update that was supposed to fix sync issues my wife and I have had constant sync issues. Worked great before that update and would've given it 5 stars. Edit: If I could give this app 0 stars I would. Thought maybe an error occurred when the latest update was installed so I uninstalled and reinstalled the app. When I try to log back in it brings me to a page that does not exist. Great, I can't even sign back in to my account....

As a long time user of Wunderlist, this new replacement fails at the single most important thing next to holding taks: remind the user of said tasks. If a task comes up as due, I expect it to stay in notifications until I clear the task. Instead, To Do decided there's a time limit on how long a reminder stays on your notifications which means it isn't reminding you anymore which forces you to remember to open the app to see your tasks. This completely defeats the purpose of a reminder.

I'm ok trying new apps. But, Microsoft purchased Wunderlist then forced us to use a much more complicated(shared lists) and unintuitive( access to said lists). My wife and I had a simple lists with about 8 shared lists. The shared lists lost access and had to send an invite to each list. Then I bought a new phone and ask shared settings were gone again. A simple task list should not be this difficult.

This App used to be a simple and functional tool to share lists between people. Unfortunately, since Microsoft purchased the product and redesigned the interface the App is now virtually useless. My wife and I have constant sync issues and the interface is over complex. Way to ruin a great thing Microsoft.

I have to restart the app multiple times a day. It sucks. After the mandatory change from Wunderlist the app worked wothout issue until today. The app signed out of the MS account for some reason and it just kept crashing endlessly and prevented the use of my phone. Why? I also had to sign in multiple times to be able to get it right. Why change it fron Wunderlist to do a worse job? Why break something that was working?

I would really love for the new tasks to go to the top. I mean everything else is OK and this might sound kinda stupid but it kinda just throws everything off to not have that 1 little function. I mean if someone has this app downloaded then that alone says that they are probably smart enough to figure out how to arrange their list in order but it's just waaaaay too much work for something that is supposed to make our lives easier.

Any app with task scheduling functionality should have basic sorting and scheduling features. This app does not. For example, if you have any task that needs to repeat monthly on every first Saturday of the month or simply sort by notification time, then you CAN'T use this app. It is simply INCAPABLE. I highly recommend a different app that can actually handle basic scheduling requirements.

Notes field glitch. Auto entering at the bottom of the field, making it not usable. I'm tired of these half-baked updates. UPDATE: MS sugests not using the Samsung keyboard. So much for the stylus I bought for handwriting notes to text! I'd rather Microsoft calm down with all their apps that are supposed to make our lives better and just focus on making the basic ones actually work. So out of touch with the end users...

EDIT: has been broken for months, repeated updates haven't fixed it. Stay on the list I want! Obviously have to get a new app. Microsoft ruined Wunderlist. Used to work fine. Now the widget (which is the only way I use the app) constantly sets itself to My Day (which I NEVER use) instead of the shopping list I want it to show. I fix it, and it eventually goes back to my day. I remove the widget and add it again, and the same thing happens. Wunderlist never did this!!!

It's supposed to replace Wunderlist but is missing several key features Wunderlist did. One feature I miss is the email notification if a team member completed a task or adds a task. Another silly thing is you have no option but to connect this to your Outlook calendar which I did not want. I don't see why these are features that couldn't be turned on or off.

This App Was Great, Until It Wasn't. This app did what it was meant to do in syncing to do lists that I shared with others. It synced to all my devices and multi account was great to also have the to do list from my work. This recently the app started demanding me to sign into it repeatingly every 30 seconds. I tried every troubleshooting step including clearing cache and storage, reinstalling, different login methods. This issue won't go away and has made it unusable. Moving to a new platform.

The reminder feature and due date features don't work - so what is the point of using this app? They often fail to appear on my notification tray. Overdue tasks disappear from it. I can set reoccurring due dates for tasks, but why can't I set reoccurring reminders for this task. There is a lot of potential here, but this app is still too unpolished.

Never really had any issues with this app until last few months. The app has become very glitchy and does not operate smoothly like it has. Been using it flawlessly for the last couple of years since it switched over from WOUNDERLIST. The WOUNDERLIST APP Was Awesome! Well Microsoft I use this app to operate a business and I'm now moving on to a different app. This glitch is so bad that they are wanting me to contact customer support by going through the settings in the app and it won't even open

Cons: Suggestions still continually turn themselves back on, now every time I open a list, despite being manually turned off *individually*! I have around 30 lists! This problem gets worse each update. No way to turn off Suggestions all at once in settings. Also, syncing between users isnt working and my spouse often can't see items I added until a day later even when manually synced. Also, a microsoft account is required for support or feedback. Pros: At least it has dark mode now.

Was forced to switch to this from wunderlist. The only thing better about it is dark mode that extends to widgets. Everything else sucks. I now don't even get about 30% of my reminders anymore and have to constantly reset things. Microsoft is one of the richest companies on Earth and this is the best they can do? Edit: changing to one star and giving up. I don't even get 75% of my reminders from this app anymore it's so poorly designed. I hate that they took over wunderlist.

I do not want my entries deleted when they are marked complete. I have "confirm before deleting" toggled on in Settings. I want the item marked complete and to stay on the list shaded out or with a line through it so I can see what has been done. Otherwise I don't know if it even was ever on the list! That is a huge plus for Color Note. Sharing isn't helpful if I can't track what's been done.

Update: decreased from 2 to 1 star. The reminder functionality is terrible. If I set a reminder on a recurring task, I want the reminder to recur as well. I miss Wunderlist. The functionality is so different now, and the transition was really bad. And I definitely didn't want a Microsoft account.

I like the idea of this hat but it has some major issues that need to be resolved: 1. Clicking onOneNote links will automatically download that section of OneNote from the internet, instead of opening it on the locally installed program. 2. Flagged email Categories do not appear here as they do in the PWA. 3. If there is a flagged email automatically added to my day because of its due date, when I mark it as complete, it does not show as completed at the bottom. This needs to change.

I forget what the original app was called, but after Microsoft replaced it with this, it has been nothing but a nightmare of having to login 50 different ways in order to look at a list... A list! Just let this be local data on my phone, instead of on the cloud (make that an option instead of the default, if anything). There should be no reason that something as simple as a list for personal use should require all this authentication or be stored on anything other than mine and invited devices.

'For Today' screen is deleting tasks instead of adding them to 'My Day' when I click on the '+' icon. This is getting worse. Every time I use the app, items get deleted instead of added to my day. And at least one is lost because I missed that it deleted instead of added it. It is ridiculous that tapping on the '+' registers as a delete at all. Pixel 2 XL

Ruined a great app üò≠ with poor & insanely annoying password management. Forced to transfer to this after they bought Wunderlist. Not compatible with Android's security manager, so I need to remember my password. Lame. So I reset it, but it says I'm reusing the previous password, so I'm obviously typing it correctly. Still doesn't work. Now I have to go to some lame Microsoft site, so they can harvest my cell#. And then I can finally make a shopping list. Because security? Stupid.

Mar 2020: Very, very disappointing. Looking elsewhere. Before:A move forward from Wunderlist? Not! MS made sure the UI looked different (with useless themes) and DROPPED Wunderlist functionality like 1) email delivery (marked stuff in Outlook is USELESS to people that don't use it), 2) no way to add tasks by widget/notifications, 3) marking a task with a star doesn't move it to the top, 4) "My Day" shows up rather than a task list. 5) ... (out of review space) I detest "progress" that isn't.

I was kicked off of Todo. Your system did not recognize my password on my Chromebook and my phone. I finally gained access using my tablet. I am terrified of continuing with this app. I have a lot of data that would hurt if I lose it. My attempts to contact you on line just sent me around in circles. I need reliability and will have to find another app as much as I like Todo. Your customer service needs enhancing.

This was a fine app until more integrations and "smart" features were added. STOP re-enabling "auto suggestions." I'll make my own to do lists, thanks. It wouldn't be so bad if it stayed off once I turn it off, but it is inexplicably turned back on every time I close and reopen the app. BRING BACK WUNDERLIST

To Do list cant be shown on widget. Only the myday can be, which i dont want to use. There are better options. microsoft refuses to use common sense agsin with this app. Your to do item needs to be less than about 15 words in order to view it. while editing the item you can write 50 words or more, but after saving you cant view it completely because the scroll doesnt function well enough. 75% of the screen real estate (like most microsoft sw) is wasted.

Granted, I just downloaded the app, but I have yet to find anything useful about it. Copy/pasting in and then reorganizing a basic task list took me about a half hour (seriously? No drag and drop?) and I haven't been able to figure out how to share a task list with someone else. If I can't share the task list, why is there an "assigned to me" toggle? Instructions on the MS website seem to be referencing a completely different version than the one I have. Utterly useless and frustrating.

Not nearly as good as wunderlist was and I don't like that I had to switch...constant issues that I didn't have (or not nearly as much if I did). It often doesn't sync with my partner who I share multiple lists with and lately it has an issue even creating a shared list. When I create a list and try to share it with him it says "we ran into a problem creating a link to share" but offers no solution on how to try to fix the issue. Bring back wunderlist!!!!!

I'll pile on with the "this app isn't as good as Wunderlist" crowd. My wife and I specifically chose Wunderlist after experiencing frustrating bugs in Google keep not keeping our shared lists in sync. Now we have switched to Microsoft To Do, since they're retiring Wunderlist, and we are back to the same frustrating bugs of our shared lists getting our of sync üò†. Also, the experience for sharing a list is terrible. Very much a downgrade from Wunderlist.

Disappointed that Wunderlist is gone because it took me years to find a task app that met my needs. The feature I miss most is being able to select Sort By Date, then manually reordering items within each date afterward. Right now I can only do one or the other. If I select sort by date, I cannot manually reorder items. If I turn off the sort by date option, I have to manually move each item.

UPDATED: I used to have this rated 4 stars until the most recent update which has issues with website addresses. Now every time you go into a note with a web address it doubles it each time you write anything and exit. PREVIOUS 4 STAR REVIEW: I was an hugh supporter of Listmaster, but they went out of business. This app does even more, except I would like to see some type of an import / export feature using csv files (for file backup).

I made the switch after the Wunderlist got taken down. My biggest gripe with this (and it is big) is the widget is very very slow to update lists or when switching lists. There is a 5-10 second delay when adding things or switching, and Wunderlist never had this problem. This has been an issue since day 1. I exclusively use the widget since it's very easy to navigate to and see my lists. If this problem was mitigated it would be a good app.

This app was AMAZING as wunderlist. Then Microsoft got hold of it and now I cant get in because of password issues. Didnt want a Microsoft a count but had to to keep this app so I signed up....nope all of my stuff is transferred but no access without logging on using a browser. Microsoft did you miss the point of having a simple phone app?

Why on earth would you create an app that doesn't link with your calendar??? The To Do app is straightforward on Android app and desktop version. HOWEVER, there's no way to link it to Microsoft 365 Calendar! It's within the same suite of Microsoft 365 and yet, you can't schedule on either one to show up on the other. That's asinine! ! You would think this would be a primary feature, but the Product Manager must be sleep at the wheel. It's mystifying.

Error: Local updates are no longer pushed to the server. Obviously, this completely breaks the synchronisation feature. Changed from 5-star to 1-star. Signed out & reinstalled the android app, it downloads the old list and still doesn't push local updates. Signed out on desktop, re-installed, same story. Something is broken server side. It does the job... barely. The UI is an absolute disaster. Buggy, inconsistent, and hard to navigate. And if you do end up choosing this, I wouldn't rely too much on the log in to save my data. Haven't tried that myself but it seems to be on par with the reset of the user experience.

Man, this app is great. Simple but complete, which makes it very effective. Customization options for habits are excellent and connecting to specific communities a huge plus. Highly recommended if you want to keep track of your progress towards a goal! Updated: logging features are still as good as ever, but since syncing is impossible, I can't see the forum anymore as my user doesn't properly log in and there is no customer service, I can't recommend it anymore...

I upgraded to Pro after a couple of weeks & initially excited about the app. Having used it for a while now I'm starting to regret my purchase. There are some pros but more cons. It's buggy, doesn't sync well at all across devices, the UI is very cluttered, the forum needs serious updating, a search tool for eg. The last update was ages ago, given how pricey this is you'd think the developers would make it worth it but they seem to have disappeared!

I like how the app has options to write notes/journals for each day. It gives you the option to reflect on how you stuck to your habits. Most other apps don't have this feature. That said, I'm rating the app two stars because the notifications don't work for me. I have set times for reminders throughout the day, but the app sends me random notifications (reminders) when I don't want them. And on other days, no notifications at all. No app updates from the developer in over a year either.

This is a great habit tracker that I keep coming back to use when I want to track things. The visuals are great and the information you can put into what you track and each day as a note is very nice to keep track of small details if you want. Unfortunately, the widgets don't seem to work properly anymore, so currently, it is not the most effective habit tracker to use now.

After changing my email, I cannot use HabitBull's premium features. I have tried emailing support--no response--and finding a way to restore the purchase or even purchase it again, but no such luck. I am forever stuck with the app thinking I have pro, even though I do not. It's a shame, really, for what is otherwise a fantastic app.

The app is good to use overall. Except, as a number of other folks have said, it does not sync. And there is no response from the developer on this issue. Annoying to have paid for an app that claimed the sync feature, when it doesn't actually work. What that means is you lose all history every time you change the phone.

I loved the app and purchased it to help my son keep up with studying. I paid for the premium account which indicates you can log in on multiple devices both iOS and Android. After setting it up on my phone, which was easy but took some time,when I tried logging onto my son's phone it didn't recognize the account. I contacted customer service but didn't hear back. It's a nice app, really like the features, so this was really disappointing. I could set it up again on his phone but without me being able to monitor on my phone it's not helpful. I still hope someone can help me fix this or I should get a refund for my purchase.

Customer support is completely unresponsive. I purchased the upgraded version and it doesn't sync as promised. There has been no help on FB, email, nada. Kinda sucks TBH. The app is nice. DO NOT BUY PREMIUM Version!! App stopped synching 7/27/2019 and is no longer supported. App is very good for what it is, but the sync feature stopped working for me. The FAQ says it's due to a rooted phone but this happened twice on non-rooted phones. HabitBull offers no support to fix. 2 stars bec it works standalone, but if you need syncing know there's a risk of permanent failure.

While i can understand limiting somethings for premium only, i've never seen an app block widgets behind a pay wall and quite frankly this is only useful to me if I can keep track of things on the homescreen. I would not recommend this app bc of an essential flaw in design - it doesn't allow you to just type in habit, instead it quizzes you. So, a simple act of just typing what you'd like to do turns into this crazy and overly complicated thing.

Good design, simple and clear but with the option to dig down for more details. However, they don't respond to emails and haven't released an update in over a year. Seems like this project was abandoned.
