I installed the app, but I didn't find it at all user friendly. Ex: Set up a BUY and everything from that point on was a guessing game. Saw on icon that looked like a LIST and thought I could create a list of things, so clicked on it, and a note advised my BUY task had been moved to a GROCERY LIST, with no indication given on how to get to the GROCERY LIST; not to mentiin the items I wanted to list under my BUY list were not groceries. I realized in pretty short order that despite the great features, thus app wasn't user friendly to anyine who did not already know ontuitively how to use it.ser friendly

My experience was not good. ... it consolidated 8 ... lists for different stores in different regions into one ... list. This trashed all my completed items that were only appropriate to particular locations. Of course, this all back fed into Alexa... 48 hour update: Today found all Alexa items, pending and complete, gone. 72 hrs update: Appreciate their team reaching out, but I have moved on to AnyList.

January 2021: In short..I'm done, and moving on from any.do. What was one of my "go to" apps, solid 5 stars, is now unreliable, buggy, and all i hear from support is "well, our developers say thats 'intended behavior'..". Well, when new so-called intended behavior now makes the app more unreliable, to the point of unusable, its time to find a new app to replace any.do. And thats exactly what I'll be doing, and then pushing the "uninstall" button for any.do. November 2020: This was a 4-5 star app for me for years, but now since what appears to have happened during a major update in October, I can't give more than 3 stars. I'm posting this here in the hopes that maybe others are experiencing the same issue, and that will prompt more serious investigation by the any.do staff. The issue I am seeing occurs when setting a reminder for a future date. Go thru the usual process, app records the reminder date/time correctly, then sometimes minutes, or even seconds later, the reminder shows up as a current task under "today". Its happening intermittently, but at least 50% of the time. I've used any.do for several years, so I know its not a situation of not knowing how to use the app. Clearing data and cache and reinstalling has not helped. Any.do support is trying to help, wants a video, but I can't take a video of every time I set a reminder hoping to catch the issue. Its unrealistic. If anyone else using the app is experiencing this issue, please please please let Any.do support know. I won't discount its an issue specific to my device, but the fact that the app ran fine for years, until an update, has me thinking otherwise.

I have sent several bugs through the Any.do (both normal and priority) about a subscription issue that I have. According to the app, I am a Premium member. I have reached out to Support about discontinuing my subscription and hopefully getting a refund. When following Any.do's website directions to cancel my premium subscription, nothing showed up on the Play Store subscription managing page. Therefore, I cannot do anything, but hope that the Any.do team reaches out and helps resolve this issue.

As like every other App. They want your money. Why, because they can! Because every other app charges. This one wants $3 per month or all you can do is 2 events per day. Don't fall for it keep searching. I might have considered paying if it was 3 dollars per year. If money doesn't bother you, then this app is fairly easy to use. Very intuitive and user friendly although I have used others under the Apple platform that were much better.

I used to love this app. I have used it for years. I even had (until yesterday) the paid version. I primarily use this app to sync up my alexa tasks. It started having issues, then got fixed. Now the company is saying that Amazon sync is no longer usable (unless you want to add a 3rd party to allow it access to your Amazon account).

Watch out if you get premium - you can only unsubscribe via the way you signed up. e.g. If you signed up on desktop you can't unsubscribe in the app. There isn't even a link to unsubscribe on the website. They don't send any renewal notifications so best thing to do is sign up and cancel premium straight away as you will still get to use it until the expiry date. That way if you end up removing the app you won't forget to unsubscribe. They could choose to be better, but don't

I downloaded this because of the cross platform syncing. I only purchase apps after learning the free version. I see the potential but will delete because: 1) constant advertising the premium version - which is keeping me from being productive - which is counter productive 2) It seems on desktop version that I don't have a choice on calendar to see day, 3 days, week, month 3) and again the pop up for premium Anyway. On to the next planner app.

This app does not warn you when doing the trial that if you choose to cancel that you have to contact their support to do so. Theres a delete account option or a sign out one...they do the same thing and doesnt stop the payments. This doesnt stop them from charging you anyways and is a huge inconvenience. If it werent for this terrible service and unreasonable price I would have kept. Will not recommend.

The option to sync with Google Assistant is completely useless - it doesn't work at all. It's like they added the feature just to trick people into downloading the app. I hate typing on my phone, so this was a huge disappointment. I wish I could give this app zero stars, but one star is the lowest option available. Save yourself the trouble and avoid this app at all costs.

Bad, bad, bad. Tons of useless features/ bells and whistles which only serve to annoy and distract. Just tried to rename non Alexa list and couldn't. Just removed Alexa integration (the lists haven't updated in months anyhow) and my lists are gone, mind you with no warning. Adding it back doesn't help, lists are still gone. Rule number one is don't loose people's data for God's sake. Like most software today, over engineered over designed yet fails to perform its core functions half the time.

I liked this app until recently. I discovered that items were being added to my shopping list without my input. I noticed a pop-up notification on my phone that an item was added. Viewing my list I saw several items that I did not add. I tried to work this out with the developer, but after informing me that they had a fix for the issue, they then followed up saying that they would not be releasing the fix. I assume they are receiving money for allowing products to hijack their paying customers.

EDITED. So the app works as expected. It does location reminders (pay version) but they are simple notifications. No vibration option which is the point of a location notification. If I'm looking at my phone then I don't need Any.do, a simple Android notification will do. Can't see paying for this app when a less encompassing app will do the same thing be for free.

Asked me to sign up for premium 4 times before even getting into the app and you can't see any sharing/family features without buying a month, which is what I wanted to see if it would work for us. Edited: you cannot see family features on the trial. The shared grocery list is not available unless you pay.

Doesn't upload correctly it just gets stuck buffering when trying to open files. When uploading photos, it doesn't allow you to pick multiple photos at once it's super time-consuming and inconvenient.

I was debited and no email was sent to me. Why???? How can I stop you guys from deducting money from my account? I did not authorize the subscription. I just checked out the app and because my payment card is on Google, I was debited. I do not want to be debited again because I am not using the app. How can I subscribe. I am not that busy so won't be needing this app. I need an option to unsubscribe from the app. I would also like a refund as well.

The latest update introduced 'helpful videos' which interrupt what you're doing to play a video you have to WAIT to skip, and that plays audio for all to hear. I could not find a way to turn them off, so if this is how they try and push premium monthly subscriptions, I'm finding a new app.

This is an expensive app. That being said, it's the most low-rent experience you can imagine. For example, when you create a list item and need to edit it, you're completely out of luck because that can't happen. The best you can do is delete it and type it in (again) correctly since edit is not an option. By the way, deleting an item from your list is a multi multi step process. (update: developer noted that editing was possible (though, multiple steps required), item deletes still impossible)

I hate this app because if it is a to do list, it should just be a LIST, not set for a specific time. I already have a calendar for that. You can make a list without times for today, but not for next Thursday. For example, if I want to write a list of things that need to get done at work next Tuesday, I don't want to have to put times on them, but if I tell this app to set it for a certain day, it automatically puts a time and a reminder. I have reminders for things that need reminders already.

More of a nuisance than anything. I disabled these stupid moments popups only to have it get in my face in the morning and accidentally delete my tasks trying to close it and get to an important notification. I double checked that it was off and it is yet it keeps popping up. I don't need reminders I didn't set. Also half these paid features are free on iOS this is just taking advantage of people. I hate that.

Any app that requires a subscription is and immediate red flag and this on threw up a huge red flag. I don't mind paying a one time fee to remove but I will never subscribe to an annual or monthly service. There are other apps that will perform as well as this one that are either free or a one time fee. Y'all need to get over yourselves and be reasonable on price.

Android 10 recently got pushed to my phone a few weeks ago and ever since then I've had no pop up reminders from the app. Now I need to be using a whole different app for my reminders. I do have a paid version and until a fix comes which hopefully will be in the next few weeks I seem to be paying for an app that doesn't work. Hopefully they can get this resolved quickly as having two apps for my to do list is quite inconvenient. 9/19-Play store shows Aug 25,2019 as the most updated release

I've been using the free version of this app for maybe a year now, and it was pretty useful, but just today I opened up the app to look at my shopping list and I couldn't see my lists because it wanted me to log in to my "account." I don't believe I ever made an account for Any.do and I have no interest in making one, so I guess I'm uninstalling it now. Too bad :/

I used to use this app a lot before they changed the interface. The older version was way better and much more efficient and didn't require an email or a premium version. I absolutely hate this app now. It's not user friendly at all! The new interface is complicated to navigate, it messed up my phone, uses a lot of ram! Thanks for screwing up a perfectly simple app. Deleted it and will never download again.

Constant crashing. After reading all the negative reviews, I Uninstalled it from all my devices. **Canceled subscription. App was great, until it crashed. After spending more than a hour setting it up on my Samsung tablet, it will not run. Cannot even get it to start. Too bad. In the past, my experiences have been good with this app. Guess I will see how long it takes to crash on my cell phone. So much for multi-device sync. Such a disappointment. **see above, for new comment added.

But the paid version for a year and never succeeded and getting 3-day reminders to not delete themselves after one or two instances. "Customer service" consisted of Microsoft forms level copy-paste "have you tried reinstalling it?" advice. Glad Google Calendars has finally assimilated three-quarters of the functionality and I can stop trying to use this app edit: this is the exact type of useless non-answer I'm talking about, like they didn't even read my review.

Keeps failing to repeat some daily tasks. I've had to remake the same tasks several times because they just won't stick for some reason. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. It's a complete gamble. Now it's more work just to figure out what tasks need done than it is to do the tasks themselves. Uninstalling. This app is more maintenance than my daily chores.

Maybe take calendar out of your name then as it's one of the top results when you search "calendar" ZERO STARS! This has to be a joke. This "calendar" app only adds the calendars that you already have such as Google calendar. You can unselect those but cannot log into other calendars. They have this connection service to connect to other things but that makes you sign up for another service. How this is editors choice is insane, I assume you paid them off cuz that's the only logical explanation.

This is an overengineered list keeping app that I hate. I kept it for years in spite of that because I was in the ecosystem, but today it locked me out of my grocery list so good riddance. No i don't need it to take thirty seconds to boot up my grocery list so that your algorithm can tell me how to most productively plan my day by sorting my grocery list in order of the order I entered each item. I do not need an any.do minute.

I do not have much to say in regards to the app itself. It seems to function fine, but it was not the calendar app that I needed. The reason I am giving it 1 star is because I canceled my subscription and account within the seven day free trial and still got charged the yearly rate. The problem has been reported to the company. I will keep this review updated with any action from Any.Do. UPDATE: The gist of the problem is this. Any.do makes it very difficult to find out how to cancel the sub.

almost all of the events from my other calendar transferred...almost. there was a certain category that didnt transfer resulting in a missed meeting and being late for a presentation. so disappointed I paid for this cause it could potentially be costing me more than just money. glad i caught it when I did and went back to my Google calendar.

It's an ok app, but it's automation is terribly annoying. The widget is awesome, but it I can't add new tasks without pressing a button of sorts. I successfully managed to add a task using Google Assistant, but it added the task to "someday" for some reason, as if I got this app to procrastinate as soon as I got it, and the controls on this are unclear. Like how do I make it stop adding tasks to the wrong catagory of time, and have it listed on widget? unclear

$$$ Im being charged a full year up front and not at end of year or monthly as advertised! Great app, and i was hoping to enjoy it. I have been busy so i didnt have time to appreciate the 7 day trial, and that is ok, so i was going to do that during first month in wich should cost me about +-$3.00. But instead i was charged $35.88 right at the end of first week. When i went tovunsubscribe, it said I'd have to keep full year subscription, so there is NO monthly... Messed me up, im NOT rich!

I downloaded the app, tried the free trial, and forgot to cancel in time. I didn't have a use for the app but left it installed because I was paying for it. Even after turning off notifications it would pop up to give me my to do list every day. It would also randomly alert me that items have been added to my shopping list. For not using the app ever, I have a very full shopping list of things I don't want or need. And I didn't click an ad to add it, since I don't even use the app.

This app has consistent issues with syncing. My boyfriend and I used it a few years ago, but stopped using it due to frustrating with all the syncing problems. We tried using it again recently because the app is fantastic otherwise and we wanted to give it another shot. Still our shared lists refuse to sync often enough that the app is more hassel than help. The app is great if you don't need to share lists with another person though.

Great UI/UX but INCREDIBLY buggy, especially with repeating tasks. I'll set a reminder to occur every 2 weeks but when I set that task as complete it'll move the next reminder to 3 weeks from then, then after that 4 weeks from then, and so on. Having to go back and manually change the date each time renders the app useless. Also, $40 for basic features? No thanks. I'm sticking with the default Google calendar reminders.

This app was great until the latest update and the grocery list changed. Now, it's just annoying to use. It takes more steps to get to what I want to do. The app forces a default list to display that I don't use, so I have to navigate back to the home screen to get to the grocery list. I preferred generic Shopping List where I would enter all items. I don't want a different list for each store. The predictive function stinks because you have to clear the field after you add the suggested text.

I really do like this app, but I have horrible problems with it crashing constantly. The stability is AWFUL. Every time I try to check something off a list, it crashes. After every single item. While it's got great structure and is easy to use otherwise, it is the most unstable app I've ever used. Just uninstalled because even updating it didn't stop it from crashing. Fix the damn app; I've submitted enough feedback about it. Highly frustrating and not worth the time.

This app used to be great when paired with Alexa. Every once in awhile the sync would break but disabling the app and relinking the account would fix the issue. This has not been the case for the past several months. Any.do it is no longer syncing with Alexa and based on the reviews of the Alexa app it is affecting a lot of people, has been ongoing for weeks, and there doesn't appear to be a fix coming. Going to give anylist a try to see if it works with Alexa.

What an awful UI. When creating a new reminder, the entire screen is disabled except for the text-entering line. Then you have to go back into the reminder to set options. But some of those options can only be changed via drag and drop, so if you have a lot of reminders, you will be dragging for a long time.

Product images show the month view at the top of the screen with dots, each one represents an event on that particular day. For android, the month view up top just shows the days of the week (no event indicators). Just an empty calendar. At the bottom of the screen there's a chronological list of events. Essentially, what I'm looking at is no more useful than list on a word document. Sure, there's a ton of bells and whistles, but the Android version is almost entirely useless as a calendar.

Love the interface, love the concept. But it lacks several key features on the Android side. The app both web, and the download version have sync issues, to keep your data inline you must keep the Web version up and the if you are using the downloaded app, you must keep it running to keep anything sync. Then you will lose any type of reoccurring tasks.   Love the sub task concept, really slick but if you cannot keep them in sync it does not work very well.   Another item that does not work, though I have requested it is that face that landscape mode is not coded for in all of the app, again in both the web and app version, makes it difficult to use on a tablet if you are switching to a keyboard for example.   So because of syncing issues, missing key landscape issues in several places in the app, lose of data due to syncing issues I had to uninstall the app. Lucky for me I am using 2 or 3 to do list so I have my primary one I am still using, so nothing lost except time. Though I was really hoping this one would pan out.   So though I am marking it as 1 start, I like the concept, and lots of it, but it is buggy,, and needs some serious testing to work out the syncing issues.

No longer usable.Awful Have used this free app for years for grocery and To Do lists. Was simply laid out,easy to use. For years, I created lists I could easily check and uncheck as reminders of what I needed from each store. IDK what happened in the last 6 months, but app has become useless and an exhaustive waste of my time. It completely erases the items I typed in after I have checked and saved the lists, leaving me to waste time to retype things.Have uninstalled/reinstalled. Nothing works.

This was my favorite To Do app, so much so that I purchased the Premium subscription and then notifications stopped working on my phone and desktop.  I tried double checking all the notification settings on my phone, where I want it to work most and everything looks fine.  So I tried to cancel my Premium subscription and it seems impossible.  The instructions to "manage your subscription settings" doesn't exist, so I can't get out of the premium subscription.  Their FAQs don't provide accurate instructions.  The desktop app refers you to the manage the subscription setting on your phone which doesn't exist.    I was impressed with this app initially, so my so that I purchased the premium subscription but all the notifications stopped working and I forgot I even had the app at some point until they charged me $26 for the annual subscription, so now I want out but can't get out.

Very annoyed that I have to keep signing in and then it deleted all my lists. Ive been working on a master shopping list for several months. Im trying to track what my regular purchases so that I could have just opened an app such as this, gone down my list, and checked off what I needed. But when I logged back in AGAIN, my shopping lists were gone for the third time. When it works, its great. It just doesnt work enough and I dont have time for this.

I have had this app for almost a year. I was really enjoying it. I mostly used it for my grocery list and weekend to do list. However, I will be uninstalling it now because it deemed it appropriate to automatically add "Welch's brand Fruit Snacks!" to my grocery list without permission. I encounter ads in a lot of places, but I refuse to use an app that panders to corporations in such a way that it starts adding branded products to my damn grocery list.

Wunderlist was everything I needed and I had no issues with the app. This "replacement" tried to keep a somewhat similar format, but replaced the things that I really enjoyed from the original app. I don't like having a list app connected to Google or the rest of my accounts. I just wanted something simple that I could easily share with my family. I'm really disappointed with this forced move to a new app. Can't Wunderlist be allowed to continue to function?!

Smart Grocery List From Hell. While it might be handy to sort your list by catagory. Now everything is spread out all over the place. I wanted to turn the feature back off and it will not turn off. I like to sort things in the order I travel through the store. i know where everything I purchase is located. Well can't do that any.more. Having to change the category on each item i buy to Esential household item so that i can keep everything together. what a drag!

This app is deceivingly terrible. There are some really nice design features like the home screen widget. All of this nice user experience is trashed by the "POP UNDER" that doesn't turn off. Every day, it's there waiting for you when you turn on your phone. I have all alerts in app turned off, my phone blocks app notifications, and I'm on Do Not Disturb and yet, there is this annoying feature that Any.do won't allow you to disable. EDIT: I DISABLED MOMENT NOTIFICATIONS A PRIOR TO DEV COMMENT

Terrible Update! This app used to be perfect for planning out when certain tasks were to be completed. The interface was easy to understand and you could see and plan as many days into the future as you wanted, and everything was perfectly broken down by date. Now when you add tasks, regardless of when they need to be completed, the app just says to do it today. It has completely eliminated the only use for this app, which was to make out a planned future.

Why does every once in a while... out of the blue, the app asks to update acct emails or such and then everything on my task list has been lost??? This last time, my list went back to some list I had quite awhile back... must have been the list I lost at another time. This is quite frustrating. And if I have to spend the time to make a new list, I cld just as well spend that time finding another app to use. Especially since this seems to be reoccurring. So disappointing.

Instead of shopping around, I downloaded Any.do because of how widely used it is. Setting up one day's schedule should have taken me just a couple of minutes. But the app seemingly randomized which day of the week an entry was for. On two occasions, it picked a day over a year away. After twenty minutes of fighting the app, I finally had my schedule together. I spent another ten minutes trying to get any notifications to work, with no luck. Fortunately, uninstalling only took a few seconds.

I have the same recurring tasks to do every day. I need a to-do-list reminder to buzz me when it's time. The problem with this app, is that those reminder times somehow start drifting every day, giving me different times the next day! That is an annoying fail! Screw it, I'm going elsewhere. if I find a better app, I'll let you guys know. UPDATE : Suggestion did not work, and I found an app, that does not drift. I have moved on.

Almost perfect but the developers choose to ignore one very important thing. There are several people posting the same request. Keep the popups but stop them from interrupting other apps, which can be crucial at times. The forum posts I saw requesting this were old so it's obviously not a problem you're willing or able to fix. Otherwise I might have bought the full version but I had to uninstall

Not working on Samsung watch6 Installed due to wanting tasks listed on new Samsung watch6. All OK on phone. On watch only thing that comes up is add a task, no list of tasks. Tasks added on watch show on phone but not vice versa.

As a programmer, this is absolutely the most lazily put together trash that I've ever come across. The basic version of this app is only meant to accomplish the simplest of tasks, but it abhorrently fails to do so. As a user, I'm appalled. My task lists were constantly being manipulated without any input on my end; I'm talking added information, reordering of items in my list, and even complete deletion of subtasks. Do not trust this app with anything of even the slightest importance.

The current notification sounds each of which lasts for a couple of seconds makes the app useless. How can the developer fail to realize that the very idea of a reminder is make sure that the user is reminded. There is an excellent app on this store which is perfect in this regard. I don't want to name it but the developer has to find it and learn how reminders should be. I. Have uninstalled this app after 10 minutes of trial.

After a task is done a duplicate will appear for the same task causing me to have to remove one. Then even if I haven't done a task that day it will still have one of them marked done (the duplicate is always unmarked). I believe this is due to an error in the day tracking it. It seems to be unable to tell whether or not the day is ended. It's rather unfortunate considering it is very easy to personalize and even allows you to create a grocery list. Uninstalled and will not be reinstalling :/

Ugh! After years of using this app, I am so very tired of the reminders not syncing across all my media! I get notifications for the same task on my chromebook, cellphone and tablet; I have to dismiss on all three! Now that Google Tasks has reminders (and syncs across all media devices), I can create lists, AND it's free, I will probably kiss Any.do goodbye. UPDATE: Contacted Team and they confirmed sync problem, and at this time don't have a solution üôÑ

Wanted to use this with my Android phone and my Alexa show. "Zapier" sync Only available for a monthly fee. Really disappointing. Was hoping this would be the answer. my Alexa list shows up separately from my any do list, which would show up separately from my Google list. so it's kind of useless I want everything to sync into one list! as I would have then used it to sync to an iPhone so our family could connect and have one list kind of stupid if I have to search through a bunch of lists.

This app has an appealing interface but the only problem with it is IT DOESN'T ACTUALLY WORK. If you want to use it for anything other than a list of things to do. It doesn't sync. It loses your data. It basically wastes your time rather than saving you time. Customer service is a joke. It's useless too. Very nice, but utterly useless. The idea that you can have assistance and delegate tasks is basically a lie because it's not available in my area and I live in Los Angeles.

Started a free trial to premium without my permission, can't take it off. Im not going to pay for it so I don't want it there so that I don't use premium features on accident and get used to them. Tried to delete account to start over and do differently but every time I type in the password to delete the account I get an error message. Waste of time. Going to use a different app.

Works decently most of the time, but I've noticed that any of the reminders I have long time (things that are supposed to remind me every day indefinitely) eventually just stop reminding me, even though they still show up on my to do list. Very frustrating. The inconsistencies make this unreliable, which essentially makes the app useless to me as a tool to plan my day around

What happened?? I have this app installed on my phone and it works beautifully as a calendar. Bought a new phone and the Cal app is now a full planner and to-do list. Thanks for complicating my life with every useless feature I don't want and specifically loved the Cal app for *not* including. EDIT--"Minimalist" does not describe this app. Certainly not compared to what you used to offer.

So many options I would like to try..but i am discouraged by the fact that I cant even change tne color theme for free. There is no explanation of the Focus mode in the app, and the last time I did a trial with google I was charged for the "free" trial. Every dollar counts especially now, and incurring another monrhly bill just for recurring tasks and to go from blue to mauve for a theme is just unnecrssary. My search continues, and i hope the devs are reading the 1 star reviews thoroughly.

Edited to 1 star. It is fine for personal lists but you cannot share them with others. When you look up 'how to' any.do claims you can do this with a free account and even shows you how... With a function that does not exist in either of our apps. The only option available is exporting it in a clunky text list- no in app shared lists. Uninstalling and re installing did not update. Gonna switch I think.

Absolutely worthless. This app runs a prohibitively clunky interface that effectively voids the promise of ease-of-life automation. Google Calendar will provide all other services promised by Any do for free with no annual subscription rate. Don't sign up for the free trial. It's not worth getting pinged for forty bucks when you decide you don't like it and forget to cancel it in time. Save your money!

I had a premium. Scam.The app is very pushy and annoying. I couldn't get into 80% of my incoming calls as it blocked the screen so the call doesn't appear on the screen. You only hear it and hopelessly looking for the call screen that you only get once the call is dropped. You have to call back then. Disturbing and annoying. I barely used this app as to maintain it takes a lot of time. I asked them to cancel they said they will not refund as more than 48h passed of yearly(!) subscription.

It looked good but it doesn't work. I scheduled simple tasks and it would change the timing. I re corrected to make it right several times. The navigation was difficult. Like I'd want to set a task but then I'd have to say the task was complete so wouldn't be sure it saved. Couldn't just back out to see the task was set correctly. Had to confirm the task was done then undo the task for later which might then change the time to something I never set. üò≥

Redoing my review after messaging with the app for a while. Basically everything I need to do is either not there or you have to pay a monthly subscription to do it. Not worth it to think you're getting somewhere with the app finally, only to have the "upgrade to premium" page keep popping up when you try to do the only useful things in the app. S'a shame. The widget looked nice.

I used to love this app, but recently they did a big push for premium. At the same time, I started having a huge issue with my lists not opening. The screen shows, but it is grayed out and I can't click on anything. I tried the premium to see if that would help, but it hasn't. My lists are inaccessible to me. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app to noavail.

There's an issue where the bottom pop up notifications do not display in Android 10. Which is my entire reason for using this app and why I paid for a year. I understand bugs happen but I'm losing the value I paid, for a reminder app that doesn't remind me... I reached out to support, they said a fix is coming in a few weeks. I asked to have my subscription extended for the loss of use, so far no resolution. I'll give 5 stars once my money doesn't feel wasted. Thanks

Don't use this app!! Any.do charged by credit card $29.99 without my permission, for a premium plan, after I'd used the free plan for quite a while. This is a good app and I transferred here from wunderlist, however one gripe I have is that you can only invite one person to share the list with. I can understand if the limit was, say 3 or 4, but for only one person to be the max is unreasonable to me just to buy premium to get 29 slots.

was great, but for the last few months the android app is not syncing on my pixel 3. Tasks entered on the pixel appear on the web, but not on the pixel itself - they seem to vanish. Alas, app is no longer useful for me.

The app keeps crashing in my Samsung m30s (android). I have sent email and feedback also on this but there has been no resolution. Some of my important items are written in the app but I am unable to access them now. Very disappointed.

App is OK. I use it for some time already. Recently I have discovered Duckduckgo APP Tracking Protection.. And then I discovered how much data TickTick is sending out without my consent. It's contacting Google Firebase and also Bugsnag company. YES. I know it's probably "aggregated anonymous usage data" that "helps you to find bugs and optimize your marketing stuff". Nevertheless I think users should have some control: like "help us improve" setting which is common in other apps.

I absolutely adored this app until the most recent update. The task nesting feature is far too sensitive and becoming a real nuisance. I emailed the developers about this issue a week ago and sadly received no response. I'll be cancelling my subscription until this issue is rectified.

I gave up trying to learn how to use this app. It's not intuitive. I can always find a ton of options, except the one I'm always looking for. Plus once I figure something out, I can't remember how to repeat what I did after a couple days. Today I downloaded a different app, and so far, it's a lot more intuitive.

Definitely uses 3rd party trackers and do not feel that my data is secured. I was even paying for premium but have uninstalled my app because I do not feel safe. I emailed them a few times to ask about this app tracking and they never responded with an answer. Told me to open an issue within the app. Uninstalled and unsubscribed.

Eh....not great for an expensive app. One of my important tasks went missing. I asked for help but response hasn't produced the lost task yet... Another crappy todo list app I have to delete. I dont understand, all I want is a simple to do list!!! I keep trying to add an item, and it automatically goes into my "inbox"- whatever that means. love the app but 2023 wrapped is freezing the app every time i try to go past the second screen.

Loved TickTick - great interface and the widget was perfect. Unfortunately I had to move on to Todoist. TickTick doesn't have Alexa capabilities and that's a deal breaker. Having issues with syncing with Google calendar. I added a task on TickTick and it's been over 12 hours and it still has not sync up to my Google calendar. I've tried refreshing but nothing showed up. I've looked at the help forum and many people have the same issue for some time now. I just purchased the pro and it's not worth it if it doesn't sync.

I really liked a lot of the features but I couldn't get the focus timers on my laptop to play a start and stop sound so I kept working through my break. Used to be great, but so many features are locked behind a paywall it's no longer worth it. I don't mind paying a one-off fee for an app, but a subscription of $30 a year to maintain a to-do list app is highway robbery. I can't even see a calendar view without paying. As it gets more complex, it gets worse. User for 3+ yrs. It has gone from a useful, quick checklist to one begging for integration with email & social media. It now disallows long checklists within a task (e.g., packing list). Free functions I enjoyed are now behind a monthly subscription.

Serviceable but not awesome by any means. I've spent enough time trying to set up tasks in here that I feel like I can't bail even though I don't love it. It's really tricky to figure out how to make tasks show up like I want and have only been able to really get things set up right by using the website in addition to the app. Nothing is intuitive or easy to figure out in this app.

The integration with Microsoft To Do does not continuously sync tasks. It just imports them one time. I use Microsoft To Do to condense and organize tasks from Outlook, Planner and Teams. I would like to have those tasks appear in TickTick as well, just as Outlook records are synchronized with To Do. Can a comprehensive integration be achieved? I submitted an issue about this in the TickTick app. Edit: no reply from TickTick devs.

This WAS a great list app. Then something happened and I stopped getting notifications. I checked the app and it said I needed to allow permissions due to Android 6.0. I've been on Android 7.0+ since I started using the app, but regardless, I checked and permissions were set and allowed the app to provide notifications. Still didnt work. I've tried resetting the phone, resetting permissions... nothing works. Now I'll try uninstalling it and using something else.

I really love the design and layout of this app but unfortunately the Google Calendar integration isn't very reliable when compared with other apps. For example, if I change the time of something on my calendar it just duplicates the event with the new time in the app and if I delete an event it still shows up most of the time. I've stuck around for over a year hoping it would improve but it doesn't and support often doesn't even respond.

I have been using ticktick for several years but currently having a couple of major issues. I think this app is the best option for a to do list except that the sync is terrible. I just paid for premium and the app will not sync. During the trial the sync between android app and PC app was also very bad. If they could get the connection/sync issues fixed it would be a great app. If I can't access the premium features I paid for in the next few hours I'm going to be requesting a refund...

I paid for the annual membership after trying the free version for a few days because I really wanted it to work, but after trying to use premium for a few days, I realized that this program was packed with features but has an absolutely unintuitive interface. I've tried using it here and there, but it's just frustrating and anxiety inducing. I advise using and loving the free version for at least a month before committing to membership.

Has been one of the best reminder app available for a long time. This most recent update messed up notifications on Android 10. They don't follow the system dark mode at all, instead you have to manually change it in the app or deal with mismatched colors. It looks ridiculous seeing a white notification background amidst other black backgrounds in dark mode. It also looks like the black is not a true black like other apps. Glitches galore! Currently am unable to see certain options at all, as they are blacked out. Tried deleting & re-installing, resetting phone, & changing the theme to different colors. Honestly the premium version is just not worth it, what's the point of having advanced calendar views and event setup and calendar import if, in every case, you can't see future recurring events? (The next event in the list of recurring appears only if you have ticked off the previous instance) In order to use a calendar efficiently for planning you ought to see what events are next, this hindrance has been made present by the users as far as 2015 (as I'm seeing online) and nothing has been done, that not only shows poor hindsight (what's a calendar without planning) but also a strikingly deaf customer service. The app is probably just as good as its free version, the pomodoro timer is ok, but the extra features are just not worth the expense for the premium version.

At first it seemed good. I paid a month subscription to try out some of the premium features. The habit tracker is annoying. I'll tick off that I completed one of my habits for the day and the app will still send me 1-3 notifications to complete the habit. Not something I would expect from a paid app. I suggest you add some piece of code that tells the app not to notify the user when they have ticked off their goal.

I'm sure the premium might be fine, but all of the most important features are locked behind a paywall. I wanted a simple app that would let me set repeated reminders on my phone, but this surely isnt it. At first, it told me I just needed to sign up to do that, so I did, but then it said I needed premium! Very misleading, I immediately uninstalled because that is just untrustworthy behaviour to me.

The app is good but the differences between the premium and free version aren't mentioned at the beginning. It is also not possible to start using the app without the "free trial period" as far as I have seen. After the forced free trial period I now realize that the sync function which enables you to use pc and and. app simultaneously is indeed a premium function. This seems awful lot like the way Evernote took, I want to buy my apps because I appreciate the work, not because I'm forced into.

I really like the design and would even pay for premium. But what makes it unusable for me is that you cannot sort the Completed Items in lists. So, if you want to buy some item again, you need to search and scroll down the entire list of Completed Items to find it. This is really bothering. Alphabetically would be much faster and make more sense.

Disappointing... I have been happily using this application for years now, but the last few updates appear to have caused more problems than they fixed. One example: when you create an event that's further away than a month, the app will AT ALL TIMES change the date and time to incorrect ones. It has done this EACH time for me over the last months, changing the dates and times for no reason; you can imagine this is a deal-breaker for a planning app...

I really like this app, it's one of the best reminder apps there is. However the new custom notifications are horrible! It sticks out like a sore thumb. You have to manually set between white or black background, which means that they don't automatically switch with Android 10 dark mode. They're also not black, but grey which makes them look ugly next to other notifications. Title and time also don't line up with other notifications. Plus it says "a min. ago", which is only accurate if I look at my phone immediately. And it turns on the screen when the notification comes in, even if it's in my pocket. This is a great app, but the recent update is one of those 'if it ain't broken don't fix it' moments. I really hope you consider going back to standard Android notifications, or at least provide an option between custom or standard. I'll gladly update my review to 5 stars if that happens.

Had been very good. But now any reminder that is not completed by the end of the day gets marked as complete inatead of showing up as overdue. Has become very cumbersome to use and has resulted in many tasks getting missed.

running on Android 13 with a pixel 6, the app crashes pretty much every time I start typing a new task or if I assign a data to an existing one, both of which are obviously core functionalities. this was a great idea in theory, but I want a standalone app that doesn't pull calendar data from some other app. for me and for how I wanted to use this app to manage my schedule, this just won't work. Very nice calendar app, unfortunately seems dependent on Google. I don't use goolag's calendar, but had to link a dummy G account. What happened to the setting for choosing how far in the future to sync calendars? The app on my phone is only showing events for 1 month in the future, and then the calendar is blank. There are many events much further out than this, that I can no longer see on the app. I've been through the entire menu tree and no longer see the setting for length of time to sync.

I've been using BC for several years now and I really enjoy how powerful it is, though it can be cumbersome to use until you take the time to learn how to use it. I used to only use the basic functionality and was actually quite frustrated with some stuff until I sat down and played with it. There are some things I would improve like tasks, but for the most part it's great. I usually only use the free version of apps, but this is one I paid for. My biggest complaint was one that I have read from other users about the default notification for all day events going off 30 mins or an hour before (11pm or 11:30 pm) while you're sleeping. I was about ready to uninstall this app because of this, but I couldn't find another app that addressed this problem (I tried a few). I did some research and found there is a setting in your Google Calendar you can change to fix this problem. First, go to the settings for each calendar you want to modify. Under settings you should find a section for 'Event notifications' and 'All-day event notifications'. I removed the values that were present in both sections. I do have a calendar that I share with my family that everyone can add events to. Sometimes I need notifications for items on this calendar and sometimes I don't. What I did was setup an email notification that whenever anyone adds an event to this calendar, I get an email notification of the new event. This setting is found under the 'Other notifications' setting. The benefit here is it's another method to alert me to new events and then when I see the email, I can decide if I need an alert or not. If no alert is needed, I move on. If an alert is needed, I can open the item on my calendar and add the appropriate reminders through BC2. I am no longer woken up in the middle of the night by all day events that my wife added to our calendar and I didn't remove the default notification for. This solved my biggest gripe which ended up not being a problem with BC2 at all. I'm still not thrilled with the task settings as I believe there's room for improvement here. I would really like to be able to remove my other reminder app, but there's some things it can do that BC cannot. For example, I can setup my other app to play an insistent sound (repeat) until I acknowledge it. I've also found it a little difficult to schedule reminders to call people in BC2. I can link contacts fairly easily, but not individual numbers that are not in my contacts. Also, sorting tasks based on priority (yes, that's what the 5 little boxes at the bottom of a task are for) would make it even better. Making these changes would make BC2 amazing!

I happily pay for this app. It does the normal notifications which most calendars do. But I really like the icons that I can add (and the different colors) so that I can see at a glance what type of appointment I am adding. I discovered the Tasks app by Pocket Brilliance on Christmas Eve and was completely amazed with its functionality, features, and design. After only a day of playing around with the free version, I knew that this was the app for me, so I purchased a subscription as a Christmas gift to myself. It's the first app that, in my opinion, really "gets it" in blending power, simplicity, speed, and the Getting Things Done (GTD) concepts of David Allen. The filtered lists and tags are great!

I've been downloading various to do list apps all day long and testing them out, and this is the best one I've tried so far. Very clean and easy to use. a very well made app. i technically have this 5 stars, but it's probably a 4.75 for me (fwiw). One thing: I wish there was a way to duplicate lists. I can duplicate sublists within a list, which is close, but I would love to be able to duplicate a list entirely so that it shows in the left hand menu and not as a tab within a list.

Works well. No problems so far. I'm well pleased. It started giving me a reminder that I could not stop. On Saturday morning I had a reminder set and when it went off I marked it done and the alarm continued. I even went through all settings and could not make it stop. It continued for at least 5 minutes. The next week same thing. I had to go through and delete all reminders to make it stop. Thank you for your response. I deleted and reinstalled. Is working perfectly now. Thanks!

I absolutely love this app! I'm picky when it comes to tasks app, because most free versions are chaulk full of annoying ads. However, this Task app has exceeded my expectations! There's no annoying ads. It doesn't glitch. And it's very user-friendly. There are so many "Pros" to this app that I can't list them all. Here are my top "Pros": - Create separate lists (work, home) - Customize colors for each list - Unlimited subcategories for tasks - May attach pics to tasks - Add reminders to task

I love this app so much. I've tried them all and Tasks is like my second brain. It's beautiful to me that the developer offers it for free with no ads because after so many failed task apps, it really lessened the barrier to trying yet another new one. Take some time to adjust the settings and find your groove with nesting and organizing tasks and you will never need another task app. Seriously, I love Tasks so much. Thank you for finally creating something I can stick with to organize my life.

Great app. Easy to use and customize as much or as little as you want. Lots of flexibility; sub-lists, sub-tasks, color coding, reminders, sorting, and more. The ability to create a list that is a combination of other lists (filtered list) is fantastic. One wish list item: I listen to music on my phone and when an alarm goes off, it stops my music so and i have to turn it back on. It would be great if the alarm just paused other sounds (like other apps i use) rather than stop them.
Very useful and easy to use

Moved my personal to-do list to Tasks recently from another app that wanted a sub before certain basic features were unlocked, and have been pleased with the decision. Better widget implementation, sublist possibilities, and possibly my favorite feature, filtered lists -- I use tags and due dates with filtered lists to bring the most immediate tasks to the top of the pile. The repeating feature is a little non intuitive to set up, by the dev offers a great video to walk you thru if needed.

This app really is amazing - I'd have lost my head without it. No ads, easy to use, and the reminders - so much stuff wouldn't get done without the reminders. Such a life saver, and by life I mean grades. Only real thing I wish that I could have with it was tye ability to attach something to a task. That, and I never remember how to delete a category, but that's more on me.

I absolutely love and depend on this app daily. I tried a few different ones and didn't like the functionality until I discovered this one. My favorite feature is being able to have multiple lists, and sub lists within those. This allows me to organize my related tasks together instead of a single massive list. I also love the reminders, since I have a hard time remembering to do things when I intend to. Definitely the best Task app.
great app , thanks so much
Best to do list app I've found.
Love the simplicity of the app. Easy checklists with custom colors. It's so satisfying to cross things off.
Having used numerous task/reminder apps, this is the best I have come across. The developer also replies incredibly quickly. Think I have finally found the one for all my needs.

I've tried many many notification apps (even paid for them and deleted them.) This app is very people friendly, multiple options to set a reminder, the alarms are visually appealing (not obnoxious). Only issue is the soonest repeat notification option is daily, not (min, hrly). So a new separate notification has be set. But seriously how lazy does a person have to be if they can't take 2 mins to add another ?!? So 5 stars all the way. KUDOS to a awesome app!!!
Very helpful for organizing and jotting.
Easy to use, well laid out
Great app.... Really useful
I absolutely love this app im so glad I decided to try it

This is a really excellent Task/To Do app. The feature I particularly liked is the Calendar view so that you view the day's tasks without the clutter of yesterday, tomorrow etc. Developer response is fast and very helpful. The premium version has a web mirror so you can you use the app on your laptop or tablet or both.
Have used for years and is excellent.

great app

I enjoy being able to quickly add tasks, schedule them, etc. (a lot to play with, if you want). Love the opportunity of color coding.

Best list app out there. Love how easy it is to use, quickly add tasks and subtasks, can add lots of details and reminders, looks great. Seriously the best balance of simple and complex. Love love love it

Really like the widget for keeping track j of my day. I like being able to add bigger project and then have sublists. Would like to have repeat option for daily tasks. Very helpful for ADHD. I now understand. Use the help videos, their is a lot of capabilties. Great customer support also.

Made My life very easy. What a app this is. Works perfectly, very easy to use and systematic, Thank you to app developer
The best task organizer!! Very easy to use.

HIGHLY recommended this app, especially for neurodivergent people who are easily overstimulated by the other task apps. this app has no distracting ads, is very intuitive to navigate, and easy to customize for your individual sensory needs. it has everything i need in a task list app, no more and no less. @ the developers: thank you for making a task app that actively makes my life feel less overwhelming.

I use the free version and find it very user friendly with just a short learning curve. I'm very happy with the app. I used to use Google calendar and was very frustrated with it's inability to be able to change days of previous month and next month colors. My Wife and I sync our mobile calendars so we don't double schedule. Business Calendar does everything we want it to do, I won't go back to Google calendar.

Works well a vast majority of the time but have had two instances of it not saving a created appointment. I verified it said July 2024, showed it to her, she said yea, it's wrong. Opened app, month view was correct. How can this happen? The widget was showing the 2023 day/date info? Despite the flaky looking icon, this is the best calendar app for power users. Lots of configurability means you customize it exactly to your liking. I wish it were available on desktop/laptop computers. (-1 star for the flaky icon.)

I've been using this app (and its predecessor) for years. Tried the others - none of them compare. This is full-featured software. Still the best. 2020 UPDATE: Can it be updated to synchronize easily with calendars beyond Google Calendar, without cumbersome multiple-step CalDAV tinkering?

this app had been good to me for years, but this latest update messed up all of my appointments. the view is botched - making it difficult to see what's actually on there. once this weird view glitch is fixed, it's back to 5 stars for this app.

I love the color bars for events. My only complaint is at the last update they took away the option to edit one day at a time. If I want to enter a change to one day one an event that is weekly, it changes every week. Then I have to go back and reverse all the other ones thereafter. It just works like I expect it to. Look it's just a calendar app, but I love the interface and how it keeps my work and private calendars displayed. My daughter switched to an iPhone and she said it's the one app she misses the most. Come on guys make an ios version! That's why I only gave it 4 stars... It really deserves 5..

Planners are the tools for success, wouldn't use anything else. I have found this app the best for my needs. I like how it works. Though one massive thing I can't either figure out how to do (which is more likely the case). Update: I had uninstalled google calendar (since I had BC2 & to free up space). Learned that this may affect sync. Reinstalled google calendar & it's now syncing just fine. I thought I had fixed it awhile ago with some settings adjustment but I am back to having syncing problems again.

Follow up. What happened to the colors? Part of it, is your program does do some degree of muting colors. I disabled Material You, I have better things to do, than worry if my icon matches my theme. The display settings were in natural. Vivid is a bit intense for my likes, but colors come in much closer on vivid. Improved color match now, only part is the program.

While not easily accessible to a rank beginner, the app seems semi-intuitive & could be very useful for someone (like myself) with experience of digital task-lists, computer calendars, or maybe anyone who's used a few Google productivity apps... Great app, the best time setting interface of anything. Only feature I don't like is if you change the start time of an event it proportionally changes the end time so you have to change the end back to where it was and if you change it enough to span the midnight hour now you have to change the days too.

calendar works good. I have a lot of stuff in there that keeps me on track and there is some overlap- I can't open an event below another. I tried to click on where there is no overlap, and sometimes I zoom in, but at times I am forced to delete the event on top to get to the lower one.

Fantastic calendar app. Lots of of customization options. Recommended. Unfortunately, the widget I set is not holding when in "pop-up widget" mode on some Android devices. I have to keep selecting the specific widget I want again and again. Has been this way for the last few updates. Please fix.

Almost perfect. I wish that it had an alarm reminder instead of notifications. I don't like to set individual alarm clocks constantly. I love the option of color coding events. Sharing calender is HARD. Doesn't always sync like it's supposed to. I really love this calendar but due to not being able to share and keep apts up to date I'm on the hunt again for a new calendar. If it was just for my use this would be perfect.

I like the App. Wish there was a way (if I'm missing something, help) to lock settings once you customize them. Possibly hold 3 styles to reload once you set all the colors, calendars, fonts, designs, etc. I wonder if something like this would be possible for those of us who have paid for the App?

Great app for keeping track of several different calendars/schedules. However, They started putting unskipable ads in while working on it so had to upgrade to the pro. Only took off one star for that because at least it's just a one time charge not subscription.

Just paid for this app. Latest update, I've lost some events in 1 of the 4 Google calendars I view. Those events show up just fine in the Google Calendar, and used to show up o.k. Still missing some events in one calendar. Refresh/resync doesn't help. All events showing in Google Calendar. Shut down, restarted phone, not fixed.

I'm not sure, but I keep getting these little hidden files in download folder but I believe they're from the calendar. I haven't checked since the update. But I do use this app every day especially for the widgets and the customization. You can get lost in it, but I'd rather have the option than not.

Now it's reminding me however sometimes twice for same event. Not like before update. Used it for years always was dependable now sometimes I get reminder and sometimes not! Old reminders screen was on whole screen and would turn screen on when reminder was set off. Also when you selected calendar on notification screen it took you to reminder screen, now takes you to event and reminder screen disappears. So disappointed with update. Looking for new app. I also paid for this. :(

Excellent task/calendar app but should work on IOS and windows 10 computers. Then it would be 5 *. Updated 9/2/2021: Really the best Calendar/task master I have ever used. Does everything one could want in a calendar and task manager with clean interface and uncomplicated actions. Linking contacts to tasks and calendar items is a real plus. Ability to use a "local" task list so one can have tasks which only show up on your device and not on a synced business application like Google. Get it

This is a really good calendar app with few ads, but I have a small gripe. I was using this before the option to reschedule recurring events for individual days became hidden behind a paywall (presumably), and now I only have the options to either reschedule all of the events, or all future events. This is very inconvenient, but otherwise I like the app very much.

Good app, great wodgets, almost perfect. Lost a star because the notification types aren't very customizable and it's very easy to miss them. I wish they could put notifications on the lock screen or have them more persistent. The best they do is slide down as a banner for a moment then disappear. if notifications were more robust and customizable, this would be the PERFECT calendar app, well worth the money.

This is really well-designed and overall I really like it. My only complaint is that there's no option to sort tasks manually - the app only lets you sort by date, title, or priority, so I'm going to have to figure out some workaround to get my task lists organized the way I need them to be. Other than that, this app is just what I've been looking for. Really nice-looking widgets too (paid version only, though).

I used to love this widget but the last update or so has made the lines smaller in the daily and agenda views. It now cuts off the very top of the event titles. I am able to read it but the events are so smooshed together it makes it more difficult and not neat looking like it was. There is no setting I can find to fix this issue. Overall the calendar is great, I just don't like the new widget updates at all.

Been using for years. Like the widget better than the Google calendar. Unable to delete a single post of a reoccurring event. I have my work schedule for every day of the week and if I try to delete one then I have to delete all. Waiting for developers response. Maybe I am doing something wrong. UPDATE: After installing google calendar and syncing then the ability to delete a reoccurring event shows up. Life is better and I dont have to find another calendar app.

I would like this app better if it would distinguish between the days more definitively, if the graphics to do so were more bold. It is hard to distinguish between the days, and I can't find a way to make it better. The older version did this, and I liked that better, but the older version would not show "no event days", this one does. Otherwise, this version has some improved features, such as being able to set, for example, the 2nd Wednesday of every month, which the other version could not.

I use this calendar mostly just because it offers me the ability to adjust the transparency of it as a widget on my android phone. I use the free version so I get the ads and popups when adding items to my schedule. Annoying but understandable. The only complain I have is that I can't edit the calendars in the app so I often get multiple reminders for one event. IE; FB contact birthdays & Gmail contact birthdays. I love that I can customize it to keep my "to-do" list and my agenda in one place.

I was looking for an alternative to google calendar and I think this may be it. My only issue is that it doesn't always display all calendars. I can go to accounts and see it has reverted back to sync off. It may or may not be a S9 flaw which got me thinking that was probably what was wrong with google. The rating is because I have to go pro in order for location to populate when entering appointment. Google i do not

Honestly after about 20 calendar apps I just gave up and settled on this one. I wish it would stop applying changes to every calendar I have on my phone though. The overall lay out and interface is great, but the highlighted calendars applied at the bottom of the app decides what calendars it wants to add, and that becomes annoying

The UI is the best of the calendar apps I've tried. There are full-screen ads though, which is quite annoying and disruptive. I dropped the app when those were introduced, but I couldn't find one I liked better so I'm back. I'm still salty about the full-screen ads, but if you can put up with them or don't mind paying, it really is a nice app.

I really like this app but it has some weird issues. Set as a widget, it'll list multiple events on the same day. Example; 3 or 4 entries as "Independence Day", & no way to delete them. Not linked to multi-accounts, shows all no matter what. Very frustrating. Other than that it's good for quick calendar entries, that's why it's staying. ***edit*** Going to "settings -> appearance -> filter duplicate events" gets rid of them. Just don't have muliltiple, exact same entries on the same date. 4* now

I really love this calendar and use it daily. I love its many features. I like that it coordinates with TASKS which moves tasks automatically to the next day if not accomplished. The only reason I am not giving Business Calendar 5 Stars is that from time to time it will drop an appointment and that bothers me! I missed an appointment the other day because of it! It wiped out some birthdays last year. That really aggravated me! I don't know why this happens.

I would happily give this a 5 star rating if somebody can please explain how to make the default reminder for event to always be turned on and always set to 0 minutes. I have already missed a customer deadline because the reminder didn't go off at the scheduled time due to the fact the reminder was turned off even though I didn't touch anything. I've done tests and the reminder is so weird, sometimes it automatically sets with 0 min, sometimes with 30 mins, and sometimes it won't even set at all

Way better than stock Android Google Calendar. The only reason it's not 5 stars is because the location field can't recognize websites.
