Ugh. Can a future version please recognize URLs and open them in a browser or video conferencing app?

Just oownloaded then started using. Looks good so far. One thing it really needs is the ability to delete a custom reminder time. I accidentally created one for 15 days instead of 15 minutes. I had to uninstall and reinstall the app just to get rid of it. Also an option to swipe left or right to change the view to agenda, month, week etc would be good
It is very easy to make an appointments with color coding

It's a great app but, when adding a new event from the wigit, it often saves it as occurring a day earlier than intended. As long as you're aware of this and double-check every time you add an event it's fine, but it would be even better if this issue could be addressed by the developer.

Excellent app. Never an issue until today, while at my medical appointment, I was making the next appointment for the first week of July. Inexplicably, my monthly widget showed July 4th as being on a Tuesday, the girl making the appointment for me said no, it's on a Thursday. I verified it said July 2024, showed it to her, she said yea, it's wrong. Opened app, month view was correct. How can this happen? The widget was showing the 2023 day/date info? I wish I grabbed a screenshot.
Sufficient for my needs. Rare ads are at an acceptable level for a free app.
It is very easy to make an appointments with color coding

This is a simple-to-use, efficient calendar app. My only complaint is that it seems impossible to stop reminders for calendar entries. I run multiple calendars simultaneously, and have tried everything I can find to stop notifications. My defaults for every calendar are set to no notifications, and I have tried everything I can find through Google, and it still creates 2 notifications on every new calendar entry. After a few minutes, notifications can be deleted but it's still annoying.

I've been using this calendar for a couple of years now, and I'm satisfied with it. It does everything you need and more, and is very customizable. I have a few quibbles about interface behavior, especially the akward activity list pop-up in the monthly view (I'd prefer a separate panel instead, like the Samsung calendar has), and the drag-to-copy feature is clumsy and error-prone, but I can live with them.
Other than the ads, I'm happy with this app. Keeps me organized!!

An essential app for productivity. I use it as a calendar and a to-do list at the same time. Does everything I'd require. Though there are a few noncritical oversights, usually about widgets, like subtasks having colors different from the main task, or the widget still hiding completed tasks (but not completed subtasks) although "Hide completed tasks" is unchecked in its settings.
Very good App. I especially appreciate the App and Widgets. An issue for me is the event colors are not synchronized with the Google web calendar.

indispensable, and worth the paid upgrade-- keeps my life in order. Sometimes the auto fill and auto correct does unfortunate things, but that could be the user. üòé I like the way it simplifies my life by integrating with Outlook and Google calendar. would like the 'task' concept to be more flexible, a wish list of activity that would carry forward if not marked as complete.. that would be useful

Very good app. Helps me keep organized, and does not let me forget anything. Also, syncs with the google account so I don't miss any dates. I would only suggest that they change all the tasks paid options to the free app, so we could have the opportunity to compartimentalize the complex tasks in projects and also to repeat the tasks daily or weekly, to achieve milestones and to track them. This app would become exceptional and dependable. Thank you, I know you will ponder my suggestion üôèüèªüòä

Fantastic UX! This app became my main calendar app. I only suffer from poor integration with Outlook (in order of importance) : 1. No Outlook tasks appear in the task list. 2. All calendar folders from my account are displayed like single calendar, no separate visibility or colors (while Google calendars have them separated). 3. Categories assigned to events are ignored. 4. Free/busy does not support Tentative status. Other than that - good work! Hopefully Outlook will find smoother run one day!

Love this app. It is almost perfect. The only additional feature that i would like to see is the ability to fold tasks. I like to see the tasks in the Day view. Currently they all tasks are shown in a single list, including sub-tasks. This soon becomes unmanageable and impossible to see on a single screen. It would be great to have the ability to nest tasks and fold up the sub-tasks so that only the parent is visible.

The app has a nice amount of customization, a good variety of widgets and the notifications are very informative about the events. On the other hand, it lacks the possibility of setting standard reminders for each calendar separately (e.g.: reminders a week before for entries on a "Tests" calendar; reminders one day before at 10pm for entries on "Doctor Appointments"). This could perhaps be done with templates, but since it's behind the Pro version I wasn't able to try.

Quite usefull app, easy to use. The only serious issue I have is snoozing and discard options - no way to apply with single button, like 'unlock phone', had to click at least 3 buttons and it keep annoy when app play sound being on background. Also there is a bug when first notification happened than you change time but next notification play regardless.

Great app. Like anything new it took some time to adapt but I really like the ease of use. Would recommend I didn't need something designed with lots of pointless additions that someone has decided would be important I needed simple to use. I rejected two apps before this one because they were ridiculously difficult to use.

I loved this app, but some update slowed it down tremendously to the point that its becoming unusable. I've tried deleting old tasks and events but it's still lagging all over the place. This saddens me, because this app was my daily driver and I was about to purchase the premium version. but now I'm looking for alternatives. I'm using an LG G6 that runs smoothly. Please try to improve your performance or revert whatever changes were made that impacted it. Thank you.  Edit: I've tried re-installing, clearing cache, checking how much memory is used (I have 4 gigs and this app's usage is negligible). The lagging started happening after I updated the app. I've now downloaded an older version APK from December 2018. This version runs smoothly like before the update. I'm not sure which update is the one that made the app unusable, since I skipped a few. My main problem is that on the month view, the scrolling is laggy, adding tasks is laggy, everything is laggy. Also, sometimes, for no reason, tasks copy themselves to a new task that is planned for "all day" instead of a specific time. I'll up my review from 3 stars to 4. I might try to update again in a few months.

Now with outlook support, the best organizer ever! I just wish we could set shorter sync periods. Now the shortest in the settings is one hour. Tasks have a long delay to be shown (sometimes until I sync manually)

I was very close to transitioning to using this app and buying the paid version. The integration with my Google Calendar is great, but Google Tasks is not. The time and other details don't sync, which the devs did clarify is a limitation of Google's API. I appreciate the info density, but the UI just feels cramped, IMO. Great app; would strongly consider again if a web or a cross-platform app is made, or if/when Google lifts their API limitations.
I find copying or moving appointments to be a little cumbersome, but otherwise it's intuitive, easy to use and at this point I completely rely on it as an essential tool on my phone.

The app is great. I'm currently using it as a driving instructor to keep a private diary of when I'm taking learners on lessons. The only thing I'd love to see is the ability to automate an SMS template like: "Hey [Name], just a reminder that your lesson is at [date/time]." and have that send automatically a few hours before the start time would be phenomenal ‚ò∫Ô∏è I used to use Goldie for that, but they want ¬£30 per month which is extortionate!

I've just installed this otherwise great app to my phone after factory reset, it connected to my calendar with no problems, but for whatever reason it says in tasks "You don't have any tasks. Good for you..." But a quick glimpse to tasks in my Google Calendar on PC reveals I have two overdue tasks. So there is a glitch with tasks apparently. EDIT: I had to explicitly connect to my Google tasks, now they show up. But that is a glitch anyway, that should be default.

Best app calender ever installed, and I directly buy it... But I found one problem. This app can't drag a event which include different days... For example, make task "sleep" between 23:00 - 07:00. If I want to drag (change) this 8 hour sleep become 22:30 - 06:30, it's cannot.... Hope you could fix that, please...

Tasks auto-sync is mostly problematic, even tapping sync button in widget does not solve it. Tasks sync works only if I manually open the calendar, go to sync menu, and tap the sync menu (with minimum 3 tappings in total). Features other than tasks sync work very well.
Very nice addition to have this on the watch as well. One more feature would give it a 5 star, and that is seperate selection of calendars to show on the phone and watch.

this app had been good to me for years, but this latest update messed up all of my appointments. the view is botched - making it difficult to see what's actually on there. once this weird view glitch is fixed, it's back to 5 stars for this app.

Great app - with plenty of features and customisation. Just one question: in the description, it says "includes watch app, tiles and complications for your watch face". I have installed the app on my watch (Galaxy Watch 6) and have found the tiles, but why don't I see any specific complications for the watch face?
Good clean intuitive interface, unfortunately like most calendar apps, the widget doesn't always update automatically.
Good app, would be great to have the ability to display a few lines of event description in the agenda widget.
Have experience a seemingly technical inability to change colors for my event themes. Also, experiencing duplications when I edit repeat events. I haven't found a solution to either glitch.

This is one of the apps that I've used for the longest time. It has a lot of flexibility and features. But I think the UI needs to be updated for a more modern look. Also, qukckly swiping through month view used to be very precise but not anymore.

5 star because it does what is says and is a really good calendar. I purchased it but no longer need it because I already have the Samsung calendar already installed. I thought it'll be better but I think I'm just used to the samsung app that I default to it. It's a great app and very good at organizing. I recommend even though I don't need it. I do not regret purchasing it in the first place.

Despite the flaky looking icon, this is the best calendar app for power users. Lots of configurability means you customize it exactly to your liking. I wish it were available on desktop/laptop computers. (-1 star for the flaky icon.)
Generally a very nice app. However, I am disappointed that the"filter duplicate events" feature is no longer working for me, and it was that feature that I got it for in the first place.
Could you please create a watch face (watch face is NOT a watch app) with events and tasks? Reference: outlook, sectograph.
Good app with lots of customizations

This app is the perfect way to stay organized. Especially with getting married this year, I was getting overwhelmed and losing track of deadlines and items to complete. This app helps me keep track of everything as summarized or as detailed as I want. And being able to have different lists / sublists helps me keep everything organized as well. Simple to use app yet gives me full control over my tasks, priorities, and deadlines. Edit: As a developer I enjoy your responses to negative reviews üòÇ

All the features + helpful YouTube tutorials I read a number of lists while trying to find certain features. For me it was important to have timestamps for when a item was created and completed, and a way to search tasks and tags. This app also features subtasks, reminders, and calendar view. Definitely check the website and YouTube tutorials! I had an email drafted, but checked there first and every question was answered. I bought an annual subscription, but I can see moving to lifetime. Thx
When you figure out how to use it, it's a great app!
Good

A help function would be helpful. Or if there there already is a help function, making it easy to find, would be helpful! How to make a list of things to do is not self evident. I thought I was making a list of things to do, only to find I made a title or catagory of a list of things to do (hopefully that makes sense). Only had this for a few minutes and there is a learning curve for most software so will see how it goes. Aha! Found the help function. Thanks. I also discovered how to delete the "categories" I started, instead of a list of tasks. At this time, this app has been helpful. Upgrading to another star.

This app has helped me stay focused and helped me prioritize my tasks. It's easy to use and therefore I use it where as many I have tried are too complicated. If I could change one thing about it I would have a section where just today's tasks were listed separately so that it's easy to figure out which are today's tadks, which haven't been done yet, and which are future tasks.

I really like this app and it works really well! However, my only complaint is that the desktop version requires a subscription instead of being free just like the app. Still the app is really amazing and does exactly what I need to do I've done a little bit a lot of other organizing apps and they haven't really work as well as this one has.

This would be a great application if only it had the ability to add task paths to the list in calendar view. Some of my subtasks don't make sense without including the main task from where it came. Also it would be really wonderful if I had the ability to sort by more than one criterion. Otherwise, it's pretty cool !
Is easy to use and helps very much to reach different goals using the task lists I've created

I love this app.. I'm inclined to purchase the 1year subscription however there doesn't seem to be a sure way to set up or access account information like a linked email which was problematic when I got the month subscription and switched to a different phone.. Besides that this app is everything I needed .. Perfect for ADHD folk that have lists within listsüòÇ Well made app!

I really like this app and all the features. I would even pay for the app but for the extras offered having it as a monthly/yearly subscription is too much money. The lifetime fee is too much for this type of app. As long as I can get what I need without the high subscription fees I'll be happy.

Intuitive and oh my god! So beautiful!!! The things that I was looking for but couldn't find: a way to create a recurring task (pay utility bills etc) and a view where I could look at all the tasks I need to get done by today or are overdue. Will stick around to see if these are supported but like the app otherwise :)

So far it is pretty good. Alarms, sub lists, calendar, and beautiful colors. The only thing it's missing is a way to save your tasks from phone to other devices. For instance, a login feature would allow your work to be archived no matter what.

I've been using rhis app for a few weeks. I have a Pixel 2 XL. Pros: Great app. User friendly. Easy to use & group tasks. I love that you can rearrange tasks bases on your preference. Im an entrepreneur with many projecrs and it def keeps me on track. Cons: I wish it could track the amount of time I spend on each major task & sub task, like a time clock. Is this a possibility in Q1 or Q2 of 2020?

Honestly, I've had problems with organization most of my life. No matter what planner or app I try, I just can't do it. I still have to get used to the interface but so far this app has been TONS more helpful than any others I've tried. 4 stars just because I'm getting used to things and getting my feet wet. But hopefully when I figure it all out I can give a more thorough review lol

I finally found this app after much searching. It's easy to use & has color choices to differentiate lists from one another. It would be even better if I could post my current working lists open on my home page for easier reference. I have multiple lists & things to remember lists going all the time that I need to refer back to. Any chance of adding this feature?

Definitely helps me to stay organized a little easier. I personally use it in conjunction with an old fashioned pen and paper when I have a lot to get done in a day. The only complaint I have with it is that I wish I could add additional reminders for the tasks instead of having to choose a reminder time based off of a due date I set. Other than that it's great and easy to use.

I really like this app. I like the design, the ui/ux. It has most of the features I want, but there is one thing that is keeping me from switching and using the app. I cannot make repeated tasks that have an All Day due date and no reminder. It seems all repeated tasks must have a due date with time and reminder. This is the only thing that is keeping me from using this app.
So far I am enjoying having all my tasks in one place. I will see how I am with the App at the end of the month.
Simple to start lists and keep track of what has been completed. Using thr free version it delivers exactly what I need.
Nice application
Great little app to keep me on track.
Really helps keep on task with brain fog.
It is very useful
Out of all tasks/to do apps ive tried the best and free. But please add to the repeat cycle the option to choose on which days to repeat
Very useful. One time payment of subscription is high. If reduced , may be, many people opt for this option.

Find this useful. Works well for me. I got a new phone a few weeks back and found by giving a small donation I was able to transfer all my tasks to my new phone. To be honest I am unlikely to have donated without the push but it was "less than the cost of a coffee" and so worth it. Many thanks to the developer.
Helps me keep up with things that I have to do.
Very easy to use!

Thank you for this well-made program, it is really useful, but I don't know why the previous versions worked better for me, I deleted the app and installed it from other sources, but the problem was still not solved. In any case, thank you for your good work.

I'm an ADHD check-off-girl. I love checking things off on my lists of things to do - it's positive evidence of my productivity and it makes me feel like I'm making progress. Tasks does this for me. It's simple, only essential bells and whistles like calendars, and reminder alarms. It's also straightforward, easy to understand, and intuitive in it's use. I'd add a few more check off features, but it works great for me as is.
Awesome app. One request ... Add drag and drop repositioning of items in list. Move to top and move to bottom is bothersome.

Finally an app that does almost everything I need! I've probably tried a dozen but this one feels right. I like to be very organised and goal-oriented every day. This app lets me do that. Is there a feature for recurring tasks rather than inputting the same tasks each day?
Really good ,very user friendly,
Hourly reminders not regenerating
Simples ..saves on post its for sure

I have used a lot of different "to-do list" apps in the past, and this one is the very best of all of the ones I have used. My one problem with this app is that if you accidentally delete a to-do item, say you slide it off the screen, and cannot hit the undo button before it disappears, the only way to get that item back on your to-do list, is to copy and paste it or retype the item. There should be a way to restore an item from the deleted file.

I like the app. Inputting tasks is super easy. I can make lists related to school, home, work, etc, which is great. I wish I could have the widget available in different sizes (ie wider so I can read my task or most of it from my home screen). 2x1 isn't big enough for anything really, in my humble opinion.

It is good, and the option of sub-tasks is very useful. It is a little difficult to mesh with the calendar app--having its own cakendar may be a good step, since it is easierand faster to schedule tasks than my Android calendar app. I don't think I've figured out how to make a recurring event. Thank you, hope this helps with the app, and God bless!

Great app and easy to navigate! I haven't really used it to its full capabilities yet, however, for the five things I use this app for, it's out of this world compared to my plain notes. This app makes it super easy to stay on top of my tasks and duties throughout my day, week, and year. Would recommend to someone who's looking to become organized or for an individual who is already organized that just needs a little more routine in their life.

This app is really nice and useful. Helpful by creating task lists and check lists. An improvement that would be especially useful, would be the ability to create a task list on one device and then easily synchronize it to another device. For example, between a phone and a tablet. Thank you for a very useful application.

Works great at keeping me organized. I have not had it long so I will have to explore the features. Update-New phone. I can now use the microphone to add tasks. This app is just smart enough. I use it as my own personal to do list separate from Google Tasks which I use for work. It's simple with just enough features and not all the predictive noise threaded through all Google apps.

Great app for writing down things you need to do and stay organized. Love how I can put the widget on the home screen and use it from there. Also like how I can color code each list and shows when they were created and completed. Good thinking. Dont think I can back up my info/tasks to save for later, but it's a pretty great useful app.

If you like alarms as reminders because they harder to ignore (versus that God awful persistent setting), just know that you can't mark them complete so that they disappear like you can with notifications. They just stay on your task list bright red like they're overdue, which is overwhelming when you need this app to stay organized. You actually have to go into the app & individually mark each of them completed. Would be five stars if you guys could add that! I've only been asking for years üò≠

Love this app! I've tried all the other recommended task apps but this is the only one that doesn't try to make you pay by taking away tags and priorites. It's super simple and I'm able to use it as a digital bujo. It's great! Highly recommend. My only hitch is it doesn't link to my calendar. Not a deal breaker but it'd be nice if it would. It'd be 5 stars then.

I'm a busy woman: single mother of two teens, executive assistant to two entrepreneurs, and a college student. Having this app available at my beck 'n call is a Godsend! I keep business tasks, personal priorities, grocery lists, & mommy-to-do checklists readily available through the app. It's having my 'paper brains' organized & conveniently located with the touch of a button. Helps with stress relief too. Absolutely necessary for working mommas!

*Please consider thess fixes, updates* -Option to repeat task until completed -Option for repeating task without having to set a date / time due I am really enjoying this app. The only trouble I am having is that some items that are set to repeat "daily" are not showing up in my filtered "today" list. I want to be able to complete the same task, each day (like doing dishes). Please let me know how to fix this. I love this app overall.

I really love this app, but it's not perfect. Here's my thoughts: Pros: - Allows you to make reminders either a push notification OR AN ALARM. This is VERY hard to find in a reminder app. - Highly flexible and customizable, allowing you to set priority, add sub-tasks, custom snooze lengths, etc. Cons: - Not a super clean interface. - Not always an intuitive interface. - The widget often gets behind. Overall, great for someone looking for a very flexible app, but not for a minimalist.

It's sadly evident that most to-do list apps are created by people with remarkably little to do. This is a delightful rare exception. Logical, simple but powerful, with all the basic necessities covered and good customization options, this is the closest mobile equivalent to AbstractSpoon's ToDoList available. Edit: Removing one star for the total removal of local backup. Monetization is understandable and deserved, but removal of a simple local failsafe to push (Premium) cloud backup reeks.

LOVE IT, but it needs the ability for additional notifications maybe more reflective of the Microsoft 365 calendar format. You need the ability to highlight each task within the list a different color not just the task list. For example, if I opened my green work list, I would like to have the ability to highlight each task in that list a different color. The priority levels need better visual clarity because the tones of the red, orange and yellow are too similar.

This is the best app I've found since the one I've used for years has gone dead. Would be a stellar app if: The repeat option would show up when creating a task from the calendar view without removing the date and adding it back. This may be because the calendar view is limited. The notifications on repeated tasks seem glitchy. The notification goes off the first day, but doesn't on the next day. Tasks marked as completed on future days revert back to uncompleted the next day. Sometimes tasks get done early. When creating a repeated task, it would be great if there were additional options. Rather than every month or four weeks, how about monthly but give an option for the same day each month, or the same day of the week (ie March 12 or second Saturday of the month).

I use tasks to organize my life, and it's mostly great. Some things that aren't: if I check something off, and something in the near vicinity has sub-tasks, they check themselves off; I can't assign sub-tasks their own date, so I can't effectively plan ahead without having to move the date forward every time I check a sub-task off; if you check off all the sub-tasks, the main task automatically checks itself off, which can be good or not depending on the situation; the calendar filtered task.

I'm using this app for all my recurring reminders that I need to remember that I don't actually want on my To Do list (like fill up water bottle, remind kids to pack their lunches, etc). I've tried several apps; the reason I've settled on this one for those reminders is b/c it will give me a reminder notification EVERY time whether or not I completed it last time. I LOVE that you can select specific days of the week (not just weekly or daily). My biggest concern is it not having cloud backup.

Exactly what I need in a task app...almost. Due dates, reminders, tasks groups, excellent widget. However, lack of integration with Google calendar is a deal breaker for me. I don't like the Google task app nearly as much as this app, but I have to use it to be able to work with my Google calendar.

I like the task set up. I would like even more if it had a percentage bar. I am always doing more then one task. So some tasks are further ahead then other due to stopping and start a different task. But over all I love what it does for me, because of all the task I have. I used to forget one and would remember at later time. And I would lose free time to play caught up.

Almost Perfect... There is one suggestion I would like to make though. I tend to stay up past midnight most nights. I have some tasks are set to repeat every day at a certain time. However, when I complete a 9pm task at 1 am the next day, I don't get my needed reminder at 9pm the day I completed it at 1 am. I would like to see some sort of "catch up" system where if a task is not completed one day, it will proceed to the next day in order. I'd add more but limited on characters.

This is a simple no BS task-organization app. I have had this app for three years, and the only real gripe I had with it was that you cannot add tasks from your computer. Seeing as I spend most of my time behind a monitor, I figured I would use something that allowed me to do this. Now that tasks is available as a computer app, i truly have little else to say. Perhaps a Google assistant incorporation would be a worthwhile improvement.

Very easy to use and I love that you can organize your items efficiently in categories. Recurring notices are essy to set up. The only downside is on recurring notices - if you don't mark it complete one day, you won't get the next notice until you fix that. Other than that, I love it!

So far (I only just started using this) so good. The app is intuitive and includes lots of details (like subtasks and notes on tasks). One suggestion, would love to be able to set recurring reminders for specific days (for instance Monday through Friday or Saturday and Sunday). Um, silly question, is there someplace I can see all my tasks in one place? Like a home screen that shows tasks by list color or something?

this app has been working well for me.....i have bee using it the past few weeks and like it very much...but be sure to back up within the app because if you transfer or upgrade your phone and do a general backup....all of your sweat and tears of lists, etc will be gone....there should be a way that the developer can link theapp to general backup functions. other that....its great!

It needs a way to put items like bread, milk, etc. into a list format that way that you can "keep" certain items on the list, but still know when you bought it before. Every family buys certain items on a weekly basis & so far the only thing I would change would be that. Keep up the good work & I hope to see more app ideas come out soon.

This is a really great app! The only thing I would change is deleting a task from the list when you swipe it to delete. Right now swiping right turns off the alarm but the task stays in the list until you manually delete it. Edit. In the app, yes, you swipe to delete, but when the alarm goes off, you swipe to dismiss the alarm or swipe to snooze. It woukd be great if, when you dismiss the alarm, it deletes the task.

This app is great. Keeps all my tasks together. The only thing I wish it would do is to not auto-move a task to the next recurring due date once the current due date has past. I wish it would show "overdue" tasks or seething like that if the task was not yet completed. If a task is overdue, the once I finally check it completed, then it would move to the next recurring due date. Other than that, I really love this organizer.

I like the variety of things that can be marked, or not, for each task, such as certain days of the week. I'm still trying to figure out repeating daily tasks because sometimes it seems that they check complete themselves if I don't get them done on time. Other times they remain uncompleted. Tasks that repeat once/month don't end up on the right day of the week next month.

After a week of use it's almost perfect. A couple features aren't intuitive but I think I've figured it out. I love the widgets! Editing right from my home screen is SO great. 4/5 stars because there's no reoccurring task option and I can't figure out how to hide completed tasks. Thanks for a really fantastic & option rich app!! ‚ù§Ô∏è

Easy to use. I like the ability to make multiple lists, it would also be nice to have the option to merge them but maintain the color coding. One issue I have is that with quick ads, the voice command stops after saying one word and has to be restarted.

It is not as intuitive as Google Calendar, but it is less cluttered. The UI allows for more sectional usage to split up your tasks and your day as a result. Edit 1: One of the great parts of this app is the main developer will listen to you and your feedback. I've gotten pretty good service out of the apps themselves (I use this across my phone and on desktop-class browsers). The monthly subscription so far has been a very good value.

Took a few minutes to figure what they meant and how to set up the sub-tasks. But got it. It'd be great if even after deleting an item it started to remember your 'regular' stuff. But otherwise, I am really loving I can split up the things for the grocery store, the things needed for the house, and stuff yet to do...Thanks!

I really like how this app gives me the ability to move my tasks around. I also enjoy having the ability to strike a line through what I have done and taking the line away if it is a reacuring daily task. I also appreciate the vast color options for organizing my lists. Great free app! Thank You!!!!!!!!!!!!

it does its job and its very responsive. i use it to keep track of the games i want to buy for my collection. i like how it shows the date and time of when your task was completed. i think the interface could do with looking a little less cluttered and a little more minimalist, but overall, the app is fast and easy to use

This app works pretty well as far as organizing your tasks are concerned. However, there is no print option. What good is making a list if it can't be printed ?! It recommends Wunderlist...which, as of May, 2020, has been retired. I need to find an app that lets me create several lists; and then enables me to print out all pending tasks regardless of which list they're on. This app is not it.

I like the app but there is one thing that annoys the hell out of me. I use a number of sublists for shopping. Very Useful. The more I use it, the more I find different ways to utilize this app. Mostly I use this for remembering items and planning projects. I also use it for speech layouts in the beginning phases.

Enjoying the app and have added lots of categories, tasks, sub tasks and notes. It's helpful and it keep myself organized for invoices to paid, unsual appointment ect...
