I LOVE LOVE LOVE this App! It's user friendly & easy enough to just start using upon opening! But for those of us who want more - it's got that too! Several settings options make it truly customizable, and i really like that i can export a simple grocery list, via text message, and send it to my husband at the store!! I use this for my meds, and can save daily lists, export to doc,log notes & pain levels (using priority scale), & tag info for myself. It's so much more then a to-do list!

Nice, practical, simple and straightforward. Easy to sort and reorganize; easy to move items between lists. Only (very minor) complaint is that, when choosing colors for lists, text doesn't stay in contrast: for example, in dark theme, text is white, but if you try to make list yellow or white, text stays white and illegible.

Fairly good product. Easy to create and reprioritize items in a list. Can reorder lists themselves but not as easy to rearrange lists (why?). Easy to move items from one list to another. THING I MOST WISH CHANGED: it should be easier to check and uncheck boxes with out ending up on the ding-dang item edit screen. I'm mostly right handed, I have to reach across the screen to check/ uncheck and it is a 66% likelihood of ending up in the edit screen rather than check box action.

This is a great app to organize and prioritize all your to-do lists. It has worked flawlessly since day one on my Pixel 6a and more recently on my Pixel 2 watch. It does almost everything I have needed, helping remind me of tasks I need to do. I really like the widget on my home screen to see my main list but can easily switch to another

I use this app to keep track of all those things you think of when you don't have a note book, a scrap of paper, the back of an envelope to capture that brilliant idea. Then, OMG, where did I leave that note to myself? Grocery lists, movies, TV shows, books I want to see/read, recommended doctors, places we want to see, etc. How did I ever manage before Tasks?

I absolutely love the app! I'm a service Foreman for a road and parks department. We have multiple jobs per day that are constantly changing this app helps me organize all jobs. I bought a Android tablet just for this app to use at work. I upgraded to premium app for the back up capabilities well worth it to me . Hopefully if I ever have any trouble with my tablet this app will be backed up fully just as I have left it .

This app keeps my To Do reminder items and other lists in one place. It has reminders when a task has a due date My grocery list keeps items after they are purchased and ticked off. Next time, just untick items I need to buy again. Customizable lists, urgency, filters, and colors. I love it.

I almost never leave app reviews, but I couldn't not give this app a 5 star review. It's absolutely freaking fantastic. I don't know the team that developed it, but it's become more and more clear as I've used that app that they had a goal. A goal to create the pinnacle of all list and task trackers. Every feature you could ever dream of has been included in this app. They thought of everything. And let the actual user decide and customize if they wanted to use it.

LOVE it. I prefer writing lists, but this app's features were worth switching: multiple lists/sublists, reorganizing items, move completed to bottom, can still view what you've accomplished. I can also re-use lists, such as packing for travel, instead of re-writing every time and forgetting to put items back on a list. I can access these lists instead of relying on my brain to give me just 85% of the answers. I use for daily, weekly, and collecting ideas over months. Should've installed sooner.

Free version is actually helpful, no annoying adds. I highly recommend this app. 12/2/2023 update I've used tasks for 3 yrs. It reminds me either daily, weekly, or monthly. Highlighting important tasks and red flagging them make sure that I know what my first priority is for the day. I suggest l that they allow uploading your list so when you switch phones your lists downloads to the new phone. I found this app so useful that I upgraded to their paid version. It's definitely worth it!

I have been using this app for several months now. It has helped me tremendously with organizing my many chores and reminders. I just messaged a suggestion for repeating tasks to show the last time the task was completed, which I feel would help alot when organizing priorities. Other than that request / suggestion, I have no critique for this app. It is wonderful! I highly recommend it! üòä

This app is beyond helpful when it comes to trying to organize what I need done throughout the day and keeping things organized! It even allows subtasks for me to see what all needs to be done to complete a task before checking it off. It allows for multiple lists which I can color code, sort through the tasks I have, and even set alarms and priorities. I do wish I could sort completed tasks from uncompleted instead of hiding completed tasks, but overall, this app has been beyond helpful!

I've been using Tasks for about 3 years now. I absolutely love it! I used to write to-do lists out on paper. But when I would misplace a list,my life would go astray. Seriously. I have adult ADHD and have learned that I forget things that aren't written down very easily. This app has helped me stay organized in a major way. And I get a pinch of happiness every time I delete a task off the list. That good ol' dopamine boost. Great job on the app!

Best app I have found for my ADHD brain! So many apps target people with ADHD these days and they are NOT helpful. This simple, but extremely modifiable app is exactly what i need to keep things straight day-to-day and long-term. I have a list for "today" and a list for "later" plus others for high-stress priorities. You can add sub-tasks, easily re-order items, color-code, etc. It is so convenient to pull this out when I feel overwhelmed and jot down what's in my head, no stress.

I have tried for years to find a good system for keeping my life organized and I have finally found it with this app! It provides so many free features with no ads and it respects your privacy, so you can try it out and see how helpful, customizable, pleasing to the eye, and intuitive it is to use. It's just awesome. I bought the lifetime version because being able to switch from the phone to the computer is so convenient. Bottom line - this app will help get your life in control with more peace

I needed something to help me and my partner stay on top of housework and it is so easy to set up! I emailed with the question after getting premium and who responds but the owner and creater! They were thorough in their response, quick and kind. My partner and I have both gotten premium now and are making use of this app and I absolutely adore it. Thank you Steve for a wonderful app experience with no adds, no selling our data and a beautiful interface. Be kind to yourself!

This is one of the best 'to do list' apps I have found. Mainly because of it's simplicity. It doesn't want to connect to your contacts or any other apps, doesn't need to know your location or need something running in the background (unless setting an alarm of course). Thank you for keeping it simple. If you do think you need all that, please call it TasksPro or something and leave this version simple.

I've tried over a dozen similar apps and this one is by far the best. I rarely leave reviews, but Tasks has definitely earned it. I have adhd & my brain is a mess but Tasks has been helping A LOT. I set reminders for all my family's appts, keep a running list for groceries & home shopping, and I've even just started a Christmas shopping list. The free version is so helpful already, but I'm almost tempted to try the premium version to see what it's all about. Highly recommend...thank you!

I have never rated an app before. I rave about it to others. It's the perfect blend of simplicity and options to customize. I love having the widget on my phone. I expanded it so I can see many items on my list. I love the different options for reminders and snoozing. I have a hard time transitioning from task to task. Only thing I struggle with is the manual reorder of tasks (hold and drag). Works better for moving tasks down than up. Maybe my screen is not responsive enough or I'm clumsy.

This is by far the best task app out there! Great widgets and reminders settings. Adding quick tasks is a snap and there are multiple ways to do it. Fully customizable. The thing just works! Wished I didn't have to change so many things out of the box, but hey, we all have different needs. Keep up the great work!

Great app! Support is superb. Only needs a few things and it takes the cake (still much better than most task, alarm apps): alert sounds per task, ascending volume options, templates. I was reminded by the developer I can simulate by duplicating a task (create a list called templates- duplicate then move to another list/sublist).

Hi Steve, vibes again w/ settings off. Prob my phone. Fav feature: choose snooze time when alarm sounds, works flawlessly! Found alarm duration in settings üëç. Couldn't understand how the filter for history works. The to-do page is confusing. It's organized by date, irrelevant of today's date, so when i see it i get overwhelmed and can't understand what alarms are coming up. Probably my brain.

I have found this to be the best management app so far. The option to have multiple lists and sublists for all the different categories in life. Being able to add notes really helps simplify many tasks. It has premium features that definitely make it nicer but is perfectly usable for free. Being able to have customizable reminders and due dates for various things without clogging my Google calendar. Tasks are also very easy to update which is very helpful when they don't go as planned.

This program takes Google Tasks to the next level. I keep two lists running. "Big List" tracks all jobs, planned and completed. "Daily List" extracts and isolates location dependent plans (hopes?) for the day. Task labeling and easy movement of tasks back and forth between these lists is key. Access from separate locations, the reason I bought a lifetime subscription, amplifies the power. This is simple, functional support for planning and advancing multiple complex jobs simultaneously.

Update: I've now used the app > 6 months & love it just as much! My only wish is that the web app was identical. I've just been using this app for a few days, but so far, I love it. It has a huge amount of functionality and is very customizable, but doesn't feel at all complex to learn or use. I especially like the fact that it combines a task manager with a calendar. I got a monthly Premium subscription and will probably upgrade to annual. I only wish I'd found it sooner. Thank you!

Really loving this app so far! Have only been using a little over a month, but it has been super awesome. My spouse randomly (and regularly) texts me paragraph-style lists of what they want to accomplish for the week and I format them into an actual list with this app so I can check things off for them. I also like that I can share the list (with checks and all) when they ask what's left. Thanks for such a useful tool!

This this app is very user friendly. The only downside that I have found so far is that in order for me to have a version on my phone and also a version on my computer I need to get the paid version, which I think is reasonable priced at $1.89 per month (The plan I chose to try out the app) or less expensive for yearly (18.99) or one Lifetime payment 59.00 to use forever. After only a few days, I find this app has way more features than the "ToDo" list that I had been using.

This app is brilliant has all the things I want . Allows me to create lists sub lists , make notes and set reminders. One annoying thing is the back button exits the app when you're in a subsist. Would like of it would not let you exit the app and would go ro a root or home page. EDIT: there's a setting for my ask above! Love this app

Best ever! I have been tracking and organizing over 400 tasks over the years. The premium version, which includes tags, has provided me with the ultimate experience in sorting and combining detailed lists that keep me up to date. I don't have to carry around a big daily planner or rely on my failing memory...

Used this app since 2018 and still going strong. It's just simply the best. This is completely for my own amusement, but it would be great to have a tab that shows just the completed tasks within a certain time period. It's nice to just look back sometimes and see what I have accomplished in the past few days. Also, it would be great if there was a toggle to auto-delete completed tasks after they have been completed for a week.

I have tried sooo many scheduling/ planner apps this isby far my favorite! It's easy to use, perfect for keeping up with multiple college courses and their assignments, super easy to add new tasks through the widget. I just wish it was available for Apple devices also so I could see my schedule on my computer too!

Great app, its simple and easy to organize. I have a bunch of tasks and I like that I can separate them in different categories. Wouldn't change anything, except to add a deadline timer feature if I wanted to make sure I did a task by a certain time. That's just a thought, its a perfect app as it is!

Ok here's why I absolutely adore this app. Talk about organized and being able to get some stuff done üëç if that is your goal then for real, down load this app. I am big on time management and being punctual, this app definitely has me on point ‚òùÔ∏è üòé it pretty much manages my daily stuff and helps me to remember things I would probably put to the back of my mind when I know those things should be at the front. Love it can't live without it!!!! üíì

12/23 Update: Still loving it 18 months later! This app helps me keep my life organized! I have been using it for a few months and I love so many things about it. The widget is awesome, you can complete or snooze a task right from the notifications, and I can even complete a task from my Galaxy Watch 4. Responsive developer too! I'm off to upgrade to premium to support his excellent work. I can't recommend this app enough.

I tend to greenlight a lot and end up forgetting a lot of things I need to do. This helps a lot with that cuz of what it has for organization: Lists, sub lists, tasks, and subtasks. Its got the works. I like that kind of organization tbh. AND it has repeated reminders which is pretty neat and didn't expect this to have.

I love this app! I was constantly losing my paper lists and was pretty half hearted about even accomplishing what was listed. This app is really helping so much with focusing and feeling productive! It took a little bit for me to figure out the best way to use the tasks and sub tasks but after a couple of days it clicked!

I've tried ever app available and this is by far the most functional while also being the easiest to use and more attractive interface. the pro plan is a bit steep in price, but there are very few restrictions without it. you could easily donate a few dollars to help and are still getting the most fully featured list/todo app on Android. things you can do that most apps can't.. Move items between lists and subslits. Have sublists. lots of color customization. quick entry. full export to csv.

Amazing! I've been looking forever for an app like this. It is packed with countless options like adding notes and photos or other attachments; lots of ways to sort lists; sublists; reminders and deadlines; etc. At the same time, it is so simple and easy to use and understand. I synced across devices. Definitely way better than iphone Reminders and Google Tasks which don't have most of the options here. I just wish it were available as an app for iphones too.

Omg this app really helps keep me organized! I like that I can make my own categories for each task (Groceries, Home Errands, Town Errands, etc). I can make each category a different color/shade. Its simple and you can make it into a timer, reminder or level of priority. Its not complicated like other apps that have useless and stressful options that people don't need or can't understand. I highly recommend this if you are looking for something simple but create it to your liking!

I love that you can turn on a setting to hide completed tasks. It makes getting things done that much more satisfying! Mark as done and *woosh* they disappear! There is also just enough customizability without being overdeveloped. Really quite a tidy little app. I switched phones and tried out the preloaded notes app, couldn't stand it for more than a day before I had to track down Tasks!

I searched for years.. downloading and eventually having to uninstall due to the To Do app not having ability to have sub lists, prioritization, flexibility to organize my thoughts the way I think.  this is super flexible and easy..   if you liked the app and it helped you save time and organize my tasks... than you should donate to the individual that created this so he can continue to make improvements.  well worth it!

Love this app! So customizable. So easy to use and have all my tasks in one place. I struggle with ADHD/remembering tasks and have usually had multiple notebooks with scattered to-do lists. This app allows me to finally have it all in one place, create sublists, color code by level of importance, sort and move things around easily (a feature so appreciated in any type of organizing app). I honestly love this app.

This app is great for making detailed lists. I use it to keep track of my monthly bills, daily to-dos, future plans, and basically everything in my life. The sublists and customizable colors are a HUGE plus for me. And I love that you can mark things off and choose what happens to them (strike-thru, disappear, etc.). The feeling of making progress by marking something off a list is an instant serotonin hit haha. All-around great app to keep you organized and help you plan your life!!

A really amazing app! All the other task list apps I tried just didn't work how I would have liked them to, but this one helps me with everything! It's got a simple and easy to organize interface, along with app customization and different sets of reminders for each seperate task and list; everything has worked perfectly so far, and I definitely recommend!

I love this app! Does what I need, and it is very customizable. 10/10 I want to report a small bug, though. I changed the settings so that new tasks have reminders by default. When I add a new task from the text box at the bottom (quick add new task), it doesn't have a reminder by default. New tasks that I add from the '+' button do have reminders, though.

Absolutely love this app. Have a list for what my ideal morning looks like, a list for what needs done around the house, & a lost of projects I want to tackle, along with sub lists of the parts for those projects. Can be as simple or complex as you want. The only thing I regret is having spent money on other apps, & not having found Tasks sooner. Most intuitive & versatile to-do list I've ever used.

It's wonderful for not only taking notes but also organizing them. It even allows you to break down each goal so that you do not miss a step. My one issue is that once you add all your tasks, the app does not allow you to reorganize them. For instance, if you needed to do the last item you inputted first, you can not move it up on the list.

I'm a chaotic mess and this app helps a lot. It comes with snooze, annoy the hell out of me, sub routines, calendar tasks, and so much customizability it's insane. If I were to build an app, this is EXACTLY how I would want it. Truly amazing and worth checking out if you struggle with executive functioning. I'm broke rn but I'll donate when I can. Also, no ads or annoying pop ups even though I'm a free user.

It's as complicated or as simple as I want it to be, and has neat options for customization that keep things further organized. Interacting with the app was intuitive within five minutes of digging into its features, and having it as a widget on my Android phone is a massive plus-- it's one less step towards accessing my lists. Fantastic app. Keep up the good work!

great app for keeping up with my needs. gave it 5 stars but I feel it lacks In 2 areas. I use it more for a list then a task manager. best app I've found so far and I've used alot. I would like to see a photo adding option and a grid view. these 2 things coupled with the share option and how its displayed to the recipient would be amazing. still my favorite list app so far though.

I love how there's Light/Dark/Black modes to choose from, which helps with eye strain; there's the ability to pick a color for the lists you make from the 'pie' of colors available, but also customize the shade of color from there with the side below the 'pie'; you can also set reminder alarms right away or later/as needed; and after searching through many apps for task lists out there, this is the one that feels most user-friendly and generally *useful* in daily life for me.

Fantastic task app! I was looking for a comparable alternative to Any-do, and finally found it. I was specifically seeking similar snooze options as Any-do, and this app has them in ten-fold. One can even customize their snooze options should the app defaults not suffice. In addition, there are a plethora of functions and options available for each reminder and list created. Therefore, I am happy to say I was finally able to uninstall and delete my Any-do account without any reservation.

I looove looove looove the app!! It does what I need it to. I can add widgets to my homescreen so I can easily see my to do list and add to it. It's free. I haven't seen ads when I log in. I can reorganize and add different types of lists. For myself it's morning routine. Night routine and weekly chores. I can easily check them off on the widget and it resets after midnight. Definitely worth the 5start and download!

I grabbed this app as a replacement for Wunderlist, as that one's closing. It's a great app for keeping all my thoughts organized in one handy, colorful yet uncluttered space. Pleeenty of personalization settings you can choose from, or use it as-is, which is enough for my needs so far. Best, no ads! That alone encourages me to pay for premium. Developer seems attentive and enjoys the work - keep it up! Thanks! EDIT: meant to give it 5 ‚≠ê

The app is really good for what I need. I like how reminders are free and I can repeat them daily, weekly, on a custom schedule, among other choices. The UI is very good overall aside from me getting a bit tripped up initially trying to add a recurring item. I like how I can customize the colors of different lists as well as the background color. There's still a lot of preferences and settings to play with and tune but I like how customizable the app is. Definitely a lot of work put into it.

Daily to do lists keep us moving toward excellence, large accomplishments are reached through daily tasks. This app is very helpful in keeping my vision before me. It's user friendly, versatile and allows you to easily reorder and edit your list. I love checking off my finished tasks, it's wonderful to glance at what all I've gotten finished and be reminded of what to focus on next. Thanks developers!

Does everything I need a todo list to do without a lot of BS extra features. Organize tasks into lists and sublists, tasks can be recurring or one-time, due dates and times, it's easy to enter tasks and easy to mark them complete, I can delete completed tasks or just hide them so that I can look at them later, set task priorities and perhaps best of all, no subscription fee! I happily donated to support such a good and useful app and developer. This is the perfect todo list app for me!

The greatest thing about this task app is that it allows you to not only list the things you need to do, but also break down a task into smaller parts. I'm an occupational therapist and activiy analysis is a crucial skill in therapy. This app can be used with special needs children in the teaching process, with seniors to achieve more independents in daily function, students of any age when learning something new, all kinds of organising. This app is thorough! Well done! Wish it was available for fire tablets.

I use this app for EVERYTHING!! To do lists, meal planning, work tasks, you name it, I've got a list for it. The app is absolutely awesome! You can set tasks to recur at almost any frequency, add notifications, alarms, or just have a to-do list to check off. I can not recommend this app enough! It's a godsend if you have memory issues or executive disfunction. I've had this app for several years and never had one single issue. Download with confidence and start your lists! Bonus, no ads!

I love this app and would, and have, recommended it to people who forget chores or errands. I myself favor this in all other apps I've sampled. I want to note the simplicity in the UI which allows users to set very precise and/or complex instruction without needing a ten minute tutorial. My favorite part, is that all the essential features are absolutely free. Many similar apps, or even apps outside this genre, if you will, almost punish their free users by making the app useless without payment

Perfect for list-lovers! Super user friendly. For a single working mom, it really helps me to remember all the ideas or tasks that dawn on me at the most random times. I jot it down in my trusty Tasks app, set my reminder, and I'm set. Plus, it reminds me to celebrate seemingly mundane to-do's every time I mark an item completed. I am a fan!

I've been using this for a few days and it's pretty great! I wanted a simple lists app, that would let me move things easily from one list to another, edit task and list names, change the order of the tasks on the list. It does all those things really easily, plus its color-coding feature gives you lots of options. The little things that make boring stuff more beautiful. Also want to do some kind of time blocking. This isn't that (maybe premium? Cld put times in task names?), but nice app : )

9/12/19 morning: I use this app constantly and love it to pieces. It so nicely keeps me organized in all the different aspects of my life and in one central place. It's simple, easy to use, and very effective. The only thing i haven't figured out how to do yet is back it up. If my phone melts down, i lose my lists, or if I get a new phone. Probably this my ignorance just not knowing yet how to do the backup correctly. Thanks for an awesome app. 9/12/19 afternoon: Ok, so Steve, the creator of this app, responded immediately to my comments about backup and showed me exactly how best to do it. You simply take any list you want to back up and go to the "Share" icon at the top right hand corner of the list window. Click on Share and then send yourself an email of the list. It comes through perfectly, super simple and fast. Lots of lists don't need back up because they are just "To Do" lists of various kinds, but other Lists like "Things to Remember," "Information to Keep," "Travel Information," "Family Facts," etc. are really important to back up especially as time goes by and they build up in content. I am very happy with this solution. Thanks Steve!.

Been using this app for a year now, and have created something like 20 lists that contain sublists, reminders, to-do's, groceries, pretty much anything and everything, and I've been so pleased with the whole experience. In my opinion, this is the best task app for Android, and the developer tries to sort out issues and responds quickly to feedback. I Highly recommend this app.

So far it's been exceptionally helpful. Three things I'd love to see: the date a task was added (to track length of time for completion or to remember when it was added), the ability to include a picture and/or address (linkable to Google maps or Waze or whatever map system one uses), and selective multi-device sync for selective tasks or to do lists (sharable so several people can check off one list if needed).

This has been by far the best task app for me. It is very easy for me to stay organized with what I have going on in my life and to help me reach my new year's resolutions. There are only 2 set backs 1. No web version but not to worry as it looks like they are working on it now so yay for the future! 2. Unfortunately for repeating tasks the sub tasks do not uncheck themselves and you have to go through each time and uncheck them to recheck them. Even still this is a wonderful app!

I am extremely hopeful that this is the very last tasks app I will need to try. I have tried way too many, and I really love this one! I like that you can swipe to go to the next sublist. The only thing I would want added is to be able to have the choice of using check boxes, or not, with each list or sublist. I like to write stories, and sometimes just want to quickly jot down some ideas or a small paragraph. Really appreciate this app...thank you! :)

Task app that is everything I imagined it should be. Google's and Microsoft's to-do lists left much to be desired. The custom filter list option is what I have always wanted. The tasks I need to know about are always right on my phone home screen widget. You have done a great job Steve, thank you. You have earned my money because you deserve it and I enjoy the web app for adding tasks quickly while at work. Haven't encountered bugs so far!

I have been struggling to find an app that helps in setting goals for different aspects of my life (ie. school, work, exercise). I use this app to make long-term goals in one tab and smaller goals in another. Being able to make a special tab to see all of my small goals and when they are due keeps me organized. I want to say thank you to the developers! This app is efficient and fun to use!

Good for old person with failing memory. My calendar app was getting cluttered up with recurring reminders, the kind that aren't actually committed times. Also I had a todo list app which was simple and handy. This does both. Todos on separate list come up when I start the app. Options for recurring reminders and notifications are very complete. Excellent.

I'm a list maker, I have been for a long time. It's a skill I picked up to help with anxiety and ADHD. This app has been incredibly ergonomic and fun to figure out; and it's fit right into my life like a puzzle piece. I like well made productivity apps way better than paper journals & planners, because I always have my phone with me, but it can be so difficult for me to remember to take/remember where I put a planner or a pen. I've been loving this app, it's really kept me on track!

Just another one of the folks on here with really bad ADD, stopping around to say this app is great. Easy to use, lets you organize multiple lists, edit due dates, create sub tasks, and then get it to either text or set an alarm to remind you anytime before it's due. I'm so glad I can finally function like a normal person, even with horrible short term memory.

***UPDATE*** Yes, you can create recurring tasks. The developer was quick to respond and help. I installed this for the benefit of priorities. Tasks have a circle next to them that you click to complete. Priority (high, medium, low) changes the color of the circle outline and this isn't really seen. I would give 5 stars if priorities were a number (1, 2, 3) or letter (a, b, c) next to the task. Almost a perfect app

Very useful, with great features. I have grocery lists for the stores I use the most, sorted in order of the position of items in the store aisles. I can check and uncheck the items I want each week and highlight them or flag with different colors. When the stores move things around it is a simple drag and drop to adapt my lists. You can have many different lists and the format is easy too read. Love this, great app.

It is amazing because it doesn't restrict you to make just one type of list or task (example, I can list my to do list with a sub section for phone calls and another for errands and another section separate for my shopping list!). With that being said, it might take a few minutes to understand how to properly use it, but the time that goes into understanding only makes the experience that much better. Love love love it so far!üíü

The widget font size is too small even when the slider is set to max. It doesn't let you check off subtasks in the widget. If you have tasks set to repeat daily and you accidently check off a task, it will automatically increment the time after you uncheck it, forwarding the task to the next day. Edit: Updated rating because Android is the problem not them. However, I would still like for tasks to not increment until after the day has passed. Is this possible?

I have not fully explored the app because I have not needed all of the features. My only issue, thus far, is not being able to share the lists between my phone & tablet. However I did see where you are working on that feature & am super stoked for that update when it comes. I would like to be able to add photos to the different task & subtask sections. It's helpful to use pictures in certain tasks that you're pulling ideas from such as party decor|games or even organization ideas.

I've really been loving this app. I would have given it 5 stars if I was able to share my lists with my boyfriend so he could check the items off on his phone whenever I sent him to the store. It does let me share the lists with him and send it to him in a SMS message BUT it doesn't look like it does on the app and you can't check the items off like you can in the actual app. I heard that if we were paying for this app that it offers that feature. Not totally sure though. Regardless, great app!

Tasks is easy to use and understand; helping me stay organized and on track with what I need to get done. The alarms/notifications for deadlines set is delightful. The only thing(s) I would change is having the option of whether or not to use my stylus pen to write freehand and an option to change colors of the tasks on any given list I make. However, the app in general is wonderful/great/super-fantastic!

Honestly, great app, has many features that help with organizing your thoughtspace and ideas. Very appreciated as someone with semi-severe adhd. However... An incredibly helpful feature that would definitely be appreciated enough to bump up to a five star rating is: Being able to attach an alarm/reminder to look at a specific to-do list on a specific day, repeating weekly, monthly, daily, or just once on a specific day in the current month or week. Get that in and, should I remember, 5* rate4u

I really enjoy using this app to stay organized. The sub list and color options! Sharing a grocery list amongst a house hasn't been easier. Suggestions: different templates or formats to stay organized. For example, I use a hand drawn chore wheel categorized by days, weeks, and months. Circles within circles. Then each ring divided by activity. It would be nice to have this on my phone.

satisfied so far. want to look into how this works across devices (PC, phone, tablet). Update: I definitely like this app real well, but not well enough to pay for syncing across devices when I can do that elsewhere for free. I definitely like the interface. I don't need all of the functionality, so I can't speak to that. Easy to use for what I need it for. Four stars only for the syncing issue.

So far so good. Been using this app for a month now and it is so convenient and intuitive. Exactly what I needed BUT I will ask for one fix that is really important for reminders and alarms when traveling: Every alarm or reminder needs an option for what to do when you change time zones. Should the alarm go off based on the time zone when you made it (A business meeting) or same time regardless of location? (Take my meds) I dont want to miss a business call because of travel.

Very nice app. You can organize your reminders into lists and sublists. My only complaint is how the widget looks (it isn't transparent when tasks don't show, so it sort of hides your background photo - just a minor pet peeve of mine), but the overall functionality of the app is great. It also isn't (currently) loaded with ads to the point that every time you click on something, a new ad pops up.

So far, really good. Only, complaint I have, but it feels like a major oversight, is that there is no "View all" view. Sometimes (most of the time really) I just want to have all of my upcoming tasks laid out in a single view and not have to switch between lists and sub lists. Lists and sublists are great for organization, but I also want to get a complete picture of what I need to do today or this week.

I really like that I can change the color of each list. The widget is really awesome - I can change to a different list within the widget, without opening the app, and can checkoff tasks in the widget without opening the app. These things seem little but they are important - why have a widget if the app needs to open, might as well just open the app anyway. Interactive widgets - every app needs to have one! Anyway I'm still getting ti know this app but those are my two favorite features so far.

Great potential - just started using this but early opinion is that this app has tons of functionality available and super flexible. Like others, hoping for automatic backups in a future enhancement. Only challenge I've found so far is recurring tasks. Seems if you mark complete from the notification it completes the parent task rather than the instance. Pretty sure that'll bite me sometime soon. Otherwise it looks pretty promising!

I just started using Tasks to manage preparation for and recovery from heart surgery. I found it easy to use at a time when I couldn't afford a steep learning curve. If it synced with my Google tasks, I'd give it 5 stars. Addendum to review: I've been using the app for about 6 months, both for recurring tasks and one time tasks. Is there a plugin capability? I would be interested in writing a plugin that collects and stores info (JSON) when a task is marked as completed.

would be nice if the app would open on a home screen of all active lists instead of opening in the last open list with a drop down, but other than that it is highly functional. Easy to set tasks and reminders and update them on the move, i love the ability to adjust settings of how completed tasks are handled (hide, keep in place, move to bottom)

Really easy to use, very nice to have the 'list of lists' in the menu, and sub lists under the lists. Works with the way I think. I can swipe to move the screen to the next sub list, but it's a little too easy to accidentally swipe and delete a task instead...maybe I'll figure out a better technique to do this, since I just started swiping between lists.

Stephen, I've got to remove a star. I've been hoping you will address the issue that recurring tasks, once marked completed, don't go onto the next iteration- instead, they stay marked as completed and don't repeat as needed. I'm missing out on reminders for my daughter's medication if I don't remember to go uncheck the box after marking as complete. I know you are working hard & I want to support you, but I may have to go back to using Samsung reminders (ugh) since they don't have this issue.

As someone with ADHD and a high-pressure job, this app is honestly SO worth it. It's eliminated the need for my paper planners and is FAR superior to Google Keep. I have two main complaints right now: - The desktop app that syncs with the phone app is buggy and missing quite a few features. It is still in beta, so, the issues are largely forgivable. - The repeating tasks feature is incredible... but it does not appear to work for tasks that repeat more than once/day (e.g. every 8 hours).

Reply to Developer: I'll just say, thanks for all you do!! I think my biggest complaint, and it's a very small one, is that the sublists feature is slightly confusing. I don't love that it creates a list that is adjacent to the original list and not beneath/inside of it. Maybe I just don't get how it should be used. I would also love multiple tiers for subtasks instead of just one. That's all I have for now. Thank you for the excellent (AD-FREE!) app!

It is an awesome app for organizing your schedule! It is similar to Google Drive but with reminders and check. The only advice I will give is that I hope it can have unlimited small sub lists in sub lists rather than only 3 layers, especially when the events can be divided into very small categories. It will be even better if it is like organizing documents.

The only reason I can't give this app 5 stars is because you have to go to the menu screen to choose the task list you're working from. I think if it had a home page with icons or even a home page with a list of the different task lists that you can choose between upon opening it would make life easier. I have one task list for packing for a trip, one for camping, one for long term projects, and one for weekend projects.

QUITE nice, but maybe not quite as intuitive as it could be. Granted, I'm 75--and slower than I used to be. LOL But I also worked at Stanford University and Microsoft (doing database management, editing, and proofreading). But once you "get there," it's quite a nice program. (The option of setting 120 different background colors, though, seems silly--and almost trivial. I mean, WHAT. IS. THE. POINT?!? LOL) Anyway, 4 stars from me. I'm sure it will be even more useful for me over time.

Very good app. I'd like it more if I could reposition subtasks up and down within a list's tasks. Also, it would be more helpful if tasks had start and end dates rather than only due date. Finally, it would be useful to be able to cancel tasks instead of just complete them or delete them. A deleted task is as if it never happened. A completed task looks done, even though it was actually canceled.

This is organized and easy to use. You can make the lists as detailed or simple as you want. Unfortunately, it's not very visually pleasing. There are no options for font style or color. You can choose one color per list, but it only borders on the top and left side which looks a bit awkward. If you are looking to make dry, plain lists this would be quite good.

I have tried so many task tracking apps because all of them seem to be missing some critical feature, and this one is about as perfect as it gets! Love the lists and sublists, subtasks, notes, and flexible reminder repeat options (seriously, so many apps make this a paid subscription option). The only problem I have with it is the kind of odd way that it handles completing repeating tasks, and I'm hoping this is something that can be slightly altered to make this app perfect! There's two main problems: 1 - When you mark the task as complete, it stays marked as complete until the next time it goes off. You can "un-complete" it and it will appear as a pending task with the next time that it will go off, but this tends to have weird results sometimes. There is an option to "track history of repeating tasks," which duplicates the task when it's marked completed so there's a copy that will repeat and a copy that will go into the task history, but the duplicated task is also marked complete--leading to the same problem as mentioned above. 2 - You can tell the app to either set a completed task to repeat the specified amount of time from when it was completed (option A), or from when it went off (option B). (e.g., if my task that repeats once a week was due at 12pm Friday, but I don't mark it complete until 11am Saturday, Option A will have it repeat the next Saturday, and Option B will have it repeat the next Friday.) It's nice to have this option, but it would be way better if we could set it on a task-by-task basis. For me personally, I have a medication I take every two weeks; sometimes I take it late, and ideally, I should take it again exactly two weeks from then, so I would prefer option A for this one. However, I also have a reminder to back up my PC every Sunday; if I complete this late, I would still prefer option B and be reminded on Sunday every time, because that's when I generally have time to do it. I can only pick one style or the other, so I have it set to option B and just manually alter the ones that need it. It works, but it would be nice to have the option to automate it! Thanks for a great app and sorry for the super long explanation!

I've downloaded plenty of tasks apps but found I didn't really use them consistently and abandoned them after a while. I've been using this one consistently. It looks complicated like a lot of others, but it's really not and you can begin to use it w/o tutorials although they are actually available on YouTube. So far no ads. One caveat, the premium is recurring and I already have too many really expensive ones. I would pay for a one time purchase. Give this one a go!

THE BEST To-Do List app I've found. I have memory issues, so this app is a life saver. It's got great functions, BUT there's one function that doesn't work. Recurring tasks can use hour based increments. This is the only app I've found that does this. However, since the app only checks to update recurring tasks once a day...this doesn't work. If possible, could you add an option for users to adjust how often the app updates recurring tasks? It would help me so much. Thanks! (Samsung Galaxy S7)

Extremely helpful app!! Helps me be very organized. I used to make paper lists, but I would lose them. This allows me to keep my to do lists in one place and is very easy to add tasks. I would like to see a feature where you can populate it daily/weekly/monthly . (ex. Morning routine daily, Vacuum weekly, mail out the electric bill monthly)

Previously I used a note app for reminders. This is so much better. It keeps me focused on what I need to do. I like that notes can be added to each task and that they are visible on the task list and you don't have to open the that particular task to view them. I like the ease of adding new tasks and that they can be named. Bright color choices are nice for each task. I only have one wish and that is that we could swipe sideways to see the other task lists so I could see other days quickly.

Useful, love the levels of task breakdown and category color separation. I wish there was a way to understand better what it is indicating needs attention when it places a number on the outside of the app icon. As well, navigating from one agenda item to another another. Otherwise, a good app with lots of options to help organize my life, business or personal.

Very confusing. I just need to easily set up a reminder, not to have to make a list for everything. I also need accessibility features, such as text to speech. I set this for the reminder sound to go off, instead it just vibrated. Not quite sure how I like this setup. I use text to speech to make entities, I need it to read my reminders to me when they remind me. eta: Thank you Stephen, I've changed my rating due to your wonderful attention and considerateness to your customers. I'm disabled and these changes one day will be helpful. I will keep checking and still try to use it and  will also recommend it to friends more tech savvy than myself. Blessings.

Want to give 5 stars but wanna test drive some more. I accidentally erased a couple of items by sliding to the right. It's efficient when u want to delete. Maybe a warning before executing? So far, it's the best I've used, and I have tried a bunch. Keep up the excellent work! *Update:* U can turn that feature off in Settings so forget about a warning!

Just started using since my last app was amazing but is now dead. I don't like that when I complete a repetitive task from a filtered list that the screen switches to the sub list. I want the view to stay where it is. I love the colors in this app. I have seen some squirrelly behavior when hiding completed tasks on a filtered list and having tasks with subtasks disappear even when not completed. I turned on hide completed tasks, but shouldn't that be the same?

I like it so far. Found this since Wunderlist is ending and I refuse to use the one they recommend. This seems to do everything Wunderlist did. I like the color options for lists and I've been happily surprised with this app. The only downfall is they don't offer list sharing and it looks like they're going to charge for that in the future. If they make that free, it will 5 stars all the way.

I absolutely love this program. I have the widget on the home screen and every time I push the home button it brings me to the task list so I can see what needs to be done. I just wish the premium version wasn't so expensive, they should have an option to have a one time fee which give you access to Premium features. I do have an issue with reminders though, I think it's a bug. If I set a reminder and choose all day option, it does not give me the option to repeat the reminder

Love the app. Having all lists and tasks in one app is great. No more need for seperate apps. Have one issue - when using or creating a grocery list I would like to see department categories such as meat, produce, etc., as well as alphabetically so when shopping you could sort by department. Makes it much easier to grocery shop when you have icons and departments to look at rather than drag and drop.

When you hit the back tab instead of going to the main list, it exits the app completely. Learning the specific why to return to main list is a little bit of a learning curve. Also, wish I could share a to do list with other app user that lets me know when task was completed. This would make the app better to a family with a crazy schedule.

I use this app several times a day. I'm retired, but I still have lots of different responsibilities. I have a grocery list, and as I buy each item, I hide the item. Then when I'm ready to go shopping again, I can bring the item up to the list again. And I'm constantly changing my priorities with ease. I Make use of the background colors for each chore. Morning shores is the lightest orange. Outdoor chores are green. Driving to errands are purple. That way, it's easy to regroup them.

I have tried a lot of task management apps, but this one outperforms them all. The user interface is so logical, uncluttered, and visually pleasing. With the ability to create unlimited lists and sublists and populate them with simple items or detailed tasks that you can categorize with custom tags, it does a lot. It has many versatile settings, task filtering, and sorting capabilities. It has a nifty widget as well. There are step-by-step YouTube videos, and the developer is very responsive.

I perused several of the internet's top rated to do apps, but found this one by accident (I hadn't seen it on any lists) and immediately loved using it! Super customizable in every way, let's you make subtasks and sublists and include as much information as you like. I think it might be the perfect to do list app! What a gem to find! If you like the dopamine rush of checking things off and you have more things to do than you can keep track of, Tasks is for you!

Unbelievably powerful. Very useful for anyone with organizational challenges or distractability issues such as ADD, ADHD, etc. The app is highly customizable. There are truly useful integrations with phone's calendar, notifications, and messaging. The ability to share lists is a feature I've frequently used. When I consider the benefits and how often I use it, the subscription costs have been well worth it to me.

Great app! Does just what I need: keeps track of things I need to do. What makes it even better is if I put grocery store as a task, I can do subtasks that are my shopping list and check things off as I go then check the whole task of Grocery Store off my list, so easy. Love the color changes for each task, urgent in red, less urgent in yellow. Makes those really important tasks easy to spot. Also, I can move them around on the list in order of importance or order I will do them in. So handy!

I've looked everywhere for an app I can use to write my schedules on and have an interactive check list widget that ACTUALLY marks them off without taking you into the app--this is the one. It is a little confusing to explore compared to other apps, but the creator made easy-to-understand videos on YouTube to explain it and I got it after the third tutorial. My only wish is that they add a full notepad section on the app as well. 5 stars anyways üòÑ
Really helpful app, it's really useful to have it on my home screen as I remember to check it.

The easiest and best list making app, I've found. It is so easy to use, edit, and customize. I use it for groceries, to-do lists, gift lists, entertaining, holiday menus, projects, etc. Check items off, move, or delete. You can also create subcategories. Developer is very responsive to questions.

Great App for staying organized at work. I downloaded this app to keep my work Tasks separate from the calendar on my phone, and so far it has been really helpful. The app is pleasing to the eye with customizable colors, and with just a click, I can see what is on the docket for the day ahead. Items can be easily reordered by tapping the drag handle on the right hand side of the task. Steve, the developer, is also very responsive and helpful!

After testing many to-do list apps, my search is over. Tasks is the best by far! The free version has many wonderful aspects, and I found that upgrading to premium provides even better features to assist in keeping track of a busy lifestyle. With reminders, sub-lists, highlighting, priority flags, and the ability to add notes and file attachments to your tasks, you will easily be organized! Thanks for this great app and for the lifetime subscription option (no monthly fee - love ‚ù§Ô∏è this)!

I really this app. Very sensible and open to various list styles and it doesn't lock a bunch of critical functionality behind ads or premium mode. If I could make a recommendation for something that could improve, I'd personally really enjoy if after you completed a full list you got a little celebration? Like some confetti and a cheer maybe? Just a thought, it could make it easier to remember to finish a list if it came with a little bit of positive reinforcement at the end.

I switched from Microsoft To Do to Tasks and it has been a great step up in features. I would love to see the addition of being able to schedule tasks on the nth day of the month. For example, adding tasks to the first Tuesday or last Friday of a month. Also needing to set a time for an all day event to be recurring is a workflow that is odd.

I had an issue with my phone not syncing to Tasks correctly after a reset, and I reached out to the dev. The response was prompt, polite, and also helpful - for me to not only realize that the problem wasn't with the app itself (but ended up helping me identify the cause of the issue that I reset it for, which was happening to other apps and previously unknown.) The cause was unrelated to this app, but because the dev responded accurately, and detailed, I was able to figure that out.

I was using Microsoft ToDo. It started sending out notifications a few minutes after they were due, so I looked for an option. This app has a way better interface and is much prettier. Beyond that, I emailed Microsoft about the issue a couple of weeks ago as of this review. I have not heard back. This developer responded to questions I had within hours. Having a responsive developer is extremely important to me. I highly recommend you try this. Update - The more I use this, the more I love it.

I had used To Do app from Microsoft, which I like how it integrates with Outlook, but several months ago it began causing my phone to freeze. Took me awhile to figure out the cause, and when I did I deleted To Do. This app is better in many ways, so I'm glad I changed. And so far no problems with freezing the phone. After giving it a try for a couple of months, I'll probably upgrade to premium, not because I need more features but to support its continued success üòä

I actually love this app! Just a few tweaks here and there would make it perfect. Cause I tried other apps before this one and this is the one that's done most of what I need it to. I like how u can customize each list with ur color of preference. I like how there is a breakdown to each list and the widget is wow! To improve, I suggest: 1) a tutorial to teach 2) a highlighted notification on the notification bar 3) attachments for tasks 4) automatic deletion of sublists once tasks are completed.

The app would be perfect if it had space for note writting. Can't find reliable apps that have both :( Response: Yes, I've seen notes available within each task but I meant something more like a notepad of some sorts, to save notes separately.
Easy to use, love crossing tasks out as I've done them

I've had this app for awhile and I like the way it looks and works etc though I have realized with reminders I have set for everyday they eventually stop giving me a reminder and that can frustrating. Otherwise it's done a good job and I like the options for notifications (alarm, vibrate, notification etc) I'd recommend it but not for everyday notifications

Compared to the competition this is a very good todo app. It does the basics the best. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it does not seem to have a way to sync with a desktop or web application.   One thing that doesn't work well in my day to day life, in any to-do app, is more customizable sorting. Either it's too manual, making the todo app more of an interruption, or the sorting doesn't predict my priorities well. The simplest solution would be to combine basic sorting (priority, due date, category, etc) with manual sorting somehow. One way would be to have items initially sorted by your selected method. Then allow the user to manually sort any item. When a new item is placed in a list  the new item would be placed in order according to the those items that have not been manually sorted. If all items in the list have already been manually sorted then there are two approaches I can think of. Either have new items automatically be placed at the top or bottom in those cases, or even better the app could have hidden values for this. e.g. an item due 2/16 that's manually moved ahead of an item due 2/12 would be considered having a "due date" of 2/11 for sorting.

It needs more options. I have ADHD. I get distracted a lot and tend to jump from one task to the next,p while working on a task, leaving things half done. This app is helpful to keep me focused on each task until completed. Since these tasks repeat each day/week/month, it would be helpful to allow me to copy it to the next day/week/month when it's due. Otherwise it's worked out great at helping me work through my tasks. Thank you.

Clean layout and does what it says without egregious permissions. Two thumbs. Unfortunately I can't find information about the app's functions even within the help menu: - Recurring tasks do not appear to reset if they are not complete. I can't figure out how to make them reset even if they are incomplete. - I can't make my recurring items show up on the calendar. - I can't manually set the reset time since my tasks might be completed between 8pm and 3 am. - View previous recurring tasks.

It's the best replacement for Wunderlist I've managed to find that isn't trying to map out my entire life. I had a bit of user-error when using the widget, but once I figured that out I updated my review from 3 to 4 stars. The widget does look a little pixelated, but that may be my phone's fault. Once list sharing is possible this will be my main list-making app! Keep up the good work, and thank you for making such a simple yet pretty app! =)

Almost perfect, the only thing I wish was different is I wish all my lists were available on a main screen & that they were clickable from there. I don't like that it stays on one list instead of a homescreen instead where all lists available at a quick glance instead of having to go & open the tab to see the lists. I'd use it a lot more that way.
Helpful app

I've been using this app for about a year.  This makes it the only to-do list type app I've used for more than a month.  It's easy to create lists and sub-lists.  The only things I wish it had are a help feature and a way to move the app, and its data,  from my tablet to my phone.  (My tablet does NOT have cell capability.)  I need the help because many reviewers mention features I'm unaware of.  I want to move the app, and it's data, to my phone as I carry the phone with me more than the tablet.

I've been using this app for a while now, and elected enough to pay for a year, but it took a while to figure it out. There are a lot of options, and not all of them are immediately obvious. Mostly, the confusion for me is hell to handle the recurring tasks and not have it marked as done permanently rather than just for one occurrence. I've got it all working now (I think), but it could have been easier and spelled out better in the help and documentation.

My wife has gotten good use out of this app and really appreciates all the features that have gone into it. The only issue that has cropped up is a bug that forcibly opens the Google Play Store app whenever she tries to edit a task, blocking her from editing it. She's using an old phone, so maybe the app is just glitchy with the older version of Android, but that phone isn't on the network, so she's been thinking of switching to using a newer phone. Which, unfortunately, will be tedious.

Still in the testing phase, but it's the best app I've tried so far, and it's really usable. I think the sublist feature will turn out to be really useful in the end by allowing me to break down tasks into subtasks and something like a grocery list into subitems for a particular dish.

I'm an ADHD check-off-girl. I love checking things off on my lists of things to do - it's positive evidence of my productivity and it makes me feel like I'm making progress. Tasks does this for me. It's simple, only essential bells and whistles like calendars, and reminder alarms. It's also straightforward, easy to understand, and intuitive in it's use. I'd add a few more check off features, but it works great for me as is.
Love it. Super simple
So far, so good. I can complete tasks easily without the need of scrap paper.

So far, I am enjoying and making good use of this app. I wish that it could sync to my Google Tasks, and I'd like to be able to sort a little more granularly, such as by due date, then by priority. Aside from those two things, the app is well designed and logical with lots of customizeable features.

The calendar is really cute. It is very aesthetically pleasing. I like that you can add stickers and link Google Calendar. There is a section to add Monthly, Weekly, and Daily Goals. As well as customized sections on the Daily view.
Very easy to use and a quick reference
Great app

Love this planner! I can set events to repeat, or to roll over to the next day, move events with my touch screen, and make as many lists as I like! AA allows me to schedule items on my lists, and I can color code and use/resize digital stickers to my heart's content! Better than paper (no more re-writing the things I didn't complete: just move them digitally or automatically to another day!), allows me to choose a font - always better than my own handwriting! Try free fully-functional trial!!

I do still need my bullet journal for stuff like my budget and what not but everthing else crossed over and its so nice to have everthing right there rather then having to go searching for the right notebook. Love love love this app/site. I have been looking for YEARS for a digital calendar that also feels like a paper planner because I've realized that I just don't like carrying around a physical planner and I need the search feature of Google Calendar to look back on past tasks and events. And this calendar DOES IT ALL! The sticker feature is just the icing on the cake! So so so happy with my calendar. Well worth the cost!

I absolutely LOVE this app! I always attempted to be a paper planner person because I love the creativity of it, but after a few weeks, I would either lose my planner or just stop using it. With AA, I am able to have it on all my devices and have it with me at all times without carrying around anything extra! I have started recommending it to everyone I know. And the price is great, I was paying that much for a paper planner anyway!

I have been using paper planners for 40 years and I can't live without them. I have looked high and low for a digital paper planner and until Artful Agenda, there has not been one I have liked. I have purchased a few but I have to use another platform like "Onenote" and they have NOT been user-friendly which makes me use it less and I always go back to paper.üòû This is the best app for a paper-like planner. Syncs with all my calendars. Beautiful design and ability to add my own personality with colors, covers and stickers. I would love more stickers or the ability to add them. To get to the review, Artful Agenda has basically successfully fixed all of my problems! It is easy to learn, fun to use, and very helpful!

The fact that the two are synced has saved me from double booking myself on many occasions because I have the worst memory. I finally feel like a functional adult (in my early 30s no less!).

So happy! I used to get the physical planners and stickers. It has all the creative and organized functions I've wanted and less than what I was spending!

Love this virtual planner! Normally every year i would buy a paperback planner and would fall off after a few months because its just not practical to carry a paperback planner everywhere you go. I love artful Agenda! As someone who is Type-A I have calendars, schedules, routines, and lists for everything and AA provides me the ability to keep it all in one place. Can one be changed to a notes section? Thank you for the response!!! I went in followed your recommendation. It was easy & now I can add notes. Thanks!!

This app is incredible! I am a HUGE calendar/organizational individual and this app is top notch! The features, design, and functionality is A+!! You've thought of almost everything. I do have a small wishlist for future features, but they will only enhance this product: -Full screen mode on website -Simple quick view for calender events instead opening to edit mode -Ability to use stickers in lists -Budget page option Thank you for this!

I love this digital planner. I usually prefer paper. But it's not convenient because I don't always have it with me. And I don't like the boring display of Google calendars. I love the fun customization you can have with this. The fun cover patterns and the stickers. I've been using this app for about 3 years and LOVE it!

Edit: Support has remedied the situation already. While the app was not a fit for my needs, customer support is excellent. I signed up for a 7 day free trial today and was immediately charged full price. I canceled it immediately after. Hoping i receive a refund as I was supposed to have the option of canceling if the app did not meet my expectations, and it did not.

My FAVORITE thing is setting up recurring tasks and having tasks roll over automatically if they aren't completed! It even has stickers!

LOVE THIS!! It's cross platform so I can access it from my computer or phone! It has beautiful fonts, stickers & covers to choose from. The VERY BEST feature for me is that I can create notes in each section for monthly/weekly/daily. If I know something's coming up on a certain day, I can just go create a note under that future day to remind myself even if it's 6+ months away! I used to have to rely on tons of alarms all the time (adhd problems lol) but now I use this daily to keep me on track.

Having a visually pleasing format that integrates with Google & behaves like a paper planner but available digitally is exactly what I needed to keep me organized. Being available as an app on my phone & tablet and accessible via the web (always synced), I never have an excuse of not having my planner handy. I like the ease of switching up the cover, colors & font themes to suit the month or season. I love the habit tracker & being able to upload my own stickers. Can we upload covers soon? üíúA|A

I love this app for the most part; however find the most functionality in the desktop/browser experience. In the phone app weekly view, I have a hard time finding my priority tasks. All in all, I've been much better organized with AA than any other planning app/calendar!

Everything is beautiful. I wanted to commit to the yearly payment of $34. But, it doesn't work fully offline. That's the only reason its a 4 star review. I don't like to be connected to WiFi if I can help it. But, if you are constantly connected, this app would very much be worth the price you payüíå

I love the to rolling to do list feature, I hate rewiting my list, but also don't like a messy list. This feature is what sold me on getting the Calendar! I wish the sticker features had more holiday options and were easier to use for mobile.

I have only been using the app for a day and already I'm in love. There are 3 things I wish were different or could do... 1. To make the daily and/or weekly view of the planner a widget 2. In the priority tasks to be able to set a time reminder... like 9am I'm reminded to do x. Regardless I still super excited to keep trying out my 2 weeks free and keep going.

I never thought I would use a digital planner, much less love one. AA is the best planner I've ever used. It's easy to learn, great access on all my devices, no extra or hidden fees. AA a great organization system. Quick and easy access to calendars, notes, and connects with all my online calendars. It's a game changer for this busy employee/teacher/student!

I tried to manage paper planners for years. I fell in love with Artful Agenda and will never be without it. I can color code events per family member, add stickers for special events, and even make To-Do lists, grocery lists, or track my water intake. Love it.

I'm relatively new to the digital world of planning. I was tired of carrying around a big book and having pages I would never use but still had to pay for. Wish I had found this sooner! I have always been a die hard paper planner person. But it was awkward to drag around and so often, I didn't have it in front of me when I needed to. I love the water tracker! Syncing all of my digital calendars in one place is so helpful. I have Artful Agenda open full-screen in a second desktop on my Mac and it's a revelation.
