It's really helpful if you can't organize yourself to complete with your study time
Helps you focus
Love the app, great for revision and concentration. It's a shame that it doesn't kill the plant if I go onto other apps though.
Amazing app for focusing on studies or any time work

i've been using it for a few weeks now and enjoy it (using the free version). i would give it five stars but as someone who gets frustrated when rewards get harder to achieve, im a tad annoyed by the trees costing more in coin value every time i unlock one. i use this to help me track how long homework is taking me per day and i like getting new trees, just wish they were always 500 coins bc it keeps it a more tangible goal whereas 700 coins is sssooo far away. have been debating going premium...

Definitely helps me study. I've bought premium and I've enjoyed the app a lot. The only criticism I have is that when you're growing a tree stopping the timer early kills it. Often times ill set a timer and then finish early, but I've still got 20 minutes where my phone is completely useless. Yes, I could pay the 60 coins to remove the withered trees, but that makes my past hour of studying completely useless. You should be able to stop early and keep whatever trees you have managed to grow.

It's really useful as I can use any tree and keeps me motivated to do my tasks. It's really peaceful app for people that just need to get off their phones. Not to mention that choice is yours on what to do. So I am grateful for that On there other hand, most of the extra stuff is behind a pay wall. As well as most trees, audios, and such as other stuff. Not to mention, it's only two hours and I wish it had more than that. But other than that, it is a good app for a timer and rest.

I have premium version. Great app, however have a few minor issues.  1) Since the last version watching ads to double coins is not working. Ad just does not show up. 2) The Planting Reminder does not work at all. I have never received any notification. I have given all the permissions required, and also verified that notifications are not suppressed.  3) As a developer to developer, loading trees in Store is just too slow. Don't expect a simple GET to be that slow. :)

I really like this app, and I love that I can give the focus points I earn to grow real trees! But in order to unlock new virtual trees, you also have to spend focus points? That sucks. Maybe create two kinds of earnable currency??? Because it makes it feel wrong to spend your points on new trees, and that's a really fun and original aspect of the app. Please give multiple currencies!!!

I really enjoy using this app. It's a great way to remind myself not to play on my phone when I should be working on other things. My only complaint is that there isn't a free account available for syncing your forest to the cloud it using it across multiple devices. I wish they could make it free to connect to Facebook, or something of that nature, so trees won't be lost if a phone needs resetting or replacing.

I write this after the first use and yes! I will be using this for studying, cleaning and what ever else I need to focus on. I love the art and simplicity of this app. The unlock of different trees makes this into a little game as a side bonus. If I try to roam into different apps on my phone it will tell me to get back to business. *they took away the unlock trees* Paying for the nice looking trees is something I won't do. Not happening but the app still works well and does as stated above.

Overall, I have loved to use this whenever I'm unconsciously procrastinating. It gives you stats on how many trees you've grown, how many you've killed, and how many minutes you've focused in days, weeks, months, and years. My only issue is recently a glitch has surfaced. It says I can not play the ad to double my coins, which really sucks because I want cuter trees.

This app is a great help keeping me on task at work or on projects. I recommend that anyone with focus issues give it a try. Only issue I've encountered so far is that on occasion it will let you pull up the internet without giving you a warning or killing your tree. But this seems to be rare and never happens if you have recently pulled up the app itself to see how much time you have left.

Works great! Keeping the tree alive is an excellent way too keep me focused! If I could ask for just one thing: add musical white noise options to the store (for instance, like the Tide timer app's Muse and Air sounds). Those can get me to focus better than ocean waves and whatnot. If you could add that, I'll definitely bump my rating up to 5 stars!

The overview window definitely needs to be polished. It can be hard to understand at times. There have been times where I plant one tree on a certain day but two will show up (no I'm not in week or month view the trees have identical stats). The app is pretty nice overall and it helps me stay on track. I just think it needs to be polished and overhauled a tiny bit

I used it and it was awesome, one thing that I would like to see eventually is the ability to use some pro options after you have used the app for a while (say 100 non-withered trees) or have enough points because I currently have no way to purchase pro to text during. I just would like to see some limited version of pro you can unlock after a while of use.

Do you wish you were more productive with your down time? I have the Pro version so I can plant trees, unlock achievements, and track how I use my free time. I love the ability to "whitelist" apps like music so I can jam while I do my chores or drive places. I have my tags listed with things I want to do more of like dance moves, doing a workout, or spending a reasonable time gaming before I do something else. Plus it helps me focus on the stuff I don't wanna do like paperwork but with plants!

Simple, cool app. Nice visualization for staying on task for long projects. It's weird that the friends feature is only for premium users. I feel like giving that option to free users would encourage much more people to start using the app, considering how friends get people invested in competitions like this, but aside from that it's worth the download at least. That missing feature is the only immediate reason for giving 4 instead of 5 stars

Update: Could we please have the option to keep snow effects after the holidays? It looks so pretty. Nice gamification. Lately, the sound effects continue after closing the app, so I uninstalled and reinstalled. Now I lost all my unlocked trees which is a bummer. This is the second time I've lost everything.

It really helps! This simple app helps me keep on track. 4 stars because you can't change the amount of time for each tree. ETA: I've found a workaround. You can select "Counting exceeded time" in Settings. That way the time recorded is the actual time you stay focused, not the default 25 minutes.

this is a really good app that I definitely recommend, especially the pro version. it gives so many more options and it's a one time payment of like 3 dollars. the only issue I have is that there isn't a type of pause or break button. this would be helpful since things can happen and u might need to stop, but besides that it's a very good app!

Great, but one big flaw. I love this app and its great for productivity, but I work off my tablet with a keyboard, meaning I put it in landscape mode. Unfortunately, this app is only in upright mode, so any time I have to set a timer or adjust my settings/tree selection, it defaults into that mode and I have to either turn my head or adjust my whole tablet. Please, if it's at all possible, I would LOVE to have this work in landscape mode and change my review to 5/5.

I have a major issue in concentrating. I get distracted easily and am often times completely unmotivated. With this, I have to say that this app is oddly helpful. It's rewarding to see the trees pop up so I guess it works, at least for me. Not being able to use the phone or else the tree dies is absolutely brilliant. I can sit on my phone all day but this makes me put it down and try to focus.

I like how simple this game is! It's easy to use, the graphics are cute and I'm prevented from using my phone whenever I grow a tree. I would prefer, however, if there were more variety in the plants since you get used to all of them after a while. Also, a lot of the other features like the achievements and such are limited for f2p players so that was a little disappointing. But other than that, it serves its purpose well!

I love this app so much! It helps me stay focused and on task while I'm in class and at home studying. I recommend this for any student struggling to put down the phone and focus on school! The reward system is amazing and I can wait to unlock more plants as i progress. As a nature lover, I live for the idea of helping out the REAL life environment aswell, which is an amazing feature of this app. The only down side is that it sometimes crashes, which is frustrating but I can get past that.

Update: They fixed the issue and I was finally able to login again. My history of trees planted is still there and all looks good. The app has always been great to use, I just have fingers crossed the good quality stays!! Previous: I haven't been able to the use the app (the pro version I paid for) for weeks bc there is no way to login with an error. I don't even care about the tree change. I cannot login!! This is honestly ridiculous and borderline a scam.

This is a good app and I've been using it without problem for a couple of months. However, like it's been stated in recent reviews, since the last update, the trees are not dying when you use other apps and no notification appears to remind you that the trees are still growing. The problem seems to be with the Whitelist feature. When I turn Whitelist off, the app works perfectly, but with Whitelist on, I can access apps that are not on the Whitelist. Hope the team fixes this. Thanks.

Awesome app! Helps keep me focused, the friends feature keeps me accountable, and it let's you track your time to really measure your productivity. Only flaw is that we can't use phone and computer at the same time without duplicating results. I get distracted by both computer and phone apps. I also think we should be able to see the trends of our sessions on the PC. The tree store should also be accessible on PC. Otherwise, highly recommend.

Hey. Just got the premium version of this app because I really liked the concept. It seems to still be in its earlyish stages at the moment so I was just going to do a running review: Very unique concept, very cute and simple graphics. It makes me super motivated to get focused, which is exactly what I need at the moment ____ The app isn't super user friendly right now, but I have an extensive background in tech, so I'm able to use the app pretty efficiently. Only have noticed a very very few bugs right now. But again, these are my initial thoughts after a couple minutes of use. It's not impossible to use. Probably just requires a basic understanding of how to operate apps. I think there's a tutorial in the settings

This is a great and effective app for focusing, I use it for breaking my habit of using my phone at night and while studying. The only things I'd like to add are that it is difficult to get enough coins to purchase new plants (which isn't really a big deal) and that the rewarded ads never work. The ads are always delayed and frozen so I never choose to watch them. I would also suggest adding a pomodoro timer to the app. Overall an excellent tool for focusing! Definitely reccomend.

Love using it to track how much time I have been working and visually see how I am spreading my projects out over time. Two issues drive me nuts, though. The ability to listen to sounds needs fixing. I like to put on the background sound while working but constantly shuts off, meaning I waste time going back to the app to restart the sound. The Google Chrome add on won't sync either.

The idea of Forest is great, but there is one major flaw. Even though I fully turned on the setting that would allow the app to stop me from using other apps, it didn't work. I was tempted to scroll social media and play games instead of focus, and the app let me do that. Despite me not focusing, my tree grew fine and the data at the end of the timer showed nothing. I really hope this gets fixed because it would work great for me without the mistake.

The idea is great. I've used it many times to stay focused and stay on task. I enjoy the fact that you can write lil bios of on your trees. However, the app would be tremendously more useful if I were able to restrict certain apps for a period of time rather than not using my phone at all. I still want to use certain apps, like music and reading apps, rather than not having access to my phone at all.

I love this app so much, it helps me stay focused and is cute and visually appealing. I had one problem. The trees that you grow change their looks the longer u can stay focused. But it's like it requires u to stay focused the whole 120 minutes before u can grow your tree to it's full capacity. Considering this is listed as a pomodoro app I'd have thought that you can add breaks every 25 minutes. It's really sad and dettering. I wish it had breaks u can adjust it to.

Very good app for focus, has helped me on more than one occasion. I will say though, the audio it plays, if you choose to play it, sometimes glitches out on my Galaxy S9. It will sometimes just shut off and refuse to play even when my volume is on and the sound option is on. Otherwise though, its a very good focus app, great for people like me who get easily distracted by their phones.

Absolutely love the app. The graphics are marvelous. However, the only tweak that should be made in my opinion is for the timer to be atleast 3 hours longer.I understand people could take advantage of that, because some could do it while sleeping. But with the pandemic, 5 hours would be nice maybe 7 for people doing school. The phone for me has been extremely distracting for me . This app helps me heavily but when the timer is only 2 hours MAX. I inevitably take advantage of this. Distractionüò©

Perfect when paired with the right water bottle -- Dont JUST use the app, actually buy a water bottle to keep nearby you so you have a visual reminder (and no excuse not to drink). The app by itself is great but definitely needs more reminder settings and general motivation for the free users, or give ways to purchase individual parts of it all; i.e. a single personality for example. It is a shame that the best parts of the motivation side feel locked behind the paywall, and $9 a month adds up

I love this app! It's so fun to plant a forest and now all I want to do is work and study to make my forest denser! The only things I would change is that there is no pause button and sometimes I'll be 30 minutes into an hour session and I'll have something unavoidable come up but if I stop the timer, my tree will wither. I also can't figure out how to turn off the ambience without restarting my phoneüòÖ otherwise a fantastic app!!!

I have the pro version and it's a great little app, but I wish there was a blacklist feature instead of just a whitelist feature. I regularly find myself needing certain apps for work that I didn't realize and I have to wait for the time to run out. If there was a blacklist feature though, I could just ban only the apps I procrastinate the most with.

The only negative feedback is the sound to select each thing is annoyingly loud and I wish you could silence it, I mean pressing the plant, and ending the plant timer really makes me jump and I have to take out my headphones to not have it hurt, and even then I can hear it through my headphones that are beside me. Other than the silencing issue, it's wonderful

I love this app so much, I've had it for almost a week and I've only found one bad thing about it. It's absolutely adorable and it's helped me stay off my phone and make it fun to do so. Overall it's super fun :) Edit September 2020: there was a new update limiting the trees you can purchase using coins without paying for premium, there are only a handful of trees available to buy at this and it just doesn't make it as fun as it used to be.

so far so good and almost perfect app, it really helps me stay focused by reminding me to go back to the app whenever I leave, pro features are definitely worth purchasing. One more addition I'll like to see is the ability to sett up a timer chain like let's say 25mins-5minbreak-25mins so I don't have to manually go on a break and then back into another session all the time

I love this app, and it is super helpful for productivity. I know it's probably not the developers fault, but losing all my hard work earning trees just bc I switched from apple to Android really sucks üòî. Also wish there were a"five minute break" option that I could push so I could time a break and then get right back into it.

Paid version is decent (app whitelist is amazing on saving progress due to system popups). I had a little bit of trouble actually activating it though (only used the app buttons the first time, and forgot the master enable). *Bring back the small cakes!* I thought their design was better than the anniversary one.

I've only been using for a few hours but so far it has been easy to learn the basic features. The monetization is a bit annoying, but I'm planning to upgrade to remove those elements (unless this app has a subscription model, in which case I'll suffer through the ads etc.)

it's a very useful app for anyone who has difficulty paying attention or those who are intimidated by a huge task (working on it for a small amount of time, for ex. 15mins, makes it seem less scary). this app, however, doesnt block msgs etc on my phone, so i have to set my phone to "do not disturb" mode manually.

This is a fantastic app to help you focus! The simple idea of not wanting your virtual tree to die is more effective than you would think. I'm a college student and I use this app to keep me from getting distracted while I'm working on assignments. I've recommended this app to many friends and even offer to pay the $2 charge the App Store has if they have an iPhone. The only think keeping me from giving this app 5 stars is that it has some (usually minor) bugs in it.

i like this app, it has helped me ween away from picking up my phone mindlessly during work. one thing that bothers me is that it is default set to vibrate MADLY when the timer runs out, which defeats the purpose to me! also was very upset that when i answered the phone it killed my tree. i figured out how to turn off the phone setting, i thought i had got the vibrate to shut off but it went off again today. a user guide would be helpful because the interface is not user friendly.

This is my favorite app. I use it for homework and practicing music. I own the paid version, and I think that it's worth it; I've added all of my favorite motivational quotes to it. All of the beautiful trees and flowers are lovely, and I find myself being proud of all my work. The only thing I would change is how gosh dang hard it is to get enough money to buy more trees or bushes. It takes a heck of a long time to do so.

Great I've been using this app for more than a year now, and I love it. It allows me to focus more, since the distraction of you phone is now out the picture. How the app works; You choose the time period you want, then they plant a tree or shrub or etc. And if you get out of the app, you kill the plant. And each time you successfully don't get out of the app, your forest begins to grow. It helps to motivate you to start your work, and it helps you to concentrate on your work.

I've been using Forest across multiple devices for a long time. My only gripe right now is that this app doesn't have a landscape mode. I use a tablet and keyboard in class and when I teach, but the Forest app doesn't rotate and becomes hard to use in those contexts.

(Apr. 22, 2019 update) The essentials are all working fine, but my push notifications are buggy. The countdown freezes and I have to keep the app open to see the remaining time. I'm also not getting a sound notification when time is up. (I have a premium account.)

I'll start out by saying I really like this app. It has really helped me stay focused on tasks like homework or reading. My only problem with this app is that most of the features you have to pay to use them. For example, making an account and being able to sync up you data with your computer. You have to pay for that. In my opinion, making an account should be free. Also, whitelisting apps is also a feature you need to pay for, which is a little upsetting. But still, it is a great app.

Great focusing app, barely any ads, & the little trees & plants you can collect are adorable The only reason it isnt 5 stars is that those things werent what drew me to the app, the chance to plant real trees was. &while yes I did get to do that, they only allow you to plant 5 real trees. I wish I could plant more! At the end of the day, the cute digital trees arent going to impact my life & my planet as much as real ones. I would be more motivated to use it more if I could do more good with it.

Great app helps stay focused and makes it fun. Beautiful design! My pro version planted a few trees already. Development areas: if there would be a navigation guide to be easily accessed for 1st time users. To my mind quite a few auto-phrases sounded like dismissive orders vs. being inspirational. No ring or buzz once the timer is off. It would be helpful to have the auto suggestion for the quick break once the timer is off vs. trying to search for that within the menu. Low variety of plants.

The app allow list and friends list need a search bar, and the plant a tree reminders need to be taken a step further: let your users set times for trees to auto-plant. That being said, forest is such a useful app that the premium version is well worth the money (and it's not even a subscription!) and I'm happy I bought it. My previous review mentioned bugs. Forest has a very active dev team; they have all been squashed. Great job!

Great productivity app to make you feel proud of the time you spent working on a habit/skill. The trees are fairly pretty when you have the pro version. The only (nitpicky) complaint I have is the fact that the app does not double coins without having you watch ads, which in itself is very slow (slow load as well). I expected that paying money would remove such a need, but the developers thought otherwise.

I've been using this for awhile and I like the simplicity of it. It has helped me focus more on my studies. I did pay for the upgrade. My only complaint is that when I switched to a new phone, then signed into the app, it did not have all my coins saved that I had. It had 295, and I had saved around 700 before switching. Not sure why, but it's annoying to pay for the upgrade but not have it work properly when I sign in on a new phone. It also looks like I'm not getting the upgraded features.

Solid app. Would be better if you could add time once started and if there were chime options to ring when time was up. Also would be cool to have the option of notifications popping up with x amount of time left. If that already exists, pls lmk how to use. But I love growing the trees and that incentive to keep them healthy! I've had the app for a few years now.

Very good at helping you focus and stay off social media while you're working. Wish there was a way to manage what apps it allows you to open while the tree is planted, as some of the academic apps I have (such as a textbook app and Canvas) cause the app to say to go back to the tree if I open them while a tree is planted. Still very motivating to have a small reward for staying focused!

A great way to lock yourself out of your phone and be more present and mindful, though it does have ways to loophole that. Easy to use, though there can be some hiccups with room invites (but the room code handles that). I wish the forest display had more variety and that the bushes had different appearances for the different amount of time they were grown.

Hi, I'm a forest pro member and I had started a tree and had to pause because I realized I needed to get a few things ready. I decided not to delete it and saw an option, I thought, was to show why that was in my forest. Instead it was "Because you gave up". Pretty rude and a little childish considering the lack of options to pause. Edit: I have since discovered how to edit the messages, so I'll add another star seeing as I really do enjoy this app. Still, pausing should be a thing

Great concept, but I only gave 4 stars because I would have to buy the premium version to be able to use other apps along with the Forest app. There are many different scenarios I would need to use another app. For example, I may need to use my calculator for my math homework or I will oftentimes use my phone for references while I draw. It's much harder to focus when I can't use the resources on my phone while I use this app. I love the idea of the app, but I really need that one feature.

This showed up as a Pomodoro app in the Play Store. I'm all for gamifying tasks, so I liked the idea of growing a virtual forest by staying focused on work. It's simple. Plant a seed. Work for 25 minutes. You have a cute tree. Satisfying. Con: there's no alert telling you your 25 minutes are up. And when you use the stopwatch function, for some reason it takes 60 minutes to grow a tree instead of 50. So it's not really aligned with the Pomodoro technique. But it's cool for what it is.

I love the app! It's a great way to stay focused, especially with all the quarantining going on. However, I have one issue with this app: the ambient noises you can play don't loop properly, and become glitchy if you let them play for too long.

absolutely love this app, everything about it is good. my one problem is that the option to plant trees in reality, shouldn't be just for pro version but for everyone - at least limit the number of trees we can plant in reality, to user like myself that prefer the free version. Our environment isn't for people that can use the pro version but for everyone, pro and free. everyone should be given the opportunity to help our environment,even of its limited.

I love this app ‚ù§Ô∏è! I would, however, like if you could add something more to make the app feel even more polished and more peaceful. For instance: animals that wonder around your forest and the healthier the forest the more animals come or you could move your trees and add rivers. Worth the $2.00 for premium. Very good for big groups to focus. I love the store and the fact that you can buy different trees to grow, get different sounds, and music.

The app is awesome. Really wish you could tag and name trees before you plant them. That would be a nice quality-of-life change. Also, if you could make the app more compatible for chromebooks, that would be nice too. Chromebooks are excellent work computers and I need a good working app on it. I really hope forest can work in the future.

I really like this ap, but I was disappointed when I finally switched to the paid version and found there was no option to double coins after studying was completed. If it is available with ads, I feel like it should automatically come with the paid version. Other than that, a really helpful and pretty app.

The app is quite helpful! I definitely leave my phone alone when I'm growing a tree. Only reason it's not a 5 star is because the pro version of the app is a little buggy. Sometimes it gets stuck on an error message saying that you need to try again later. You're stuck with that unless you restart the app. Otherwise though the app is great!
Good üòäüëç

Cool and calm pleasant forest rain makes us to focus more for the reason why we have started it and avoiding distractions to reach out next minute away goal that's by practice possible even more with better environment by this app ..... More of a game thing which hits ur dopamine while studying too...
Good

I really struggle with putting my phone down and not habitually picking it up minutes later. This app is the only thing that has really helped me. Whenever I see my phone usage becoming problematic I start using it for a few days and it really seems to help. I have been using this app for multiple years. Also love that I can help the world in some small way.

Very helpful when studying or when you just want time off your phone! im horrible when it comes to doing homework or dedicating time to read, but with this app (and the sounds you can unlock so it isnt super quiet and awkward) ive managed to be more involved with my school work and im halfway through a book! you can customize what trees show up in your forest the more you focus, and can help the process of planting more trees. i really love this app :^)

Forest is incredible! If you're like me and feel motivated by both the concreteness of a timer and cozy woodland art, you might love this app as well. It's part of my daily work routine and helps me avoid getting sucked into my phone. You can earn coins for focus time and save them up to buy new tree/flower types, so there's a little sense of progress there as well. It's beautifully simple and effective.

I came across Forest while looking through simulation games, and like the 'leave your phone alone' angle. Motivational messages display as the timer runs, and if you're doing something where you're going to be away from your phone anyway, why not set the timer and plant a tree? You can double your earned coins by watching an ad. Other than that, as are very minimal. It's a focus game, after all.

This is one of the best apps I've ever downloaded and purchased. Great idea, with an adorable presentation. They lock custom labels for your growing sessions behind a pay-wall, but so many other great things are unlocked that it's well-worth the $2. Their other app, "Sleep Town," is also adorable and the same price for great features. I use both apps on a regular basis and highly recommend them.

This is my favorite way of keeping track of time and motivating myself to do things I don't feel like doing. My only suggestions would be to add even more trees, add automatic timers/ a scheduler if I want to enforce a schedule, and make the alarms louder or more than just one chime. Alternatively, more customizing options for alarms would be nice. I've missed Forest alarms before, so being able to make the alarms more noticeable would be appreciated.

Over the years, I've experimented with a lot of different productivity apps, but Forest:Stay Focused is the only one that I've continued using. The incentive to grow beautiful and creative trees really does encourage me to focus on my work. I love that new tree and plant species are added all of the time. I do wish that there were more ambient noises to unlock and more badges to earn. Otherwise, I am very satisfied with this app and think that it is worth the money.

It's an amazing app. I've been using it for years and it has helped me a lot. I upgraded to premium just recently. I think an option should be available for people to search study rooms and be able to join them. It's extremely difficult to find a friend that studies with forest, premium version, and would want to study at the same time I would. Being able to study with another, even a random person I might not even know, can immensely improve my outcome.

I paid for the pro version and it was definitely worth it. Growing cute little plants for some reason is enough to keep me off my phone when I need to study or when I'm just tired of my phone addiction. I do have one small suggestion. Maybe have advanced app allowed settings so I can set which apps to allow depending on which category I chose. Ex. Journaling category I could allow pinterest but study category wouldn't allow it. (Hope that makes sense).

Forest is great! I had the Apple version originally then switched to Android and was happy to pay $2 twice. I'm very motivated by cute aesthetics and gamification, and I mainly use the app to track the time I spend on my dissertation. I don't always use it when I work, but I often do, and it's nice that it can be as intense or as chill as you like. The stats are fun and useful. I recommend it!

Update: Thank you Forest for the quick reply. I deleted the app cache and restarted my phone. Somehow that did it. No issues anymore. Keep up the good work! Old: I would give this app 5 stars because it's simply amazing for making me focus both at work and during study sessions. Seriously, life changing. However, it crashes every single time I try to purchase a new sound with my coins or try to add a friend. I upgraded to the paid version and have a Samsung S9+, if that helps.

It's not very different from a timer but it does let you keep track of progress in different areas if you use all the features like tags or different trees. Side note the alarm only works if you are not in "deep focus". I do think it helps me focus when I pick my phone up and those reminders pop up, like a good accountability-buddy.

The genius of this app is it's simplicity. The apps works by encouraging not using your phone versus locking you out of your phone or apps. The incentive is little trees you grow by twenty-five minutes of no phone use at a time. If you give up during that, you get a withered tree instead on your plot of forest. It's making staying off your phone a game. I've just been using the free version. The paid version is very cheap and a one time purchase. I'm considering that as well.

UPDATE: changed to 5 stars due to the price changes in the store. The pop up ads are still a little annoying but it's still not too much of q problem. I love the variety in plants you can buy! It's a really cute app. Occasionally an ad would pop up outta nowhere but it's not too much of a problem. I think it'd be nice for the bushes to cost lower than the trees, due to them not needing as much time off to grow, but that's just my opinion. üòä

I really like this all. It let's you quantify your focused time, and theres something so rewarding about it. Not only that, but the aesthetic of having a "digital" forest is simply beautiful. I may even consider getting the premium version. At least for me, a timer is not enough when I do homework; I need to see something that tracks my progress in a more creative way, and this is exactly it.

Forest is the perfect app for anyone who struggles with self control with their phone. It helps you keep focus while providing fun and cute rewards, which allows you to feel a sense of accomplishment when you look at your grown trees. It's free, but I recommend supporting this app and getting the premium, which allows you to whitelist certain apps, receive statistics about your usage, and no ads. One of my favorite apps on my phone.

I am incredibly easily distractible, and would rather do anything but focus. Forest blocks me from my most common distraction by threatening me with the horrifying fear of murdering my precious baby tree. The app is cute and easy to use, and I love all the little tree designs, plus the fact that you can customize the background noise. It's great!

I really like Forest, and I'm glad it's free on android. I am weirdly sympathetic to digital plants and animals, so the motivation to stay away from my phone and not kill the plants by exiting the app is strong. I would feel really bad if one died!! Great app interface. Simple and cute, and pleasing for someone like me with aspegers. Edit: oh, please bring back the extended timer feature! I miss being able to set it to 8 hours to keep me from using my phone during the night.

A really cute little app that really helps keep me off of the stuff that distracts me the most. I'm not sure if it's accessible in the standard version, but I love being able to choose which apps are still okay for me to navigate to, like texting apps. And I like being able to change that when I need to (in between times of planting trees, not during the planting). Highly recommend if you're like me and tend to dissociate into your phone for hours when you have stuff to do.

A game-changer in productivity. Having a real motivator for focusing is an incredibly aspect of this app. The in-app experience is clean and appealing. A must-have for people who want to get busy. Suggestion: Planting messages are great, and being able to customize them is a splendid option. However, what if we had to option to customize it while planting? That way, we can put up a to-do list or a reminder!

Love this app! Not overwhelming like some apps, and perfect amount of customization. I just have a couple ideas/suggestions: First, it would be nice to have more achievements to unlock in the future! Also, I think it would be really cool if there was some sort of "real tree icon" that would show up in the virtual forest next to the other trees?? It's really nice having the virtual trees to look at and see how much time I've spent studying, but I also want to help out! Keep up the great work!

I'm a senior in college and I've been using the app for 3 semesters now and I'm OBSESSED. I love how you can actually see a physical representation of your hard work, and the plants are adorable! It really helps me avoid getting distracted by my phone both while studying and doing tasks like cleaning. It doesn't completely drown you with ads either, and the few automatic ones are very short. Overall great user experience, the devs did a fantastic job!

Love this app! I use it in conjunction with a physical timer, that one is more for the alarm aspect, this one really helps me not get distracted by social media. It's easy to select which apps you want to allow use, though selecting the system ones can be really tedious because of all the different system functions for one action. But, it's not a deal breaker. Would recommend to anyone looking for a satisfying reward to not letting your phone distract you while you're trying to focus.

Great way to focus! I love that you can set allow lists for certain apps! Edit: I reached the five tree limit, and although I understand why it exists, I do wish you could plant more the longer you have had the app installed, or could buy more at a higher price. I don't know if that would be possible, but I wanted to put the suggestion out there. Still an excellent app!

amazing app. very simple, easy to use interface. extremely helpful when you need to focus. the only thing that would be great is if tree type that you purchase had separate stats or features. for example, if tree 1 provides a better coin amount or a compound effect, plant X amount of same trees and it gets stronger and gives you more coins.

Am I so base that simple gamification of my time helps me stay focused? Yes, and this is the perfect tool. I've had this installed on my phone for a while now, but this week I actually used it regularly and I feel like successful and accomplished. It's pretty amazing how much real work gets done in 25 minutes when I'm not trying to do everything and checking all my other apps. definitely switching to premium too.

I don't ever rate apps but I really like this one. I have pretty bad ADHD and it makes it hard for me to sit down and study or do homework. I get distracted easily and don't feel like I really accomplish anything. But Forest really helps me stay on track by locking me out of apps and I get to actually see my hard work through my cute little forest. The pro version is definitely worth it (its only like $3) and I love all of the cute trees and flowers. :)

I used to be a study skills tutor, and I commonly recommended this to students who struggled to stay off their phones or needed a focus timer. Forest is visually appealing, motivating, and user friendly. Unlike many other apps of its type, it doesn't induce shame; someone can go back to their phone in an emergency, they just lose the tree. It also allows for easy time tracking, amd for students to play music/spotify throughout the period (so long as they don't adjust). Love this app!

I love this, it has legitimately helped my focus and productivity a ton during this pandemic. I had a lot of trouble focusing at home when my college went online, but this is simple, clear, pretty, and very satisfying. The free version has all I needed but I upgraded just to support the people who made this. I use this daily, even months later. I've recommended it to family, and I'd recommend it to anyone who needs some help staying motivated and focused during all this!

I've used this app off and on for many years. It brings me so much joy when I use it, and I always feel more productive and motivated. I love seeing my forest grow and I love that I can keep track of custom subjects/tasks and the time spent with each. I bought premium awhile ago. I didn't care about the benefits. I just wanted to support an incredible app.

This app is amazing it offers relaxing sounds to play while you work and flashes motivating messages at the top of the screen. It has a give up button but those motivating messages help me keep focused. The type of tree you get depends on how long you work when you're finished you gave the option to take a break. I really do recommend this app especially if you are a student.

Update: excellent FAQ & support components for the app! Both issues resolved, and support team member was helpful and easily contacted. 5 stars. Effective & well-designed app! I've enjoyed using it enough that I bought the upgrade. However, when I did so, I lost my previous purchase (Octopus Tree)- it seems like purchases made with coins should carry over into the paid version. Please let me know how to resolve this. Also, the app is often slow to load when switching pages within the app.

This app has been an absolute lifesaver since having to work at home. I dont use it every day but there are some days where it's been too easy to get sucked in to my phone and starting this is usually enough to get me focused back on work so I only have to use it once or twice. The "stopwatch" feature is absolutely perfect for me. I work better with a timer counting up instead of down and this let's me get trees for however long I can focus instead of having to guess how long that will be.

Thus far, I'm enjoying this app. I feel absolutely motivated in completing a task; and, staying on track. Even, when I feel like getting off track, I'm reminded of the growth that's manifesting between my tree and myself. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for the best app ever. Looking forward to additional features!

Amazing app!! Helped me alot with medical school. **Just a suggestion, it'd be really helpful if we can have the option to start a new clear forest (just like the ones we have at each new year) so that we can start a new forest at the beginning of each new college semesters in September/October instead of 1st January, it'd be really amazing to compare the focused time between 2 semesters instead of 2 years

Super effective, I've tried lots of other apps to focus and the way this one forces you back to focusing is so nice. Also, the premium is totally worth it for the price with being able to have an allow list and more customizable options. I'd recommend it to any chronic phone addict or extremely busy person who needs every minute of their day to count.

As someone who really struggles with staying on task, staying focused and getting things started, this app has helped me tremendously. I highly HIGHLY recommend getting the full version bc It is only $2 and SO worth it, but even if you don't get it, it is still a wonderful app. There are so many useful features and encouraging messages. This app has honeslty changed my life and I am so so happy it exists. Thank you for making this!!!

Love this app! I sprang for the premium version, which is something I honestly never do. In truth though, you don't need the premium version. The free version is light on the ads and ultimately has the same functionality. It really helps me to concentrate on whatever I'm doing and be proud of myself when I see my whole garden of bushes and trees!

So many great updates! I love all the statistics this app provides. I look forward to completing my task and remain focused when I use this app. Couple this with their Water-Do app is a must! I look forward to getting things done. I'm all about the stats, so being able to visually see how much I get done so beautifully is motivating for me. I'd love more audio/sound options added, please.

Got this when I realized I got most distracted from my work by looking at my phone. Really helps me focus when I need to. I didn't want one of those apps that completely locks down your phone in case I actually needed to use it for something important, but I don't want to kill my trees for unimportant stuff. Also I like that they have a variety of trees that you have to work to get. It makes me more motivated to use the app. I hope they add more season-themed trees (snow covered would be cool!)

Bought the full version of the app and love it. Definitely helps with motivation during the day. My only wish is that you could combine trees of the same type at the end of the day or something, to get the more complex trees (since I have ADD, and focusing for 120 min at a time is monumental). One small bug is that when you plant a tree by yourself, it shows a friend's icon instead of your own. Such a small complaint! xD I'll be using this app for ages, I reckon.

I don't usually leave reviews for any apps I use but for this one I'll definitely make an exception. Awesome app for sure! Forest really helps keep me focused and on task and seeing the visual representation of my hard work (the forest of trees planted while studying) really drives me to continue working. Also, love the ability to make real change by planting trees irl just by studying and using the app. All around really awesome idea, definitely worth the download and the dollar upgrade.

This has to be one of the best focus apps there is! The gamification of getting you to focus does a great job in getting you to do so by blocking other apps and allowing you to grow some cool trees and what not. I've definitely seen an improvement in my ability to focus, which at time where seemingly everything is fighting for your attention, it's helps alot! Great job and glad I got the premium version which has allowed me to carry my progress across my different devices!

Ive been using Forest for several years now. As an adult with ADHD, I often have trouble focusing on the task at hand. I use Forest to tell my distractible brain when it's time to concentrate, and the charming trees and shrubs give me a little reward when I succeed. It's a brilliant tool for anyone who needs a little extra incentive to get the job done.

I'm now editing my review and giving this app 5 stars. I've realized that although getting more plants to use is a slow process, it's supposed to be that way. If you were able to get more plants quickly and easily you'd have less incentive for using the app as much. I really enjoy slowly racking up coins and buying new plants for me to plant in my Forest. Phenomenal app that has helped me with digital minimalism and enjoying the present moment more. üòÑüåπ

I have used many focus apps throughout college and none of them worked. I was skeptical going into this app thinking "this is just another focus app, it's not going to work". Oh boy was I wrong. This app really helps me sit down and focus without any distractions. I HIGHLY recommend this app to anyone who has problems focusing on something for more than 10 mins. If you're still skeptical like I was try downloading it and plant your first tree.

I love it I've only had it for 2 days and I already upgraded to the pro version. I think it's great for people like me who get distracted easily. I love the creativity of the app and the forest feature. I think the pro version is worth every penny. one thing I would change about it would be the growing process, it would be cool if the plant would have more phases of growing. For example, the pine tree goes from a small sprout to the tree from one second to the next. But besides that, perfect!!

This app has helped decreased my screen time so much and improved the quality of my studying. I use the allow list + deep focus mode to ensure I'm only accessing things that will make me successful while in school mode! You can even plant with friends, which is fun an acts as another avenue of accountability. If one person kills the tree, it kills the tree for everyone. The trees are super cute and it's fun to make patterns if you're feeling ambitious! I love using the Chrome extension as well. I can make sure all websites except my school stuff is off limits. That way, I literally am unable to goof off on my computer if I'm planting on my phone. I definitely need the double accountability. Awesome!

Literally the only app I've ever used where gameification was actually effective and not annoying! Actually, it *is* annoying--why can't I just choose the tree and background sound that I want? But the fact that I actually *want* those sounds that help me focus and those different trees that visually differentiate my tasks entices me to log my hours and get those coins! Which means I'm actually being more productive! 1 note: make the alarm when you complete a session louder so I don't miss it!

I've never been able to study or do my homework because of my adhd, which I get easily distracted with, but with this I'm able to focus and occasionally look at the screen to see my tree has grown, its amazing and really rewarding. If you leave the app and give up your trees wither but if it gives you a warning and you go back then they keep growing which is pretty cool. Its an amazing app to use, I highly recommend it, and no, this isn't a fake review :) love this app <3

My favorite study tool! It's really helpful to set the timer and just focus on my work until I get the notification that my tree finished growing. That way, I make sure to include breaks while still keeping on task when I'm working. Plus, it's motivating to visually see my forest grow after having worked a lot. The trees and plants you can get are so cute too!

This app has really helped to improve my focus while working, bc it's encouraging to know that I'm growing a forest, while using my time intentionally! The rain ambiance is very nice as well, and overall I celebrate small wins when I see how much time I've focused on my tasks. There are some parts of the app that are a bit confusing for me and I wish it were a bit more detailed in usage. Overall the app is useful and the Tiny Tan ver. is so cute! üíúüíúüíú

This app is amazing and legitimately saved my thesis. I am so distracted by my phone, but the idea of me "killing a tree" because I checked Facebook made me think twice. It is worth the purchase in my book. Essentially, it's a glorified, "be productive for however long you need," Pomodoro timer. Will recommend to anyone looking for an extra motivation boost!

I appreciate all the great features to provide a unique focusing experience. I like being able to add certain apps to the white list so that I can still use them while the forest app is running. I love listening to podcasts and music on YouTube while cleaning, so I liked being able to add it to my whitelist. I also love the great selection of beautiful plants, and how they keep releasing new trees!

I absolutely love the cute theme! The app is really good for focus, and my little siblings love reading the quotations you put on there! Its quite addicting in my opinion. Growing a litttle forest with this app by putting your phone down is awesome! I think something that might be good/cool is something for overnight. You could grow multiple trees/bushes/etc. Or 1 big tree/bush/etc. It would help for if you woke up in the middle of the night, and figured you might want to use your phone.

This app is great for focusing! It gives you a cute incentive to keep going, and the pro version is definitely worth it. Being able to write my own messages for myself and get achievements makes this app all the more helpful. But even the free version is great. Anyone who has trouble getting off their phone will find a great learning tool in this app.

This app is an absolute lifesaver, and with the browser extension it's even more helpful. As someone with ADHD, I often struggle to stay focused on things that need to be done. This app helps keep me from getting distracted, and when it seems like the work is taking forever, it doubles as a timer that I don't want to cancel. I can look at how long I have left and tell myself that I can't take a break until my tree is grown. Trying to collect all the different trees gives me added incentive to use it as well. One of the only apps I've ever paid for, and I don't regret it one bit. (It functions perfectly well without paying; I just wanted to support the app.) Thank you so much for this wonderful app. A+++.

I recommend this app to all of my friends for studying! In addition to the focus help, it motivates me to get more done and to challenge myself in new ways! I especially like seeing a whole forest for a day, month, etc. Sadly, there was no way to transfer my plants when I got a new phone, so I am having to unlock plants again.

Great app! Works as intended and super cute and motivating, I love their backround sounds. I do wish there was a bit more personalization within the app however, like being able to name our planting reminders and being able to change the notification sound for forest. Aswell as more trees/coins for more time. If I focused for two hours on timer mode, I would get 5 trees instead of 4. Where if I focused for 30 minute blocks for a total of 2 hours I would only receive 4 trees.

It feels really good knowing I'm breaking my phone habit while also contributing to reforestation. I think I need to see the physical progress of how much I get done in a day. Plus the rainforest sounds block out background noise which helps me concentrate. They have other sounds too. It's really nice, try it if you can. You don't need to buy anything either unless you want to

Forest is brilliant. if you want to focus, it's the way to go. the Premium features (which really dont cost much, so cheap!) let you plant together with friends and participate in the leaderboard. I've been using Forest for a long time, and I definitely love it. I figured it's time to give them a review, since I use it practically everyday!

I love this app! I used it when I was back in school and it was very helpful for keeping me focused on studying. I find myself too distracted while working from home, so I decided to redownload Forest. The app is still easy to navigate and use :) I would definitely recommend this to anyone who catches themselves on their phone for long periods of time while teleworking.

Cute app that helps me stay focused. It's customizability makes it really great, so I can tell it what apps are and aren't okay for me to use. Like if I'm doing work and I NEED to check my email for something related to what I'm doing, I can take my email app off of the black list Also it's kinda nice to plant a real tree every once and a while the focus rewards. If you're struggling to tame your time on your phone during times you should be focusing, the free version is worth a try.

Rewarding and Beneficial! üåø Recently I've been having a hard time locking down to do my homework or studying since I've been adjusting to a new environment (aka College). This app helped me take my very first step into a productive grind by allowing me to reward myself everytime I finish a study session. Fair warning: You shouldn't cheat yourself. With this app comes growth and a great observation of who you really are when you're in the "zone".

I really like this app. It helps me stay away from my phone while I study. It lets me grow cute trees üòç I got the Pro version to let me create/join groups and it definitely helps me to be more accountable because if I leave, everyone else's tree dies too. There's also a whitelist feature that allows me to choose certain apps that i=I can use while on in a group. initially, I thought that the 'multiplier' function was gone when I got the Pro version, but I found that I could turn it on in the settings. And I think the best feature is that I get to grow real trees too! Super recommend the app!

Great app to help stay focused. Some things can be improved though: 1. Sync frequency: Can users set the sync frequency by themselves, or at least make it sync automatically every day/ every time using it? I uninstall it by mistake and lose a whole week record. I feel really sad about it:( 2. Sync the app whitelist. Not sure if the button at the upper right corner on the app whitelist page is for sync, but it does not work very well. I need to set up the whitelist manually after reinstall it.

Really helpful in getting me to focus on my schoolwork without worrying about getting distracted on my phone. The concept is cute, and I often look forward to getting enough coins to unlock new trees and plants. I like the different tree design options too - there are some cool and unique designs for a customizable Forest experience. Overall a good and effective app (at least for me)
Really impressed with interface and its theme üëå üëè
It keeps me focused and helps me study more efficiently. My only issue is that you have to pay to study with friends.
Easy and simple to use
best app for keeping consistency

it is amazing app it helps me stay focused the songs of the water really help me focus more. This app is a very very good app I really appreciate it. I hope you install this app and I hope you install this app.
this app helps me to keep track of the hours have spent studying ‚ù§Ô∏è , I love it .

The app has allowed me to become more focused in my study sessions and it helps keeping me away from distractions. But I hope the developers could add more features to add excitement to the users and be more engaged with app.

I'm really enjoying watching my forest grow so things I used to struggle to accomplish each day are going far more smoothly for me thus completing my task list is becoming a source of joy and strength rather than the stressful, confusing thing it was merely a week ago. I'm using the free version but plan to spend the $3.49 for the full version very soon.
It is very good app for focus but alarm iss very week can you make the alarm stronger üí™ it will makes decipline

Staying focus is a decision. I work hard and want to be 100% productive. But, when things are extra hard, it's easier to get busy. I found this app in the book Indistractable by Nir Eyal. I was skeptical but the more I use it, the more I find it useful. The hidden idea that I'm planting trees while doing the hardest work, its becoming unexpectedly motivating. The app is always giving you nuggets of encouragement to stay on task. I would add some motivational quotes.

I like this app for holding me accountable when I'm trying to unplug and focus. It can even guide you back to the app when you try and wander to a distracting app. I really don't buy Pro versions of things, but honestly I think it's worth it. It's such a handy tool, and there are options to grow real trees just by focusing with the pro version, as well as more trees to plant! Very cute. I'm also trying out their "WaterDo" To-Do App, which is also handy and cute. 10/10 useful and fun challenge!

Relaxing and useful for many purposes! I love the options for customization related to app use, timing, white noise soundtracks and the ability to design my own garden as the reward feature. More than any other aspect, I appreciate that the app is meant to increase productivity through positive reinforcement (reward) and that it's a tool meant to help the user throughout the process. Thanks, Forest creators!

This app has greatly helped me in creating better study habits and eliminating procrastination (I'm a high school senior for reference). Part of the reason is because, rather than simply completely blocking usage of apps, it allows you to choose to break your streak, forcing you to actually consider the consequences of procrastinating. My only gripe is that I feel like the ability to whitelist apps should be free (although it is only around $3, which isn't bad). I'd recommend it to anyone.

best app for staying focused and locking your phone while you work. there are other knockoff "free" apps that are similar but they all have micropayments for what this app comes with, and add up to be more expensive, or they use a system of using money as a deterrent to looking at your phone- which doesnt really work since mistakes do happen (go to check the timer and accidentally exit the app for instance), or don't really allow for smaller time settings, but those 15-20min trees add up!

I downloaded this app back in 2016, and I still use it consistently so I thought it finally deserved a review :) I love the Deep Focus feature - allowing me to whitelist apps means I can keep my music on and text my husband back without losing my tree or getting distracted by Instagram. While there are a lot of features you have to pay for, it's literally never bothered me - I just want to plant my little trees and focus. I get so invested in them - I think I've killed <5 in 8 years! Thank you!

I love this app! unlike other focusing apps that just yell at you and block you from websites, this app actually puts something at stake. if you stop focusing, your tree dies. if you successfully focus, you're rewarded with a new addition to your forest! this risk and reward system has been really effective for me. plus, once I get enough coins I can use them to plant a real tree and add some good to the world! üå≤üíö

I have used this app for a few years, and I just enjoy it so much. It really helps during crunches like finals. I also just love all the different trees and seeing them at the end of the day. If you like the idea of the Pomodoro method but struggle with it like me, something about promising a virtual tree I'll study for them helps. Don't ask me how, it just does for some reason üòÇ

I highly recommend the forest app of you're struggling to stay committed to tasks such as writing, exercise, work from home. The experience with the app is so pleasant it makes you want to log to and do your tasks. It has helped me with daily progress and even pushing past my original goals! The only this I wish was different was that you don't get an alarm or sound when the timer is finished. I understand why you can't pause it, because taking a break interfers with productivity.

I've been using Forest on and off for years and it's wonderful at its job. I often struggle with focusing on tasks and it's helped immensely with discipline. Something I wish was a feature is combining the allow list with the tags, or having an option to pick the allow list when starting a session. I have different allow lists for different tasks and often forget to switch and need to cancel my timer midway through. I do love this app and will continue using for years :)

Great app! Motivational and helps you to get your things done. One thing is that the price of the plants are too high. In all, very good app. I'm using it before my exams and it helps very much. Also, too many features are in premium. Leave a little for us too!
It would be nice if there were more opportunities for free trees. I'm low income and can't afford the paid version. But it's a nice simple easy-to-use app.

I can plan what I need doing and when I want it done by along with a really helpful pop up to remind me at the time. If I can't do it at that time it gives me the option to snooze the pop up for anytime. I would 100% recommend this app if you want to be more organised and productive.

Keeps getting better and better with the updates and new features. I only use the free version but it gives me all the tools I need to manage tasks and todo lists. Love that it's cross platform so I can get access on any of my devices. Clean, easy interface means I enjoy using it and it keeps me engaged on a daily basis. Great app, love it...
I love this app, you can create as many categories for your lists as you like, it's easy to use, you can collaborate with family and friends. Would highly reccomend.

The best To-do app out there. Good layout, organization system, reminders, intuitive, simple, customizable. Syncs between devices and with Google calendar smoothly. The daily planner and widgets are useful. The free version is more than enough to get going, and the premium features are definitely worth it. Recommended! Any.do has anthing you need in a To-do app, no need to try any other apps. The only thing I would add is a Pomodoro timer or similar time management tool.

I find the Any.do app to be a great way to capture any to do lists. I love that I xan run multiple lists, share them, and check them off as I get things done. Gone are the frustrations if lising my list, or my oen while grocery shopping or running errands. It's all conveniently on my phone. I add irems as I think about them. It's easy to repopulate the grocery list which saves typing. This app helps me stay organized and streamlines daily errands and tasks. Thank you for the excellent app.

I love this app and I cannot think of any flaws it has. I particularly appreciate that I am able to create subtasks and to connect it to Google calendar, and that it is accessible on both my phone and my laptop. Regarding this, the synchronisation between my devices has also worked well until now. I don't use the premium version, but I think the price is quite acceptable.

Really great "to do" app. Allows for adding subtasks, notes and files + tags to distinguish among projects / lists. Very easy. Excellent reminders with "one touch" snooze possibilities. Prompts to plan ahead your day a pleasant surprise feature. "Focus on an activity" in order to eliminate distractions, another great surprise feature. Excellent service response. Only annoying, you have to first save task & date and then go back to it to add tags, notes etc. But overall, superb.

I have been using this app for 2 years, still my favorite to-do list app from other apps. It has a clean widget I can see on my home screen, also allow me to add a new to-do item straight from the widget without going into the app. I also love that it sync up with my Google Calendar. Moreover, all of these features given are totally FREE! Thank you!

I've been on Premium plan since '14, have tried other apps for comparison along the way, and I still haven't found any reason to give up my current plan. Any.do provides a lot of useful features w/o overwhelming users. Other apps may have a lot more features, but they're designed in a way that overwhelms new users (making them unusable). Customer support is TOP NOTCH too! I had an accidental billing issue (that was mostly my fault) w/c they immediately reversed upon request... over the holidays!

A great little basic organiser app, nice and simple to use, clear, user friendly and not over complicated, grabs calendar entries from pre-installed phone calendar, doesn't bombard you with notifications, well worth the money. I have just started using some of the more detailed features and am enjoying the simplicity. I've tried other organiser apps that are way too sophisticated for my needs, this app motivates me and I can use it even when I'm in a hurry or half asleep.

This app is my spare memory and I love it! It takes so much of my stress by reminding me, keeping track of my tasks...just perfect, easy and quick to use and setup all the things I need To Do. I use this app for her long time, tried few other, in the meantime but back to this one always. Just trying out the desktop version...will see and review that later. Only one little thing...I REALLY HATE when my tasks cut of my ongoing calls. That must change. Otherwise 9 out 10 stars.

Best app for reminders. I have started using it before I started university to help remind me of important things and it has. There were times that if the app would not have reminded me I would have had problems like doctor appointments. I have been available to stay on top of things and stay organised. This reminder app is better than any other that I have tried. I can make lists and I can also put a specific time to remind me of the thing I need a reminder of. Highly recommended you try it!!!

This app keeps me productive! I have a tendency to try to tackle too much at once and end up with an overwhelming number of unfinished tasks. Any.do keeps me on task and helps me to prioritize what needs to come first. I love that it reminds me what needs to be done and I can snooze it nice that item to another day if needed. I live to add various lists so I know what my task pertains to. It's just an awesome resource for sure!

I purchased premium almost immediately, as this is exactly what I've been looking for - simple to-do lists. Can repeat tasks, can set reminders, can add subtasks, can colour code, can sync with calendar, can have several lists - or can just ignore all that and use a simple dump-it-all perpetually ongoing to-do list. Love it. Can also use it from desktop on any OS (web interface), and it syncs quickly. There's a light mode with several colours available, and also night mode with a black background. Separately I would like to mention customer service. I was stuck in another country due to the pandemic, and my card got blocked. My bank took its blissful time to reissue and send a new card to me - meanwhile, all my subscriptions and bills bounced. I got a billing issue notification. I replied, explaining my situation, and any.do was very kind to provide a month of premium usage for free. Priority support replies are very prompt. The agent I was in contact with (Tali) is polite and quick. Overall, this app is a keeper. Finally a todo app that I use - because it doesn't annoy me.

i've tried a lot of to-do list apps and this one is by far my favourite. The best part is that you can schedule a time for it to prompt you to plan your day and then it goes through all your tasks and allows you to triage and prioritize. Easy to use, and has a great free version. I only upgraded to the paid version because I wanted more flexibility with scheduling recurring tasks. All in all, an excellent app to get your life, business and brain organized.

Great app. Have been using it for quite a while now. It works well across my Android phone and my browser on my Macbook. I use it for tracking personal and work actions. I find the grocery list really useful. Easy to use and has most grocery items in its database so its very easy to populate. Had an issue with it closing lists by itself. Reached out to Any.do for support and they replied very quickly with the solution which required data clearance and reinstallation. Was worried about loss of data but the reinstall went very smoothly and all data came back from the Any.do server. Great service. Thanks Tali

The best to do app on the market The free version is just perfect, no annoying ads and no missing features. The paid version is just as amazing, super cheap, super fast to use, every action is optimized, and the whole experience is great. I have a really hard time with my daily task and this app is a blessing. Helped me like nothing else. Also it syncs with calendar and computer which is greatly appreciated.

This app is great! So easy to enter information and at schedules. It links with my calendar and I can set reminders and move tasks around so easily. I love the front end which gives a clear overview of all tasks. Everything is so simple. There's no learning curve either - completely intuitive. Absolutely brilliant! They have thought of everything.

I've been using the free version of this app for a few weeks now and really like it. The design is beautiful and intuitive. My favourite and most useful feature is the anydo moment. Once a day the app lists your to dos and allows you to decide when you will do them. This is great because it allows you to prioritize on the go. Also love how easy it is to see both the to do lists and the calendar. I like this app so much I'm considering using the paid version for extra features.

Without a doubt the best task organizer among dozens I have tried. Have been using it for years and I can't function without it. Very smooth overall user experience, functional and intuitive. It can be used as a simple to-do-list as well as a more sophisticated organizer. The dev team behind the app seem to be working actively as I notice regular updates and new features. If Google calendar is not your cup of tea, then the next thing to try would be Any.do, before anything else.

So far, really f'ing good. I've tried a whole bunch of different todo apps, I've usually ended up parting ways with them for one reason or another --- but Any.Do is seeming to work with me really well. I love its simplicity, the fact that there's an accompanying web-app, and that you get a fully usable app for free and that you can unlock bonus (really cool) features as the premium. Give it a shot. See if it's worth you. If not, don't settle. Find something that works for you.

The best! I have downloaded tons of to-do-list apps and this is hands down the best in its class. Simple and intuitive UI, easy to use, flexible, powerful and highly customizable while staying simple to use and understand. I tried other apps and I keep going back to Any.do everytime. I still have to find a worthy competitor to this app.

Very good application. There is a widget that allows you to enter in a new task with natural date and time language and it will properly decode and set the reminder. This makes it very fast to quickly add new tasks. Also the web app that accompanies it is very well made. My only gripe is that long tasks get cut off and you need to select them to read.

I am satisfied with the app and the service. I am a free user but I get excellent service from the team when I encountered a bug. I didn't expect to get a reply from the developer but they replied me. (The bug: Sometimes events disappear after saving. Need to remake events several times. After contacting customer support, they told me to clear cache and reinstall it, and it worked flawlessly.) The app works smoothly, the design is simple, easy to use, and light. I like it.

Throughout my busy life, I've used a lot of task management apps. This one is absolutely the best: elegant design, intuitive interface and complete feature set even without premium membership. The premium plan is, however, very affordable, and eventhough I personally don't need it, I probably will subscribe to it as a gesture of appreciation to the developer team. Great work!

You can add sub texts and smaller lists and information you need to remember within a single task. You can sync it's calendar with your calendar, and contacts as well as time and date. I highly recommend it!

A to do list where you can schedule each task in time with a reminder - or just keep it as a 'someday' - and easily switch in-between. Which is awesome! It has a super-low threshold to create a task, which makes you actually use it. Plus if you don't want to flip through menus to schedule you can just write date & time in plain language! Or speak it, using your Assistant. I know Any.do can do much more than this, but that's what I use it for. Oh, plus, also its intelligent grocery list!

Even as a free user this is still a pretty powerful tool. It has almost everything I need in a to do list. My only complaint is default predictive features designed to help, but instead complicating simple tasks, i.e. a task with a holiday in the title sets a due date of the holiday. Would love an easy access pure calendar view, especially if also available in widget form. I know this is more of a tasks app than a calendar app but theres really no reason why it cant have a simple dedicated calendar as well. Also, the Android widget still doesnt sync with the system light/dark mode. Otherwise, its perfect. I've been using Todoist for years and I can't imagine ever going back to life without it. It's the smoothest and most consistent tasks app out there.

On android it would be very helpful to provide SelectAll feature in any list. Similar to as in the iOS app. For example, when any filter is applied I cannot select all the items in the result on android app but it works in iOS app. Second request: It would be very nice to have collapsible headings when we group by using project or due date. It would make easier to check a long list of items. Defect: Android app crashing when trying to create a new label.
Once you get the hang of it, it's really easy to use. I like the labels features alot as well. It's easier to navigate through tasks by just searching the label. The widgets are also very efficient.

Good app, needs an option to disable the 'reschedule' option that appears if you don't do a task. I just want to start at a blank screen each day and not be nagged by the app to reschedule something that was day-specific to begin with.

I loved it until the latest update. I was using the karma view to help keep track of recently completed tasks, and that particular piece of usability is now hidden more than it was before, and I needed instructions to find it again, the process was not at all intuitive.

Please bring back the old mobile dark theme for the widget! I loved the minimalist look with no colors and the ability to turn the opacity down completely. Would be 5/5 stars with this design feature back in place.

1. Brilliant app. Uncluttered and easy to use. It works offline too which is important to me as I live in an area with unstable internet connectivity. For me, perfection will be to see long-term, repeatable and annual tasks.
Pretty good. My only issue that would prevent me from replacing my current notes app is the lack of long press (3D) to do a New Task/Item. Please add. Thank you!

Great app, but you guys nerfed the widget design in the most recent update. Before you could make the entire widget transparent. It was clean and blended in well with the background but now the header is no longer transparent and it just looks bad on the home screen.
No complaints. Does the job. And the widget is a good reminder. Overall will increase productivity.
