The app is good, but it's not for me. I found it too overwhelming. I prefer a more simple and quick app for my reminders, like Microsoft Tasks or Google Keep. Also, many features are paid. That by itself is not bad, but a subscription is a bit too much for a reminder app, especially considering that many of these paid features are available for free in other apps, like the ones form Google and Microsoft. It should good for professional use, if you're willing to pay for a subscription.

I love this application so much!!! Good job to the developers. However, I've been having some issues lately with the application. The application refuses to notify me of some tasks I planned to do. When trying to set the time for a reminder, the clock's 5 minutes faster and automatically blocks the other minutes before. As an alternative, I set the date and time using natural language but sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Kindly fix this. Once again, it's a wonderful application.

All it needs is Google Calendar integration. Edit: Oh wait it does have it! I was using the Any.do Chrome Extension (the little pop out thing) when writing this review. The Any.do Chrome Extension does not have the ability to display Google Calendar events alongside one's Any.do tasks whereas the Any.do Android app does indeed have it. AFAIK. It doesn't have IFTTT applets but I'd return if it made some.

I used to love this (five stars) before you changed it. I was able to set repeatable tasks for each day of the week, but now if I set a repeating task today, for example, for every Wednesday, the reminder will come up today, not Wednesday. I want the reminder on the day I want. I am very disappointed. By the way, I won't use Any Do for my grocery list. I use a better one that keeps a running cost (including tax) for each store I go to.

As someone with ADHD, organizational tools are a necessity and this is one of the best. I say that having tried just about every well rated organizational app in the app store. That said, this is obviously still in development. The web version is missing many important aspects. However new features are coming out regularly and the team is very responsive. Once a few more features are up to par (namely the website and the smart lists) I'll be changing this to a 5 star reveiw and paying for pro.

I really appreciate many of the features in this app, especially the ability to sync with Alexa task (or grocery) lists and see the list easily via the widget! One feature that I've not been able to find (and would love) is a dark mode setting for the quick-add notification. This would be a great feature to add (or make it default if the app is in dark mode). Thank you for all the great work on this app! Very pleased!

Very helpful. I bought premium its not a subscription which I love. Problems: 1. The widget lists everything you need to do today and in the futuren in a long list with no divide. I see that and panic. 2. Being able to select multiple lists to display but not all. I don't need my shopping list showing on the widget 24/7. But I would like my appointments and daily chores displayed without having to change between lists (because I wont) 3. Being able to color code lists would be awesome.

Coordinates Humans üôåüèæ This app was my go-to until covid hit. Keeping my personal, consulting business, and day work calendars in one app was madness. I broke off my day work to microsoft .to do on a separate device. Any.do now coordinates my consulting and my personal and family tasks, lists, and bills. Its refreshing. I do have syncing issues for calendar events as well as a crash everytime I add people to invites when creating an event. Thats why I gave it 4-stars. Love it for tasks.

Honestly, awesome app... or at least used to be. Lately, it is extremely laggy, which is honestly a pain in the ass when trying to check which tasks u have to do. Also, it seems like there is a new feature where every time you back out of a task, it asks you if you want to save or discard; previously, it just auto-saved, which was very neat. On top of that, whenever I try to add a tag to my task, it doesn't save. It either takes me multiple tries to save the tag, or it just never saves. Plz fix.

This is my favorite to-do type of app, it's gorgeous on an oled display, but I really wish there were a better way to set up repeatable checklists. To start a good habit I find the reminder to do it everyday very helpfyl, but even better is tracking how many times I actually did after a week and when. This app allows repeat events with notifications but doesn't track time completed or show completed or incomplete events on Cal or Google calendar so making schedule adjustments is a chore.

I wanted to b a more organized person so this app was editors choice, and I subscribed to Any-do for the year. I'm just not sure what the difference is between this app and a glorified notebook. I mean I'm still getting to understand, ex: Any-do moments I have no idea whats going on there (any advice). Also it claims to sync to all Google apps but I've seen things I put on NOTE that have yet to sync. Any way maybe I'm wrong and will keep practicing, overall it's a good organizer

App is very simple which is what I wanted. Can sync to Google now. Can put as widget on home screen. Tasks are same color but seperated by date and will say "this week" etc. with list below. Wish I could put a date ending; for example I put a reminder "spring break 3/1 to 3/5" but can only put a start date and anything else has to go on note. Notification only show on task bar and never chime for the time selected. I keep using bc simplicity tho to have view of what all I have to do for month.

almost perfect. I do wish we could sort by list AND time instead of either-or. and it's not quite to the point that wunderlist was. but the voice control is incredibly handy, and it's decent at both shopping & to-do lists (although grocery lists feel a bit weird/limited compared to to-do lists). and the paid version is not necessary for most basic functions, although I personally upgraded because I felt it was worth it.

I LOVE this app. It was the one I narrowed down to after having downloaded several to-do apps. HOWEVER, I wish it had just a plain note taking feature for day to day things to remember, without it being attached to a to-do item. I also wish the interface was slightly easier to manage, there are a couple fixes that would increase the apps ability to be intuitive for the user. (An easier way to undo checking off a list item, being able to view the agendas differently ie calendar and tasks)

better one of the hundreds of apps I've tried in this category I would definitely say top 10!! it's definitely a different look and approach to the "to do" or "List" apps that are usually out there! you could say it's more of a simple or easier way of looking at everything that you need to accomplish as it uses the today tomorrow and some day layout but it can also be useful for details as it has the options for subtasks if you so choose! keeping it for a while for sure over a bunch of others

I like the ease of creating different to do lists, ability to create subtasks, and that i can make my grocery shopping list according to what store I shop at. It's great that the grocery list are automatically sorted by aisle for you. However, i noticed that if i add a price to the beginning or end of the grocery item, that it gets put in the 'other' aisle category. I also like how you can switch something in one list to a different one just by tapping on it. Nice work üëç

Overall good and useful. I'll likely continue to use, and.. .. . ..I would like more control of reminder sounds including repeating (so i don't miss it) and sounds without needing to open app. (maybe there are settings i can adjust). also more integration with other apps including Trello and Evernote and more a general multi app share feature would be great. As is i am copying and reentering things in multiple apps, and i want to just send them.

The app looks great but it's limited. You cannot add notes for specific days. You cannot add a calander unless you connect it to your email calander and the stake white color scheme can't be changed unless you buy premium. Which is about 18$ a year. I would love to see a daily note option with text editing allowed and the ability to add a calander without having to sync it with your Google calendar.

Honestly, needs a lot more features for me to be worth paying premium for (I tried out the free trial). The deal breaker for me was the fact that I can't set custom alerts for calender events.. maximum I can do is 2 days before event.. why can't I customize it (i.e 2 weeks or 10 days)? Then they need other things like automatic dark theme switching. Other than that, it's a nice productivity app. Love that it combines tasks and events into the calendar

This app has been my sidekick ever since it was released around 8 years ago!! The grocery list feature they recently developed really makes shopping a breeze. My only complaint, and the reason for only 4/5 stars, is that the long-press always vibrates when reorganizing tasks, even when my ringer is off. Really annoying when youre in a super quiet place, not just for me but for others as well. Otherwise, absolutely my favorite app on my phone!

Would give 5 stars if it wasn't buggy and didn't cause me to miss a task. The calendar widget is a complete failure. It randomly removes some of the calendars that are synced and creates a duplicate of repeated tasks when they are marked as complete. The whole reason I subscribed to this app was because I needed to sync all my calendars and make my life easier by maintaining them all in one place and not miss any appointments or tasks. The app is useless if I can't rely on it to display and sync correctly. Fix the bugs and I'll reinstall and change to 5 stars.

I have used Any.do for quite a while, especially for shopping lists on my phone. After a recent update, I cannot find a way to add to any list I have. That was my original review after an update. The help center was great and after only 2 emails and a screenshot, I was able to add to my lists again. The update made the feature to add items to my lists have a different look but it all works well now that I know the new look.

The app looks great visually, and I really think the devs put a lot of time into it. But I'm not sure how it offers any real benefit over Google Calendar, considering the features are largely the same. Plus, this app still isn't available for the Samsung Galaxy Watch3. Truthfully, I would still be willing to pay $2.99 a month just to support the devs (the app really does look great), but there's no option to pay monthly, just one yearly price. If there was a monthly option, I'd likely subscribe.

A great app for keeping things straight! This is the only app I've ever paid for the premium, and it's worth it. It's great even without premium, but it makes remembering daily repetitive tasks much easier. I have trouble remembering things like that, or knowing if I've already done it. Only thing keeping me from putting 5 stars is that completed tasks have to be manually deleted after theyre marked complete, and reminders will randomly stop showing up. Maybe the update will fix the second one!

I've used this app to manage personal and work tasks for over four years with no trouble. Over the last few weeks, I've noticed that tasks which I've modified (by adding or removing words) are randomly defaulting to what was there previously. This morning I saw a task blink away and return as the previous version of the task (missing the words I'd added). I rely on my tasks being accurate and have never had this happen until recently. Any hope of a fix?

Confused. I'm not sure what happened and I'm glad I didn't have a long grocery list because I just had to transfer everything from my "Grocery List" to a new one so it would open like a normal list and not as a pop up. I don't understand why y'all thought that was a good idea but whatever. I've clicked everything I can think to click. "Convert to regular list" isn't an option that I've seen anywhere. Is that only in premium?

It suddenly quit syncing. I've tried logging off and back on again with no luck. When I try to do it manually it just already says that it was synced "just now"...even though none of the things I have added show up. Never had this problem before. If I can't get it resolved I will remove app and find something different. Very frustrating. Update: I did a FORCE STOP on the app, and it seems to be back to normal. It works for what I need (shopping list) but isn't the easiest for rearranging the list, and the advertisement at the bottom of the list is very annoying and makes rearranging the list even more difficult.

Long time user of this app, problem is it doesn't have a search feature. Or if it does I can't find it. Sometimes I forget where I filed my note or task (again longtime user) and then it takes me a while to go through all my files to figure out which title heading I put it under, but if it had a search feature I could quickly find it and get back to being productive. For this reason I gave it 4 stars because it has room for improvement.

It's a pretty good app, but there are a few issues. It doesn't sort tasks that occur on the same day by which task has it's reminder set for earlier in the day. Instead when I select sort by time, it orders tasks that occur the same day in a seemingly random order. For example, a 12PM task will be at the top but a 10AM task is at the bottom. Additionally, if there is a way to delete color tags, I have not found it. At some point a couple of my tags duplicated and now I can't delete the extras.

Clean, simple interface. Generally fast and easy to add things as I think of them. However.....I wish the app didn't think it was so smart. I find the auto-spelling annoying. Putting in 8-10 ft. electric cord under lists was automatically interpreted as August 10th. And the assumptions about categories for shopping lists is annoying. 5 different things to get a hardware store end up in 4 different categories. Changing the categories for shopping lists is not easy to manage (and why do they show up under Tasks at all?)

I've had this planner app for years. It just recently started bouncing back an entire year when I put new appts in. For example...I just put an appt in for May 11, 2024. After I saved it, the calendar jumped all the way back to May of 2023, and I had to manually scroll back to 2024. I know... first world problems, lol. But it would be nice if this could be corrected.

Missing one key feature that is a deal breaker for me. I MUST have the option to create recurring tasks based on date of completion. Ex: If I have a recurring task set up to complete every 10 days, but I actually go 15 days before completing it, I don't want to be reminded again in 5 days. I want the next due date to advance 10 days from whenever I last completed it. It's unfortunate because I love everything about this app, but won't subscribe to the paid version until this feature is added.

Pretty good app! I've been looking for something where I can make events and "check it off." I couldn't find anything else besides this one. The sync feature with Google calendar works great but it reverts back to April 28th and you have to scroll to preset day for whatever reason. Aside form the bugs it's actually just the app I was looking for!

Really nice todo list app,  love the web interface and notification features. Also the plan my day is a brilliant feature.  However for the more advanced users this software is lacking in features and overviews. Also found some weird behaviour when setting up recurring tasks.   For any novice users, you have a great app here. If you're looking for something on steroids, look at todoist.

1) It has a calendar feature but you can't customize the calendar events repetition as much as you can in google (can do daily but not 5 days a week all in one entry). 2) edit: figured the task sorting part out. Sort by time and collapse upcoming/tomorrow and it will just show your daily tasks. I like that. But it's still not worth paying for unless the calendar event customization is as good as Google's since that is free.

Clean, straight forward, and easy to use for me so it makes it more effective and likely that I'll continue using it. No distractions and helps me plan my day I really like being able to access it on both phones and computer too. Would like the sync updates between phone and desktop to be better / faster, hopefully that will improve soon. Would also like some additional functionality but that comes under premium.

Really good app that has helped me get much more organised! Just one change to make it perfect. When deleting an event from the calendar, pleeease add an option to "delete this and future events". At the moment there are only options to delete one or delete all. Sometimes I need to delete client appointments from then on, but need the others in the previous weeks for invoicing, etc. Would make my life much easier üòÖ

It's fast, easy to use, and I like how my repeated daily tasks only show up one day at a time and only shows up in the next day after I've completed the task the day prior. The moments feature makes daily planning a breeze, too. In terms of areas for improvement, I would like to see the Gmail zap integration fixed because it isn't working on my side. Also, for an auto-sort feature in my task lists so I don't have to keep refreshing it when I adjust the reminder times. Thanks. :)

So far, so good! I've been eyeing this app for quite a long time and I'm pretty satisfied so far! I'd just suggest two features: being able to see completed tasks on the calendar, without them showing up all the time unless you clear all of them! And I'd love to see more features with the tags, like being able to sort tasks by them and putting different "levels" on them. For instance, this tag has more priority than the others. Thanks for the hard work!

I love this app for keeping track of my homework, but I wish they would add some kind of timetable functionality for students. Also I think it's a bit poor that you have to pay for a subscription if you want to use the focus mode. In general the app is great, though, ideal for keeping track of everything I need to do, and it's great that I can set recurring reminders for orchestra, clubs etc.

I love this app and I am so glad that I have found it. I wish I had found it sooner, then I wouldn't have wasted my money on other apps! The only things I would like improved is: - preview of the tasks in the tags and my list view. - the box view for the tags to be colour coded. Instead of the text, the whole box is in the chosen colour. - Quicker synchronisation with windows Keep up the great work!

I really love this app. I find myself wanting to make tasks for myself about it. It has an incredibly clean UI and feels great to use. The only issue I have with it is the pricing model for the pro version. For 5 or 6- admittedly useful- features, there's a monthly subscription. Which personally I find to be ludicrous. I'd willingly pay a one time charge, but a monthly payment is just silly for this app.

It's a great app, but there are a couple small issues I think are essential to be improved. 1. If I accidentally click off of a task as I'm creating one (which is easily done when trying to scroll along to set a custom time for the reminder), it will go away and I have to re-create the whole task again. 2. When I snooze a task that's on repeat (I.E Portuguese word of the day), it resets the task and stops repeating it also.

1 week in. not bad. somewhat intuituve. I like this app so far for its thoughtful blend of simplicity and intuitive features that go beyond being a task list, & more into routine habits. some important features are hard to find or change after initial set up. my day planning activity 'anydo.moment': I could not find all week to modify... So, it was starting this important step at a difficult time of day to use. Many simmilar apps aim & claim to be useful but only achieve novelty.

I LOVED this app because it has a calendar and to-do list in one go. I can categorize my tasks and put subtasks below. But when I recently updated the app, no radio button to tick off for the subtasks. I handle a lot of tasks categorized. Plus the notes below the subtasks is not there anymore. You need to add more clicks. It was easy and organized. Now, in uninstalling. So sad, i thought I have found the app. Was about to go Premium to get the full benefits but uninstalling. üò¢

Very good app, simple and easy intuitive organization. The available free vs paid things are also very well balanced. The only thing I would change is giving it the ability to put tasks at a scheduled time. The task itself, not the notification, which is how it currently works. It makes it so you HAVE to have a notification if you want the task in the right place in the calendar.

Very nice. One thing lacking in this and all similar apps I've noticed: lack of customizeability. The semi-transparent widget is cool, maybe my favourite so far. But surely it's not such a stretch to allow custom colours and an opacity slider? Otherwise seems fine, apart from the ridiculous premium fee for features that exist on preinstalled apps. My web hosting is cheaper than this, come on guys.

Great tool. I use it every day. There's a bug, however, that's very annoying. I'm on Galaxy Note 9. When I move the items, there's 80% chance the item will loose previously assigned datetime and will be moved to the Someday list. It's very annoying and time consuming! This is the sorting mode by Time. Additionally, when I choose this mode, majority of items belonging to various lists, unfortunately, will not be sorted by date & time, so I'd have to move them manually... Please fix these issues
This is a great app which I use daily. It could be improved if able to export completed tasks with the task completion date.

Suggestions: - Make the tag colors the background of the task, and not just a small line under the task title. At least have this as an option. - The trees in the Focus mode are all the same no matter how quick or long you do a task. Add variety to this mode: trees/plants to choose from, other decorations, probably even animals or different landscapes. Add more music to choose from, too. I definitely love the look and feel of this app. I enjoy it better with Premium, though.
Lovin the app, I wish it has an "expert mode" so there would be more settings and options to organize my schedule
preferred original home screen more. I don't need anything with a lot of bells and whistles. Great tool, though. Use it every day

So far I think I like it. I wish there was a little more explanation of settings, and perhaps an easy way to set a task to a particular day without adding a reminder. Otherwise, I like that I can view my Google calendar in the same app as my tasks, and I love the way the task lists and grocery lists work.

A Great app.  Nice interface.  However, it's missing the ability to sync other tasks/todo list such as Google's, Microsoft Outlook, etc.  The company shows good support but is missing an official user-to-user support forum... a method for users to assist in helping each other.

I love this app! It has helped me become so much more productive and organized. Any time I think, "I should do ..." I just add it to my Any.do! [Would rate 5 stars, except I hate that the Upcoming list is automatically bumped up to Today after a period of time, and it also continuously logs me, which is not only cumbersome, but renders the widget useless for that time.]

I used to love this app, my wife and I both had subscriptions to premium. Through no direct fault of it's own though, I have to quit it because Google no longer supports third party lists in assistant and that is one of the biggest uses I had for premium. Without premium it doesn't do enough for us. Thanks for the generally good app, I hope folks who aren't tremendously tied into the Google ecosystem can keep you going strong!

Love this app because it does exactly what I need it to do (I use it for lists).. however, lately if, for example I need to pick up 2 cases of water and I put a 2, it immediately wants to change the date of the "task", and moves it on me. That's a little frustrating but otherwise the app is great.

Beautiful app. Used premium for a while, but I just could not get over subtasks not being visible. Having to click into a separate screen to view subtasks is way too annoying. Also difficult to use with the Eisenhower method. Make subtasks visible in the list, and I might come back from Nirvana HQ.

Best wunderlist replacement with one major flaw. As far as a to-do list app it is pretty decent and has what you would want. It is very tricky to figure out how to disable all of the random notifications this app sends you. That is my major complaint, but once you finally get it all disabled this app is decent. The layout is a little messy, but the smart grocery grouping is nice.

I had this app quite a while back and wrote to Anydo that it was imperative for them to make it re-orderable... Meaning if it is re-orderable, you can simply move the tasks easily up and down in their order. When I discovered Google Keep... It had that component, so I started using it and I have been happy with it.. But I took a look at Anydo again, and was amazed that aspect had not changed. Anydo is a good app, and I would give it five stars if not for that glaring problem

Real nice app. I like links to google calendar for events, reminders. Not sure about tasks. Have you guys thought about drag and drop between tasks and events? It'd be perfect for time blocking or scheduling tasks. Right now I use a zapier that takes new tasks in a specific list and lists them as 5 am on today's calendar. I'd like to drag them to certain times so my schedule doesn't fill up (shows time blocks as busy in Calendar). Thanks

I like the concept, but it doesn't work with how I use to do lists. I use them as a running list of things I need to get done within a general span of time. Something about putting a specific date for things to be done makes me procrastinate until the "due date" I've set, even if I give myself reasonable time to do it. I like the draw over that pops up when I use my phone for the first time in a day, but the due dates add an urgency that I use a calendar for. I know any.do is both, but still.

I've used Any.do for years, both paid and free. I love how you can prioritize tasks, and the daily review of tasks easily helps keep you on track. The calendar that shows events and tasks is great. Highly recommended! My only comment would be that I wish it was a bit more customizable in the free version. üòÄ

I absolutely love the Any.do app. I have a terrible memory, and this app is great with helping to remember all the things I have to do in a day. I also love that I can snooze tasks, and that it will remind me to make phone calls as needed. The only thing I dislike about it is that you have to pay for premium in order to set reminders based on location rather than time. Like I said, though, great app.

Love the app, but when I transferred it to a new phone, it prompted for a login, and I can't remember my password. Went to do a password reset, but my wifi security won't let me access the page from the link Any.do sent for the password reset. This is the first time that my wifi security has EVER rejected a link to a password change. That's really NOT cool. I refuse to override and risk my internet safety, so my lists are all lost. Get rid of the hacking/invasive code in the password reset link!
It has everything you can think of. Easy to use. Has widgets for home screen. Clean and smooth UI. Love it! The only bad thing about it is you have to pay for full app experience (that's why 4 stars)
good app sofar so good
It has everything you can think of. Easy to use. Has widgets for home screen. Clean and smooth UI. Love it! The only bad thing about it is you have to pay for full app experience (that's why 4 stars)
Really good app. Helps alot with planning.

Awesome app. I use this more than any other app. I've used it for years. I am a very task oriented person and me being able to create a separate list for my family members, work, etc. And setting alarms on when tasks need to be done is invaluable. Reduces stress in having to remember what I have to do and allows me to have more productive & happy days. Try it and you'll be glad you did.

I've tried several different list/to do apps and none are quite as versatile as Any.do. I love that I can integrate it with my Alexa and add things to my shopping list. I also love that I can share and collaborate lists with my husband. The only sightly buggy thing I've encountered is trying to move a new list, made at the bottom of my numerous lists, to the top. It'll often get stuck and pre-order however it likes. If I go back and try a second or third time, I can get it to move

i love any.do ive gotten 4 other people at least using it everyday! so convenient and easy to make lists add to different lists and i like the opportunity to share lists with my husband and we can check things off and they show up on both ends. i love the daily reminders that keep us from slacking off! amazing app! way better than the reminder app that comes with my samsung phone!

by far the BEST note app I have ever used the user interface is aesthetically pleasing and easy to grasp, the quick add to ur list button is reliable and unobtrusive, it allows you to integrate with calender and any other note taking app you may have been using before, u can separate the tasks and it automatically....nevermind just try it. it's fantastic! and that's just the free version. I haven't even tried the free trial yet. cool.

It's not just a callendar! It's an excellent electronic version of a planner! In the callendar section, type events for every day of the week or month! Type in the location of the event and it will synch with your GPS! In the task section make separate list such a grocery list or regular list of items or tasks you need! Pretty cool and usefully for success in school, work, and personal life!

This app is amazing. This is such a well put together app I had to get a subscription to support the developers. A couple suggestions: 1. Can we connect the calendar to Facebook events? 2. More themes and backgrounds 3. Continue to improve reminder/notification options and displays. I am a big person that loves to be reminded because I often times forget to do things

I absolutely love this app. I like having to do lists for myself but my calendar would often be over cluttered, or I would forget something I needed to do. I love the snooze option where it asks how long you want to snooze the reminder and ypu can set to an exact time and day easily. The unpaid option for this app is perfect for me.

After trying several different task app's, I came across Any.do for a few years ago. Since then I've have had no reason to switch. This app is easy, intuitive and customizable to fit my needs. From a development and maintenance POV, I have also found Any.do to be thoughtful in their updates for both mobile and desktop versions.

I need to use it more honestly, reluctant to purchase pro version of the app due to there being no set price. I would pay a one time fee for this to be my main planner. I use it on my phoen and on my laptop to plan ahead keep my days structured, grocery lists that i can send out to others, great overall app 10/10.. But I dont want to be on any more subscription services other than Netflix, Hulu, and Audible.

new user, so far so great! just started using and am on the premium trial period. already I think it will be worth the annual fee! I'm in love with the sorted grocery list that i can print or share with my husband. i also appreciate the "plan your day" that allows me to select which items in my to do list i want to accomplish today and which i want to postpone. integrating with my calendar is also very useful so that i can see my appointments, events, and to do list all in one place! AWESOME

Honestly, I struggle with most reminder apps because they make too easy to get rid of notifications. This app forces me to choose between checking something as done, snoozing the reminder for a duration of my choice, or a "focus" mode that goes into that tree planting focus app thing. I like that it forces me to make an active decision about whether I'm going to put something off or not.

I've only had this app for a short period of time and it's already made a HUGE difference in my day to day life. No more paper lists to obsess over, lose, or struggle to read because of my sloppy handwriting! I have a super hard time staying on track and getting things done, so this app is super helpful. It's user-friendly, it has a ton of helpful reminders and task/listing options, and it connects to my Google Assistant to do (and sync!) everything. Highly recommend!!

By far the best planning app out! I just have one issue. I happily outdid the premium yearly fee, but upgraded my phone the following month. When I uninstalled and installed on my new phone, it recognized me, email, even old tasks, but did not transfer plan. Can someone please help me with this. Thank you. Keep up the good work!

Love this app! This is the only app that lets me move items around on my lists, like moving unavailable grocery items to the bottom. I also like that my completed items stay with me if I want, like my packing list, so after a trip I can make all items active again for the next trip without having to think of everything again. And the completed items on the grocery list jog my memory for the next shopping trip. I just use the basic app and am very happy with it.

Started using this a long time ago, recently redownloaded after going through a period of not using any productivity apps and, returning to this app I love what they've done with it. The integrations to the calendar, the sub-task feature, the various categorization options, and the customizable any.do moment are all very useful and exactly what I was wanting from this type of an app. Basically it's good at what is does, and they update! It also had my old tasks, which was a good little chuckle.

I've tried nearly every other "to do" app available, and none of them compare to Any.do: even the paid ones. The feature that holds Any.do above the rest, in my opinion, is the unfailable reminder system. This app literally hijacks your screen to remind you to plan out your day or to complete a task. I'm sure not all would find this a necessity, but personally, a simple alarm just won't do. I benefit greatly from the forceful nature of this app. It's pretty amazing, actually. Good job!

Stopped working with Google Assistant. No notice of why. Literally my entire reason for using this app. I'm done. EDIT - My review was unfair. Their response here was measured, professional and appreciated. While I'm disappointed that I can no longer set Any.do tasks from my Google home ecosystem, this is Google's fault for discontinuing compatibility, not Any.do's. The fact that I'm so frustrated to lose Any.do integration speaks to the seamless, intuitive interface of their excellent app.

great app! unfortunately does not allow for notes about (or long descriptions of) sub-tasks, but everything else: tasks, topics, google calendar integration, etc. it's got everything to serve my needs in a very clean and visible UI. thank you for such an amazing app, definitely considering going pro once it becomes more integrated into my routine and I decide I need the extra features.

Amazing and very simple to use which is good for anyone with a busy schedule. Easy to Quickly put all plans for that day or as far ahead as you want. Jot down any reminder at anytime during the day in a few seconds or change anything already put in. Easy to share with anyone else if wanted. Easy to set up with any other calendar or app so it automatically saves in your to-do list. And quick, easy tips to help you with anything you need to know about the app. Love it!üíûüíØüíû

I love this app. It has so much functionality. Moreso than I even know! I really like that it is a hybrid task/to-do list with a working calendar so you can have your daily tasks but also put your appointments and meetings on the calendar in advance. So many others seem to be one or the other. Plus it prompts you each day with a "Plan Your Day" sequence which is a nice reminder what is needed that day. I wish adding new stuff was included in the prompt, but i can let that slide. Thanks creators!

I never write reviews or endorse products, but this one, I have to hand it to any.do -great job. It's always seemed like a no-brainer to me that some one build a planner, calendar, and to do list all in one with the added features of being able to pin in attachments to tasks (and hopefully calendar events in the future....?) with a killer widget (hope to see the "my lists" section end up as a widget option someday too!), and sleek interface, I don't know if I've ever nerded out so hard on an app.

Fantastic UI with near perfect integration with calendar. I would love the ability to make tasks with no due dates that do not show up in the "someday section." Things like my grocery list and books/movies to read I don't need a date for and don't want them in the way when I'm looking at date-specific tasks. Edit: thanks for the reply! Not sure if I am missing this somewhere, but I would love to see the ability to comment on tasks. Would really help with communication with my team. Thanks!

I reinstalled this program and now it works great. I think there's a bug when importing from Google calendar. (I submitted logs). Update- I decided against using this, the calendar integration is not as good as I had hoped. I can use Google calendar with better functionality for my purposes. I don't need separate lists, what I need is the ability to easily color code calendar entries and to add reminders. YMMV.

App is user friendly and does what is needed, and more, without being complicated. I've never had any issues with this app, and I've used it for several years via different Samsung phones. Being able to arrange items and list catagories is great. Being able to easily share a list is nice. I love that I can easily add and view notes on any chosen item. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed with Any.do. The app backs up data, as well, so I've never lost existing info when changing phones.

After trying literally every cal app on the app store this is the one. I've used Any.do a few times over the years but it was never quite right. This time they nailed it. It's a super simple UI but has everything you need without being annoying or overbearing. Very simple to use & figure out. 15 mins messing with it & I'm fully ready to go. I transferred all my biz meetings, personal sched. etc. In minutes. Definitely give it a try, even if you have before. It's totally worth it.

Love this app. I like to utilize lists to keep myself organized as well as to feel the small accomplishments. (Even on days when you can't get through everything it's nice to see the progress you're making) I use it for groceries, to do lists, tasks that will help reach a short/longterm goal, work to do lists, and more. It's great that you can have more than one list, set reminders, attach a file, add notes or a tag with priority. It's the best app I've found.

As someone who really does a bad job making to do lists, this app really makes making them a breeze. Traditionally I don't make lists, or planners, etc because of the overhead in doing so; I'd rather spend that time doing the things I know I need to do. For a while now I've tried to find an app that would change that, that would make planning a breeze. After trying SEVERAL planning/TODO apps, this one quickly rose to the top. The interface is clean and simple and adding tasks takes no time at all - literally seconds. And above all, the Any Do moments make re-organanizing those tasks VERY simple and constantly keeps you on top of everything but in a non-intrusive way. Keep up the great work!

Anydo keeps priorities in front of you, allows you to continually add, prioritize, delegate, move, and adjust tasks, thoughts, reminders, events, etc. in whatever way makes sense to you. It's motivating to check tasks off as you go through the day. It can be as precise or as relaxed as you set it to be. It works best for me by giving me a place to capture and instantly prioritize and plan things as they pop up. I love that it keeps me accountable and motivated without forcing a rigid schedule.

Truly the best planning app! I was looking for a planning app with widgets that can change their size. Was harder than I thought! I love that you can see everythubg even in the smallest widget. That was very important to me. What I also like is that you can see all your tasks in a time line sorted by time. This way I don't miss anything. Subtasks and notes are helpful. I like the separate feature for the shopping list! This app is super flexible and intuitive!

Its great, doing the job it need to. But i wish the homescreen widget is more simpler. I feel there is a lot of text, boxes. I wish it can replace the texts calendar, tasks, add task to some simple icons. Like putting a "+" sign for add task text on the widget and then giving the mic icon on the input field instead having it prior. Also, showing the tasks just for that day and removing the tomorrow, upcoming, someday things in the widget. Just my opinion, to have the widget simple.

This app is really cool. one feature I would really appreciate is if you could allow events to be completed, or allow tasks to have durations/end times. A common problem I have is a task has a specific time and duration, but sometimes I don't get around to it at the exact time so I would like it to only be completed when I actually manually mark it off.

This app is awesome! I'm using the bare bones version (not the premium) and signed in on all my devices, laptop, tablet and phone. I make/update my lists on the PC at home, I then reach into my pocket at the pharmacy, supermarket or while running errands and don't arrive back home kicking myself because I forgot something and now have to waste precious time and energy on another trip. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

VERY EASY TO USE!!!! I have ADD and this app has greatly assisted me in keeping on task and completing task! There is no greater feeling than looking at all the task I have completed throughout the day. It motivates me to keep going and decreases distractions. I have added it to my daughter's phone who shares my disorder. The groccery list is awesome also. I love how it breaks items into categories.

Eye candy to do list without bells and whistles. Workflow based on reminders, as for me, I wish to have a "my day" feature as in Microsoft to do. Best of all I love sync - it really takes seconds to syncronise 'done' tasks even with aliases. Also planning a day is a great feature, but it would be brilliant if it cover some tasks with no due date, or tasks that have been aded for a long time ago and not executed. And after all pricing is the most democratic among same apps.
Good tracker. My only suggestion will be to be able to sync the completed task in a list and keep a note. currently, the completed task vanish from the list

Great Ap to organize your day. The free version is good but I upgraded to the paid version. Worth the couple bucks a month to stay organized. I always put reminders on my calendar and have a handwritten planner that I use for really busy weeks. This ap is great though it keeps all those reminders out of your google calendar so you can see your appointments at a glance but then it adds your calendar to your reminders on this ap. My favorite thing about this ap is it has a Plan your day feature.

My FAVORITE task app...and I have the free version! Both the mobile and desktop versions are clean and sync flawlessly. Also love the separations of "Today," "Tomorrow," "Upcoming," and "Someday." It's so easy to get lost with planners and lists that require too much detail. This system let's you type in the thesis statement of your task and rearrange it as your day or week goes. I won't be needing any other task app (Alexa, Google, ect.) again.

Loved wunderlist and was disappointed when I heard it was being sundown. This app kind of grew on me and now I like it. I just need something that easily let's me group and name my different lists and this easily does that. Widget and interface are great. Hate the post it note style apps. Brower version is great. Would be better if it worked with Google assistant, but that's probably not Microsoft's fault.

I've used multiple productivity apps that are supposed with a focus on to do lists. And this one is simply THE BEST for me. I actually feel like clicking the app and planning out my entire day. I love how simple it is with not too much overwhelming features which was a big thing for me. I would gladly choose this app, any day and any time over any others.

This app has redefined how I live my life. It has made me much more organized, and I get so much more done! I use it to remind me of daily activities, work projects, house projects, "do sometime" projects, phone calls, bills...everything! I love that you can snooze an activity or easily change the time when it pops up. Also love that you can color code different types of activities. Most used app on my phone!

I love using any.do for organizing all my tasks! I use it as a master task list. While I don't use it as a daily to do, it's a good organizer and reference of all my tasks. This helps me plan tasks as far as 6-12 months. The ability to make lists and tag tasks helps me to run searches and find things easier. Thank you!

Love this app! Comes with a widget function so I can access and plan my day right from the homepage, not to mention you can customise the widget to fit with the style of your homescreen. Favourite feature is that the widget displays all the dates in a month along with any given day's tasks right below at the same time, so I dont have to switch back & forth. It syncs with Google Calendar events for a seamless experience. Its free version is powerful and already satisfies most my planning needs.

Love it! After the last 1 1/2 months of trying both Any.do and Microsoft To Do, I have finally settled on my Wunderlist replacement. Any.do is the winner by a landslide.
