It would give us option to add new task in a list if we want or to select already existing tasks in list. Now what we have to do is go out of my day panel, Search for the task, open it and then add it to my day - long process which can be made more fluid as above.

This ap is a lifesaver! The only thing that would make it perfect is being able to have a task recurring before the due date, as a reminder to work on it each day/week. once the due date is put in, it doesn't show up in your list until it's due.

It would be nice if there were goals that the tasks could be related to. I don't need the business version of 365 just yet, so buying it just to get planner is not in the cards right now. So, having a way in todo to connect my tasks to my goals would be nice. That being said the app works well.
One of the best to do list app Add priorities to task
My laptop sometimes doesn't sync with my phone
good really help me
It would be great if the app could also provide a sub-tasks feature. Where a major task can be broken down into smaller ones over separate dates to mark the progress.
good
Handy but it's weird that you get one notification for the task, and another that there are tasks due. Seems redundant.
does what you expect it to
Seems OK. Early days yet so will let you know.
Enhanced it and give it more teamwork feature
Great app, but id like to have it on my watch as well

Love this app. It helps me organize my life, both at home and at work. I only have one suggestion. I live entirely in the Planned section and wish I could reorder the items within the list for a day. For now, I have to use numbers or exclamation points to cause items to sort at the top.

Mostly great, but unable to recover deleted items. If you accidentally delete a task or entire list, it's effectively irrecoverable. The standing advice from Microsoft is to go into your Outlook (???) and restore the items in your Deleted Items folder. However, only a subset of what I deleted was there and restoring had no effect in the To-Do app. Pretty silly data handling. The other features in the app are good and offer more organizational tools than other task lists at least.
simple and effective
good üëçüòä specially the planned list I like it
The app is good overall. The only issue I face is that the widget on homescreen gets stuck often. Please try and fix that

I use this app for personal reminders and my wife and I share it for a grocery list. The only improvement I would add would be an "undo last" option, as sometimes I hit the complete circle by mistake and then panic as the reminder has disappeared and it is very difficult to find out what it even was.
overall good and when opening the app take some time or slow to open
some fuctionalities missing. templates and then som general ui stuff just a bit off. but great overall

Love this app. It helps me organize my life, both at home and at work. I only have one suggestion. I live entirely in the Planned section and wish I could reorder the items within the list for a day. For now, I have to use numbers or exclamation points to cause items to sort at the top.
A very good app. if they add a calender view and subtask feature in adding tasks it will be best

This ap is a lifesaver! The only thing that would make it perfect is being able to have a task recurring before the due date, as a reminder to work on it each day/week. once the due date is put in, it doesn't show up in your list until it's due.
Estimated time and actual time taken would be a nice addition to measure productivity.
I need hourly reminders
Nice little app. Syncs well with desktop. I would like to see the ability to sort items by time as well as date, or at least some way to order them within the same day.

The app is absolutely great! It helps me keep my activities on track and set reminders. I would have given a 5 star but it has a slight bug - when I set a customised background, it goes blank after a couple of days. It's really annoying, I downloaded this app because it allowed me to customise my wallpaper but this bug is just defeating the purpose.
would be nice if it outlook calendar would sync with To Do.
I rarely gove 5 points.

While adding tasks in my day panel, the plus button should also search existing tasks in various lists which gives the option to add tasks directly from the already made lists. It would give us option to add new task in a list if we want or to select already existing tasks in list. Now what we have to do is go out of my day panel, Search for the task, open it and then add it to my day - long process which can be made more fluid as above.
Sometimes tasks are not displayed
Great experience ‚ù§Ô∏è & a tip add notes option
It's been very helpful for past few years. There are some short comings, but I see the effort in improving the app with each iteration
Love the simplicity.
Works well, only once the list didn't sync
need to add feedback. when we add pictures to the list we can't see them. only link is seen. change this.
Very helpful and efficient.
Very good organizer

I use this app for personal reminders and my wife and I share it for a grocery list. The only improvement I would add would be an "undo last" option, as sometimes I hit the complete circle by mistake and then panic as the reminder has disappeared and it is very difficult to find out what it even was.

The app is absolutely great! It helps me keep my activities on track and set reminders. I would have given a 5 star but it has a slight bug - when I set a customised background, it goes blank after a couple of days. It's really annoying, I downloaded this app because it allowed me to customise my wallpaper but this bug is just defeating the purpose.

I liked Wunderlist much better. It was easier to use, and more streamlined. Microsoft bought it and turned it into this To Do app, and dropped some features, and changed others, and it's not the help to me that it once was. The only reason that they would do that, in my opinion, is that they didn't like having competition, especially when it was better than what they offered. So, IMHO, they bought it and changed it into this mediocre app that has their name on it. Disappointing.

I have only had this app for a few days. The more I search for solutions the more I find. This is a great app, but it needs a way to give each task a sortable priority number. I love the My Day page which gives me the most important subset of all my tasks. I never put more than 5 things there. If I complete them before the end of the day, I add more. One of my favorite features is the ability to hide completed tasks. The biggest fault is I haven't found a tutorial for all the features.

I love it, i use it to help me remember small tasks I need for school and grabing stuff at the store. My only downside is I wish there where more complex customization. Like putting a downloaded pic into the background instead of the small selection they have. Or a way for it to refresh the tasks in the entire list, instead of going through all of them and setting times to remind you.

Best ToDoList app I've seen, in fact, this is the only Microsoft app I enjoy using (for the most part.) However, the reminders portion could use some work. The main problem with reminders is: it doesn't give you any indication of whether you set it at 8AM or 8PM! AM/PM is non-existent, only "8:00." So, if you set a reminder for "8:00," you won't know if it'll remind you at 8AM or 8PM! Please fix this, as it's very confusing.

Excellent to-do list application. Syncs reliably and allows me to add and check off tasks from my phone or my computer easily. The only feature lacking is the ability to assign a time of day, not just a due date, to a task. Sometimes I have tasks that need to be done by a certain time (e.g. online assignments) and it would help if they could be organized automatically in order of time of day they are due on a particular day. Other than that, no complaints at all! 10/10 would recommend.

Update: Developer responded and fixed the issue. Pretty sad they don't QA their updates for issues like this Original Review (2 stars): I used to enjoy this app a lot. Now, every damn update turns back on the "auto suggestion" feature which I have to turn off for EVERY LIST EVERY TIME. This is out of control. I will be searching for a new to do list app that actually remembers my preferences. Really ridiculous that this is an ongoing issue.

I came from Wunderlist and was skeptical, but I have really enjoyed this app so far, the only improvement that I would like to see is that when you show completed that the items be in order of how you completed them with the most recent on top. There doesn't seem to be any order to it at this point. Also, there doesn't seem to be any settings to adjust this.

My favorite app! I use this to help me remember EVERYTHING I need to do. Unfortunately, though, the most recent update has caused the notifications to come through blank. It used to tell me what my task was in the notification but now I have to go into the app to see what the task is. Kind of annoying. Can this be fixed? I can send you screenshots if you want to see what I'm seeing.

So far, I really like the app and how fast everything updates between my different devices. I would really like it if the widget would show the scheduled due date next to the task. Also, it would be nice if scheduled tasks would show in the My Day screen for that day automatically instead of manually placing them there. The custom repeat option for monthly should also give you the option of either date or day of week. Other than that, it's pretty good.

Update: from 1 star to 4 stars. One more thing in my book that needs to be fixed, it's gotta play nice with Google calendar. I would like to see things due on my calendar. üëçüèº Thank you for updating. Doing good. Original post : ARG!!!! I'm sooooo annoyed with this app! Clicking the star should throw the item to the top of the list! Adding items should be added to the TOP of the list! FIX THIS APP PLEASE!!! üôèüèº

It is great, unlike others: items in list can be checked off or deleted. google app "TASKS" only allows list items to deleted. A feature to group a list of items does NOT WORK. The group can be created but no list can be assigned by "tap or drag" list. no list are presented, the android Galaxy note 20 screen just flashes!! I like the interface and will contine to use it tilll MS fixes this bug.

So, this is generally a great app, however there is room for improvement. Within app, you cant search any one specific list or list grouping. You have to back out to the main dashboard to be able to search, which searches within all lists. Unlike other similar apps, you can only have a bulleted list. I would love the addition of the option to also create notes vs. only lists. Also has great reminder features for one time and recurring reminders.

Fantastic task list. They took the best of Wunderlist and improved on it. The only thing I'd like to see is a change in the default reschedule options. It always provided the same options that I really use. I'd love it to earn from my previous rescheduling. It would save a lot of clicks.

The app does not have the same features like Microsoft Outlook tasks does. Setting due dates and reminders takes a few extra steps, like selecting 'Add to today' for the task to show on the day's agenda. Also, the app does not sort by due date past 'tomorrow'. On the plus side, it does include flagged emails which is very useful.

I like using this app. It helps me keep track of longer term goals. BUT... I HATE this new look. No need for it. I liked it the way it was. Stick to keeping it bug free, don't mess with the interface. Want the plain white background back and the colored band just at the top.

Would love to be able to sync to the calendar and pre-configure my day ahead of time. Other than that, I love the app and how it connects/syncs to the computer. It has helped me immensely in keeping track of my life, making sure I don't leave anything behind. I really appreciate being able to add quick tasks and being able to set reminders for myself.

This app is great but is missing some user experience features that I feel would make it a lot better. I love this app because it integrates so well with the Microsoft launcher. I really liked the old Google now and Microsoft launcher has something that I feel is fairly close to that with its at a glance screen. This app powers the tasks list that goes on that screen and it would be nice if it was just a little more user-friendly, such as automatically adding new tasks for my day.

Never thought the day would come where I would say Microsoft To Do is the best task app. PROS: PINNED REMINDERS, shared links work flawlessly, my day, excellent email integration if you use Outlook, less glitches compared to Todoist and Any Do. CONS: no secondary label management, no way to move an open task to another list, Smart dates do not work on Android, reminders do not have a reschedule option. BOTTOM LINE: If reminders are the most important feature for you than look no further.

After using the now defunct wunderlist for quite some time, I was curious to see if another app could work as well. "To Do" has pleasantly surprised me. If I could change anything it would be to have more options when comes to arranging items within a list. I'd love to be able to arrange completed items one way, and the uncompleted items another way.

I really like the "skip to current task" option in the app and some of the more recent updates like customizable background images. So far, this app is the one that works the best for me overall because I don't necessarily want detailed tracking stats. I just usually want to know what's next and have somewhere to store undated to-do items too, and it's convenient because I use Microsoft Office products on PC. I also like using just one app for to-do errands AND household chores.

As is typical for Microsoft, they took over a wonderful app in Wunderlist, screw it up, and jam it down the throat of their customers. The MS To Do List is harder to use than Wunderlist and lost some features that made it convenient to manage your tasks. I am convinced MS programmers must never use their own products. Follow up: I am glad Microsoft listened to its users. They actually emailed me back and fixed some of the issues that I and others have complained. Now I am using To Do and happy.

I love this so far and I am recommending it above Google Keep, which has been my go to previously. I have been trying more Microsoft products since switching to Office365 for work. please add the following features for a five star review: -annual reoccurrence of tasks (up to monthly is available) -import via Excel list or similar, ideally with multiple fields (such as deadline) -cross functional with OneNote

This is a useful app. My wife and I use this to track things we do both individually and together. One shared use is a grocery list. Whenever I find myself making an unplanned stop at a store, I text her and say, "At grocery store. Need anything? Update grocery list." She adds things using the app on her phone and, because that list is shared, they show up on mine. One thing I don't like is that search only works from the top level. I want to be able to search within a list as well.

The app itself is good for computer. For the phone is too much space and too much battery waisted. I wish, that this app will have phone compatible app, that can connect to the computer, without making battery crazy. I uninstalled it from my phone because it takes too much battery, and continue to use it in computer standard. Thank you.

I love this app, so far. I use it for my shopping lists, to do lists, scheduling, and other organizational needs. I am pleased that I can sync with my email, other devices, and calendar. I would love to be able to give it a full five üåü, but I can't. There's no way to delete a list that's been copied to another heading without deleting that list as well. List also sync up, apparently. Also, once a list is deleted, there's no way to bring it back; it's gone forever. Otherwise, great app!

Needs one thing that Wunderlist had: Grouping! As someone with clients, I want to group clients under a label or folder (or similar) structure. For instance, say I have clients for Web Design and for Video Production‚ÄîI'd like to group the clients for each service (in my case) under a collapsible label/folder to make sifting through client tasks a bit less cumbersome (for real, I have a list for each client and am at around 50 client lists so far...it's a lot to sift through as a straight top-down list in the navigation pane). Also, the ability to manage/be logged into more than 1 account would be great in instances where I use To Do for business but also when I use it for personal tasks shared with my significant other. Please consider!

Very nice app. Almost as good as Apple üòÅ. Would be nice if I could schedule task on calendar. But great that I can have on phone and laptop. Dumped other apps that do more for this simple straight forward app that allows me to capture stream of consciousness things I need to do like reschedule doctor apt. Got rid of paper tablet on my desk in favor of this.

I converted from Wunderlist to the Microsoft To Do and the transition has been quite easy. I really loved Wunderlist, but this app mirrors many of the functions, and particularly the ones I use most, for lists and list sharing. The performance has been consistent and easy to use. I'm very glad the Wunderlist/ now Microsoft team was able to model To Do as closely as possible to the excellent Wunderlist app, plus add some new features. I definitely recommend it. Thanks for all your hard work. PG

Update 02/08/2022: Still use the app every day and love it. There seems to be a bug that crept in during one of the updates. If I go back into a note that I previously created within a task, it becomes almost impossible to edit that note. The screen starts adding blank lines. As this happens, I can no longer see the text from my note (it has moved up...the app is automatically adding returns). A wonderful, uncluttered app to remind me of things I want to get done; today, tomorrow or next month.

I really like this app. It's great for helping me to stay organized. My only complaint is that quite frequently, the alarm doesn't remind me when it's supposed to (my 6:45 task reminder sometimes doesn't alert me until 6:50 or 7 or sometimes not at all). Hopefully this will get fixed soon. Otherwise, it is a great app.

I use it for my grocery list. Now the completed items are moved to the bottom. I kind of like that except for the order the completed items are in. I need them to stay in alphabetical order so I can easily find items. It's so aggrevating to skim back and forth looking for something that I need to uncheck. Please fix! Update: They fixed the sort for completed tasks. Very nice now. Thank you!

So far it has been everything that I have been wanting in a to-do list. I have had a few issues with it saying there have been some activities that have breached the user agreement (I barely used it two days) and it blocked my account for about 24 hours. But other than that, it has been wonderful so far. Very easy to use and add whatever you want and what I really like is reminders! It actually works when you ask to be reminded of a task or bunch of tasks. Very happy with app, for now.

One critcism: To-Do doesn't inherently have a recycling bin. Once you delete a task or list, the only way to restore it is apparently through Outlook, but I couldn't get that to work. Pretty big flaw imo. Otherwise, a very tidy and useful app with most features that I need, including sub-tasks, tags, and a widget.

Update 10.13.2021: 2 more stars earned. The app has improved a great deal. Original review: I might go a day or more with no notifications coming through before I notice, then begrudgingly sign out, force stop, clear cache and storage before re-signing in and just hoping it works. Problem is, a test task doesn't solve the problem; have to wait for an old task to run to actually see.

PLEASE add the option of adding tasks to the top instead of forcing them to the bottom. That's the only thing stopping me from using the app. Edit: I just heard you're killing off Wunderlist for good in May of 2020. I know I'm just one person, but I'll be jumping ship if such a simple improvement isn't made. Edit again: 3/27, and you did an update. But why in the world would you give iOS the "add tasks to the top" feature but NOT Android? Come on, please?? Edit 4/15: You did it. THANK YOU!

Good basic list maker. There were many updates made since its inception and I look forward to what lies ahead. It is missing the ability to organize your lists and folders alphabetically. Also it's odd that when I'm moving a list, it gives me all the other lists instead of the folder. I'm sure this will be corrected soon.

Generally, I enjoy this app. I used Wunderlist before it was bought by MS and rolled into To Do. The main complaint I have is that when you mark an item as "Important" it puts it into a single database with all of the other items from the other categories that are also marked as Important. With Wunderlist, you could have a separate "important" list for each category. Now, it just dumps all of the important items into one list which is really annoying because it seems like a simple fix.

Really helps manage whats important. Im able to see items stared, flagged and with due dates easily and intuitevely from my complex, and extensive files in tasks and emails. I can manage them from my phone or computer and integrates well with Outlook . My only wish is to be able to schedule any of these items with a right click send to calendar feature to support scheduling the day / week and hours to be devoted.

This app is just what I needed in my life! I tend to make many lists and they eventually become disorganized or revisited months later. To Do helps me quickly jot things down, keep me organized, and include other snippets of info like deadlines, notes, etc. I agree with others that I would love to have text formatting or bullets options.

Great app, just recently started using it. One suggestion please, on the widget for the homescreen, is it possible to give us the option to choose whether to always SHOW any tasks we've created all the time UNTIL the day of its completion and then it disappears, OR, the task stays hidden in that widget UNTIL its due date and then it appears in the widget. I create some tasks on the daily as a reminder and I also have a weekly reminder and that can clutter up real fast if one task doesn't hide.

Useful for quick reminders. But needs some basic improvements. Need a time zone. Due date/time and reminder date/time sounds not be 2 separate setting process. Yes there needs to be both but streamline the setting. Maybe do a default reminder preset-able based on due date. Google calendar does that. Preset reminders would be nice too. Additionally snooze settings etc.

Pretty good for quick reminders and to do lists. Some of the features aren't very intuitive especially the my day feature. Also better integration with outlook would be nice. Like if I made a task with a due date it would be cool to have the option for it to appear on my outlook calendar. Otherwise solid app and my go to

Didn't want to switch over on principle, but after trying a couple different list apps, this really is a proper successor to Wunderlist. Can't give a full 5 stars because I don't use the app to its fullest (and didn't Wunderlist either) so I can't speak to total feature functionality, but for what I do need it works perfectly. Widget is great as well

It's so useful! My husband and I can collaborate on the grocery list, household to-do's, baby name ideas and more! Minus one star for the less than intuitive way of deleting items and lists, and it would be neat to be able to have subcategories within lists (i.e. separating the grocery list by department).

It's a great app and very collaborative. I would like to see the option to set your reminder for whatever time you choose (day, hour, and minute) and a "location based" reminder would be excellent (i.e. "remind me when I arrive at: example address"). Still excellent and handy, though! I avidly appreciate the Microsoft family of products! Thank you MS Team

It's good. A great way to remember what I have to get done in a day and have to get done by certain deadlines. A pretty streamlined featureset that doesn't get in the way when you want to add tasks or collaborate with multiple people. However I can't find a way to delete completed tasks automatically. I'm sure it exists, but it's not exactly clear how to achieve this. I swear, it used to be a feature.

There is a problem with setting recurring reminders. Even if I add them to my day. A setting that would allow repeating reminders without having to set a due date would be great and the very likely make the feature work (as it currently doesn't). The other problem is notifications. I've set appointments and other events and I don't get prompted with anything. Other than that the app works as intended.

Been using this app for 5 years now. Best app for checking my assignment lists. Love the design as I can customise my own background hence it has been a great help in keeping up my motivation to come back for my assignment. No adds disturbing or money charges. However, one thing that I would like it to improve is that I hope it has a feature where I can move a whole category list to another category list instead of just on of it , else it will be too slow for efficiency as I need to scroll alot

Available on all platforms and systems. Simple and Intuitive. I use it many times a day, often many times an hour. I use ToDo to enter and reorder tasks that do not need dates. I am disappointed the current android release clutters the new task name with a date field. This spoils To Do, making it like a project management app. The date field should be a setting option.

I've tried several to do apps and for me this is the best. Can create several lists to keep organized. I like that it syncs among my different devices and I can add things to shared lists with my family. The most important thing is that I can manually arrange tasks in any order, except in My Day. I give it 4 stars, the only thing this app needs is the ability to move anything marked with due date of today to the My Day List automatically and to sort by time due as well as due date.

UPDATE 2: Microsoft may have fixed the issue below. I have not seen the auto suggestion prompt again. UPDATE 1: Microsoft is doing their best to ruin this app. They enable auto suggestion frequently now and still do not allow us to permanently disable it. ORIGINAL: Was much better before Microsoft took over. I turn off the auto suggestion feature, but Microsoft apparently thinks I need it, so they turn it back on every so often. They need to allow users to permanently turn that feature OFF.

the app is great. I would like to see it able to interface more with the Outlook calendar. Also, it would be nice to be able to insert some text notes right on the face of the overall list itself. it would also be nice to be able to move items quickly from one list to the other list. But this is still a very functional program and I am enjoying it very much.

New user. Love dark theme (on widget too!) and that you can voice command Google Assistant to "add note", to populate task list. Also able to add items via tasks widget. Edit by tapping task on widget, opens handy popup with options to mark done or delete, set reminders, star. Looking forward to cool updates. Color coding would be great. Using on Android 9. Did not use Wunderlist.

I love it. very simple and lovely interface, there are two reasons that I gave 4 stars; 1) I wish you add some more view such as week and month of calendar. 2) when I add an event to my outlookCal, then it automaticalky appears in my To Do List. (But currently it doesn't and I have to add tasks or events again in To Do List)

This app is so helpful in managing my business and home responsibilities in one spot. I love that I no longer need multiple apps to manage tasks, and it's synced with my laptop so I'm not glued to my computer just to access my to-do list! There reminder feature is nice too for those really important tasks. I would like the option to create My List for the next day before midnight but that's something I can work around.

With the latest version, the app has become more like Wunderlist (given that Microsoft bought Winderlist it's no surprise). I love the new features like themes and synching across devices. I would like the ability to view all my tasks in all my folders at once tho without having them under My Day. Still the app has come a long way!

Overall, I like the app. You can set daily medication reminders or reminders for things every other day, etc. I have some minor quibbles like it defaults to My Day but it doesn't show what I already planned. So I'd want it to do that or give me the ability to make "Planned" my default view.

I migrated to this app a few months ago from Wunderlist which I absolutely loved! Im still getting used to this version and the Microsoft integration as I have been a GSuite user for a few years now. While I love this app I took one star for the MyDay list. I get the developers want you to be more intentional BUT I plan my day the night before so this list is useless to me. And with the due dates not auto loading in it also makes it difficult. Nice thought but does not work for night planners.

The best most flexible to-do app I've ever used, and no adware. However, a defect has recently crept in. If you have a recurring daily task, you can't set the due date to "today". It briefly flashes today & then changes to tomorrow. Happens on all platforms. Fix it and it'll be 5 stars again. I love this app. I can't believe it's from Microsoft. This one is really for customers, not just for them. See my Windows version review for more "praise".

Love the app but have a few suggestions to make it even better. Have scheduled todo items show up on the Outlook calendar app; This would be awesome!! Have an option to hide certain lists from "my day". I have some lists I use as filler projects when there's free time and I don't want them taking priority over other necessary items I haven't scheduled yet. Thank you for a great app thus far!

I used to Love it, but now as of Jan 2021 it's taking 2 pages for what used to be 1/2 page?! It's now putting my ingredient (grocery list) and then a new line, then the check box by itself and then a new line again... grrr, frustrating! I don't see a fix for this either. This has been my 'go to' app for lists forever üëç Very easy to use

Near identical usability to the outgoing Wunderlist app. I do wish that there was an option to save as a draft or prompt to ask if I really want to exit the quick add of a task. If I'm not careful, I can lose a lot of text description of a task by dismissing a keyboard. That would draw a 5 star rating from me.

i have been using microsoft to-do list for some months now. The app is really useful and intuitive. phone and desktop access to a clean UI. It is part of my daily routine and helps me organize business and personal projects. Ideally the export feature would be easier to use.

I love this app! Works great! Only two update requests.... 1. Allow longer text for information entry 2. When we have an item that repeats, such weekly, make it now adjust next repeat date to one week from date completed. Not one week from due date originally set. If the task is late for completion. Or at least have the app ask if it should adjust next repeat
Hello Developers Friends , Can you please add the priority number option in Task Sorting & This option may be optional for user So that we can easy find out priority task Thanks
There need more options
nice app, I wish you could customize your lists a bit better though in terms of background and color code. but otherwise it's just a regular app that syncs your todo lists across your devices

With improvements over the last year, this is now become the full full-blooded tasks app many of us have long hoped that it would be. It has everything important that was in Wunderlist, plus a new task model that I have found, over the last couple of years, has reshaped my thinking and actions to make me more effective. I wish it had voice assistant integration and plugged into my Outlook app calendar, both options that exist with Wunderlist but for some reason not yet with To Do.

This has turned out to be a pretty great app! I love the My Day feature. Wishlist: 1. overdue items shown on the Today list, 2. in Wunderlist I could highlight an item when the keyboard was up, but here I have to close the keyboard first, then highlight (that extra step is a distraction and a little annoying), 3. ability to hide Flagged Email list when empty, like you can with the other Smart lists. Otherwise, perfect. Thanks!

My one problem with ToDo was that new irems were added at the bottom of the list instead of at the top because my lists are often hundreds of items long in reverse chronalogical order. At some point it started putting new entries at the top. I then discovered a setting that chooses whether new entries are added at the top or the bottom. I assume that this setting is new, since I had not found that setting at the time it changed. I now really like this app. Now a good replacement for Wunderlist.

This is truly a great app, from my experience. Been looking for this type of functionality and interface for two years. Aesthetically pleasing and user friendly. Have uninstalled so many apps like this before finding this one. A great planner, which I created a shortcut on my phone for, then easy folders set up for my business and writing. A+ grade.

I have just started using this app but so far I am pleased. Microsoft Outlook Tasks is a full featured To-do application that has been time tested for years. This app integrates with Outlook Tasks so you can use it as the front end for tasks you have entered in Outlook. The app doesn't have all of the features of Outlook Tasks for creating new tasks but it provides a list of your Outlook tasks that run your day by. Anyone who is an MS Office 365 subscriber should especially consider using this

It's great! I have discovered that this app has almost everything I need. Alarms for med's, for appointments. Schedule tasks once or daily. I try not to schedule too many daily tasks though, because once the daily tasks are complete and on repeat, the tasks get sent to the bottom of the app when completed. Every single task daily must be deleted individually by swiping to the left. It would be really nice if we could delete the completed tasks all at once. The gmail sync would be great!

love this app. nice to look at. syncs across all my devices, apple, microsoft, android. I would like to see widget customization that would be the very last thing to make this app perfect! atleast give us some transparency on the widgets, or more customized options! please! my favorite device for this app is my Note 9, which is great because this phone was designed for tasks and note taking, and a plethora of those accompanying apps. The nicest app for this and syncs very well across the board.

I have an issue keeping organized and remembering to do things. My experience with this app started out not very great but by my own design. Now that i put things in it with reminders and due dates set right away, it's been super helpful. I just have to put the thing i need to do in it as soon as i realize it needs to be done. I would suggest any sort of reminder app for people who struggle keeping their goals and due dates in their head, like myself.

I use it everyday and completely love it. It is very simplistic to use and understand, even for older folks like me! If I'm putting together a list of projects I want to get done; it's allows me to take a picture or a screenshot, then title and save it by Category! Extremely helpful for users of all age groups; and with the Backup & Sync features you just can't go wrong with this app!

I was nervous about the switch from Wunderlist to Microsoft To Do, but I'm glad my pessimism about it was proven wrong. I like the interface design on the desktop and so far using it on Android is actually just as good if not better than Wunderlist. I'm seeing a lot of outdated reviews regarding being able to add tasks to bottom or top - those are outdated. You can switch between the two. As long as nothing wonky is added or changed, MTD will turn out to be a successful replacement.

On the non-technical note, its a great app. You can use it for so many things, of which ONE is to-do lists. I moslty use it while traveling so i don't forget anything, or miss out on any activity. Some things could be added, like a ringtone to the reminder, or adding more emojis to the list name, but in the end, if you're going to use it for its main purpose, it will serve you well.

Read this if your lists disappeared. Still love the app. Noticed about a week ago all my lists were gone after a recent update to the app. I thought maybe a bug and they would come back but never did. I came on here and saw others reporting the same issue. I was about to contact support, but went ahead and went to the app settings in my phone, cleared cache, cleared data, rebooted phone, signed back into app and all my lists returned.

Great app for organizing and sharing . I love how simple it is to use so we can share lists and other users are able to use it without issues. I miss the folders that I had with Wunderlist and would like to see that feature added. Also the notification alerts only once unlike outlook which continues until dismissed. With those 2 changes my rating would go to 5

I LOVE this app! I have it installed on every device. (Phone,tablet, and computer) I literally plan my life with it. I created monthly list so can plan for future dates, or just get stuff I want to do out my head on to something I can organize better. My only requests is it sync up with my Goggle calendar and I can move my items on the list from one list to another. Other than that it's great!!!

I like it. However, when sharing lists, I find it frustrating that I cannot share with someone who has a different email domain. That was not a requirement when the app was called "Wonder List." Other than that, I greatly appreciate this phone app. I appreciate the ability to use the app or the Windows desktop app and item stay in sink. I also have many lists shared with my wife and we can both work on items and they stay in sync... even when we are not in direct contact. Technology is awesome.

I never write reviews but I love this app! I have tried a couple to-do listapps before and never found them really helpful. As a law student I need to keep track of a bunch of things and this app makes wrangling assignments, meetings and tasks so simple. I like that in addition to having your daily tasks there is a list making feature. It's also just plain fun to use. You have the option to change the theme and you get the perfectly satisfying ding sound when you check off a task.

I was very hesitant to switch from Wunderlist to this app. Especially given that Microsoft bought out Wunderlist just to kill it and push "To Do". However, over the last year.. as updates have ended on Wunderlist and "to do" has continued to get better - I have slowly become a fan. I've switched over all my notes now. So far, I'm happy with this app. However, please remove the "Delete List" option from inside of the list. It's too easy to make a mistake there. Allow deleting only from outside.

I used to be extremely organized & keeping a small notepad with each day's to-do was the key. Over the years I've fallen away from that with more use of the digital calendar - which just isn't the same. This app is PERFECT for a list making person like me. I love the way it's formatted, that you can make sub-lists, and that your flagged outlook emails are noted! There's a certain satisfaction in checking things off your list. Great app!! üëçüëç

I downloaded the Microsoft "To Do" app late in 2022. I explored it a little and I didn't like it because it didn't seem easy to adapt to. So I stopped using it. But now that Microsoft has updated Outlook and migrated the previous "Task" function from Outlook to "To Do" I have been compelled to learn how to use it, and I like it now. All of the previous "Task" functions are still available but in a streamlined fashion, and there are additional ways to customize a task in the app. Fantastic!

The widget is spectacular and being able to quickly enter multiple tasks on the computer is wonderful. The widget shows all the useful data and shows the next recurring task as soon as I complete the current one. I tried Samsung's and Google's task programs. They integrated with my calendar (which I thought was important), but they were both woefully lacking. This program needs another program to sync with Google calendar. I don't like the idea of having to use a separate program to sync (I don't want to give companies I don't know or trust access to my data if possible). I thought that would be a big deal, but my calendar is actually cleaner without the tasks in it, and the widget takes away the need to have it there. I highly recommend you try it.

Finally, a dedicated To-Do management application! I've cycled through various alternatives from Google Keep to Calendar but never stuck to one. My favorite feature of Microsoft To-Do is its ability to add tasks from different lists to a consolidated "My Day" view, allowing me to prioritize the tasks for that day. So far I've been using the app for a couple of months and have not had to reach for any alternatives.

Update: Thank you for fixing the add item to top feature. Now it adds it to the top of ther list instead of the bottom. No more having to scroll to the bottom to manually move it to the top. Many many thanks. I learned about the Wunderlist buyout. So I transferred over to MS To Do List. I love it & will surely miss my Wunderlist. MS To Do List is almost identical. I wasn't too afraid of the change. MS works great. Thx

This app is amazing, everything I could ever ask for in a task app. Especially the widget. It's so neat and clean. Repeating tasks option. It doesn't auto delete tasks when completed. I have not explore it completely but I love it. Microsoft Please add a feature to delete tasks at a set time. Like daily, weekly, monthly, set date, etc.this would be a nice bonus.

Absouloutly Amazing! I am a very list oriented person, and this app is such a great and handy app to keep everything in your life organized, from work jobs to household chores. The one thing I would improve is the design. It doesn't have a very aesthetically pleasing format. But other than that, I would not change a thing. Thank you Microsoft!

ADHD? This apps for me. I work full time as an engineer and artwork on the side, so things can be a little nutters when it comes to being organized. This app has helped a lot, especially since I can have it synced across my pc, phone, and tablet. Very simple, easy to use, and no adds or premiums. My only nitpick is not being able to choose the background color on the phone widget itself (in app its fine.)

Best to-do so far. Created by Microsoft, it has all the reliable things you would expect from them. One feature that I heard is coming, but has not arrived yet is the organization of stacked lists (lists inside lists, etc.). They keep it running nicely and update frequently. If you need to organize your life or if you have a job that requires a lot of tasks to complete, this is the app for you.

As an avid wunderlist user I was a bit afraid of using Microsoft's version of wunderlist. I researched all of the other options and finally decided to take a chance. The conversion from wunderlist and the user interface was simple, bug free, and most importantly, did not require learning a new interface (unlike the transitions from the various releases of Windows!!!!!). I have several shared lists with quite elderly and computer illiterate friends who were afraid to transition. No problems

Helps me keep my life in order. It's seamlessly incorporated itself into much life. It's unobtrusive, and useful. Besides the standard to do, I use the create a list feature to keep track of books I want to read, and shows and movies I want to watch. It's helpful to be able to pop those things into a virtual list (that syncs across devices) when someone makes a recommendation.

There are few expectations out of a To Do app - operation and be everywhere. This app does that perfectly. I never had any hiccups regarding it not syncing on time or anything of that sort. I love the fact that it works on so many platforms smoothly - Outlook, smart phone, laptops.. Plus, it's has a great UI, simple thoughtful, yet options and settings to do nearly everything. And if you use it for work, you can create group and then lists. Microsoft, at least you got something right!

After years of using Wunderlist, I was nervous about moving over to this new app, but I should've known I had no reason to be! When it first moved over, my only complaint WAS that new tasks only went to the bottom instead of the top of the list, but they fixed it almost immediately. Any complaints you have they're quick to take care of. I love the additional features they didn't have in Wunderlist, ease of use, and how easy it is to share lists with my husband and use for work. Excellent app!

CANNOT recommend this app enough. Absolutely works wonders and is incredibly simple and user friendly with lots of nice options for colors and customizing lists. All for free too which is remarkable. As someone who often feels anxious when handling a number of tasks at once this app is quite literally life changing. Basically a perfect, and endless paperless alternative to a planner so thats always great.

I transferred from Wunderlist. I enjoy many features, especially being able to share it all with another person. They have fixed some of the comments I've seen like you can tell it to put a new item at the top of the list. Only problem I've seen is when I move a weekly item to a different day, it keeps the reminder on the day it was originally on.

Awesome app. Allows for custom lists and allows collaboration on ones you specifiy for group projects/tasks. The interface is clean, crisp, but also allows you to make it your own by adding color themes to the accents of the task pages. The only thing I wish this would include is a customizable "smart list" based on certain parameters. This would make the app even better, though out of the box - this has everything you need to get your tasks and projects done!

I was a user of Wunderlist but then MS bought them out and transitioned to TODO. It's about the same, at least for the features I use/used. I like that my wife and I can share lists and assign tasks through it. I haven't checked to see if it offers location features - that was a feature I liked from the similar "G" based offering.

Seems to have implemented most of the best features from Wunderlist, acquired in 2018/9. Easy to add tasks/headings and move them from one heading to or rearrange them in any order, dismiss or restore them. IMPROVABLE: Give us ability to add images (eg that represent parts of a pattern I want to build a plan by) or (on a lower priority: to select one's own background).

Fantastic experience! Has everything I need, utterly useful, and a beautiful, convenient, easy, and frankly enjoyable way to capture all my random thoughts and get myself organized!!! I love how it perfectly synchronizes with my work email, computer, and calendar. Only thing I would change is have more background themes to further customize and personalize it, or the ability to add your own themes or pictures.

This app is incredibly versatile, it provides a variety of useful features without being cluttered. The layout is easy to navigate, and it makes setting daily goals and organizing to-do lists much easier. It's definitely boosted my productivity, and I would strongly reccomend this to anyone with an existing microsoft account.

I love this app! I recommend it to everyone I know. It is so easy to use. I can create multiple lists to keep different areas of my life organized. I can send kids on errands and share my lists with them so they know exactly what I want or what the household needs. We can with together as a family accomplishing things together with the share feature. Again... I love this app!

I have been using this a lot since last year. It is a good addition for more organization. it takes a lot of practice to get into it. It can be overwhelming at first but the app pools categories very nicely and it is also integrated to my outlook which is great. You can also categorized and put tasks in different lists. I love it. It make me more productive everyday.

Well done here....not always a Microsoft fan but this app is simple and intuitive. I have tried so many "GTD" apps, to do lists, etc... So far they lean heavy either on too busy, too many clicks needed to get a task put in or....missing one or two key features that were really needed. This one....it's simple and effective. Finally....thank you!

Edit: everything is working. I reached out to support and they asked to uninstall the app, restart phone, and install. I cleared the cached and data first, uninstalled, restarted, installed and was able to add both accounts without further issues. These apps work great and help streamline daily tasks. These nuances get in the way sometimes but I'm glad it's all working again! Thank you MS Support!

This is the best to-do list on the market. You can use it stand alone, but the great thing is that it also syncs with your outlook or exchange server data. Everything automatically syncs. I also use this app to track my goals and habits, and to stay focused. This checklist app has done wonders to help with my productivity.

I've used this app for several years now. I absolutely LOVE IT! I've got a grocery list that I share with both of my teen/young adult kids, and they just add what they need to it and I don't have to keep adding things they tell me myself. Or worse yet, forget what they ask me to get. I've got a separate list that I don't share with anyone with my packing list for travel and one for movies I want to see. I just love this app! I used it before Microsoft & I love it more now!

Essential. Wonderful Amazing, been with it since the WunderList days. Always Adding New Features, however the latest updates cause basic loading of tasks to go slower than I would like. Noted on two different phones. It may not be that long but when you're moving in and out of tasks fast and often there's a noticable hang time. Still a wonderful program.

Of all popular to-do applications (doist, ticktick, etc.) this one is free and has most levels of organization. You can create groups, which contains lists of To-Dos and each To-Do can have sub-tasks. Each To-Do has option for many file attachments and lists can be shared with other users for interactive collaboration. Not only does this app do it better, but it's also free! PC, Mac, Android, iOs native apps. No Linux desktop app, sadly, but web-interface is very good

I like the way this app looks and works. I say this because I've tried othees that we're similar and I prefer this one. I like how it's Microsoft which syncs with my Google accts. The only issue for me is remembering to open it and actually do the tasks I listed....if I would just do that I would be golden! But instead I rarely do- therefore the list never shrinks but gradually increases instead, making it all the more daunting... Such is life.. 1 day at a time, 1 task at a time. ‚úåÔ∏è Pese

I use this app for keeping track of grocery and pharmacy shopping. We all end up having to go to multiple stores to get all our various needs met, so making a list for each separate store helps! I also make a To Do list. Nothing feels as good as hitting the button after completion and hearing that satisfying ding as it disappears from my list! I have lists for books to read, movies/tv to watch, and garden/nursery supplies needed.

I tried Microsoft right after Wunderlist was discontinued several years ago, and HATED it. However, I decided to give it another try, and I'm glad I did! I like it MUCH BETTER NOW! The dark theme, unlimited open source categories, and ease of use brought me back. I would, however, like to see more solid colors added to the themes, and the capability to add your own photos to use as themes. Otherwise, it's perfect!

Great app! Keeps me on track. What I'd like to see though is reminders also repeat when a task repeats. Repeating tasks can't be set for a particular weekday for monthly, but yes for weekly...odd. Like I want a repeating task for Sat. once a month...can't do that. A calendar view would be great. When the app updates, my tasks in the status bar disappear but don't return after (minor thing).

Perfect to do list: can add steps for an item, reminders, and add things to My Day, which helps because there's no way I can do everything on my to do lists in one day so it helps me prioritize. Most importantly, I can move things up and down within the list or to another list. Sounds minor but it's not a feature on many apps. Developers, a nice future enhancement: add tags so have the ability to view across lists, by tag. And view by due date across lists. But great as is and helpful!!

This is an excellent task tracker for small projects. The notes section is critical to keeping track of specifics and notations. I also use it to keep track of correspondence with vendors. It would be even better to have a date/timestamp feature that I can use when documenting phone calls. Right now, I have to manually key in the date and time before I make notes. In some instances I can have multiple phone calls for one task. I've had software in the past with that feature and it's great!

Exceptional and robust productivity app by Microsoft. The app is packed with features that seamlessly integrate with Microsoft services. Keep up with your flagged emails, make dynamic lists, customize the appearance of the indicidual lists, create shared lists.. I could not be more happy with an app in this category. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a solid "to-do" list app that is much more than a glorified notepad. 10/10 stars if possible.

This app keeps me sane at work and organized at home. This is by far the best To-Do app I've ever used. I love the ability to schedule things to do as one time or reoccurring tasks, have multiple lists, group lists, and be able to access your list from any device you install the app on and sign into your account with. The only thing I wish was added was being able to add your own background picture or custom color rather than pick from the very few options available.

It is a great step forward. Microsoft has a lot of assets within the office setting and this is just solidifying their position as king. The app could use some improvements: - 'open in outlook option for email chains. Could be awesome, but it opens via the web browser. I could maybe accept this on the app for a little longer, but on the desktop version this should open the email chain via outlook (if you have it) directly. - a refresh button

Surprisingly amazing app. Ive been through all the online and app planners out there and this by far is the best one (for me at least). This is great if you are using it for school or anything with deadlines. If you like a clear set list on what you need to do and when you need to do it, with a little bit of elbow room to do that, then this app is great for you! It has reminders and lists that you can categorize as well, which I find very helpful. I use it for highscool and chores/tasks!

This is my absolute favorite app on my phone, and my PC. The fact that it's so easily ties into Outlook is amazing, and makes my life so much easier. Being able to add individual steps to each task to allow me to complete certain objectives in pieces is absolutely incredible, I feel like I am fully on top of my game and it is impossible to forget anything these days. Highly recommended for anyone that has a chaotic workflow and needs a little organization in their life. Absolutely incredible!

Really nice. Has all the features you could want in this kind of app. UI is beautiful. While I'll miss Wunderlist, this app is a worthy successor, and I don't think they could have made it any easier to switch over. Hopefully Google Assistant support is added at some point, but given this is a Microsoft app, I have a feeling it's entirely up to Google whether or not they want to play nice. Please Google, please.

I love how I can set labels for tasks to keep them organized and have the ability to move them over to a Today view so that I only need to look at what I want to try to accomplish everyday. The app also does a good job of syncing so my phone and laptop stay up to date with each other. No complaints, and really the way it is set up makes me gravitate to it more than other tasks/reminder/list apps that I have used

SO useful, I was bummed at first when I found out this app was replacing the Wunderlist app I used for years (Microsoft bought it and it became To Do list I guess), but this is incredibly convenient and easy to use. No pads of paper with lists scribbled on them laying around. It only takes a second to create, update or edit a list and it's straightforward to learn how to use. Best list app I've found.

Great app. I prefer this over Google tasks. Google task is very basic into the point. Microsoft took it just a little bit farther, and thankfully this is one of those apps where they don't actually push anything on you. There aren't any ads or anything that forces you to use Microsoft features. It's a clean and useful app, could use some more features, but it definitely has the basics of exactly what you need

This app is as good as Trello and almost works the same with some minor differences. I love it. It would be great if it combined the features of Trello Boards as well as Evernote. Still givin deserves 5 stars on its own merits. It can get overwhelming the more items that are put into it, but that's my own problem of having so much to do more than the app. This is the best automated To Do list I have found. I use it in combination with my handwritten lists.

Easy to keep up with all my task lists and honey-dos. I'm asked to do something at home or work and I magically seem to remember because this allows me to see notifications and reminders across all of my devices including my Invoke smart speaker, my Xbox, my computer at work and home and on my phone. All around the most usable across everything and very simple interface. Love it.

This app is really great! It is so easy to use from day one. Easy set up and nice organization. I love how I can oragnize my tasks into differnet subjects (unlike other apps) and get remiders of when stuff is due and that if I want to see an overview of everything, I can! Being able to choose themes makes the app more customizable. The only thing is when making titles you can choose emojis but from a limited list.

Better Than I initially Thought it would Be Seriously, this app is great. I thought because it was an Microsoft app that can work on andorid it wouldn't be as great. It works great on both platforms. Love how it ascetically looks. Simple but has a tone of nice features for a note app. Easy to make list, make a group for list, sync to both devices and more. Worth the download, its my main note taking/list app.

Great app!!! Able to keep track of projects, add steps to tasks, keep notes. It has simple, easy to use intuitive interface. Looks same on all platforms (android, apple and windows) so you don't have to relearn how app works on each one. Amazing part it's free, and it has apps on a d syncs across all devices, including desktops. The only thing that I could think of would be if it was integrated with Outlook. Other than that Looks, huge thanks Windows Team!

I like how the experience is ad-free, and is able to sync across all of my devices. Best of all, it has an offline mode, and is totally free. However, it would be nice if the app had more customization in regards to the backgrounds and appearance. A seasonal or monthly automatic wallpaper change like Google Calendar would be nice.

Being able to see my Outlook take together with other take I create and be able to organize them in a useful way is so helpful. I also love My Day, and how it starts empty each day, so I can start each day with a fresh assessment of priorities. Otherwise I just keep adding stuff to my daily to-do list until it gets so cluttered that I stop looking at it altogether!
the drawback is the worker also can edit the work assigned by others to him...
Please add fingerprints / pin or any security option. Because My tasks are very personal to me
Can really do better with the reminders. Would also like search functions and easier access to features
Good app, reminder must be there.
Nice and easy to use. You're easily able to share with anyone else or use by your self
very useful app to remind everything

Hi Microsoft team, I want to give my suggestion 1. adding a new feature of voice notes or voice tasks to the app that will make it easier to add tasks and manage them 2. There should be option of some sort of time counting that will show how much time he has consumed on that task 3. Option of repeat tasks
Very easy to use. Good job guys.
Microsoft is low key better at business stuff than Google is.
It would be nice if they had an option to automatically add overdue tasks to My Day so that incompleted tasks don't fall through the cracks

In addition to grouped by due date in Planned list, you should also add sort by due date. Currently, it is only grouped by due date, but the tasks are sorted alphabetically making it complicated to know which tasks should be done first
Please make a Wear OS version üôè
A bot basic, but functional enough.
The app is great but whenever I customise the background it disappears
perfect app for me to plan a day and execute the plans
great app, very clean organized, and self explanatory. reorganizing lists is simple but slow if your list gets too long. this is my only note keeping it from 5 starts
perfect
Amo o aplicativo! Sugiro integra√ß√µes com outros APP. N√£o consigo repassar as tarefas ao calend√°rio Outlook e outros. Tamb√©m seria bacana inserir in√≠cio e vencimento/fim para as tarefas.
Leave me alone
very Hady and easy to use links nicely with my phone to plan tasks etc.
My 9:30pm reminder shows up at 8:30 for some reason. Other than that, useful and effective.
only admin delete list
I guess if voice note would have been there it would be more beneficial
love this app! it would be 5 stars if there could an option to mark things as not complete.
I wish I could move the order of the tasks of my day. In my agenda I used to put a number on the left side.
Please can The Eisenhower Matrix productivity quadrants be added to the app? To boost productivity
This app is so good to do a day plan. Please add timer to make a perfect time planer.
easy to use
Please add location reminders
When i select the task as done, sometimes it won't show that task for few minutes. Seems like it's a bug.
I like this overall, but it won't stop nagging me about having it's notifications disabled. I don't want your notifications, stop bugging me about it every time I open the app.
Please , add more colors to the tasks .. the app has boring colors
Its a really good app for planning and listing your works. more importantly reminders about task /work in email.
Better if include delete all completed tasks option.

I originally left to two-star review after switching from Wunderlist. I was really annoyed that I was forced to switch apps, but after a few months of using this I've realized it is far better than Wunderlist in almost every way (except for the brief pause to load lists that Wunderlist never had). It's loaded with every available feature you could possibly want and I'm very pleased with it overall. Thanks for a great free list tool.

Very user friendly and great to use for work, home, or just for fun/ideas/wishlists. I use it for all of it and it's been a game changer. Would definitely like to have more ability to customize/personalize things with colors/images and put in photos in the lists (unless that's already a feature that I'm not aware of/don't know how to use) in case you need a visual aid.

I love this app, I use it for everything! I do have one suggestion, but it's not important enough for me to dock stars haha. Since you can due dates for tasks, I think it would be cool/ easier to use if there were a calendar section (that looks like a traditional calendar) so you can see all your tasks all at once instead of scrolling through them.

Uncomplicated design that's easy to get familiar with. The ,, that is easy to use moving seamlessly from phone to tablet to computer while having the ability to check off items or add more without having to reach for another device. The ability to move from one device to another without problem is the feature that I considered a must-have for a list. Especially when all other comparable apps were single device or wasn't didn't really meet the definition of a tasks and list app.

Absolutely love this app and the many ways you can form a list. It's changed my life and how I use my mobile. I tried to get away from hand-written lists with various "notes" apps, but the lists got too long, too unwieldy, and too disorganized, and I couldn't sync across devices. To Do solved all those issues, and also allowed me to grab whichever one of my devices is closest at hand, without skipping a beat.

Extremely flexible, fairly intuitive, and versatile. Takes the place of several other apps I had been using, for notes, reminders, lists, life balance trackers... and wraps it all up in a daily to-do list that is totally personalized and editable. Apparently you can sync up with your other devices, though I haven't tried that feature yet.

Best app by far for to-do lists and i have tried many. Very clean, simple, uncluttered. I especially like the My Day feature that makes it easy to get focused upon the most important things to do each day. I now use this app exclusively for to-do lists as well as other lists (goals, shopping, routines, conversations, media to watch/read/listen, etc.) which each get their own list group. There are a lot of good to-do/list apps out there but this one is great and I highly recommend it.

I was using another to-do-list app for several years which started becoming unfunctional. I decided to give this one a try. The list creation setup works with your imagination. So far it totally meets my needs and then some. The sync between devices is awesomely immediate! There is one functionality that I would like to see implemented which is the ability to sort list "STEPS" by a selection choice the same way that lists can be sorted. Overall, it's a keeper app!

Pretty useful, works as both a collection of lists for myself as well as lists I share with my girlfriend. Has nice features vs other list programs as well. Couple things I don't super like, (but still think it's a five star program): Each list item can only be so long (a few sentences), definitely wish it were a little longer. And it has a nice feature of letting you choose to add new items at the top or bottom of your lists, but it's a universal setting instead of being per list.

I was looking for an app, years ago, I could use that would sync with gmail. Sorry Google, I'm not a fan of gmail. Had to settle for using Wunderlist, which worked fine at that time, but eventually moved away from using it when we were able to switch over to Outlook for business, which I prefer. So happy Microsoft came up with the "To Do" app. Syncs to Outlook. I can add items to the list from desktop or app. However, I do have more options available on the desktop, but still recommend it. üëçüëç

Love love love this!! Easiest to use and most tightly integrated to-do list I've worked with yet for anybody that uses Office 365 and Outlook. Only Gap I see at the moment is the ability to assign tasks from the mobile app. However it works perfectly when you assign tasks from Outlook. We just need the reverse functionality as well and then this thing is nearly perfect. The only other comment is it would be nice to have some easy way to add priorities Beyond just the favorites üåü Must have!

A bit more innovative than similar apps I've used. The fact that it integrates automatically with outlook is icing on the cake. The only suggestions I can think of right now would be to add more customization options for colors, especially. A color mixer is at the top of my wish list. But the bottom-line is that I had no problems getting up-to-speed after a couple of hours of random use. The app doesn't crash, supports floating windows; well-done.

When Microsoft announced they were killing Wunderlist, my expectations for the New Thing were soooo low. But they did a great job! It has all the familiar featues plus some new ones like subtasks, and the user experience is pretty solid! Importing was easy. Great job! The one negative is Microsoft's strongheaded wrong assumption that everyone wants "one Microsoft account for everything." Please preserve the ability to create different accounts for different purposes!

May 22, 2020 - updating to 5 stars, this app is my go-to. Easy to use, pleasing UI, and sharing is easy. Also, thanks for listening and responding! Was a 5, dropping to 3 after last update. Separating completed items would be fine (though less tidy visually than hiding), but sort orders now don't apply to completed items. Grocery lists become much more tedious, as you have to now either search through an unsorted list or type every grocery list item again from memory.
Can be simpeler with accounts

For someone with ADHD who forgets things constantly (minute by minute), having an app that syncs across any device I want (PC, phone, work computer, etc) is a huge benefit. Think of some random thing I want to do? Add it on the phone, and then I can see it when I go to my PC next. It's a pretty darn good free app. It syncs with Outlook, too, for those of us who use it for work or whatever.

This is -to me- the most intuitive to-do app I've found so far. It's not big, it works well across my devices, it's simple but offers more depth when desired. Example: I can make a general list and decide which items need reminders etc. The app doesnt make me go through several screens for every single item, prompting me to set up dates, notifications, steps, etc.

Almost as good as Wunderlist. The only thing I would change, and this is very minor, is that every time I open the app, it goes automatically to the last list I updated, instead of to the main list of lists. That's my only pet peeve. My husband and I share grocery lists, Home Depot lists, etc through this app now that Wunderlist is gone, and it's very useful and user-friendly.

I was a longtime Wunderlist user and had a very hard time converting over to the Microsoft To Do. Once I got into the app and started using it I saw it was still a very good app even though there were differences between it and Wunderlist. I have completely converted over and probably use the Microsoft To Do app for more things than I did Wunderlist. The ability to switch between accounts is very helpful to separate personal and business lists.

I really like it because it works from my computer and my phone and the information put in one will be accessible to the other. Great for making lists and being able to check things off. You can also reuse the lists for another time. I have a packing list that I have used repeatedly so I don't forget anything important. Planning meals so you can remember what was needed for a meal

The hardest thing to do (pun unintended) was to get into the habit of checking my To Do list everyday. I'd write down things but would not add a reminder, and so, it was useless. After some serious commitment, I started putting down things as soon as they came up, and would also add a reminder. Today, I finally am using this app to my advantage and it has helped be more responsible. I never miss an appointment or something important I have to do.

'Microsoft to do list' is a great and I use it constantly. One nice feature is that you can start your most important and group them at the top or with the sort feature. Other nice features are the ability to add steps, coordinate with calendar, & use due dates. It's very easy to use. You can share your list with others but not all. I think it may not work well between Android and iPhone. Haven't tried this recently.
good
The application can add an additional feature of alarm facility
task planned for tomorrow sometimes show in my current day. that's my only issue
very good app- but the balance days for the expiry is not added Pls. make update on this

this App is friendly use but it has a little bug. for example 1- share todo not complete i mark to my day but my coworker not see, i tern on notifications but my coworker not see and so on 2- remember notifications have bug 3- It's not level for todo and don't have highlight for important and immediately works
very good app for day planning

Can you please add starting time and finish time in it? It would be a better tracker of what we're doing. And please make it in a way that when we decide to do the task, we have to push the "start" button, to generate the time it's started. Even Google Task has it. Don't lose to Google

The app is chic and simple to use and one will find it very helpful in making tasks and keeping up to date with the day. I however think that the app would have had notifications that could at least remind you to keep track of your time and tasks

I don't know where this app has been my entire life but I can't go without it now. I had paid for a different to do list app and it was absolutely terrible. There wasn't an option to set reminders, no due dates, no repeating events. It was a complete mess and I'd get so overwhelmed by it that I wouldn't get much accomplished, paper and pen would have been better. However, this app has been my ultimate life saver for my crazy busy life. It's so easy to use and isn't sloppy. You can add a task straight from your notification bar (s7 edge) if you enable that in your settings. I love not having to check it constantly throughout the day because I set a customized reminder with the task. I have this on my phone (primary use) and my computer, they sync without a single issue. My only complaint about this app is I personally don't need the "Important" list and there isn't an option to delete it.
Splendid
Still need some improvements!
Thank you very much for your great effort, Dev & Team! However, this app needs to sync with my calendar which is not what I needed.

Very useful to track your time. I would prefer a one time payment for the pro version tho. Edit: read through their reasoning for subscription model. I agree with their reasoning. I guess I would argue for a lower subscription price instead.
Plz give check out option so that it clearify which task is completed or which one is not. And give all analysis that what percentage of task is completed
This is a great app! Very useful and efficient even without premium. Although i think you should add a "completed" feature. Or just like a box to tick. It would be very useful. Thank you very much.

Excellent,this is the type of app I was looking for.My schedule changes every month so the templates really come im handy.The only thing I think would be cool to add is a new type of persistent notification where it shows the duration of the task like in the app.

Good app, it gives u a time schedule, but when i finished making my daily routine, i moved to the next day that should've had the same schedule as the day before, but i found that the times for my task have changed and overlapped

Great when it works, but sometimes fails to update alerts. Have looked at my battery settings, including using don't kill my app instructions, but it doesn't seem to make a difference as the error occurs randomly.

Good app but id doesn't let me select which google calendar to sync, if I have various. I pretend to use this app por day routine and I usually not use the main calendar for daily routines, instead I created a new one inside my own account. This app won't let me use sync that calendar.

Set the Time Management once and forget...thereafter whenever you open the app it will show you what you need to do now at present and how much time elapsed and remaining for the present task, etc. Excellent App but Reminder Alarm most of the time not working so one star reduced.

could be more intuitive. but as it is, it's good, deserves a solid 4-5 stars as is.

Love the app so far - it's great for helping me organize my daily routines. Right now it shows both the Block and the normal routine for that time frame in the schedule, as if I could do both the Block tasks and normal routine tasks simultaneously... which doesn't make sense to me.

So far the app looks really great! The only suggestion that I could have that would immensely improve the experience is to create tasks/check lists and having them on the widget too for easy check off (hiding the ones you checked). This would greatly inprove the experience and enhance productivity - description is nice to have but have a checklist task section under it would also be immensely helpful. I hope this suggestion can be taken on board, if it was there then this would definitely be 5*

very helpful I've been looking for a daily planner for thing for a long time !! I like how you can have templates very helpful !!

I love the app allows for actual use without adds and having to pay. Would 100% recomend one of the best organization apps I have found. Though I wish the had a way to but task(not as blocks). The task thing does not matter that much you can use paper or other apps.
