Best and cleanest scheduling app I've found by far. It has it all: multiple schedules repeating on custom intervals, visually effective tags, comments visible on table and notifications, widget, statistics, events, dark theme. All without adding unnecessary noise. Using it is extremely intuitive. Doesn't lock any significant features behind premium wall, instead they're just extras that are nice to have (which is a rarity). But one thing that's missing is the ability to copy events/activities.

Wonderful app! Been searching for an app of this kind with a timer/alarm or notification feature whatsoever so I don't need to use a separate alarm to remind me of my schedule for the day. I just hope the notification will work everytime, because most of the time it just doesn't. It doesn't remind me as per the set time/schedule I made in the app. If you can make the notification like that of an alarm, I'd truly appreciate it. Please, please do something about this. Thank you.

A great app for setting routines, simple to use and very customizable. A slight learning curve for the routine setting, eg. The +/- symbols. A few things that could be improved: easily assigning routine for each day rather than programming a period of time (from the pro version) or the same routine (from the free version). Also the widget could be more useful if it indicated the ending time as well. The comment text style could also be better differentiated title/tag of the event.

Been looking for an app like this for a while! I love being able to coordinate things with 'tags' customizable by colours AND icons! I would happily give 5 stars apart from three things: 1. It would be great if there was an option to mark tasks as 'completed'; 2. I don't see much of a difference between the 'time block' and 'routine' choices (generally just looking for advice on this one); and 3. It would be great if we could add more than 3 tags to a time block or routine! üòä

Excellent app!! I use it every day. I've got a few small requests though, if possible! Another app I tried had the option to drag & drop timelines to reschedule times, e.g. make things a little shorter or longer. It's not an absolute necessity, but I find it a little clunky having to edit each event in turn, although I do love the "add this gap to previous/next activity" option. Also, not a necessity but would be a nice touch - I'd love to be able to reorder my routines. Couldn't figure out why they were all in a funny order, but it arranges them alphabetically, and since I make a routine for each day of the week, they were all very jumbled up. I've solved it for now by adding numbers to the start of each name, but again, just slightly clunky. As for the rest, I absolutely adore it. Love the persistent notification; each time I pick my phone up absentmindedly to check my notifications, I see what I'm meant to be doing, and it gets me back on track. Thank you!!

This app is brilliant, it's great being able to plan out my entire day. The only thing that I think would make it better is if you could edit/delete individual events that are part of a repeating block or routines. For example if my routine says I have a meeting at this specific time every day but the meeting gets cancelled, it would be useful to be able to delete it for that one day without impacting the others.

Used to love this app, amazing UI, simple. Definitely one of my favourite, and so helpful. This new UI thought, not for me... Too much clutter and scrolling! Tried to get used to it but its not for me, so it's time to let it go. Useful non the less, so try it, maybe it's your thing! Edit: I don't know how to answer so I'll edit and hopefully it gets trough. If I can get something back, I would like the choice to go horizontal (make it a choice on pro). A bunch of horizontal scrolls is not a problem if instead I have to do a bunch of vertical ones. Looks less intuitive to me. And I can use the go-to option, but I kinda already could and never did. I liked to scroll horizontal, because I liked the view that it gave me, and the side comparison of days on same level.

Great app, I love the layout and the display of actual time left in between tasks! :) But there are some minor errors. When I try to change start and end time in a block, I can select the hour and the minute, but there is no apply/confirm button, only the cancel button. I can however confirm the time when I randomly tap on the screen, but it takes a couple of times to get it right. Also, the white background color is ok, but maybe pick a more muted one. This shade is quite bright, a bit much.

I like the app, it's easy to use and gives a clear layout. This would be 5 stars if I had the option to mark tasks as done/complete- then if I finish a task ahead of time (or have some extra time) I could check which tasks are still incomplete and get them done. Plus, I love the satisfaction of ticking a box or crossing something off a list- it gives a sense of achievement that helps me to stay motivated and on-track.

Hi I really enjoy and appreciate this app. As a mobile app it works perfectly for me, however I'd really appreciate a computer version that can sync with it. I'm not sure if this exists already? I like that the app is on my phone so that i can constantly check my schedule anywhere - any time, however when I feel the need to adapt and change my schedule, it feels a little cluttered and time consuming. I frequently feel the urge to open it up on my computer as it is easier to work with this interface given the larger screen and increased capability. Please consider this in future upgrades, Regards,

Loving this app a lot, but it really bugs me that there is no visual of the remaining time left on the widget...you'll have to open the app to see it. Having a widget is a game-changer, but I wish the visual is better, so you can easily see where you are and how much time is left. The only indicator is having the time in bold, but it's not enough. A frame around the current time block or having it highlighted, so you can quickly see, would greatly improve the functionality of the widget.

Its a great app if you want a calender or routine app. I really like the colour coded tags for different types of activities. I would love to see a separate to-do list. I would prefer the to-do list to be separate to the calendar, or have a linking capability so that when you schedule your task into your calender it disappears or you have to choice for it to disappear from the to-do list.

Absolutely adore this app so far and I've barely had it for one day, extremely helpful for someone with adhd and who struggles to prioritize tasks and get things done promptly. The only thing that's keeping me from wanting to raise this to a 5 star review is the fact that the 'voice' feature in notifications doesn't seem to function as expected, it'd be helpful to add a feature to this where either a male or female voice reads out the task title then custom message.

I really love TimeTune in helping me better utilize my time, see where it is all going and plan routine tasks so that I can stay on top of my busy life. Great when it works, but sometimes fails to update alerts. Have looked at my battery settings, including using don't kill my app instructions, but it doesn't seem to make a difference as the error occurs randomly.

Really love this app, but an addition I would love is having the option to have the persistent notification not show during free time (unscheduled time). That way it doesn't get in the way when I'm not scheduled to be doing anything. As it is now I have to turn off persistent notification everytime I'm done working for the day and turn it back on when I go to bed.
Really great system and something Ive been looking for a while. Would have been perfect if the Calendar events were part of the statistics.

It's a good app and being able to route alerts through different sound channels is a great idea. I've found a bug though and couldn't find a way to contact you about it besides here: It's daylight savings today and while timetune has the correct time, for some reason it has pushed forward all my events by one hour. So an event which says it is happening at 6:30 is now on my timeline as 7:30. Hopefully its just for today.

(The ability to save different schedules and just toggle each or all of them is perfect. Have some seasonal schedules that I can just turn on or off as required, while keeping other routine schedules":This is what i most liked! Would be perfect if: - You could update cloned activities, meaning if you changed one all of them would change too - You could check off the activities like a to do list (it works as a reward system) - You could scroll up in your timetable to see what you did that day/things you missed because it only shows everything from that point in time forwards. Otherwise really love the design and layout, and it makes me super organised.

Really helpful app. I've looked at lots of other schedule apps, but this one is the easiest for me to customize precisely. Great for making routines! Since a few of my routines overlap, it would be amazing if there were an option to see routine titles in the widget timeline above or before the task, in order to keep an overview of which/whose routine is in effect. Both of my children have their own different weekly routines, so it would be nice to see on the timeline, that for example, it's kid#1 who has school on Monday mornings and kid#2 on Monday afternoon instead of two "time for school" tasks with no specifics. It would also be great if this app could be accessible from my computer desktop or if I could sync with other family members.
could be more intuitive. but as it is, it's good, deserves a solid 4-5 stars as is.

I will like one more option in settings -> calendar sync -> [checkbox] push events to google calendar ... I know it's not good to receive notifications from two places but on galaxy phones always on display shows only events that are listed in google calendar or samsung calendar app and I really like my schedule on always on display screen... please do it this will help all galaxy users.

This app is super useful to keep me scheduled. I only have the free version, but it's still really useful. I like how it looks and how I can look at how much time I put into certain activities. After installing and uninstalling several other apps I finally found this one and it suits my needs the best. I like the appearance and all the features. This would make this app a perfect tool for me and I wouldn't mind to pay for it. As a busy mom battling depression I need a simple tool to help me to organise my day and week, and to remember my tasks.

Very satisfied with the app, helps me arranging my day and getting an overview at the end of day. I just tried this app and I am already compelled to buy the premium version. Okay so far as I have used, the app was pretty good. I read that this is s new one, and I like all the features present in it. However there is still lot of room for improvement. I have a small suggestion to make, you could add a new feature that marks things to be done or followed and if not done it sets an overdue and in the end of the day it tells what are done and what are not. This is the app I've been looking for but there's still room for improvement. I like this app a lot. I really like this app. The concept of blocking your times is great and I find it helps me structure my time really well. I deleted my original review, but still highly recommend this app and loving it still... at this rate I doubt I'll ever change to a different app... Notifications stopped working after the last update but going to Settings > Apps > TimeTune > Battery > Battery Optimization and setting the app to "Not Optimized" did the trick for me. I know every Android version/manufacturer has slightly different settings but maybe this will help some of you. Basically you have to manually "whitelist"/unoptimize the app so your phone won't automatically kill it. Overall great app. Helps me stay productive and on track during the day.

The best time management app I have ever used!! I had purchased the pro version and I have been using for quite some time. Recently, I had changed my phone and moved to iOS. Been using this app since 2016. Decided it was long over due to go premium and support you guys. Lol. I love that you guys constantly improve it. It's hard for me to find a scheduling app that I stick to as a person with terrible ADHD. Time tune has always been consistently the app that keeps me the most in focus. I especially like the clean widget that doesn't let me forget what I'm supposed to be doing and what I'm going to be doing next.

Absolutely Amazing, exactly what I've been looking for!!! The only improvement I can think about is allowing us to see our timeline in a calendar view... pretty please??? The visual would really help me with time blocking. Other than that, I'm very happy! I bought premium pretty much straight away (which I never do!)

Been hunting for an app like this for literal weeks and this is hands down my fav of all! Super trimmed down layout for easy use + function, able to switch entire schedules with 2 clicks at most, customizable notifications down to adjusting the base default, easy to use + modify colored tags - overall perfect for my needs!! Plus the day summary helps a lot in actually understanding how much time is going where which is something I struggle with big time, but can now adjust accordingly!! :))

I've been using this app for the past 4 years now, and I must say, this new UI update was the single biggest improvement that I've ever experienced in an app. The new tag system simplifies everything, and it looks so much better. I'd always struggled with giving a block of time multiple equally important activites, but the new design caters for it upfront. It may sound really small, but it used to be the most annoying part of the experience for me, and now it's my favorite thing about the app!

After trying tens of apps, online services and methods, I can say that TimeTune is one of the best solutions in the market. It's flexible, user-friendly and minimal. Maybe the only thing that could have made it either better was to have an web interface...or ability to sync with more than two email accounts (e.g. Gmail, Outlook). Nevertheless I'll by the premium version :) - good job guys

Thanks, amazing. Took a little while to figure out how routine worked with program, but I think I understand it now. Love how you can tweak everything and integrate it into the homescreen background. Love the icons in de bar as an option. Really useful, but non intrusive app. Good value for money. Would absolutely recommend it for anyone who thinks Google calander lacks a few functions or is really bad at organizing or routines.

Great App for daily planning. I have one thing to ask for. Could you implement a function where you see the remaining time until the next task? For example it's currently 15:15 and the next task starts 16:00, so the time in-between displayed is 45 minutes and decreases with the current real time. You recommend this app to people with trouble planning and I think such a function would make it much more easy for people without a good sense for time. Otherwise it's a great App, intuitive and easy!

The app is great, but it only misses a major feature, if it has it; it will be #1 plannings app. The ability to make plans according to specific days of the week, like I have routine that only occurs at Wednesdays and Thursdays, but the rest of the week, I have different routines to assign to each day. It would be amazing to have this feature! Edit: Found it! Didn't know how I missed it. For me it's #1 plannings app now!

This app is the best I've found at organising my time, especially useful to set different routines for different work pattern schedules. I bought premium so I can program this all in seamlessly. Some additions I would like is to add notes or check lists to my tasks. For example under "eating" I'd like a comment such as "spaghetti" which deletes every day and checklist so when I set time for "cleaning" I know what tasks I have to get done. But overall an excellent app.

F***ing love this app! I have been looking for an app that lets me keep all of my plans and daily routines in one place and works as well as this. It was getting to the point where I was going to program my own app :/ It has a tone of customizability, it you're like me and your very obsessive with how you use your time it lets you feed that and after many failed attempts to better organize my life this is doing the best job so far.

I like the program a lot. It helps you realize how much time is wasted during the day, how long routine tasks actually take. One thing I want to warn you about: I added daily wakeup time as a reminder -I think- not definitely sure. It is recorded in standard Android calendar. I re-installed the OS, now I can't delete 365 x reminders for daily wake up time. I'm still searching for a way.

I never rate apps but I have to rate this one. I've been looking for a time planner app where you can create a routine once and use it on a daily basis. It also provides a weekly /monthly basis and you can choose if you want to repeat it after how many days e.g. every after 2 days. There's a calendar and a statistics feature that's going to track your habit. There's tags for easy reading. Pop up notifications. I could go on but I'd reach the limit, so go on and get this app. It's THEE best.

Took it yesterday and it is exactly what I was looking for. If you have an idea of how you want to manage your time and need something to help you change your focus to the next thing in your plan so you won't lose track of time, this app will make everything much easier, being able even to overlap atypical routines to normal one. Only took pro version to support the good work as they already give all the necessary options in free version. ++ And it works great, no bugs, no major issues

This is a fun and exceptional app for scheduling routine actions. You can also schedule non routine events too. If I had any quibbles, it's that it would be nice to make edits within the schedule for the day I'm on without having to adjust a whole saved routine day. Also, the emoji options could be more expansive (they're pretty good as it is, though). Otherwise, it's an excellent app!

I have never written a review for an app before but I feel I want to give my feedback to the developers of TimeTune and for anyone considering downloading it for a routine planner. I have never been so impressed by an app. It works so smoothly, the UI is amazing. The customisation options are great. The style/design. The statistics presented to you so you can analyse and change things around in your routine is just a phenomenally useful and an ingenious idea to have there. Everything is just easy and works. I was so impressed when I was setting up my routine, my life, it was like a dream to work with. I cannot recommend this app enough. The developers seem to have delved in to my brain and pulled out exactly the kind of thing that I have always searched for all my life. I can finally say goodbye to the days of trying to organise my life with Excel spreadsheets or having a mini breakdown trying to edit routines on Google calendar without a headache and finally giving up. With TimeTune the details, the functionality, the style, everything, down to the great widget customisation, just... simple, elegant, intuitive, perfect. To the guys/gals who have made this, wherever you are, I shake your hand. Well done on making such an amazing product. All the best for the future - you're going places. As for this app - don't change things too much!!! Tl;dr Everybody should have this app.

I've been using this app for a few years. It's changed since I first got it, but only ever in the right direction. I bought the premium version and honestly it's such a big help. I struggle with adhd and stuff like this is (not necessarily timetune alone, but it's my ideal app). Even without premium it was A+, but I decided it was worth the investment. Devs have also been very helpful when I had a syncing issue in the past (responded from reddit lol! kind initiative!). I definitely recommend.

Fantastic app. Best time blocking solution for Android I've found. They also don't lock you out of the most essential features when the free version, which I have a ton of respect towards the devs for choosing to do. I'm able to backup schedules, create multiple variations and do everything else I need without issue. It's laid out to be easy to use and visually appealing as well. Highly recommend.

So far I've found this app incredibly useful. Perfect to schedule morning routines or study plans etc. Exactly what I've been looking for. There is an option to buy a pro version which I am considering, but it is not forced as the app functions well without it. I've been working on turning my life around and it's been really helpful. Definitely recommended. I hope this helps xx

This is a very good app, when compared to others of this type. However, I think all of them, including this one, lack flexibility in adjusting the schedule. I'd like to edit my daily schedule by editing the start of my day, adding breaks in between, extending activities. If my new activity clashes with another, just move it. I don't want to edit manually every activity.

I have remote learners and this app is so helpful when keeping track of their school schedule. Highly recommended. I have the free version so I'm not sure if the pro version allows you to designate a specific routine within a specific date within a calendar app, but I can import a specific routine per day with the free version and it's been very useful.

I love this app. I experience a serious issue with feeling or noticing the passage of time thanks to good old depression and anxiety issues, so having a programmable nag like this is amazingly helpful. You can even customize specific sounds for certain activities so you don't even need to look to know what it is reminding you to do. I bet if I would throw a normal calender into the fairy spring from Zelda I'm reasonably sure it would come out as a smart phone with this app installed.

Amazing! This is exactly what I was looking for. I don't need a to-do list. I need an app that will tell me what I should be doing NOW and remind me when it's time to switch tasks or take a break. The widget is really attractive, and the basic features are super intuitive. But the more complex, optional features also add a lot of customization options for people who like to tinker. 10 out of 10 Would definitely recommend
Simple, awesome UI. I love it so far. It would be good if there was a option to reset or remove all plans.

Room for improvements: 1. The daily schedule should be able to size in and out to make it as 1 page for whole daily plan review 2. The interface division include customs hours to choose for instance from 6a.m to 11p.m

Great app, but in notification and pop-up it is only showing start time like "task starting now and start time" please add more details in notification like when it's starting how many minutes it is and when it will end.
Looks good so far. The repeat feature needs a "weekday only" option.

Exactly what I needed! Working from home is tough, and having stretches of unstructured time can be daunting. I like set different productivity times and meal times to look forward to. And reminders to do my skincare ofc. The widget needs some changes... I'd like it if the tags were able to sit side by side instead of stacking vertically, so the block looks like one item and less like a confusing list of words and tags. Maybe display symbols of tags only and adding divisions?
it is worth downloading üî•‚ö°

Me encantar√≠a que los bloques se muestren en el calendario dado a que se ven en la agenda , pero la agenda s√≥lo se ve por d√≠a y no por semana, y tengo que usar la plantilla para agregar al calendario . Love the app I think it would be way better if youd get notified for a task, the alarm only goes off if you're on the app which defeats the purpose..
-100k for lifetime -No way to mark time block as done -Meh UI for the timeline / time block

Changed from 1 star to 4 now. It is one of kind atm in PlayStore. If you play voice for notifications, you cannot hear the first couple of words as both notification sound and voice start at the same time. A major update I would want is to have sub tasks/activities withan activity. Currently, I have to create multiple activities atm. Since it is Tag focused, the Tags can have multiple editable sub-Tags.
it really needs a desktop version to use at work and sync with MS products. then it would be perfect.
Too complicated Too plain Idk I just didn't like the idea

This app is great. The reminders work and the customization is great. As someone with ADHD, this is super helpful in my daily routine. The only thing that would make this app better is if each entry was treated as a task, with a "Mark as Complete" button in the notification, allowing you to mark it as done. For people that rely on the satisfaction of marking something as done, this would be extremely helpful and satisfying. Dopamine on tap.
Very great app but I request you to add an optional alarm for reminding. Else all works great and I love this...

Overall, this is a great app and the notifications feature is amazing. In my opinion, however, the interface is too big - blocks could be a bit more compact height-wise. They're too big. There could also be a way to set blocks duration by duration - instead of having to set Start and End, just set Start & duration (e.g. 9:30am and 20 minutes). Would also be nice if there were templates of individual blocks, like a block I can easily reuse.

This is the exact app that I really need as a student. I can organise my time in detailed ü´∂. Also, the tag function is such a brainy idea. I loved your app but I have 1 suggestion right not to make your UI/UX more better. Please tell me where should I send the details.
Amazing app, I'll give it 4 stars as it still has a lot of potential when it comes to UI and additional features

I like and use this app the most out of the other apps I've tried but this app doesn't have two key features that would help anyone be more productive. 1. There is no way to drag timeblocks to move them to different times in the day for easy schedule changes. 2. A feature that lets me tap any time in the day and place in previously made time blocks. (i.e. have a place to store more permanent timeblocks) Both are Big deal breakers (I almost Didn't use the app) PS. Please add custom themes .

This app would be a 1000x times better IF you could push any templatea you have FORWARD or BACKWARDS x amount of time. Otherwise? You have to put it in manually. Sleep in? Too bad, enjoy 5-10mins of rearranging everything EACH TIME. Please add this simple feature in, I've bought the paid version and its amazing but please, add this feature.

App has been useful and i like the design and features. I am finding blocks really confusing. What is the purpose of the blocks tab? I would love to be able to create individual premade blocks with a description, tags, notification settings and duration but be able to click on the calendar and choose from a list of these blocks rather than making a new one every time. I cant seem to find a way to do that without templates currently. Would this be a possibility? Thanks.

I purchased the premium version but I have a problem with this app. Why can I only see statistics of 1 month ahead of me and not more than that. For example I have created a schedule for three months starting from Feb, so I should be able to see statistics of Feb-march-april. But I am only able to see until March. Why is it so?

It's the only app that lets you make templates for schedules, which is great for planning ahead and making adjustments without it being added to your calendar. However, one thing slightly annoys me. Tags are a good & quick way to sort tasks, but the tags icons are way too big and very distracting in contrast to the time on the sides, duration or your description. And it would be great to have an option to choose if you want to use tags at all (one is required at the moment).
Fantastic app, the only problem i have is your can only add 3 tags to one thing wish it was more
usefull
Well Sound feature is not working at all.

Very satisfied with the app, helps me arranging my day and getting an overview at the end of day. There is still a bug though, after I deleted some blocks, they still appear in the statistics for this certain day/month and even year. How can I get rid of this? But overall very likely to recommend this app!
this app is very good for time management, ringtone not given free subscriptioners ,& also notification.
App is good but not useful for free users. Atleast graph of week and month should be available for free.
El √∫nico problema que considero tiene la aplicaci√≥n es no poder ver en el calendario m√°s de un mes en adelante, incluso la versi√≥n paga no permite esta opci√≥n.

Its simple and straight to the point I am loving this app! Though, I do have problems that the app widget does not update unless I open the app and other similar shenanigans. I would also love to see a loading bar instead in the persistent notifications, if that's possible it just would look really cool. Anyways, thanks, and if I have money to spare I'd buy your premium options. Cheers!
9 JJ
Really very good user experience

[Pretty damn good app] Due to an injury, I struggle with memory. After picking this app up, and using its widget, it's been way easier to schedule out my day to day. I've also just recently moved into trying to get some muscle back. I've got every minute of the day calculated with this app, ive got notifications for reminding myself to eat, get in the gym, etc. Dope app, good job devs

I installed it a couple days ago and I like it well enough so far. I do need to track down a louder notification tone for it so I can hear it at work (constant loud machinery running), and it did take me a little bit to get the hang of how it works (a beginner's tutorial wouldn't be amiss, a quick 2-minute tour would probably be plenty) but I think I've got it pretty much figured out now and it's been more helpful than any other personal planning apps I've tried out.

Great schedule keeping app. A small learning curve to learn how the app works and what each setting does. I can finally see clearly how much time I have in my day and how I have space for all the activities I want to do. The custom notif sounds allow me to pick a light beeping noise to signify a time block change. Persistant notif gives me an icon at the top of my phone so I never forget what I'm doing. Great app, again, I love it.

This app combined so many features, that normally require multiple apps into a very intuitive interface. What sold me was the widget. I can see my routine, reminders and events in a scrolling timeline, that highlights the current scheduled event. I'm definitely going to upgrade to the pro version. Thanks for a well thought out app. The effort really shows!

Overall, I like the latest update. It's perfect for making schedules. I do wish the blocks had two catagories, past & upcoming so I don't have to scroll past old events to get to my current events. I also wish blocks still had the personal icons instead of only tags. Edit: I really like the atypical routines but I wish the days wouldn't continue to increase when the routine isn't being used.

Great app! Really helps for planning general day schedules that are repeated. However, it would be really helpful if there was also a way to just plan for one day at a time (not repeated)--to be able to plan more specifically day-to-day (and maybe this would auto refresh for each day?). I find it very beneficial to set up specific tasks for the next day, the night before. I would also love a feature where each planned item can be crossed off, to give sense of completion/track progress. Thanks!

Really enjoyed this app, but was disappointed to find it doesn't automatically sync your schedule to your account. I had to reset my phone and was bummed to see the schedule, routines, and tags I worked on for days, tweaking it to fit my kid's days perfectly was gone. Not sure I will take the time to redo it although I really did like it. If you do use it, just make sure you back up your schedule!! Edit: Had to just suck it up and redo my schedule. This app is just too useful.

I absolutely love this app! I tried a few different options before this one and no other timetable/routine app had everything I needed. This app has a free option as well as a small one-time payment option that unlocks all of the features. I paid for the full version and don't regret it for a second. This is sooo helpful for keeping myself on task with my ADHD and the ability to edit routines makes it easy to adjust day to day. The widget option for Android devices is amazing as well! There are so many options for block events and routines, from how they are notified to the color they are on my schedule. I personally like that the notes show up in full on the schedule no matter how long they are so that I can list all the steps of my morning/night routine and don't forget anything. The only thing I wish is that there could be an option to connect this to my computer and have some way to back up my routines/schedule automatically to the cloud. Also, I'd like the ability to make a to do list for each day for things that aren't time-specific, like paying off my credit card and stuff. Like reminders on google calendar, but less annoying, ya know? If there is a way to do this and I'm just missing it, please let me know!

Brilliant. 5/5. My only problem: Would really love to see the "undo" option remain after exiting to another menu within the app, as I accidentally overwrote a day on a routine schedule, and pressed the back button in a panic, which disabled the "undo" button, meaning I had to redesign the routine! Other than that, this is a stellar app which I would be happy to recommend to anyone wanting to timeblock, and up their output/ productivity in all areas. Remember to make copies of routines as you go.

Edit : Love the app fantastic way to set aside time for what you really should be doing and the notification setter is fairly robust. one thing to mention is that if you don't turn on pop up then you will have to actually click the the notification in notification center. I don't really clear my notifications ever so I had to force stop the app a few times, but after contacting support they help me figure out what I was doing wrong.

Apps like this should really come pre-installed onto your phone. The way its so easy to navigate and how user friendly it is (although I have had a little trouble) is really innovative and interesting. This will definitely help me accomplish alot during my Summer Break, and I look forward to any future updates! (Edit: It would be nice to have the setting for a discreet notification that changes depending on what Block you're on, rather than a bunch of notifications)

As someone who procrastinates constantly and needs a routine to keep myself focused, this app is amazing. The constant notification with personalized icons makes it so easy and helpful to keep track of what's going on and what I need to do next. No, this app isn't perfect. But I've found great use from it. I recommend getting the pro version. It's only 5 dollars and the programmer is SUPER useful :)

It's great! They seem to be actively developing it, so still not the most feature-ful, but very neat, easy, and so far bug free. I'd like to be able to share my schedule with my bf, but no way to do that yet. Takes a minute to decide how you should break your schedule into sub-rourines. I made weekly routines like "sleep", "work", "clean", but they could all go in one routine technically if they all repeat daily/weekly. So far nice UI and easy to see what I have coming up. Thanks dev team!

This app is amazing! It's very user friendly and easy to plan out your day/week. For people who identify as planners, it might be a little addicting,. Being able to make routines for as far in advance as you can imagine, and just turn on that routine when you need it, while having different ones waiting or running is amazing! I just wish that there was a desktop version, or even just a website access point. Hopefully that comes soon!
Very good app. Suggestions would be to add the ability to put my phone in do not disturb during a timeslot (ie; at work), and a sectograph so I can see my full day as a clock

I needed a simple app that I can schedule my day throughout. This has a VERY simple interface and a very visually appealing aesthetic. I love it so far! What would really fit the bill even better is if I can drag and drop blocks. Sometimes I have to shift priorities and it messes up my schedule and I need to manually go in and change things in every block thereafter.

Perfect app for my ADHD! Tracking and visualization of time when utilitized right! I'd love to see tap hold/gesture fratures for some actions(deleting/altering some common states of blocks, ect.) Original block vs selected block can be confusing; feels clunky to use or edit. I don't even use templates since it's a bit confusing/non intuitive to me. Check list in blocks would be nice! Displaying overlapping blocks side by side would help!(appointments that override normal daily blocks, so on.)

For being a young project and all the features it has, it's doing a great job. I wanted something that wasn't exactly a calendar or a scheduler or a to-do list, but help me figure out where and how I am spending my time. This is helping with that beautifully. Love the interface, love all the colors. Probably spend way too much time picking out colors and tags! No glitches or problems. Definitely starting a wish list as I use it more! Would love to be able to analyze data in more detail.

This is exactly what I was looking for in an app. It allows you to set up a routine, and choose whether or not it repeats daily or weekly, or a certain assortment of days (such as monday, wednesday, saturday etc.) This app also has notifications for each event to help stay on track with the schedule. It is very easy to use and read, and can be used to plan events, daily tasks, appointments, etc. I absolutely love this app, and to make it better all these features I spoke of are free.

timetune is a very simplistic, organized, and helpful app! i have been looking for an app like this! it's nice on the eyes and you can customize almost everything! it has a dark mode and a cute little widget for your home screen. i recommend it for people that procrastinate and easily forget tasks! ‚ô• (i thought this app had a bug. later on, all my apps started crashing. the developer kindly responded, but had it not been for the response, i might still be trying to fix my phone. thank you!!)

Love the app, it serves its purpose well. I've found that routines are a must for effective and long term habit building. The latest update allows 2 tags per time slot which is awesome. But, the notes now visually appear seperate, or disconnected from the timeslot and tag. It's really just an aesthetic issue, but I do wish it were fixed.

I've only had this app for a week and I love it! My only complaint is one small glitch. When I have routines scheduled in the programmer, some of them show a random tag that's not part of the routine at 12am on each of those dates in the itinerary and widget only, but when I click to edit it, that tag is not actually in the routine. Also, one suggestion for the future: create a feature that allows you to set a whole day back or forward in the number of minutes desired.

I loved this all before, but with the new updates, it is the BEST!! I lose track of time easily and this allows me to make a schedule and choose which items give a notification. This helps me SO MUCH to stay on track throughout the day. Perfect for an ADHD brain! I'm a homeschool mom with a busy schedule and I struggle to keep the household running efficiently. This app is a gift to me!! Additionally ... I haven't encountered a single ad. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è Well-designed app. HUGS TO THE DEVELOPERS!!

I've tried a lot of routine apps, and timetune is amazing. I use another app to check off whether I've completed each item or not, because i like the widgets that I get for that feature kn other apps and tracking is good. But the schedule and time manageability timetune gives is GREAT, and I love the alarm features. I would love to see better themes, like custom backgrounds. And I would also love to be able to manage notifications better. The Persistent is too much, but the regular schedule isn't quite as intrusive as I'd like. Need a more customized notifications option. But all in all, 5 golden stars, great app!

This app has been a life-saver so far in college!!! I have several routines worked out: sleep schedule, school week schedule, crunch-time schedule for exams, and another for when my late-start class begins. My class times are a bit confusing, so this ensures I don't forget which day is which! I love all the features it supplies to set reminders or events, and timers that help me keep my pace when I read. Just absolutely love it, use it everyday!

I have severe time management issues, this app has every single crucial feature a chronically tardy person (i.e. Myself) needs. Widget, in-app timer, (custom) notifications, a clean interface, icons and clear color coding ‚Äî everything I've ever needed. Superb app, honestly, it's been a life changer.

Best timer and scheduling app out there by far, in my opinion. This app makes it super easy to visually organize and schedule your entire day and stick to a routine. I'm a very visual person, so being able to schedule my day via colorful time blocks and add tags to each activity helps me stay focused and on track in a way no other app has managed. Been using this app for close to 10 years now (or earlier versions of it) and don't plan on stopping anytime soon.

I really appreciate the efficient and clean design!   I do have one question.  Is it possible to create a time block that has a length but without a specific day/time attached to it? I would love to be able to click on blank time slots and have the time blocks that fit within that time frame on a pull-down menu.  Blocks for things like studying, cleaning, reading, knitting, etc. that don't need to have a set time.

A useful app with a few potential improvements. But... the notifications are suddenly gone. I've seen your answers to people reporting the same problem and followed those links but found no help there for my device.
Used this in my Samsung and it was great. I then changed phone to an iPhone and cannot get the app üò´üò´üò´üò´üò´

Great for managing adhd! Being able to see the entire notes/comments section of a block is super helpful too, I hope that always remains a feature (or at least an option). I love that you can change the theme, and use color & icon coded tags. Having to manually input everything isn't something I can keep doing, tho. I bought pro, but since my schedule is always changing, the routines option isn't useful for me. I wish I could just have an everyday schedule, and edit individual days as needed.

Not much to say here. It's good. Pros ‚Ä¢ Syncs with your PC via the cloud. A must have nowadays. ‚Ä¢ Interfaces with OneNote via links in the "Add File" section. I use both - that's good. ‚Ä¢ Displays schedule on mobile home screen. I find Task display best for mobile and Planner display best for PC. ‚Ä¢ Subtopics are nice if you have a list of things that need too get done under a main topic. ‚Ä¢ Alarm set separately from due date ‚Ä¢ Color change or separate listing for overdue items. [I love deadlines. I love the whooshing sound they make as they go by.] Cons ‚Ä¢ No snooze on mobile. Mobile - alarm rings once (softly) and does not repeat for that notification. It would be nice if you could set it to go off every 10 minutes or so until you tell it to shut up. It does leave notifications in the notification bar. ‚Ä¢ I don‚Äôt see any way to set alarm sound or duration or volume on mobile.

Great App. Like the options of multiple routines, calender, and reminders. However I wish there was more control over the routines. I'd like to be able to pick the start of my day instead of it starting at 12am. I'd also like to be able to pick what week days for a routine to be active so I can have different routines each day. You can manually program it if you pay for pro version but it's a hassle to go day by day if the routine is going to be used for months.

Would love a tick feature I love this app! Perfect for getting my everyday uni routine pinned down. I really appreciate that it has dark mode and the text is easy to read. I lovee how many reminders of various durations and settings I can have, even ones that alert me after that event! The ui is very easy to understand. Thank you for your hard work. Redownloading now that the overlap issue is gone.

This is my favorite app. For me, having a visual representation of my daily schedule prevents me from missing important things. I have ADD and haven't had success with a regular calendar, but with the sectograph widget on my phone, I can see my schedule superimposed on a clock face every time I check my phone. This helps me a lot. There is a little bit of a learning curve to understand just what you are looking at, but the tutorial is good and once you understand it is very intuitive.

I love this app, great way to view my agenda for today, pro version really worth it. The option to get both from google cal and outlook is awesome as well. And the support of wear os is a blessing. I recommend this app ro anyone who asks. One feature request for the wearOS: would be awesome to be able to include some indicators, like steps or something (the ring for battery is perfect). But even without that feature, this is my fav watch face

This app helps me keep track of my life. I am able to display all meetings from work and my other calendars and they're color codes so I know what type of appointment it is. Using the widget and watch app together has made my day so much easier to manage and I haven't missed a meeting since I started using it. Slight learning curve with all the settings but well worth it.

Sectograph provides something immensely valuable: a watch face that makes life with ADHD slightly less harrowing. Oddly enough, it was exactly what I was looking for in practically every respect. Not just a good enough fit; it's like someone read my mind. And if you don't need the paid features, it doesn't bombard you with ads as punishment. It doesn't even crash or bog your device down with unnecessary processing. I literally cannot find any flaws with it.

Firstly, I have to say that this app is one of the most brilliant apps I've ever seen. I love it, I've used it for ages, and it improves my life in a huge way to be able to see my calendar events on a clock. Five stars. Secondly, I'd like to add that if you could make this work with Proton Calandar, it'd help me have less Google. in my life. I could finally migrate, and that would make me thrilled all over again.

Love it! So helpful for my neurodiverget brain. I love the watchface and widget and extensive customization options. I'd like to have the watchface be able to open my calendar when pressed. Thanks for making the free version for all to be able to use! I didnt even need to buy the upgrade but did anyway just to say thanks for developing such an amazingly helpful app!

A must have for me due to watch integration! I'm using a galaxy watch and with that the app puts the schedule right on to the watch face. Makes it incredibly useful to see my schedule at a glance and get reminders. In general the app is great too. I like the visualization concept and the integration with so many calendar apps. Try it out!

Outstanding, the stock connectivity with various time based applications is perfect and the 5 button layout on the widget is customizable and should be called the 9 button layout! This feature alone is worth the price of admission! Granular controls allow for rich and diverse personalization. My only issue is the app came out in 2013 and I was not on it earlier!!

Very unique, customizable and cool way to keep on track with your daily schedule and access your calender. If one has rated this app low do to user difficulty try to use the resources available. The customization is awesome and one of its strong points! Take a little time to learn, you'll realize it's not so tough. A user mentioned having a syncing issue, prob not the app as it seems to be isolated. Also, a user that complained about battery consumption since edited the review + rated 5 stars.

This app has been immensely helpful in keeping me organized. I prefer to create events in here as I can't set the duration of an event and that is sometimes more intuitive for me. One thing I would love is having events that happen concurrently stack, instead of laying over each other. I like to schedule small tasks during events where I'm expecting to have free time. I would also love to be able to duplicate events and change the calendar an event was assigned to.

This apps is amazing at giving you all the information you want in a very clean and simple way. And includes all your time managements needs, analog, digital clock, day of the week and a calander that all functions smoothly and with easy, and works well with other apps. Also works great on a smart watch, littery sold me on getting one, never could find a watch I really liked before this.

This is a unique & creative way to view & follow the agenda of the upcoming day(s) in a concise manner. If necessary, corrections can be incorpordted without involving a chaotic process. Obviously, a team of talented professionals have been able to incorporate their various specialiities so the spectrograph can be easily adjusted. R√†rely, have I posted a review concerning any app. However. the stellar nature of this excellent work product is well deserving of a comment. Thank you.

It does a pretty good job. I love the widget, and I love being able to look ahead/behind in time. The worst thing about it is the controls. It was pretty tricky to get a hang of, even after playing with the demo version. You kind of have to teach yourself how everything works before you really get anything out of it, but after you do it is worth it. And I'm not saying it's hard to learn! You just have to invest some time. The best thing is that it SO EASILY adds events from your Google calendar.

Glad I stumbled across this app. I don't change my home screen often (maybe once a year), but this one app convinced me to rearrange the whole screen to accommodate its widget, and I'm glad I did! The way the scheduling interfaces with the clock in the widget is something that should have been thought of a long time ago. Edit: I forgot to mention the watch face and app. I have used the same watch face now for 2 years. This app replaced my Pear watch face and I haven't looked back!

This app has a small learning curve but wow is the functionality spot on. Absolutely great for visually representing a schedule. I instantly purchased Pro features for the 24-hour widget and utilize it every minute of the day. What compelled me to write this review was the customization options: this app is compatible with any setup. Thanks for helping me keep track of my time from someone who really needs the help.

If you use Google calendar and like circular visualizations of your schedule, this is a must have. I paid the premium charge for the full set of features so I can see a 24 hour calendar view, and I'm going to buy and "Wear OS" smartwatch to use this app's smartwatch sync feature to see my widget on both my watch and home screen. Perfect!

So far this app has been really helpful to me. It is a very intuitive way to view time. It helps me realize how much time I *actually* have in my day (which is less than I usually think). It's convenient to have repeating events in it as well. The widget is probably the best part. I get to see my whole day as a nice snapshot and I can always reference what I'm supposed to be doing when. So far, excellent app.

I frickng love this app. Good visual for me who is bad at time management. I prefer to see my schedule in the form of a clock. Google calendar schedule view just doesn't do it for me. Am convinced that those that struggle with using this app are the same people who struggle with adding a contact to their phonebooküôÑ. It's straightforward and customizable.

Title: An Exceptional Calendar App: The Perfect Tool to Organize Your Days! Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ As someone with a busy lifestyle, I have always struggled to effectively plan my days and keep track of my schedule. However, my life has taken a significant turn for the better since I discovered an outstanding calendar app that not only helps me stay organized but also offers a visually stunning and intuitive user experience.

Amazing app that makes keeping track of your calendar easier than ever Edit: after using this app for about 2 months, I find myself more inclined to add things to my calendar so they will show up on my widget. It has vastly helped me keep better track of my time throughout the day. I would highly recommend this to anyone that is looking for an easy [and visually appealing] way to add a little more structure to their day.

I have ADHD. Time management and planning are my worst nightmares. This app makes it so easy to SEE my schedule. The visual representation of the wheel makes it easier to make sense of how much time I have. It's also SO helpful to see how far I am into my day... I could go on. It's a great app and worth the premium price, but the free version is also fantastic.

This widget app is so cool. It links right to my Google calendar and shows me in a clock format what my next events are. It's much easier to figure it out in my mind when I see it like this. Rather than go to my calendar and scroll up and down its just a widget on my main screen that shows me details like how many hours til my next event. That's super cool. I think it's a real game changer in daily time keeping.

As someone with time blindness from ADHD, this app is incredibly helpful. The visual map of how far away events are really helps. I love that it syncs up to my Google calendar, so setup was fast. I love how large I can scale the widget up. I immediately payed for the premium version so I could access the 24hr clock face & have no regrets. (Esp when most planner apps are now subscription, a $4, 1-time charge is more than reasonable.) Would be nice to have more visual customization options.

Although there are some features that I wish were easier to use, I think this app is very helpful. If it was possible to add a way to easily reorganize the order of events I would enjoy this app even more. Maybe being able to drag the order of events down at the bottom to change the order on the wheel? For now if I need to make a change to my schedule I have to make individual changes to the times of events. Overall a great application.

Wow this is super helpful. I hope I stick with it. The addition of in app tasks would be nice and if it could pull your alarms from Samsung clock app. I could be wrong, but it doesn't seem to show when my alarms will go off on Samsung clock, just the calendar I'm guessing. More watch face customizations would be nice as well. Like to click to expand an event. This may be included in the paid version, I'm not sure yet, but I will be purchasing the pro version in the near future

As someone with ADHD the concept of time is even more abstract and subjective in my head, so I really helps me to be on time when I have a visual representation of time passing and events looming. It's easy to use and understand. Great app! The only thing that would make it better is to make it a watchface I can put on my Samsung watch. I would die a happy human.

Cool graphics and easy to use. It pulls directly from the calendar you link it to so you only have to input events once. I'm using Google calendar so the calendar displays everyone I've linked with; great way to keep the family in sync. I'd love to have a To Do list added to the functionality especially one that supports the "bucket" concept so effect for people with ADHD. I am going to purchase the full app.

This really is pretty handy. It does a good job of visually showing what is happening on a specific day. I tried it a couple of years ago and decided not to use it. I gave it another try and I do like it. Although I probably didn't need it, I purchased the Pro version, because I like the idea that the app is not subscription based (I refuse to fall for recurring payments). Very handy and it works seamlessly with Business Calendar 2 Planner.

This app is the perfect command central. I was just looking for a visual clock, but this is so much more! It is so nice to have an app that automatically syncs with my calendar so I don't have to manually put things in. The interface is super user friendly and the widget is incredibly customizable. I love how clean it looks and how I can customize the buttons to include all my productivity apps in one place.

I really like this app. It helps me visually see how much time I have scheduled for each event. I have it synced with my Google calendar. One recommendation I would make is having different themes for how the widget looks. With my background image, the widget can sometimes be a little difficult to read. But other than that, I would recommend it.

I love the ability to visualize my day ahead with the home screen widget. I just made the transition toward keeping a rigorous, whole-life schedule using Google Calendar, and this app seamlessly integrates with my existing calendar without any effort on my part. Highly recommended for those undertaking the necessary task of organizing their lives.

This app finally did what I have wanted. Made a visually appealing way to portray my calendar that is also WearOS compatible. What really helps the visual appeal is the complete control over customization the user is given. Keep up the great work! I would love if clicking the event on the WearOS watch face showed the full event details like the Phone widget does. But perhaps that's not possible with a watch face.

This application should be considered by all who have a vision and a dream to succeed. Those who fail to plan, plan to fail. Sectograph allows you to elaborately plan and prioritize effectively. I absolutely recommend this to all busy professionals who still are positively moved by their achievements. However, i don't think this is for the nonambitious type who are already satisfied completely with where they stand in life. This app can boost your productivity, in a life changing way. Try it!

i love it everyway, it was a good idear to put in the list and the clock at the same time and the colours beautyfull i use it for trading i love that there are no ads if you put them in after this i'm deleting this app. but over all it great planing on buy it too and don't change the price too. just don't change anything........ there is an problam about notifications

Sectrograph is an excellent app, and as a pro user, I'm particularly impressed by the color scheme, graph representation, and event display system. However, I would like to suggest an additional feature: the ability to integrate daily Google tasks into the app. This would be a valuable addition for users who want to track both their time and their tasks in one place. If this feature is already available, I would appreciate it if you could provide instructions on how to use it.

Best app for event schedule planning and visualizations. My favorite schedule app. I have been use it for years. It uses calendar data, and shows events in very conviniant way - with cool sectors! This app has very flexible design options, full control with widget buttons. It has it's own nice calendar. Widget is not lagging, even has special button to refresh widget. These small details shows quality. And support is also very nice and friendly, really want to help, using video instructions

I have been using this for a few years now without ever running into an issue. It's a great widget to have on my home screen to show upcoming work meetings and personal events. It's the beat I have found that show time allocation as if viewing them on a clock face. Highly recommend as it does not push hard on buying the upgrade. You can use the widget effectively without.

Exactly like I imagined an app like this should be. The visualization of my day is more intuitive than it looks like at first, it inspires me to follow a structured routine and it has helped reduce my anxiety greatly, since now my day is all planned, easy to follow, and any gaps in my days are easy to know how much time exactly I'll have, which makes it easier for me to plan. I highly recommend this app if u want a routine but can never follow it

Love this app, gives a great overview of my day and looks great on my watch too! Great motivator for creating routines too by mapping them out on a calendar! I do have some wishes for the app to add in the future. One features is to have the ability to hide event series and not just individual events as work calendars are not very customizable. Another one is for wearos to replace the battery indicator in the middle with a complication. But those are just extras.

I've been wanting a visual calendar like this for some time, to the point that I considered making my own after I wrap up my current software project. However, this app has all the functionality you could ever want, and I'm absolutely delighted with it. I paid for the upgrade to pro so that I could customize the colors and it was 100% worth the $8. I'm so glad this exists, and I have no desire to make my own when this does everything I need. I can't recommend this product highly enough!

Thank you so much for adding the ability to tap an event sector on my watch and see the event details. I noticed that I can not turn off the numbers on the face of the watch now. I see the setting on the app, but nothing happens on my watch when I change the setting. The numbers are always there.

Literally the best scheduling format for me. It just makes so much more sense than anything else. I am surprised this format isn't more widely used. You guys have a gold idea in your hands. The design is very aesthetically pleasing, and the level of customizability is something that all other developers should follow. Also the fact that it has a watch face is the cherry on top. As a software engineer, I say very well done.

This is exactly what I need to get work organized! I'm a freelancer who has a complicated calendar which I really just need to visualize! The only thing I wish is that I could make it bigger. It's the center of my page now, but it would be great to have it take up all the space. Also weather in the center would be cool (since it replaced my clock/weather widget) thanks folks!

Very clever app. It's clear a lot of thought went into this. Quite customizable and you can still have all the button actions go to your existing calendar app. Bought Pro the same day I downloaded the app... It would be so nice to be able to change the color scheme on the notification widget.

I do like this app. I honestly have not fully used it to it's full potential yet but that's mainly because I have a very settled down, low key, schedule these days, but when I do have an event I can view it on my home screen which I love. I love the organization of my events and it does go great with Google calendar.

Sectograph is probably my favorite phone app. I have a hard time with time management and the way that sectograph displays the time and all the ways I can customize it makes it fantastic. It always works, I never have any issues with it and the developer is very quick to help if needed. Highly recommend!

Sectograph is so helpful for me to visualize my day and how I'm going to spend my time. It's almost like a pie chart of my time, perfect for this visual learner. What I would love is a companion app (watch face or widget) on Samsung Galaxy watches so I can see it on my wrist, too. I use the the widget on my phone's home screen all the time. I love it!

Ok, I definitely need to edit my previous review. This is EXACTLY what I've been looking for in a watchface. Able to integrate my work and personal calendars into a fantastic integration of your watch and agenda. Easy to read, customizable, and honestly just perfect for those on a schedule. Can't believe i couldn't get the app to work on my watch when i first purchased the Pro version. Thanks for the quick response to my earlier review! Top notch developer!

This app is fantastic! I work from home anyway, and with the disruption due to the Coronavirus, it was difficult to maintain my usual schedule. By the end of the day, I hadn't accomplished much and really didn't know where the time had gone. I downloaded Sectograph and it has made all the difference. I am getting my work done and even have free time to enjoy. I even recommended it on Twitter yesterday.

I originally doubted how this would help me. But decided to try it & see exactly it was meant to do For me, he most useful thing is it fits my daily schedule into a 4√ó4 size widget. Using a small % of my screen. + the way it's organized, just a quick glance & I see what's happening for the whole day. Way more efficient than digging thru my calendar app. I use a month calendar widget, but don't want to make a 2nd large agenda widget. This solved the problem perfectly!

100% of my day is based on my agenda. Each calendar event is right on my Samsung Galaxy Watch4. Sectorgraph makes my Wear OS device worth so much more, meaning I would buy my watch just for this watch face. I love how my personal and work calendars with colors both are synced and how the past events up to 3 hours are visible. Plus Holidays, birthdays, anniversaries and all day events are also visible on the outer border of my watch face. Note: There are no third party ads in the free version.

I quite enjoy playing with this sectograph. It's easy to set up with as many of you (google) calendars as you want.Once you've familiarize yourself with the settings, it's a quick visual reminder of all your tasks for the day. The adjustable widget size means i can have a giant, readable version on my home screen.

Love the widget, took a minute to figure out all the buttons to sync the watch. Very customizable, which is great! It was my mistake. This is great for my ADD. It allows me to time block so I can get a little distracted and still be on task. So worth the money.

This app is great for what it's for. I can easily manage my Google Calendar in an intuitive way. When I've tried to enter my daily routine using only my calendar, the amount of information was overwhelming. With Sectograph there's a natural flow to how I see the events of the day unfolding.

This is a great app, and it's helped me stay organized in just these last few days. I'm currently working around Google's Reminder issue (it's not accessible per Google's restrictions) by adding a subset to my calendar and setting Events there as reminders. I'd really love for touchable zones on the watch to open applicable apps. And those outer rings could be linked to step goals or other targets!

Such a great app! I have some requests! On the WearOS watch: 1) Have titles to scroll in place so we can read the whole event title 2) Have all day events take up a larger fraction of the watch perimeter, preferably as much as possible, shrinking to fit the available space if more than one all-day event is present 3) Make the start time and event length optional elements on the watch face so we can fit in more title space 4) change the sectors in ambient mode so the text is white with a thin opaque black shadow and the sector itself is the same grey, but uses a diagonal stripe pattern so the total OLED power consumption is substantially lower.

Great idea. A clock dial is certainly how I like to visualize the day. But... the widget's "Visualization of old events" should have an "All" setting; I use the calendar to record what I have done, so I like to look backwards. 3 hours back is insufficient.

I struggle very badly with time management due to ADHD. I absolutely love this app and the way you can put a wiget on your screen. I'd say I'm still struggling but I've only had the app one week & I see improvement in my day planning. Syncs with google calander. I wish I had this app as a stationary screen or watch. Really helps you plan out your day and get an idea of how much time is left & passing. Takes a day or so to get use to it though. Just wish 'reminders' were able to show

I got this app in hopes it would be more task/time management oriented. I wanted an app that helped me divide up and plan to do assignments and tasks by completion time. While this app is not what I was looking for, it's certainly very useful. I love being able to combine all of my calendars in one app that displays my calendar events in a neat, organized graphic

Life-changing, if you use the app right it can very much help you like no other app I've found so far! I have to say a big thank you to the developers, you have no idea how much you've helped me and my family in a time of crisis by just something as simple as this although I do wish there was an option in the app so that the notifications worked like alarms because I have to use a separate app to do that because notifications are so timid. Actually truly life-changing thank you

A brilliant idea, an entirely new way to look at the passage of time that strikes me as having advantages to this square-calendar-concept that is the default. I will admit I have used it in a while, but whenever I do I really enjoy this new way of seeing the time available to me and how it is filled. It gives a clearer perspective about how soon things are. If I had a smart watch and this was a function, I might just look at it all the time.

1st: Great concept. Except for the fact that nothing is showing up. It's just a blank clock no matter how much forward I skip. No matter how many times I close the app in hopes of refreshing. None of my events even show up on the widget. Deleting. 2nd: Deleted and redownloaded. It works now.

It's by far the best time tracking app for me, helped me a lot with keeping track of my schedules and getting works done by the time, the only thing I can suggest is showing up the widget when the screen is locked so the user doesn't have to unlock the screen to take a glance at what's the next to-do in his/her daily schedule You've done a great job, thanks for this amazing app, keep it this way, neat and functional, ads will destroy the app, don't resort to the ads

*Note to Samsung users: the app wouldn't update to my google calendar until I selected to "always use" google calendar on the pop up window asking what app to use.*üëç I have really struggled following the schedules I create and something about this visual and seeing how much time I have left to complete something or until the next scheduled item has already been beneficial! I put the widget on my home screen to try to help me not get screen-time distracted as well. Thank you developers!!!!!‚ù§

Hands down one of the best apps I've used. The details are very well thought through and the options to tweak are immense. Someone had the patience, smartness and thought to add everything they can think the user will need. As a dev myself, I'd love to get in touch with the brain that built this.

Totally useful and amazing!! Has definitely helped me with time management and stay on everything. I do wish that it would include my alarms, instead of just my calendar, but I make do and it still works out. I have recommended to many people and they've all gotten it too, they're very grateful. 9.75/10 recommend to all, especially students!

I don't have an intuitive sense of time due to my ADD. Because of this, I always wear an analog wrist watch which provides a visual sense of time that can't be accomplished with digital watches. This app manages to do much the same thing in how it displays today's events. The free version is good, but the paid version is well worth the extra cost. Creating separate widgets for work and family makes it much easier to not forget my commitments. Sectograph has become the app I check most often.

I kinda just needed something to give me notifications on things I needed to accomplish throughout the day. I needed a nice way to visualise the time I'd be spending and this app is the best thing I've found for that so far.
Good....
A really great except i don't know how but the tutorial is harder than the actual app. Like it makes itlook really complicated.
Next lv..
Frickin amazing bro

Spectrograph review. Great app that let me see how I use my time and how to balance things out. I only wish it was $2.99 not $7.99. I'm not sure if Google takes a bigger cut from developers or Apple, but I can see a lot of people buying this app at $2.99.
I enjoy having the segmented clock-face display coloured as selected. Great to have the widget on home screen for easy reference too. I recommended it to participants in an online course I'm doing.
By far the best calendar view on wearos. However would benefit from being able to have tiles for main calendar view and current event view with time remaining.
almost perfect, I just with in the center of the graph there was a timer so you know how long till the next event or how long left in current event. also needs more color options
Very useful and novel way to visualize your day. The widget is information dense, in a good way!
Great . Helped me stay organised through a busy schedule

Love this but new widget please? I've been using this app for organisation for the past few months and it's remarkably good at organising your life but my only request is that you add a widget similar to Google Calendar Day View where I can easily see what I've got to do next throughout the day, the sectograph is too visually confusing for me especially because my day is often jam packed with things to do. Thank you and keep up the good work!!!
I think this app is amazing, but I do wish there were a way to move the text for an event. If I have a work meeting in the middle of work, the text for the two events overlaps.

I REALLY like the idea of this app, so much so, that I paid for the premium version. However, on my Samsung Watch, it did start off showing the different entries from my calendars, but has now stopped and it nothing more than a standard watch face. I've not changed any settings (have you?). Any advice on why this is the case please, coz I REALLY want to give you 6 stars (out of 5!!).

I love this app helps me to keep track on my timeblock schedule. I do wish that you could use complications. I purchased a complication that can show your notification Icons and it helps me a ton when doing laundry so I don't forget the washer lol. Sadly I cant use it with this watchface
Cool
I wish there was a feature where it automatically deletes the previous day to do list. That would be great.
usefull even in the free version. you gotta have it!

It took me 3 days to figure that my outlook work calendar not syncing was not the app's fault but a company IT policy issue. I don't understand why you don't point users in the right direction in your FAQ? You're probably loosing quite a few potential clients who probably just give up where they could just chat to their IT administrator to sort it out. I think it's an excellent app, I bought the pro version asap. Cause I knew how good the app would be as a tool to improve my schedule and how I visualize it. It was struggle to get the right resize dat I wanted. but what this app did best was "a unique scheduling set up I could not pass away. I had to invest." So if we don't persist around uniquely. Such time will be lost.
Would love a setting to enable notifications for the end of an event, for example i want to know when my break ends :)

Seems to only support Google and Microsoft for calendars, and only Android's stock alarm clock, I use Skiff for calendar and the Early bird alarm clock (that's what the app's called), please add support for them, thanks.
Nice

I'mAlways procrastinating, thinking I have more time than I do, ya know, thinking that you can do it in 15 minutes when it actually takes 2 hours, anyways, this app has been very helpful in helping me to visualize my time and manage my day, also it helps me to be accountable, like I'll give myself 45 min to clean my room, 5 min to dick around for a sec, then half an hour to do the dishes etc etc, wouldLoveToWritemore, but cant:( 10/10 wouldRecommend, increase my quality of life 10 fold!
Solid app so far
This Is what I needed. Thank you!!

I absolutely love this visualisation for my watch and phone home screen - I'm ADHD and struggle with keeping track of time but this is super helpful to make sense of how long things are. The only thing I dislike is that it's almost TOO customisable. I would love to be able to just select from a small list of pre-set themes. Trying to change every single colour for every single item so that it looks nice and coherent is a bit of a pain. I still love it and I regularly recommend it to people!
Looks smart

Need help. Bought the Pro version but my phone got hacked recently. Reset my phone to factory defaults, sent an email to get pro version back (bought in 2/2023), got no response. I don't want to purchase app twice. Please fix. Your app is very useful
