Wish a companion app was available for Huawei watches

This app is awesome, I love the wear os compatibility. I have a couple feature requests. It would be great if you could filter which calendars you can see on the greyscale mode. Also it would be nice to have an option in the settings for making the watch 24 hours always, currently if I restart my watch it switches back to 12 hours, so I have to turn on the tap to toggle feature, tap my watch, then turn off the tap to toggle feature since I don't want to accidentally switch it back.

This is one of my favorite apps. With so many thoughtful features, there's a bit of a learning curve so it's important to experiment. Def. capable of replacing your calendar but its true value is the home screen widget. It offers a pro version, which is well worth it, but the free version is every bit of 5 stars itself. One request. can you add a sunrise/sunset event based on location? This feature would integrate perfectly. While you're at it, let's see the moon's phases too!! üôèüèªüåûüåñüåôüåùüëè

It looks very slick, and is, so far, my favorite watch face. It really does help me visualize time until my next meeting and how much time I'm able to work outside of meetings. One possible improvement would be the ability to color all of the events coming from a certain calendar together in addition to being able to color them individually. Edit to add: there is already an option for this... awesome! So...maybe the ability to add some tap-able areas on the watch face?

I first found Sectograph shortly after becoming an Android user for the first time and loved it! Then I started getting into theming, especially very minimalistic theming, and the widget didn't fit well on many of my home screen layouts (my preference, not any issue with the app). But now with the notification bar option, it's back in regular use!! I'm entertaining the idea of getting a smart watch, so it's exciting to see that would be an option as well! Thanks for an awesome app!

I really like this app and it is definitely a very nice visual way to keep track of time. The one MAJOR issue I keep encountering though is that it does not seem to easily sync with my Google calendar, which is where I have all my daily tasks stored. Edit: after trying a few troubleshooting options (including the FAQ suggestions), I was finally able to get Sectograph to begin syncing again by uninstalling and reinstalling Google calendar. It seems like it was a one-time glitch. Love this app!

Out of box, I really am liking it! Usually I don't review things, but it's pretty awesome. Definitely interested to see if it has integrations. Time boxing built in - easier day view migration of tasks that sync to google calendar. I think it would be awesome to create a time box for list of similar grouped tasks that's communicated to google calendar, able to move them to and from groups. Overall, the app has a lot of customizations. It feels more like a Tasker or Nova for your to-do list.

It is a lovely interface for your calendar. I think it would be fantastic with a smart watch. I use it as a widget on my phone, and I like the way it maps out my day. I wish I could code the color of the events to specific calendars to reflect how my google calendars are set up, and I would love if it worked with other calendar apps or todo list apps, since google 'reminders' aren't compatible with anything - not even with other google apps.

I have ADHD and medication can only do so much; planning and organizing are on me to improve. I've tried a variety of apps. The best part for me is that it visually changes throughout the day with upcoming plans, and with plenty of time in advance to still feel in control. All other apps I've used are repetitive, or I don't open them and forget, the same buzz/tone for reminders gets ignored after a few weeks, this one gently reminds right on my home screen and stays visually interesting Perfect

Fantastic time interface. I have ADHD, and being able to remedy time blindness with clear information about how much time there is between events and when I need to be ready for things is just perfect. No idea how good the event creation interface is, I've just tied it to my personal and work calendar apps and left it at that. One request, I'd love to be able to further customize the interior of the center ring, I don't like the preset options and would like to just enter a date format string.

Love this app! I always want to visualize my schedule, but seeing everything in list or crammed schedule somehow stress me out a lot. But seems like this clock-like visualization works well for me! I use todoist and google calendar to sync up with this, and add some emoji to the event title, make the viz even more clear! Also, the update is one-time payment, which is amazing, also I don't even feel limited in free mode. Hurray to the dev!

This is one of those potential game-changer apps; thoughtfully designed, programmed well, and dare I say revolutionary. I found myself ignoring the normal calendar "Schedule" widget for lack of accessibility. The presentation of the Sectograph app and widget are both intuitive and attractive. It's a sure sign that a product is good when you start to rethink planning and scheduling from the ground up. I also applaud the developer for taking a more nuanced approach by offering a robust and functional app (without tacky ads) with optional and significant add-on purchases. After using it for a week I'm ready to fully support the creators with a purchase--probably the highly customizable pallete chooser but I'm also curious about the 24 hour display function. This is development done right. This is one of those apps that is so good you want to see what else has been made by the same people. Cheers.

I hope dev keeps going with it. This is the most original and useful productivity app out there. Time is cyclical, sunrise then sunset ad. Infinitum. Never made sense to me to think about time during the day as a chronological line moving downward, like on a traditional planner. Sectograph only gets better the more you use it. It's really special. Install and play around. The initial learning curve is how you know it's so good, you'll see.

Happened to come actress this App while looking for a widget that would give me the hours remaining for alarm time. This does that and a whole lot more. A really great visualization of calendar reminders with a quick view of how long to the next event. It took awhile to configure to my liking but now working great. I'm not sure how to save the widget confirguarsion beyond the current saved version but maybe I'm missing that. . App seems very stable and highly functional. Very impressed.

EDIT: I can see the events now. This app is very functional for me so far. . . . previous review: I just installed the app today and thought it was super cool. The issue that I have is that not all of my events from my gmail calendar are showing up on sectograph. I even tried adding an event through sectograph and it wouldn't show up. I doublechecked which calendars were marked to show up and it doesn't make sense why only some events are showing up from the gmail calendar and not all of them.

This is the literal best app I have ever used in my entire life. Awesome features: -Syncs with Smartwatch seamlessly -Syncs with Google Calendar -Look amazing, makes sense. -Has widget option for homescreen Needs Work: -Changing clock appearance is a little clunky. User Interface could be improved. -Changing clock appearance doesn't look ver aesthetic, but it is operational. -App has a little bit of a learning curve to it, but once you learn, it's not difficult and looks amazing.

I'm testing this app for a disabled person. I am loving it within 15 minutes of using it! One thing I think would really benefit him and myself would be to have a button or link within the task details page to open the alternate calander that is selected, such as Google Calendar. The Sectograph Calendar does not allow attachments. This way, an attachment such as a picture can be added to the task. Great app!!

Great app. I have a couple of feature requests. 1. Let me create a template, where I can have an event set up with a particular duration (45 mins) and reminder alarms turned off, so that I don't have to keep customizing those details many times per day for many events. 2. You already have a setting for the default duration of an event, but there are only a few options. There should be a numeric dial where I can set any value from 1 to 1000.

SO nice to see my day on a clock face! This makes it way easier to keep it straight in my head and I love the versatility with being able to add just a line for a start of an event, block out the time, hide events, or have the flags if it's several hours long (my husband's work schedule doesn't take up the entire space anymore üòÑ) I know there's more features because my husband keeps showing me the next cool thing he just figured out it can do- tons of thought and effort into this!! Thank you!!

Great app and it is free. Well structured. All the necessary information at one glance. Gives a good idea visually how much time certain tasks occupy of a day. Great if you want to simplify managing your time. No bugs, no glitches, no annoying ads. I feel almost bad for using this app for free. I am going to get the premium version for the visuals and to support this. Thanks for this amazing app. I love it. It's excellent. Very happy with this. Yes.

I really like the visual aspect of this scheduler. I have ADHD and I'm on the spectrum and establishing a routine is really hard for me but to visually be able to see what's coming up and not too far ahead to start worrying about things unnecessarily really helps me to focus in on right now. And it's the visual nudge I need to Make the move from one activity to another which is difficult for me. This app is neurodivergent-friendly.

Sectograph, an innovative app, transforms my daily tasks into an intuitive visual pie chart, enhancing time management. Its seamless integration with calendars and color-coded segments aid in efficient scheduling. This app not only boosts productivity but also adds an aesthetic appeal to planning. Highly recommended for optimizing daily routines, Sectograph is a must-have for efficient and effective time management.

OK this app is seriously game changing for the neurodivergent mind!!! I have add and I've always really struggled with time management because it just doesn't compute for my brain and I often overestimate what I'm able to accomplish in a day. With this app I'm able to visually SEE how my day fits together and where there are gaps between scheduled events/tasks that I can fit something in. I honestly can't recommend this enough if you have add too! I just wish I had more colors to choose from.

Great so far. Upgraded to pro so I can tap the watch face to bring up description of event. Keeps a visual reminder of my upcoming meeting and appointments right there. Areas for improvement: 1. A very few items have not uploaded to the app or watch for some reason. 2. The app when new always seems to default to not updating the watch. 3. Let me dial the watch forward like the app so I can see events on future days

As someone with ADHD, I love this app! It takes some getting used to, but it's wonderful once you do! It took me so long to find an app/widget that provides a nice, clean visual. I love that you can use a 24-hour mode, which is what really sold me on this app. I have weak planning/time management skills, so having that full visual really helps me, ESPECIALLY being able to see how much time there is until the next event!

Im a visual person, so this helps me so much throughout my day. A feature request I have is to please allow the ability to use complications. Great idea. Really it's 4 1/2 stars. If this app would partner with an app like Business Calendar and become a fluid interaction / view to use with the regular calendar it would be phenomenal. The circular view and general functionality of the app are wonderful. Excellent work!!!

As a forget and visual person... (I'm not paid to review) I absolutely love this app. I struggle with visualizing the amount of time I have between tasks and events. Usually always late. This is such a beautiful app. I've used it for about a month and it's also helped with keep with a routine which is so important to my mental health. Highly recommend to those who has difficulties monitoring time.

_Great qpp. Does what it claims almost perfectly. _Its a bit expensive for what it provides but atleast it is not a sucscription based app which would not be on my phone if it was Few features that could improve my workflow significantly: 1-A light windows PC version that allows me to manage everything from my computer. Even the free version is just great, it provides just enough. I love it. The only watch face that's complicated enough to look good, but in a way that it's not just design, but actually improves productivity.
This has been an amazing app to help me visualize and understand my full day at a glance. I can't recommend it enough for folks who want to be on to of everything they do.

Well I like having an agenda where, if needed, I can be reminded of what I need to do. However, I am not liking how after 3-5 days of reminders, it just stops doing it and I have to go in in order to refresh. At this point a normal calendar app preinstalled would be better, since I can set it to remind me every day. Could this be fixed?

Great for time management as long as you have a repeating routine. Blocks and programmer tab not intuitive/useful. Would LOVE to be able to share my routine with another user (read only) so we can adjust our routines to better coordinate free time, work outs, meals, etc. Would also LOVE to see (maybe instead of blocks tab) an "Appointments" tab where you could input a single occurance event that would then show up on your schedule. User can choose which is done, effecting weekly hour count.

I just started using this. One thing I would like to see is the ability to add check boxes to an event. For example I have a time slot labeled housework scheduled from 11am to 12pm. I would like to be able to tap on that block of time and see that I need to do dishes, vaccume, and dust in that time frame, and be able to mark off each task as it is complete.

This app is amazing! You can tell the developer really thought through alot of the functionality of what's in the app. I lobe the layout of the time slots for your tasks and I highly recommend using this app. My only reservation on 5 starts is a small detail in the widget but even the widget is near perfect. It shows you a whole week which you can easily scroll through!

I like and use this app the most out of the other apps I've tried but this app doesn't have two key features that would help anyone be more productive. 1. There is no way to drag timeblocks to move them to different times in the day for easy schedule changes. 2. A feature that lets me tap any time in the day and place in previously made time blocks. (i.e. have a place to store more permanent timeblocks) Both are Big deal breakers (I almost Didn't use the app) PS. Please add custom themes .

I'm not sure if this does what I want. The premium version may, but not enough description. I want to make a daily goal to do something for 1 hour every day (5 minutes here, 20 minutes there, Keeping time with a stopwatch rather than hard scheduled) and see how well I do over time. I like the look, but I'm going to scout around for something to try before I buy. I appreciate that you don't collect/share data, so that's the reason for the extra star.

I love this app so so much, but the biggest drawback is that I have no desktop software or web app to go with it. I get easily distracted by my phone while working, and have to set it aside when I'm trying to be productive. I like the routines and visual time blocking, and I want to be able to access them from my desktop computer as well. If such a thing exists and I'm unaware, I'd be happy to install and change my rating! I read requested fts page, willing for cheap sub cost to access web app

This app has a ton of potential, but it needs some basic features. 1. It would be nice to have the option to see the block view with all the times in one hour chunks even if something isn't scheduled there so you can see what free time you have in a day at a glance. 2. You can choose a color for your time block, but it doesn't fill the whole card. It would be nice if you could turn on color blocking so the entire block turns the color you choose. 3. Desktop version is a must. These are the three major features that need to be added. Otherwise it seems to be a great app and worth paying for.

It is useful for setting time to work on something. I wish at the same time it also had an option not to use a block. Also, a timer to finishing an assignment would be useful. Additionally, being able to repeat templates, but not at the exact same times of the day would be useful. Also, putting a tasks in between a block such as a break. As for paying, I would consider it for a one time payment or definite number of payments

So far really enjoying how I can create blocks and the ease of adding the tag its makes for quick planning. I would like to see an option to easily adjust the blocks. For example say I block in work and I have to stay a half an hour late...now I have to manually adjust the start and stop times of the activities that followed. It would be nice to press + hold over a block and move it up if needed!

Seems like a very well made app. Very good for if you want a rigid schedule that has plenty of options for repeating patterns. One thing I would maybe look into adding would be a feature where you could set an assumed cost of an activity such as your daily lunch or dinner, or maybe your commute so that you could plan your budget along with the schedule.

extremely helpful app! allows me to organize and alot my time in a way that perfectly fits the way i think about time, with many tools and customization options to help! my only complaint really is that there is no middle ground between paying a subscription or just using the free version... its a very useful app and i would like to support the developers without having to commit money forever. please consider adding a form of one time payment for no ads or a few extra features or something!

This is the best time blocking app I've found, but it still has some significant pain points. I wish there was a desktop version, since creating/updating blocks would be 5x faster with a keyboard, mouse, and large screen. Editing would be faster too if blocks could temporarily overlap, and if routines were per day instead of per week.

I really like this app! I ended up getting a paid subscription because I like the data it lets you access. Being able to see how I spend my time has been so helpful. However!! I'd really like to track my sleep. The problem is that if a block covers two days, for example, sleeping from 10pm to 8am, it'll count all those hours on the first day. Please fix this!

Great so far. Upgraded to pro so I can tap the watch face to bring up description of event. Keeps a visual reminder of my upcoming meeting and appointments right there. Areas for improvement: 1. A very few items have not uploaded to the app or watch for some reason. 2. The app when new always seems to default to not updating the watch. 3. Let me dial the watch forward like the app so I can see events on future days

so far so good! relatively easy to use. I was really hoping to be able to check off routine items when completed. trying to build up on habits. so it would be great to be able to track completed progress. calendar sync in pro verson went seamless! however when i go to change a routine item because it conflicts with a calendar appointment,there is not option to just edit that one Tuesday. its either all Tuesdays or no Tuesdays. It would be great to see date options & completed progress tracking

Exactly what I needed! Working from home is tough, and having stretches of unstructured time can be daunting. I like set different productivity times and meal times to look forward to. And reminders to do my skincare ofc. The widget needs some changes... I'd like it if the tags were able to sit side by side instead of stacking vertically, so the block looks like one item and less like a confusing list of words and tags. Maybe display symbols of tags only and adding divisions?

Downloaded this app back in high school and got the premium version, I love it! It's very well put together and exactly what I need for focusing on important tasks for the day -- not just for work but at home as well! Four stars because more recently (since moving to Android 11), I've been having a bug where notifications just stop. May be as much an issue with Android 11 as TimeTune, but I really need this issue fixed before giving 5 stars. Notifications are central to this app's function.

I love how many options you have for setting notifications. My Fasting routine notifies me at the start, 30 mins before it ends, and when it ends. Very cool. The app is missing two pretty big features though. 1. The ability to see how your routines overlap. Right now it's completely unintuitive. You basically have to do math in your head to understand your schedule 2. An indication for what the current time is. Again, math in your head. A schedule is supposed to help you visualize your time

I'm liking it so far. It's a very customizable experience, and I can really get into the details without the interface being too complex. I would like to see more widget options for the ap on the home screen. I like to see my schedule and routine the moment I open my phone. While there is a widget, it's rather lack luster. Synced with the programming, I think it would be cool if they had a calendar widget available.

This app is helping me get my (totally ADHD) life in order! The only thing I wish this had was a slightly more elegant visual layout as far as hour by hour goes. If it were able to be adjusted so that the blocks were larger to represent longer amounts of time I would give it 5 out of 5! Also if it was easier to adjust individual blocks without having to remember to go back to the original block first. Okay, that's all!!

This app is great, and they're super quick to respond if you have an issue/question. This is the only app of it's kind I could find that you can plan intervals w/ start/finish alerts (w/ more options too). The only drawback I have that keeps me from giving 5 stars is the lack of desktop access. I also wish there was a way for blocks to overlap in more of a visual way, and that the length of time for the blocks was more visually represented as well. But overall, this app is super helpful!

Great for maintaining and keeping a routine. This is detailed enough to develop any kind of daily/weekly/monthly routine, and flexible enough to incorporate out-of-routine events and distractions if you use it right. It is a bit tedious for some people, (that's why the 4 stars) but they can keep it simple and high-level if they like. But, if you really want to tame that beast called your work week, school agenda, or personal days like me, this will take care of it.

I love this app. The customizability in the reminders and tasks is perfect for helping me with my ADHD, and having the reminder overlays make it difficult to ignore - so helpful! The ONLY thing I wish was available is a way to track completed items so that I can hold myself accountable. No need for fancy statistics or analyses, just a simple streak or chain count would do. A lot of other apps have this, but they just aren't nearly as customizable, or easy to use. Thanks for all your help!

This app is great. The reminders work and the customization is great. As someone with ADHD, this is super helpful in my daily routine. The only thing that would make this app better is if each entry was treated as a task, with a "Mark as Complete" button in the notification, allowing you to mark it as done. For people that rely on the satisfaction of marking something as done, this would be extremely helpful and satisfying. Dopamine on tap.

It's exactly suited to my time management needs. I only have 2 real gripes: 1.) I need to have my notification sound on in order to get notifications sound. That means, not just timetune, but every text, push notification, etc, would have my phone yelling at me, which is annoying. I tried Alarm volume channel, but that didn't create any sound either. 2.) It'd be great to have a widget that displayed JUST the current time block, not the continuous schedule into the distant future.
With a small learning curve, it is a beautiful, intuitive way of scheduling the day.
It is on my must have top five list!

This app clock is great! I really like it. I've been using it for years now‚Äîstill using it!‚Äîand it just keeps on getting better. A suggestion tho, it would also be great if there's a desktop version of it and free syncing between computer and phone. Anyway, thanks for this!

The app is good and in general highly customizable, but it has one flaw: it uses days (24 hours periods) as a basic unit of measure, but it doesn't let you change the default starting hour (midnight). This is inconvenient for people who have unusual working hours and it makes the app impractical to track daily tasks for users who are more productive at night. I would rate it as a 5 stars app, if I could choose when my day ends and be able to log my dailies properly.

Great app that motivates me to do stuff. I really like that I can set the penalty to 0 (punishment is not an incentive for me), although I wish there was a permanent disable option. Great, but it is missing a feature that honestly has me looking elsewhere. I'm interested in the tracking of my successful executions of an event over a long period of time, and so not having an option for a graph over a longer timeline is a bit of a bummer.

I have enjoyed navigating my way around the set up so far, definitely worth a subscription for the full experience. Shared it with friends but unfortunately it's only available on Android. Perfect for me, takes some serious investment to set up proberly, but absolutely worth it. Further more, when i use a task that gives me 100 exp, my herolevel gets stuck at 90/25 and doesnt update anymore. If these minor bugs are fixed, i will provide the 5th star.

It's great mostly. A bit buggy, but great. I have a feature request though: ability to create achievements based on execution in a row, like, clean something 10 days in a row - bam, new achievement! Right now we can create achievements based on number of task execution in general, which is cool, but not enough. Both options should be available :) Habit generation doesn't cut it. Great app for doing everyday to-dos without fail, just to protect the virtual hero which is an extension of your real self. Fantastic app but 4 stars. Every part has been a comfortable experience for me until I started trying to use it across devices. I took me around 30 minutes to set up all my tasks the first time and when I signed into my account for the app all the tasks I had made got overwritten by the default tasks from the other device. It was partially my fault for the careless order that I signed in on the devices. But perhaps my issue could have been avoided entirely if when it attempted to sync my tasks from the internet the first time it asked me if I wanted to use the database that is from the internet or that is local. Would have saved me a lot of headache remaking all the tasks again. That said every other function provided is great and I would recommend.

This app is really good. I want to suggest to that the app should have a "Rest Day" option or something similar. That you can activate it anytime you want and while activated, the tasks will be put into a halt including penalty and overdue. It is useful if you are on vacation or there's an occasion you need to attend and makes you unable to finish the daily tasks.

This app is great! I love the idea of turning my daily life like an RPG game. But I have this goal to wash my face twice everyday and it feels repetitive to make two task for the exact same thing. So can you guys make a task where it has to be done twice before the said task is completed? Been trying my hardest to do this on your app, even finished reading the user guide, but it still wouldn't work.
Very good UI and app in general. It's disappointing when you find features that are paid exclusive, but it doesn't distract from the basic function of the app.

Can I make task templates in this app? I can't find such option and if there's ain't such I would really like if there was, so I don't have to create every task from scratch and to be able to create my plan more easily. Nonetheless, if there is, I can't find it, so please help and consider making it more intuitive. After all my demands are fulfilled I will happily give this app 5 stars. :) Cheers.

Does the calendar in pro integrate into Google Calendar? Depending on this I'm considering buying pro. This is my ideal feature, an app that tracks my Google Calendar progress. If not I will probably drop this app, because of the work required to maintain two task apps. 5 stars if this feature comes/exists.

I like the options though I wish there was a pause/start button when setting up so it doesn't count until you have everything entered. Also have tasks that can be daily but bonus if done multiple times. Or the option for infinite repeat tasks to show up in daily list.

i think this is great, but i dont like the fail system, failing is just as important for learning as suceeding is. the fail multiplier for EXP should be positive, (default: 30~50%) losing gold is still fine, but losing EXP doesn't make sense at all. besides is anyone setting it past 2 or 3 times?

I love this app, its helped me quite a bit. I would love to provide 5 stars, but I'm having issues with no notifications even though I have them active and the widget is a bit fussy clearing randomly when I finish a task. I really hope these get fixed because then this will be the single most useful app I've ever used.

I love this app, pretty simple and to the point. Although choosing rewards for myself is hard. Make sure when you purchase premium you make sure you select the right plan, I ended up getting charged $17 but they have started a refund.

Just after I looked at the interface I knew it was what I was searching. Not so for the xp thing which is a very great idea but also how it handle goals like reading books... For anyone who think in terms of goals (and obviously who love RPGs) It's totally free though

I love this app. It turns doing tasks to a entire level up game for fun. Just one thing I want more than anything. I wish they can add where you can set it to add a random item to the rewards. Then I can randomly get items, instead of getting a certain amount of items each time. Wish they could add more. Still love it though....

I like alot about this app but really want to add one thing to make it round out my gamify experience. Skill tree. I would love to be able to lay out and plan how my skills level up and progress into other skills. Linking them together and seeing how the diverge and converge. Some skills may need levels to unlock from other skills or need a basis in 2 skills to be usable. It really would make this app a huge step above any other gasification app.
This app is great! My only complaint is how complicated it is to initiate each task.. how do I know if it increase 50% discipline or 100%?

I've really enjoyed the app and has been very helpful. although to me the app seems like it's not fully finished. I wish the stats you were building actually did something in game. the money also seems kind of pointless. I can buy items that I create but they just adjust your stats which I could easily accomplish through tasks

I bought the full version. its a fun app to challenge yourself. I would like to see an update gives you the choice to choose a pen or pencil icon or a book icon, which seem to be missing, that would be useful. for example, if you want to write a book, it would be nice to have a "book"üìöüìóüìòüìôüììüìîicon, or "pen"üñãüñä icon, or "pencil" icon... UPDATE: I seem them now! Thanks for responding and letting me know. Looks like I needed to scroll farther down to see them. üëç

You add execution note but when I check in history it just one word that appeared, and the next is ........, I confuse how to check the details. Hope the next update, there is detail preview when tap a mission that's done in history. And also search feature in history will be very useful to check some mission among all those missions in history. Thank you for great app.

Fun app to use, very customisable with the skills, just like any RPG game. I would use it a lot more if we could actually countdown the time as we are performing a task, but the app is already packed with things to do. Support team is very quick in responding too!

I like this app, but it really annoys me that it defaults to playing a chime when you first pick up your phone in the morning. When just checking the time, I don't want to be woken up even more. I wish it were possible to just disable that notification instead of disabling all sounds from the app at once.

This app looks to carry the torch from the now abandoned LifeRPG app and from a bit of digging so far I'm impressed. Some things are tucked behind a pay wall such as the calendar and aesthetic additions like themes and icons but it's a relatively low price and helps support the devs so I'll probably bite on that once I've set up everything and used the app a bit. One suggestion I'd have is to implement geotagged triggers for events - like bringing up a reminder when I'm near the gym or store.

I downloaded this game in the Hope's that the format would help me with my procrastination and can I just say, its exceeded my expectations. it's so good ! I ended up having to change some of the pre set tasks and rewards to make it more personalized but apart from that, it's great. highly recommend if you, like me, like to procrastinate and make excuses to avoid tasks.

This has made so many boring little everyday tasks feel a lot more fun and rewarding. Would really like to be able to edit skill levels though. Took me a while to get the hang of making custom skills and how they synergise with base stats and tasks. And now some of them have values that don't correspond properly to actual real-life skill level compared to others.

I've been using this app for some weeks now. There are still some features that I don't understand and there's just so much available for customisation that it's overwhelming. But, once i spent a few hours customizing all i wanted, this app has been so fun and useful. Most to do list apps out there are so cumbersome and anxiety inducing. This one isn't. It has helped me prioritize what's important to me while letting me role-play. I like it a lot.

Notifications fixed. App keeps getting better. I'd like to suggest being able to use habit generation as an unlock condition for achievements. Edit: Nice :D Another thing I would suggest is add the date when an achievement was unlocked (example: unlocked 01/04/2019) so we can also order them by this date when looking the unlocked tab. Thanks for this app!

Nice app with lot of options. Like the reward system. Developper look active as i read the reviews and take comment into consideration. What is fear doing in the task don t really understand. ? Ui could get some work. Not possible to have reminder on ad vitam eternam task. Don t know if possible to have multiple reminder for the same task but would be usefull Maybe a better tutorial, don t like wall of text for tutorial, something more interactive would be nice. Would love to have reward separated per group, for example i am eating healty all week long i can have a burger. I am stopping smoking + do sport i can have a new phone What would motivated me is a picture of my reward that get slowly fullfilled as I get closer to my goal Very expensive app.

(+)Pros: it's fun, LOTS of customisation, ALL basic functionality are free, inclined to habit generation than everyday to do list. (-)Cons: first time setup are quite challenging; literally create your own system. Icons & themes are limited (minor inconvenience). I was using LifeRPG (which seems abandoned now) so it helps with the learning curve. I see devs made lots improvement here. Recommended!

I absolutely love this app. I am using for a couple weeks and it is really helping me with my tasks. I tried similar apps and they're not quite as good. Tasks are highly customisable and gives tons of options. So why not 5 stars? Well, there are some issues, but please take them as constructive criticism. 1. It is not respecting the silence mode. 2. Steep learning curve. (Worth it though) 3. Auto failing task with subtask is not working. I will promptly give 5 starts when #1 is fixed!!!

Really a fun and somewhat complex habit tracker to have. Recommendation : you could include some fantasy quests and creatures and some kind of algorithm that uses the skills I made to be used in finishing the quests and fighting creatures, maybe like dice roll mechanics. Would be fun to see your skill in use, cos just building them up isn't enough. Good job, add this quest system and its a complete app. Also app generated loot too...

So far this app is amazing. It's exciting me to continue to work towards my goals. As a person who loves video games and anime, I set goals thinking of myself as a main character. Everytime I lose, I lose my points and all my experience. When I win, I gain experience and perform good habits, transforming me to new heights.

Great app for setting up to do list and setting skills, very similar to LifeRPG, differing only in UI and the addition of achievements in my opinion. Stuck with the other one of the basis of not wanting to pay a subscription for an app. Would prefer one off payment to unlock features.

It seems good but there is no way for me to increase the "art" category. Music and drawing are not the only forms of art. Please change this. Maybe change art to "crearivity" but certainly add more creative pursuits so those who cannot draw or do music can increase it. Also aren't erudition and learning really the same thing? My conclusion is that this app is great but needs a lit of work.

Love the app, it's fun and easy to use. I've used it on and off for a long time, and it's the most encouraging without any pressure. And i do feel committed when I set levels and achievements that reflect who I hope to be. The only thing I wish could be different is having the option of purchasing themes seperately like before.

It's a great app, keep up the good work! It has almost all features I've ever wished for in gamification. But a few things were missing/quite annoying for me and lead me to abandon this app for now. If it helps you I could write you a comprehensive list of enhancements and features that I think could make this app better. Here's not enough space for that, though. Please give a short answer of you'd like me to send you an email with the list of my thoughts. :)

Overall an amazing app.Just have one little complaint.It seems we can't customize the amount of xp required to level up skills & characteristics.Skills & characteristics level up way too fast compared to the hero's level.For example,my hero level is only 7,but my charisma level is 41! That looks a tad bit ridiculous don't you think?

Perfect, the "life rpg" that actually gets updates as i always wanted. 2 things i would like to see: 1. Please, for the love of god, brand the app and learn a bit about branding, do you have any idea how hard it is to find content for an app called "do it now"? 2. Quick capture: (a small one, maybe unnecessary) where you can capture a task in 10 seconds so you when you have the time you could set the reward and the states, also so you don't forget it and give you a headache trying to remember.
very good app I have a suggestion to add subskills because I'm a handyman and know how to use the drill the hammer etc and adding those its too much woulbe better handyman skill> drill

I like this app but I wish it could also help me moderate my food intake better ect. That seems really hard to work through. I bought the full version but there are a few things that could be improved but actually a not bad app. I asked myself if I think purchasing a yr would be a good choice for me and I have enjoyed it so far. (I also thought $12 for a yr subscription was a decent price for a organization app that can hold my attention for at least a week)

This is an awesome app! I initially thought the idea of "gamifying" my life was a little silly, but fun. After trying for two weeks it is far more motivating than I ever thought! üòÅ Thank you, this is finally getting me into habits I have been trying to develop. One thing I have difficulty with is the subtasks; once I complete the subtasks they don't carry over to the next day's parent task. However, the rest of the features of this app are so great you still get 5-stars! Edit: Issue Resolved :D

This is an amazing app. You're able to customize almost everything to what you want. There are some things I'd love to see added, though. Some way to have an item reward you with money would be nice, and being able to have a task directly award you with an item, too. Developer(s), if you see this you have done an amazing job, I'll be getting the in app subscription soon to support you.

I have ADHD and this app helps me break down tasks and motivate myself by setting up rewards. This is worth subscribing to because it receives ongoing updates and the creater responds to feedback and suggestions. This app makes getting things done more rewarding and fun, and is a great way to organize my to-do list. It also helps remind me to do things that have a due date.

SO USEFUL!! I struggle with ADHD on a daily basis, I can never remember to do simple tasks and things like notebooks, whiteboards, stickynotes, alarms, they just Don't Work. But this app helps change the game dude!! It's a clever way to incentivize completing tasks, and it's helping me build better habits with the reminders and penalties for not completing it if you miss it. SUPER USEFUL!! I feel more productive and motivated to get my tasks done, I'm grateful this app exists

Perfectly what I enjoy about having a todo list is the reward of seeing progress stack up in skills and attributes (characteristics). The customization of everything is amazing. If you take the time to think and setup the rpg details of the todo list to reflect on a character you have in mind, it's fun to see the progress. I felt the extra desire to complete tasks I would otherwise procrastinate on without the app, and I find that really worth its value. I highly recommend this app. 5 stars.

Awesome reminder app. This one actually motivates you to complete tasks because it shows you your progress and the ui is easy to use. It's very customizable, from being able to choose the icon of a task to allowing you to create an unlimited number of tasks. The free version also allows the use of almost all of its features and doesn't hinder you in any way. I'm considering getting a subscription, but mostly because I want to support the creators of the app that has improved my daily life.

I'm loving this app for an extra motivation boost for my daily tasks. One feature I'd like to see would be a library of pre-filled tasks with the option to add without manually adding them myself but keeping the same ability to customize and perhaps having new tasks encouraged/offered at each level up. I do love the duplicate function though, time saver! Having weekly tasks not requiring a specific date would be nice too. Overall great app!

The app is great, its free version is somewhat limiting, but it's more than usable. There are a few things that are a bit underdeveloped, but they don't break the purpose of the app. One thing that I dislike in particular is the inability to hide inventory items that are not in stock; it's quite misleading seeing an item in the inventory but not being able to use it. Other than that, the app is great and has a great deal of customization for a robust rpg tasker.

I've been trying my hand at self improvement for over a year, and I really wish I had this app back then. It's been a real struggle for me to keep at it after so long, and this app makes things very exciting for me again. Also, I was thinking this game might be a little more fun if there was a daily boss challenge for when you finish all your tasks, and implement some kind of roll system with your stats giving it a boost.

I have been using this app for about two years now. Very cool idea. I have seen other people complain about setup pain. I found that if you create templates, then duplicate them, you can make missons with ease. (Long press on task, get a check mark, tap three dots top right, duplicate... a new copy is created with a "1" at the end. Do a few tweeks on your new mission to fill your needs and save) The developer is actively involved with this App for which I am thankful.

Fun, free, and heavily customizable. If you are a gamer, even in the casual sense, this is the app for you. 

*Edit* (2.1.2020) : One problem to note is that there doesn't seem to be an easy way to renew overdue tasks. By which I mean in other apps I can usually refresh them all with one click so that the tasks are due today. Would love an option for that, since otherwise I have to go into each task and set it to be due today. TT^TT

Great app! I would love if we could add a streak option, where you get more coins every day that you do something daily. So if you keep up a habit you get more rewarded. I'd also love to see more of a celebration when you hit a goal and your level changes, like a quick confetti shower or something. I love the reward feature of the app for spending your coin. Could the app come with some suggested rewards? A leader board might also be motivating! Great app, I love it. Just some suggestions!

I just discovered you can change the time and date when you complete a task! If I didn't have time yesterday to log in I can still collect my tasks without having a weird double day on my trackers. Very customizable and easy to add tasks and skills. There are ways to adjust the XP you earn it and it could be overwhelming, but you don't have to change any settings if you don't want to.

(EDIT: I DELETED AND REINSTALLED THE APP IT WORKS NOW YAY. Never mind what I wrote earlier.) I love this app but I can't give it 5 stars because the app crashes every single time I try to load my own notification sounds. One of the reasons why I bought a subscription was for changing all of the sounds to Breath of the Wild sound effects, but I can't do that now. It worked for 3 of the sounds, but now none of the sounds can be changed without the app crashing.

This is a great application for forming habits and improving yourself and your life. It is extremely customizable and has a lot of tracking information. I've recommended this to all of my friends to take advantage of the friends features, even giving tasks to my friends! The paid version is affordable, but everything you need is available in the free version.

Just on personal preference alone, this is by far my favorite of these kinds of apps! The options and ability to set your own skills and characteristics is done very well. So are the graphs and charts to visually represent them. My only critiques are that the calendar is a bit lacking (almost useless) and there is no supporting web/desktop app, and no integrations with other apps. If had all those things, this app would be top of its class!

So cool. It's like having a Pipboy! Absolutely awesome, and the developer is a badass. : D Seeing that the developer takes suggestions, I wanted to add a couple of things that may improve user friendliness. Adjusting the time frames of the repetition of tasks can be a little confusing. After playing with things a bit, it became easier to identify how to make things repeat when you want them to, and identify what the terms mean and do. Another thing I noticed was: when you're altering the Importance/Gold Generated/Difficulty/Etc, it would be helpful if the bar snapped to different increments. I love the way you can customize it in extreme detail, but I think it would be easier use if you could not only enter a number into it, but also click the bar without hitting a completely random number. I think the initial set up would be slightly easier if there were more examples or explanations (like in the beginning when you're first getting acclimated) for how things COULD be set up. Nothing beats trial and error, but it does take some time. Lastly, I'm a huge fan of widgets on my phone, and I love the idea of having a widget for this that ends all widgets. I would absolutely LOVE if the free version's widget was a little more fun and informative. The list is great, and simple, but I would be INFINITELY more invested in this app if the Widget had some more details on it... A smaller icon of my Character image at my level, maybe some differences between the fonts (sizes, colors, or stylization), with stats displayed in a less linear way... I think a border around the outside of the widget would really make it pop. All of that being said, I LOVE LOVE LOVE this app. I'm considering purchasing the full thing once I finish completely setting my character up. Of course, there's always room to improve anything, please keep up the great work!

Love this app. It's fun and engaging, it makes creating a to do list enjoyable. I've been using it to help keep track of my progress quitting smoking, and while most of the rewards and feedback are for appearances sake, that visual guide has been helpful in gauging my progress. Definitely recommended, has helped me find that little bit of motivation I needed in a lot of areas.

My favorite habit-gamification app so far, after trying a few. Definitely minimalistic compared to Habitica, but it makes up for it in just being more functional, and with a much better system for attaching relative value/importance to various habits/to-do tasks/etc. All habit apps face the fact that it's hard to put actual numbers to how much a good habit should be "worth", and that scoring points you set can feel a bit like digging up treasure you buried. Do It Now handles it all well, tho

Thank you for making this amazing app and thank you for having a free version. I love it so far. I've noticed others leaving ideas so here's one: add an option to make decay of skills contingent on whether or not certain tasks are done. Ex. If I don't study Spanish for 3 days (variable time frame) my Spanish skill loses exp. However if I do study then no decay ocures. Thanks again for the awesome app!

This app is great! You get to personalize your skills and characteristics to fit your liking. And by finishing tasks, which you create, you will earn experience toward leveling up your overall character level and your skill levels. My only wish is that i could do more with my character. Like, it would be cool if i could level up my character doing irl acrivities and then use that character to fight monsters or something, but i guess that would defeat the purpose of the app, which is motivation.

right off the bat I am amazed with this app. it appeals to something I didn't even know I needed, but now I see that having a quest style to-do list is really the best way to go. I only wish there could be a game attached just to take it that next level up. because having a character with levels and gold is fun and all, but past that there isn't really anything to do with it. it's all arbitrary. but playing a video game where you have to accomplish real world tasks to level up? would be genius.

Not the most easy app, per say. But in a way, that is the biggest advantage of this app. You can customize so much and make it super simply or super complex. It creates an engaging experience, adds another layer to my motivation to keep up with my bigger goals while managing my daily, weekly, and monthly routinely tasks. After about 2 weeks I upgraded to premium - you can get by without it but I simply wanted to open all of the features available and support the team. My most useful app!

What an amazing Application, the idea of this is just perfect for my lifestyle and personality, it really helps me organize my life in a fun way. I would really like to see consumables give you some sort of experience gain or loss. For example, consuming a beer decreases your health or fitness stats. It would be interesting for sure. There are so many things you guys can add, I'm excited to see more development. Edit: I thought about that as well, I have lots of ideas, I'll send an email

Great app! With ADHD, work is hard and doesn't feel like progress... With Do It Now, it feels like a productive game! I can see my tasks dwindle down, hear the sound of success, and see my gold, experience, and skills go up. It could use some way to order your tasks (ex: dragging them up/down) but since I'm really using it to avoid slacking off academically, "class" repeated is fine. I urge you to try the app- it's pretty intuitive and took me 15 minutes or so to set up. I love it already, and it's made me nearly twice as productive!

I am liking this app alot. I use so many do it lists, but none of their reminder features give me notifications on time as accurately as this one! One thing I would like though, is when its time for reminders, it gives me a big screen that tells me what I planned for that day. Since I have attention problems, it would be easy sometimes for me to miss things that are right in front of me, so having a big screen for reminders would be really helpful.

Easy to use, LOTS of features and customization w/ premium. You mostly have to define your own levels, xp, rewards, etc., which is a little less motivating, but it's still pretty useful. I like that you can define your own skills/characteristics and select which ones and by how much they improve with completion of each tasks. The widget is also super helpful. One thing I wish they'd add is the option of uploading your own emojis for to-dos. Also, the custom color picker needs a bit of work.

Great app, very customizable. Little bit of learning curve understanding how everything works, but it isn't hard & totally worth the effort. Top things I would love to see in furture update: ability to change icon colors; ability to add achievments based on hero level; ability to add XP multiplier to achievements; ability to edit default achievements; ability to sort invetory alphabetically & by number available/have

Gamifying my life is actually helping me get on track with tasks that I've up until now been unsuccessfully trying to incorporate into my life. I usually don't like the concept of gamification but in this case, since you set up the tasks, levels, skills, and achievements yourself, it doesn't feel like manipulation. Highly recommend this app.

Fantastic app! If you're someone who loves video games, and loves having access to stats and whatnot this app is for you. Being able to create and track nearly any and all data is so satisfying. I have a list of tasks for work, one for home, one for doing things for my son, one for my fitness goals, one for learning languages. Just so many different ways you can create tasks, challenges, and stay on track with your life. You are able to control so much! Thank you for this app!

I love using this app for myself to help me prioritize/organize my time for school, homework, and playing. One thing I would love to see in here is an option where you can have multiple characters so a parent can get the app on their phone and make a character for each child so that they can keep track of what their child has done and what rewards they can have, ex: playing games, extra dessert, screen time, etc.

This is the best, most customizable, app around. I appreciate the dev for being on top of responding to feedback and such. The app has grown over the years, and it keeps getting better and better with quality of life changes. It's actually spoiled me from installing other similar style apps again simply because I can just make everything to my taste all in one app. It really makes keeping a schedule feel like less of a chore, and for a gamer like me, that's golden. Real life questing is fun!

Best app by far. This app looks great, it helps me try new things and stick to a plan. Cause we know its hard to make a plan in your head and keep it. Anyway this app as lots of great features, my fav is you can make any task you want. I was going to give it four stars but then i saw how they respond to alot of the reviews and try to fix whats wrong. Their are a few bugs but thats it. The bugs inculde, crashing every now and then, when i made a task once it wouldnt show up, i had to close app

As someone who struggles with the negative effects of ADHD and motivation, this helps massivley to ensure I do tasks, thank you. For everyone who likes RPGs, it takes some setup time to personalise, but it is worth it and I would reccomend it. Only feedback/request I could have is that it would be nice if 'skills' could be nested within other skills, e.i a piano skill nested under the music skill which feeds into a characteristic.

I've only been using this app for a few days but it's been improving my life already. I am so excited to see the progress in my life 90 days from now. You can gamify the daily tasks you need or want to get done, create rewards, and start leveling yourself up. I watched a great video on YouTube about the concepts of gamification before I got started editing my setup and I continue to add tasks and rewards as inspiration strikes. Good luck on your quest!

This app is very customizable, which I definitely wanted in an RPG style To Do list. However, it does come at a cost, since getting everything set up how you'd like takes much longer than similar apps. Personally I think the trade is worth it (hence my rating), but be aware that if you're looking for something more simple, this probably isnt the app for you. If you want to really determine exactly how you want things to work, pick this one over the others!

Easily the best task app I've ever used. It speaks to the nerd in me and I'm drawn to use it and customize it, as if it were an RPG...which I guess is the whole point. I would love if it offered the ability to set ongoing tasks "twice a day", "three times a day" etc, but otherwise it's perfect.

Honestly, the only to do list that makes me happy to do my tasks. The simplicity of the point chart on the main page has a great aesthetic and it makes me happy to complete difficult tasks. I have to admit I haven't yet tried bribing myself through the items screen but it's an awesome task planner.

Incredible app, Made a huge difference in working on my goals, routines and habbits. The only thing that I hope will be added is that there is a pc/online version. This would make structuring and creating tasks so much easier as this can be very difficult and time consuming to set up on the mobile app

Awesome app for making small, mundane tasks far more satisfying! I highly recommend buddying up with a friend (or small group), setting up a system together, and comparing graphs and statistics regularly, either as motivation, or a competition! Amazing way to start new, good habits.

This is cool, I'm on my first day and just put in all my major daily goals like exercising and reading. You can customize the traits that are rewarded by each activity, as well as penalties for failure. You can even link customizable titles to your level progression (my personal goal: Archwizard of the Order of Ptolemy). Very few features are locked behind the paywall, and everything that is essential is free.

This app is a GAME first (imo), then a planner & habit tracker. For a moderate gamer, this app is beyond EPIC. You can make the game play as easy or as complicated as you want. If you purchase the yearly [$15.99] the possibilies are nearly endless! There are reading instructions provided, for a more non gaming person. I have some ADHD issues, which cause me to have to adapt to the "normal" world. This definitely will hold my interest for a little while! Thank you, please don't ruin it [devs]!

Honestly it helps encourage you quite a bit, kind of sucks I have to fail tasks and lose money and XP and then if you're honest about it instead of the auto failure that's always kind of a kick you'll be sitting there and all of a sudden something fails LOL it's definitely motivated me a lot Note to the developers Just wanted to say thanks for making this app. Honestly it's motivate me to get my mental health in check. Because I can literally track anything

I've only had this app for a couple of days but it's already helped me so much! I've tried a LOT of planner-type apps but I never felt motivated to follow through with them. This app allows you to make schedules and tasks, and it has a reward system in place! I've had a hard time focusing with all this online school stuff, but my productivity has shot up due to this app :) definitely worth a try. Thank you devs!

BEST APP EVER! You can customize your skills and tie skills to characteristics. Awesome number of options on tasks. Set up rewards for your progress (ex: create a "Buy 1 [item you really want] once you reach a certain level of skill" reward) That way you can motivate yourself with IRL rewards as well as reaching in-app levels.

One week of use & I purchased a subscription. I've used other similar apps, I enjoy this the most. There a few improvements needed, so I need to add suggestions to the Reddit page. I spent time & wrote out what I value in life, what my aspirations are, & then I narrowed down a few simple goals to reach those aspirations. Then I added my goals to this app. So far it's easy to keep track of my goals, habits, & how I'm doing. It's incredibly easy & even fun to use. Thank you for this app.

I love the idea of this app. The customizability and effectiveness of this app are it's strongest features. It does take a while to understand how to setup and figure out the ins and outs of the app, but once you do it's super easy. One feature I'd love to see included is having rewards and items image customizable like the hero level

Great app for those who enjoy analyzing and quantifying and have trouble sticking to routines. Ive heard complaints that it takes a long time to program a task in, but i found analyzing the task to be fun! It really gets me to think about how important i think tasks are. There were times i had to rethink my priorities. Creating routines and habits are a challenge irl, but this app serves as the driving force to remind me how well i am doing or where i need to adjust to succeed.

*request* (setting day start & end time, e.g. 3am not 12am) Extremely cool idea, and a phenomenal execution! This is like a gamification on being a healthy human. There are SO many little details that really make this app shine! I love that it is not on the head with the mental wellbeing that it is promoting, it just makes it seem like a fun game! To expand on the gamification of it, I think a secondary app with little mini games where your character and it's stats and skills affect the game!

S‚óã far, s‚óã good... This app is useful for what it intends to do and is somewhat motivating to try to keep up with tasks. I really like the "level up my character" mentality to a task list. I'm still trying to figure it out, though, (as it isn't clear) how to set up the tasks well to accomplish what you want. If in a few months I am still using it, I will update this review.

Amazing app with excellent customer support! This has taken so much stress off my shoulders. Just being able to track the thousand things I'm constantly juggling in my head is a huge help! The system is easy to navigate and highly customizable. Reward system is awesome! Great job! Please continue to optimize this and I will continue to sub :)

I LOVE this app. I had tried Habit RPG and I liked the generalized idea behind it but wished it was more in depth & video game like, that you could not only lvl up but gain skill points, this is extremely detailed, even has characteristics you can lvl up as well as skills & allows for complete customization in everything. Being a nerd & someone who lacks discipline, I forsee this to be an extremely useful tool to help me stay on task, achieve my goals and feel like I am ACTUALLY lvling up IRL!!!

I love this app. I use it for motivation with my writing. I custimized the skills, characteristics, achievements, and my hero levels to reflect my writerly ways and it's been so fun to use! Watching my skills and levels increase is a blast. I also appreciate the" rewards"options, but wish I could create"in-app" rewards for myself. Like potions or consumables that could increase a skill or boost XP earning for one day, etc. Even without that, though, this app is amazing! I highly recommend it.

Good app... Relatively easy, with out being too simplistic... Rpg aspects are engaging but not excessively time consuming! Calendar is 'paid access', which is a little annoying, but certainly understandable... Popup ads are mostly brief (as should be), and far enough between, they are acceptable enough... All in all, best 'RPG ToDo list' I've tried...!

Love it, incredibly useful and I feel like a superhero growing in a gamification style system that tracks my lifestyle and productivity... Great product. The only thing I need is an online opportunity, it is hard to use the interface exclusively on the phone because it is such an interactive interface, this would really expand on the product usage, I can't pull my phone out at work, but could open a website.

Highly recommend. It's basically what you learn to do in cognitive behavioral therapy, but it's sneaky so it took me a while to figure out that's what it was doing. It's very flexible and customizable, and helps me to actually meet goals. Then I can use my gold for rewards (which you set up yourself - hello Amazon wishlist).

It's a really great app I love most that it reminds you about your tasks since I tend to forget a lot especially feeding my pets and watering my plants it's easy and fun to use especially with the reward system I think it would be challenging if the app had personal rewards for say keeping up with your tasks for a large period of time and all but honestly I love the app it's perfect you can personalize it to whatever you want or need

Most amazing task organizer. Everything is customizable and easy to understand. Functions perfectly whether you use every detail of the app or just basic task lists. I'm Pavlov-ing myself with the task completion noise and my serotonin levels are through the roof. I've never wanted to give anyone money before but I 100% would buy every add-on, even though I don't need to, because I can do almost everything for free (HOORAY) THANK YOU SO MUCH

This is the best app of its kind I've found. It does everything the others do, but I orefer this one's UI. Though I would recommend automatically saving changes when editing tasks or at least prompting the user to save because I often find myself pressing the back arrow instead of the ok button, causing me to have to redo the edits and press ok to save.

This is exactly what I was looking for on my tablet! Suggestion: be able to create multiple heroes for specific character goals for example switch from a body builder hero or dad hero and have an overall hero that combines all of your stats you have gained. Also I don't know if it's already implemented but have stats deteriorate over time the less you work on them. Thank you for this app!

In the few days I've downloaded this app my habit consistency improved 10 fold! Other apps don't give any incentive to get what's on your to do list done beside your own will power; which isn't a bad thing but the extra kick from the stats, the coins and the rewards you can redeem with them, and the achievements help. I also love how customizable the app is, for me at least being able to create your own rewards and achievements makes the app fit me personally.

Personally I absolutely love this app and it is exactly mathematically what I have been looking for. The only true inconvenience is that once the day is over you cannot go back and add tasks to a day. Developers could you pretty pretty pretty please with sugar on top make it possible for us to go back and add tasks that we have completed on previous days!?! Maybe in the calendar area or something! Thank you kindly! üôè‚ù£Ô∏è Revision: 5 star! Thank you for responding and teaching me hot to edit task!

The most affordable and customizable RPG To do list out there. Truly create yourself as a character and level up in life! The only thing it's missing is a better family/clan system so my family and I can share attributes and assign tasks, require multiple peoplw complete a task, or allow anyone to complete a task. All of those tasks could affect personal stats and/or the family/clan stats. That would be perfect.

Absolutely love this app! Helps motivate and keep on track, while having plenty of features and customizable things to look through. Even so, I hope they find a more specific thing to spend coins on such as pets, clothes, or any kind of collectible. Besides that It's a very lovely, and fun game. Very recommendable!

Used for years. helps a ditz like me stay on top of things that I need to do and work towards short term to long term goals. Down side I found was steep learning curve to get the most out of this app but one of the best. Note: I made the one time purchase for premium futures which was worth it.

ADHD hack life. You can set the difficulty level and the "fear" (aversion) level for each task (all tasks are made up by the user) and level up your "character" in specific exp like 'productivity' 'hygiene' 'communication' etc. Tasks can be repeated, or individual, or just reset after you complete it once. It's been awesome for me so far. I hate putting it that I "failed" a task, and watching my character lose points. And getting points and staying good gives me the dopamine I need.

I like the concept, but the widget doesn't update from day to day. I tried both daily and continuous, and it just stays the way it was the day before, despite any repeating/ continuous tasks. I find myself having to remove the widget and replace it every day. Please fix. Thanks for the otherwise great app. (P.S. I'm on android 11 if that helps fix the issue btw.) Edit: Thanks for the response. It worked.

The app is amazing so far, however, the only concern I must express is the unavailability of decreasing the exp less than 1 for skill. Everytime I try using a decimal point, the app crashes, if you could fix this 5 stars is on it's way : )
Really good app so far. Only problem I've experienced is when a task fails, it will take the remainder of xp from a skill or level, and then when reverted will give it back plus more.
Not very straight forward to edit/make your own goals and tasks. Other than that, lots of customization and a nice UI.

For an app that's supposed to help organize your life, it isn't very organized. I absolutely live the idea, but how is a task for today actually one from 5 days ago? I can't brush my teeth 5 days ago right now bro. The task for the next day shows up and it confuses me all the time and makes me think, "but didn't I do that this morning? Oh wait that's from 3 days ago. Then why is it still there?" I have ADHD so this really messes with me. The app as a whole tho is really cool and I love it!

Mr. Lozovyi, I hope you and your family are safe during this war crisis. We hope that this issue will be resolved soon. Good Wishes! #People of India stand with Ukrainians. üôè Weekly/monthly/yearly Comparison is highly needed to keep ourselves motivated. Time Based /expiring date for unlocking achievements should be introduced. #Crash on search

I love this app. It turns doing tasks to a entire level up game for fun. Just one thing I want more than anything. I wish they can add where you can set it to add a random item to the rewards. Then I can randomly get items, instead of getting a certain amount of items each time. Wish they could add more. Still love it though....
Please add a timer. It can be linked to certain tasks, so that one can create a termless, duration based tasks.
Pretty handy to have. Not sure if worth money yet. Check back in 3 months.
Good,
Great app, but I'd love to see streaks for tasks...
Really like it! But please make this for ios too! Recently bought an iphone and found out I cannot use this app anymore

So far this app is amazing. It's exciting me to continue to work towards my goals. As a person who loves video games and anime, I set goals thinking of myself as a main character. Everytime I lose, I lose my points and all my experience. When I win, I gain experience and perform good habits, transforming me to new heights.

I think this is a great app especially for those with ADHD. However there are some slight improvements I think could be made. 1. I would like to be able to change the times that a task can be done more easily, just because I'm only up during the night. 2. I wish I could change how much XP and Gold I lose for failing a task separately. 3. It would be nice to be able to set up a custom default setting for task. But besides those few things I do really love the app.
A bit too much

I really like this app and the concept, but I feel that it should be possible to see your friends profile, and in general it would be good to add the ability to interact with your friends in some ways apart from assigning tasks

Hmm, so far it's seeming promising, I have alot of brain stuff going on and alot of my executive dysfunction comes from making decisions so its awesome you start out with default tasks to just remove unnecessary ones. The subtasks thing is something I've desperately wanted in an app for years so yesss, it might help more if there were more presets like cleaning specific rooms and what it might entail and what skills it increases. Idk if that's already a premium feature but ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Very good routine app. Perfec to create task lists, it has an alarm system to remind you in time for every task, but sometimes it didn't work as well, so I prefer the stock android watch app to do this.

Does the calendar in pro integrate into Google Calendar? Depending on this I'm considering buying pro. This is my ideal feature, an app that tracks my Google Calendar progress. If not I will probably drop this app, because of the work required to maintain two task apps. 5 stars if this feature comes/exists.
It's nice. Constant reminder of what to do, cute. Wish they let you pick a woman / non man avatar but other than that it's ok

This app is great if like me you are forgetful or just need a small reminder to do certain things. It's super cute and has a lot of customisation (in and outside of premium payments). My only complaint is that the UI is a little difficult to get your head around at first and it could do with more of a tutorial/instruction page to explain all the settings and options you have. But other than that I highly recommend this app. And for once the premium payment isn't extortionate!
I am facing some problems:- ‚Ä¢How do I add Imventory Items that I created into rewards.. PLEASE üÜò HELP
Is possible to give buff toward exp of some skills after i done a task?

UI is a bit clunky for changing a task from one-off to repeating; requires clicking several menus deep and isn't obvious at first glance. No support for nesting tasks into checklists. Gamification is nice, though.

Perfect, the "life rpg" that actually gets updates as i always wanted. 2 things i would like to see: 1. Please, for the love of god, brand the app and learn a bit about branding, do you have any idea how hard it is to find content for an app called "do it now"? 2. Quick capture: (a small one, maybe unnecessary) where you can capture a task in 10 seconds so you when you have the time you could set the reward and the states, also so you don't forget it and give you a headache trying to remember.
Quality app, none of that character building BS. Just missing public leader board.

I just installed the app, and so far, it looks really helpful! I'm excited to use it in my everyday life. However, the one thing that made me sad was that there isn't a hero icon that has a wheelchair. I'm disabled, and having an icon that reflects that about me would be really nice.
Hello can you please make it so that we can manually sort the subtasks? That would make it perfect and then I would give this 5üåü

Great app for doing everyday to-dos without fail, just to protect the virtual hero which is an extension of your real self. Fantastic gamification of everyday to-dos with plenty of features which are highly customisable. Few things I noticed are: (1) The letters on the HERO Tab are haphazardly placed and looking unprofessional. This space needs a complete redesign for a professional look. (2) The graphs on statistics page are not so appealing. Graphs should be designed in a better way.
I do not "identify" as a male. I am a woman. Where are your female avatars? God bless the Ukraine!

This app has amazing potential. I found it looking for points maker for vacation trip scavenger hunt. Needs shared rewards, secret rewards for others. Getting many decaying skills when turned off. Needs XP requirements for rewards. A lot of potential

PRO: I *love* the fact that it provides a framework for first deciding WHO you want to be (characteristics), then HOW to get there (skills & habits). CONS: - To use the app in that way is not intuitive, and there is a long learning curve to get there. - Ads are obtrusive. The inclusion of audio limits where I can use the app, which makes it less useful. - User guide is not always clear enough. - Reward system needs more robust explanation. - A few more free icons would be nice.
S√≥ falta ter a op√ß√£o "miss√£o pai" que tem o LifeRPG que fica perfeito!

Hello I love the app it's by far the best "life RPG" app I've used. But I have 1 problem that I would greatly appreciate if you could help me with How do I enable notifications for it? I want the app to tell me when an activity is to be proformed in the same why that google calander does it by showing a notification on the home screen If there is an option to eneble this then how do I do it? Please I would greatly appreciate a reply

It really feels like I have a tabletop character sheet for myself, and I didn't even know I wanted it until now. The skill and stat customization is incredibly deep. The reward system is great. I highly recommend the premium, if you can afford it. These devs deserve it, and the calendar is a nice bonus on top of all the aesthetic additions.
